- When is a bit windy the night show is not using the drones which makes the show a lot less spectacular... 
- The restaurants in the parks are closed in the evening 9most of them after 16:00) making it impossible to have dinner at a decent hour and then see the night shows (after the show is over - 22:00 is to late to grab dinner outside Disneyland Park because everything is closed so you end up starving in the night).
- After the night show the park is closing immediately so everybody is leaving the park at the same time making it very hard to get home with that huge crowd heading to the same busses/metro/shuttle stations.
- more surprise appearances of characters would be great. we only met Captain Hook. Maybe princesses (especially since for Princess Pavilion you have to wait so long in line and then meet whatever comes your way), fairies, no Frozen characters or shows available
- some sort of virtual queues would be nice

The Paris Catacombs.address: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France
The Paris Catacombs.description: A genuine labyrinth in the heart of underground Paris, this ossuary houses the remains of approximately six million Parisians. The history of the Catacombs dates back to the late 18th century when the city's cemeteries were closed due to health reasons and its contents were moved to an underground site. Today, you can walk down the spiral staircase and take a guided tour of the network of tunnels or explore it at your own pace. It's recommended to buy skip-the-line tickets online to avoid snaking lines. You can easily reach the Catacombs by hopping on the Paris Metro. – Tripadvisor
The Paris Catacombs.address_string: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France

reviews.title: Fun and interesting
reviews.review_text: Definitely a great thing to do with your teenaged kids. Great history lesson many stories down and just the right amount of creepiness that comes with 6 million people’s bones underground.

reviews.title: Definitely go !
reviews.review_text: A very surreal experience! Definitely not for those with limited mobility as there’s a lot of stairs and walking. Booked tickets a week in advance on the official website and got an audio guide included which was really factual. Definitely a bit spooky but gives a completely different view of Paris.

reviews.title: Scary and fascinating at the same time
reviews.review_text: It was very interesting, spooky and very well done. The place has a very mysterious vibe. If you want something creepy, come here! The only downside was it took a while to get to the actual skulls, and it isn’t very accessible. But if you are travelling in Paris, I would definitely recommend that you come here.

reviews.title: Great catacombs DO NOT USE HEADOUT TOURS
reviews.review_text:
Great experience and fascinating to understand the history behind the catacombs BUT don’t book through HEADOUT Paris is our advice. 
See HEADOUT Paris reviews for reasons.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.review_text: This is a must see. Save money and just go online and buy tickets for 29 Euros and take an Uber there-instead of over $100 on a tour formal tour. You wear an audio device that explains everything in great detail as you walk through. All the history around the catacombs.

reviews.title: Very convenient in Paris but with points for future improvement
reviews.review_text:
Rode the Paris Metro when I visited Paris in September 2024. And it was very convenient for me to travel from the hotel in the outskirts of the city (Gallieni) to different parts of Central Paris (including the Eiffel Tower, Trocadéro Square & Louvre Museum. The services were relatively frequent (at least every 4-5 minutes at peak times), it covers most areas of the cities with a dense coverage in Central Paris, the trains were relatively quick - even with older trains being used in Line 3, some of the modern lines are automated with cab/front views and have platform edge/screen doors, station spacing was relatively close without long distances (compared to parts of the London Underground), and they are also integrated with the RER Trains, buses and even trams (although I didn't ride the trams) - to which I can say Paris has an amazing public transport network on the whole (possibly one of the best in the world with its different modes).

However, my only issues with the Paris Metro was that accessibility in the older lines wasn't great as most of the old Metro stations didn't have lifts, escalators or level boarding with the trains (wasn't a major issue for me, but would be trouble for disabled and older people alongside people with heavy luggage/loads), the train reliability for Line 3 was variable (most of the time it was fine, but on the last day, there was a signal failure which really slowed down train speed & operations) and a few older stations looked a bit worn out & in need of better maintenance. I also thought it was a little bit weird that a few lines had rubber-tyred tracks although those lines were thankfully quite quick & reliable. But apart from those, the Paris Metro on the whole was very convenient for me.

reviews.title: Don't take the risk of getting on the metro
reviews.review_text: Last month, our family had a terrible experience on the Paris metro. As tourists with two minors, we were abruptly and disproportionately approached by four "metro agents". They demanded our tickets and, upon not finding one (which had been lost during the trip), accused us of fraud. Despite showing the purchase receipt and explaining that we had just arrived that morning, they ignored us and fined us (50 euros). This experience was very traumatic and left a bitter taste in our mouths, ruining what was supposed to be a short two-day trip. We felt a great sense of injustice. How many other people have gone through something similar? Paris is an empty shell without tourism and this is yet another demonstration of how badly the city treats those who keep it alive. -- Le mois dernier, notre famille a vécu une expérience terrible dans le métro parisien. En tant que touristes avec deux mineurs, nous avons été abordés de manière brutale et disproportionnée par quatre "agents de métro". Ils ont exigé nos billets et, n'en trouvant pas un (qui avait été perdu pendant le voyage), nous ont accusés de fraude. Malgré la présentation du reçu d'achat et l'explication que nous venions d'arriver ce matin-là, ils nous ont ignorés et nous ont infligé une amende de 50 euros. Cette expérience a été très traumatisante et nous a laissé un goût amer, gâchant ce qui devait être un court séjour de deux jours. Nous avons ressenti un profond sentiment d'injustice. Combien d'autres personnes ont vécu une expérience similaire ? Paris est une coquille vide sans le tourisme et c'est une nouvelle démonstration de la façon dont la ville traite mal ceux qui la font vivre.

reviews.title: Worst experience at Bir Hakeim Metro station
reviews.review_text:
We had to take the metro to reach our bus station, but the staff wouldn’t accept cash. Luckily, I had a virtual card, so we managed to pay. However, the ticket they gave us wouldn’t validate. When I went back to the staff for help, they told me to join the line again, even though it was super long and we were running late.

I politely asked for assistance again, but instead of helping, the staff started using foul language. I was with my sister, and we didn’t have time to argue, so I just let it go. In the end, they opened the gate for us, but it was a terrible experience.

I wouldn’t recommend using the metro if you’re short on time. The staff was rude and unhelpful, and honestly, it didn’t feel safe. It’s disappointing that behavior like this goes unchecked.

reviews.title: WARNING METRO STAFF SCAM AND BULLY TOURISTS
reviews.review_text:
Awful experience on Metro - we bought tickets which but my partners didn't validate for some reason. Just after going through we were surrounded by 3 guards aggressively wanting to check tickets. When my partners was said to be 'invalid' as if it had not gone through the barrier they demanded a €60 fine - no discussion. We explained we had just bought it with help from a staff member for the final journey we needed to make back to the Eurostar and asked if we could point her out. She stormed off and refused to let us point her out. When she returned she said the ticket office staff said no one helped!! They said they would call police which would raise the fine to €200. They were bullying and aggressive and it was very clear there was a genuine mistake as they had watched us the whole time buying the ticket and go through. 
We will never visit Paris again and if you are going avoid the Metro - there is definately scamming there with tourists from the very people who should be looking out for you. What an awful way to treat tourists. Made me appreciate the UK and Londons underground staff. We were glad to be home and will not visit France again ever.

reviews.title: Fantastic System
reviews.review_text:
Just back from a 3 night stay in Paris with 2 children aged 14 and 12. I had lived in Paris 30 years ago, but my wife and kids were new to the city.

The Paris Metro system is fantastic. If you are staying in the city you are probably less than 250m from an entrance into the Metro and your destination is equally close to a stop. If your destination is on the same line as your start location just follow the signs for that line - there will be 2 options, one for each direction, and the direction is indicated by the name of the last station in that direction. Sometimes they will also list out the stops in each direction, but not always. If its on a different line you will need to change - this involves getting off at a stop and following signs for the next line/direction you need to take. You won't have to leave the Metro system, so you don't need a second ticket. 
We used the phone app Bonjour RATP to see the best route (including transfers). I would suggest practice using this app before you go if you are new to subway systems.

We used paper tickets as we didn't know how much we'd use the Metro, but a Navigo Easy card each preloaded with tickets would have been cheaper and simpler. There are other options such as day passes etc. The paper tickets we bought were called t+ tickets and they cover any journeys within the metro system except to Orly Airport.

Hang on to your ticket until you leave the Metro system! Twice we had to use the same ticket twice as there was a second set of turnstiles for some reason. Also, while we didn't see any ticket inspectors, they do check tickets and you'll be fined if you have thrown your ticket away.

A few words of warning:

Take precautions against pick pockets - they will target tourists and its hard to look like a local! Carriages can be crowded so valuables need to be well secured. We didn't see any pickpockets, but there were warnings everywhere. I also bought any tickets in Republique rather than the more touristy stations.

We took the Metro from Universite Saint Denis to Republic and back as we arrived on the bus from Beauvais airport. I felt it was quite challenging travelling as a family with suitcases in rush hour. We had to manoeuvre to make sure we were near the carriage doors so we could get out in time (Parisiens are impressively polite though!) If the kids were younger I would have looked into another form of transportation for this journey.

The system is old, and unlike more modern systems it doesn't seem very accessible. If you are unable to use stairs then do your research before travelling - while some stations have lifts I didn't see many.

Some Metro journeys involve quite a bit of walking within the system (to/from platforms, between lines etc)

Some trains are very busy - so you'll find yourself quite squashed in. The longest wait time we saw was 4 minutes though, so if you are concerned about a train being excessively full, then wait for the next one.

Conclusion:
Overall we took 12 journeys on the Metro in 3.5 days, most journeys took less than 20 minutes. We stayed in Republique, which has a number of lines, so most journeys didn't need a transfer. We packed loads into our trip to Paris and there is no way we could have seen and done as much without such an efficient form of transportation, and the kids really enjoyed the novelty of it.

Paris by Mouth.description: There’s a reason why our tours are top-rated food tours on TripAdvisor and have been celebrated by The New York Times (twice!) and knowledgable foodies like David Lebovitz and Ruth Reichl: we keep our group sizes tiny, we spend generously at the best shops in town, and we only work with expert guides who have devoted their lives to food & wine. Our tours are in English and last for around 3 hours. They include some walking and standing, but also feature a seated tasting with wine pairings. Our tours are designed for adults. We’re unable to host children under ten years of age. Our price of 125€ per person is a little higher than the competition because we spend more than anyone else on premium tastings and to pay the most experienced and knowledgable guides in Paris. You’re also paying for the tiny group size. You can visit our website to see our calendar of availability, and we hope to welcome you soon!

reviews.title: Five star experience!
reviews.review_text: We did the Left Bank tour with Aurelien Laban with our family of 4 (two 18 year old teenagers) and can't recommend it more!  Aurelien was the most knowledgeable tour guide we have had on a food tour and we've done several with other companies.  We learned a lot about French food and culture, and had amazing wine as well.  Don't miss this while in Paris!

reviews.title: Best part of our trip
reviews.review_text: Thanks Andres! Your tour was the highlight of our week. The food was great, we learned a ton, and we enjoyed getting away from the masses of tourists in the back streets of Le Marais. Also appreciate the fantastic dinner recommendation! No hesitation in recommending this tour to others.

reviews.title: Great Food Tour!
reviews.review_text: My family did the The North Marais food tour with Andrés, and it was spectacular. It's pretty difficult as a tourist to find great authentic French cuisine, and Andrés did a fantastic job of not only showing us the best food and wine, but also giving us great insight into the details of where the food comes from and its quality.

reviews.title: South Marais Tour
reviews.review_text: Our mouths were indeed quite happy on our Paris by Mouth tour with Faye.  We saw parts of Paris we had not discovered yet and were so thrilled with our tastings that we went back before departing to purchase a few things to take with us to enjoy once back home.  Fantastic guide, fantastic experience, Faye’s enthusiasm was contagious.

reviews.title: Highlight of Paris
reviews.review_text: Andrés was an amazing guide. He had tremendous insight into food as well as the culture of Paris. We were guided to appreciate the quality of the food as we were eating it, and over the course of the 3 hours had some of the best bread, cheese, chocolate, meet and wine I’ve ever had. Highly recommend.

Galeries Lafayette Paris Haussmann.description: Visitors to this massive department store can find brand-name items of nearly every variety. Shop accessible to luxury fashion & accessories for men, women and children, enjoy exclusive services such as personal shoppers, concierge and tax refunds and indulge in restaurants and a gourmet epicerie.

reviews.title: Great shopping
reviews.review_text: Shopping here was an experience.  Typical European shopping mall with higher end stores on bottom level with less expensive brands as you travel each higher floor.  The shoe section was phenomenal!  A bit too crowded on Saturdays, so go during the week if possible to avoid the chaos.

reviews.title: Nice building
reviews.review_text: Nice building, beautiful decoratios, a lot of very well known shops, cold staff. From the terrace you can have a beautiful view on Paris

reviews.title: Not the average shopping mall!
reviews.review_text: We had a day in Paris with a group of friends including several teenagers so we wanted to visit Lafayette. We wanted to get the experience, see the dome and visit the rooftop. It is beautiful, even if you don’t like shopping it is nice to walk inside and just look up to the beautiful dome. We saw the glasswalk at the 3rd floor and went there, to find out they work with reservations with time-slots. Luckily the ladies in charge helped us to make the reservation on the spot and we could go without too much of waiting. It is very nice to walk on the glass floor and have a view from there. After that we went to the rooftop for an even better view of Paris. We wanted to visit the restaurant but with that one we had less luck as  it was full. But there were some beach chairs we could use to enjoy the view. We walked around inside as well and really enjoyed the experience.

reviews.title: Fun and Different
reviews.review_text: This was a fun class to learn new baking techniques. Not a typical tourist attraction, would highly recommend.

ExperienceFirst Paris.description: Make the most of your visit. ExperienceFirst's award winning tours create memorable experiences and save time for our guests through optimized itinerary, skip the line tickets and great guides.

reviews.title: Amazing tour of Montmarte & Basilique du Sacré-Cœur de Montmartre!!!
reviews.review_text: Paula was amazing.  So much fun learning about Montmartre and  Basilique du Sacré-Cœur de Montmartre.  She was insightful with a lot of fun facts about the area.

Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.address: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame Place Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris France
Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.description: The iconic Notre Dame Cathedral Paris—meaning ‘Our Lady of Paris’—is a masterpiece of French Gothic architecture. Built back in the 12th century, the important monument has witnessed many historical events. It has also inspired Victor Hugo’s story of the Hunchback of Notre-Dame. Outside the cathedral, you can admire its grand exterior which is framed by an elegant pair of bell towers, stained glass windows and an ornately decorated facade with grand statues. You can also enter the cathedral for a small entrance fee to view Nio-Gothic artwork and furniture as well as join their weekly sessions. – Tripadvisor
Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris.address_string: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame Place Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris France

reviews.title: Palace
reviews.review_text: Versailles is a vast palace built by the Sun King, Louis XIV   It can be completely overwhelming.  Check it out, for real...

reviews.title: Beautiful church
reviews.review_text: Beautiful and of course very iconic. There was a lot of construction when I visited which was unfortunate, so I would definitely want to go back.

reviews.title: Resurrection
reviews.review_text: The corner stone of Notre-Dame de Paris was laid more than 860 years ago and, over those centuries, the cathredral has survived war and revolution—even the terrible fire of 2019. The publication of Victor Hugo’s novel “The Hunchback of Notre-Dame” in 1831 renewed interest in preserving what by then had become little more than a rundown landmark. Even the iconic wooden spire was a later addition, having been added in 1859. At the time of the fire, a five-year goal was set for the restoration of the cathredral. Given that it took almost 200 years to build, some thought that two or three times that number might be needed. But now, an opening date of December 7 has been officially announced, just a month away—although further work will continue for another year or two. These pictures, which were taken on a misty Sunday in October, show how much has been done—and still to be completed.

reviews.title: Opens December 2024!
reviews.review_text: Opens in December of 2024, we were 3 months early but had to see.  Wish to come back, the history is haunting, and the view is magnificent.

reviews.title: impressive and majestic!
reviews.review_text:
I went to Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. I had an excellent time, the place is really beautiful and the building is majestic. The guided tour gave us a lot of information about the history of the place, and I was able to discover some incredible anecdotes about the illustrious figures who have built the cathedral. The interior of the building is filled with paintings and stained glass windows that let in a beautiful light. 

Netherless,the place is packed with tourist. Try to choose less busy times to avoid the waiting queues for the audio guides !

Enjoy your trip !

Big Bus Paris.address: 11 avenue de l'Opera Stop 1, 75001 Paris France
Big Bus Paris.description: Hop on board an open-top bus with 360-degree views and explore all that Paris has to offer ! From historic sites and iconic architecture to bustling streets and the world famous Eiffel Tower – immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of the French capital. Explore Paris and enjoy the ultimate freedom to take in the city at your own pace. A choice of live guided commentary in English on our red route or recorded commentary in 11 languages are available.
Big Bus Paris.address_string: 11 avenue de l'Opera Stop 1, 75001 Paris France

Le Marais.description: Get lost in one of the most charming neighborhoods in Paris, brimming with unique boutiques and stylish art galleries. Besides its vibrant LGBTQIA+ community, Le Marais also has a rich Jewish heritage, with winding streets lined with historic medieval architecture. If you're looking for a night out, head to one of the many gay bars or clubs that the area is known for. Take a walking tour to discover fascinating insights about the neighborhood, or a food tour to have a taste of the area's vibrant culinary scene—travelers say the falafel is some of the best! Visit during the week for fewer crowds and wear comfortable walking shoes to navigate the neighborhood's cobblestone streets. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: One of the Top 5 Iconic site in Paris
reviews.review_text:
Le Marais has become a trendy district of the Marais. Definitely Iconic like the Latin Quarter and La Rive Gauche, as its graffitis sometimes prove it. 
It is located in the 4th arrondissement. It is full of museums, trendy boutiques, galleries and bars, some of which are gay. 
It also used to contain the Jewish quarter of the city. This district is still home to many kosher restaurants.
Another iconic site is the Place des Vosges, verdant, which houses elegant arcades and the Victor Hugo museum, where the writer lived. 
The streets around the Saint-Paul metro station lead to the Maison Européenne de la Photographie but you have not less intersting museums such as Les Archives Nationales and Le Musee Carnavalet, ideal for rainy days.

But actually if we forget the trendy aspect of the Marais, I love it for its narrow streets and its Louis XIII architecture which takes me back to the history of Paris.

reviews.title: Best place in Paris
reviews.review_text: Place to be. Was here for whole october and there is no boring days at all. People are nice and really international. Also lot of great restaurants and coffee shops

reviews.title: Charming area of the Right Bank to explore in Paris
reviews.review_text:
This is a charming district on the Right Bank in central Paris. There are quieter neighbourhoods you can stroll as well as important sightseeing including several museums, churches and historic hotels, Opera house, quaint public squares and monuments to enjoy. 

You will also find a nice range of hotels and dining opportunities, all nicely connected to the rest of the city by buses and the Metro. It is a really nice location of Paris to spend a day or more exploring, even longer if you plan to stay overnight in this area of the city.

reviews.title: A Charming Parisian Neighborhood
reviews.review_text: Le Marais is absolutely perfect! Our apartment was right next to the Place des Vosges, and we were surrounded by great restaurants, bakeries, and grocery stores. Plus, there are two free museums just a 2-5 minute walk away. The area is truly beautiful.

reviews.title: Le Marais is perfect
reviews.review_text: This neighborhood has it all; museums, history and food abound.  The young energy and edgy fashions make it a constant feast for the eye.  Our apartment was quiet and restful for evenings, yet riveting nightlife is only a block away.

Paris Las Vegas.address: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4345
Paris Las Vegas.description: You won’t get a view like this at any other Las Vegas pool. Pool á París is located right underneath the hotel’s Eiffel Tower replica at Paris Las Vegas, positioned in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. Take rest and relaxation to the next level with a lounge chair, daybed or cabana rental at Pool á París. The romantic atmosphere paired with various amenities will leave you rejuvenated and ready for the evening on the famed Las Vegas Strip.
Paris Las Vegas.address_string: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109-4345

reviews.title: April IS the worst MANAGER!! WORKING AT FRONT DESK! NO COMPASSION!!
reviews.review_text: "Manager" April is the WORST MANAGER EVER!! She has NO compassion, we reached there at 2.30 pm and my son had a stomach bug and she had no compassion to let us check-in early. Instead she yelled at yet and showed unprofessionalism. How these idiot crazy nuts become managers??? We come here to enjoy and not to deal with people's attitude!!

reviews.title: Favorite Vegas Hotel So Far
reviews.review_text: This was my fourth trip to Las Vegas and I loved Paris. We used mobile check in and it was so easy. Staff in the reception area were helpful and still gave check in advice with the added perk of no line. Our room was very clean and seemed fairly recently updated. Formula 1 setup slightly blocked our view, but we could still watch the Bellagio fountains from our room. The rest of the property is just as beautiful as the room with gorgeous restaurants - try Alexxas for brunch and snag the Cinnaroll Waffle. We even were offered an impromptu tour of the Eiffel Tower restaurant on our last day. Mobile checkout was even easier than checkin. I’ll definitely be staying here on our next trip to Las Vegas.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Paris stay
reviews.review_text: Our room had amazing views and was spacious, comfortable and clean. Easy check in and friendly accommodating staff. It was a hike to the Versailles tower from check-in as they hadn’t finished the direct walkway yet but taxis and transportation were close to the bottom of the elevators. Pools were great as were the variety of restaurants and food. Staying there again for NFR we liked it so well.

reviews.title: This is NOT a 4-star hotel
reviews.review_text: This is NOT a 4-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination.  The rooms are very dated, sheets dirty with holes, missing knob on the dresser and the check-in staff was rude.  The restaurants are limited in this hotel.  The best thing about this hotel is the location, the bellhop, housekeeping, and wait staff were nice.  Other that that, there's nothing.

reviews.title: Go somewhere else
reviews.review_text: Please go somewhere else - pay a bit more if you have to. The queue for check in was over an hour - we were slightly early and were told to either pay $50 for early check in or join the queue again. There was an automatic check in machine but it wasn't working. There was only 3 clerks on, and the queue was out of the reception and into the casino.We were celebrating our 41st wedding anniversary and asked if an upgrade was possible and the clerk literally snorted and laughed at us.  I said that I didn't expect that response, she told us that the staff were not allowed to arrange upgrades, and she was fed up of people asking, and she was thinking of just walking out, and how stressed and understaffed they were, and her manager didn't care. We paid for the early check in, just so we didn't have to queue again. It certainly put a dampener on our visit.The room was dated but OK, but no tea or coffee making facilities. We asked if we could get a kettle and were told that no rooms have that facility any more. $8 for a cup of very weak tea was a bit excessive, I thought, and when I asked for another tea bag as it was so weak, was asked for another $8! Lots of very drunk and noisy people coming back to their rooms during the night and shouting and slamming doors. There was a lot of mess in the corridors- dropped popcorn etc, and this was not cleared up. We visited lots of the other hotels, and none of them had such problems with checking in queues. We found the reception staff off hand and unfriendly, and the bar staff weren't much better. We ordered a coctkail for me and my husband asked for a whiskey. The barman asked which one, and my husband ordered one. "That's a Scotch, not a whiskey says the barman" - we giggled and said - oh that's what you call it over here- he very rudely replied that it was called Scotch everywhere, and you should know what you want to order and avoid me wasting my time having to explain things to you. This trip to Las Vegas was part of a special holiday and the visit to Paris Hotel was the lowest point in our trip. The customer care was much better in other hotels - we used the bars there. Go some where else

Paris.description: Lingering over pain au chocolat in a sidewalk café, relaxing after a day of strolling along the Seine and marveling at icons like the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe… the perfect Paris experience combines leisure and liveliness with enough time to savor both an exquisite meal and exhibits at the Louvre. Awaken your spirit at Notre Dame, bargain hunt at the Marché aux Puces de Montreuil or for goodies at the Marché Biologique Raspail, then cap it all off with a risqué show at the Moulin Rouge.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text: Food was absolutely delicious!!! It was so good I ordered a second serving. Service, ambiance perfect. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel with friendly staff
reviews.review_text: The hotel is nice, cute and clean. The staff is very friendly and polite. The room was small, but to be expected for an hotel in Paris. The bed was comfortable and the location very convenient. I really enjoyed my stay, thank you.

reviews.title: Great Paris hotel in the 5th
reviews.review_text: Hotel Monge is truly a great hotel! It has a great location and it is near some very convenient subway stations. The staff of the hotel is very helpful and extremely keen on making your experience good. The rooms are pretty small and it can get hot in them when the heating is on (the heating is controlled centrally, not in the rooms). Still, I believe this to be a very good Paris hotel. I recommend it.

reviews.title: Great atmosphere and food
reviews.review_text:
Very good food and service and nice atmosphere in this restaurant.

Seems like locals also eat here which is always a good sign

reviews.title: Extremely upset
reviews.review_text: I don't normally leave reviews but was so disappointed with this hotel after receiving a cancellation of my stay here 2 days before arrival.  I booked this 10 months ago for a surprise weekend for my husband's 60th birthday.  Apparently, they had advised me from an email address of 'reservation' (not the hotel email address) 3 days prior saying my card was no longer valid and to give them my new credit card details within 24hrs - of course an email like this was going to go to my junk.  For something Iike this I would have expected at least a phonecall but no!!!   Please, please make sure if you book in advance that you check your credit card details.  I was so upset to lose my booking of 10 months and phoned the hotel but there was no apology I was told to go online and book another room.  We managed to do this but with no view of the Eiffel Tower as was originally booked.   Still no apology (even when I arrived at the hotel in person) a very very sad and disappointed customer 😥

Disneyland Paris.description:
Welcome to the place where everyone can shine their brightest!

Since opening in 1992, Disneyland Paris® has welcomed hundreds of millions of guests through its gates, making it Europe's number-one tourist destination

With the majestic Sleeping Beauty castle as its heart, Disneyland park is the fantastical home to five incredible lands. For 30 magical years, it's been the place where extraordinary stories come to life before your very eyes. Buckle up because you’re about to whizz around Discoveryland, Fantasyland, Frontierland, Adventureland, and Main Street U.S.A.®

Feel unique magic in the air, as the 30th Anniversary festive aura transforms Disneyland park into a vibrant wonderland. With stunning surroundings, the mesmerizing Gardens of Wonder, and many eye-catching surprises, you're sure to get swept up in the celebratory spirit.

As night falls, prepare to be amazed by the award-winning Disney D-Light, where spectacular drone light choreography illuminates the sky.

reviews.title: Great Christmas Visit.
reviews.review_text: Really great time. Weather was snowing for the first day but cleared after that. Atmosphere was wonderful. Some areas were closed for refurbishment but it didn’t kill the atmosphere. We stayed in Newport Bay Hotel. Really recommend going at Christmas

reviews.title: We don't think about it to come back
reviews.review_text: First thing to make clear: Disneyland Paris is 2 connected parks, Disneyland Park and Walt Disney Studios Park. We only did the Disneyland Park. Visited on a hot summer day in July. As we rented a house in Esbly we were only 8 minutes away. We arrived before 10.00 and passing security and the entrance went smoothly. Then the wait started. You can see in the app and per attraction what the waiting time is. 1 - 2 hours of waiting is no exception. The park is nice and the attractions are great but waiting 2 hours for a 2 minute ride is not funny. We were with teenagers and focused on the rollercoasters but also did 'it's a small world', Alice's Curious Labyrinth, Autopia and the railroad. It was nice to sit for a while in a cool place during Mickey’s PhilharMagic. We have seen and experienced it and we don't think about it to come back. The hot temperature and long waiting lines aren't worth it. The price (we paid almost USD 80 per person with a Family and Friends ticket) is also not attractive to try it another time. Restaurants, food stands, and souvenir shops are also extremely expensive, but they think they can justify it because it's Disney. The crew we interacted with is also not friendly and looks stressed but what you imagine with these big crowds? When we wanted to fill our water bottles (they have some water fountains) a lady started shouting to us because it was the area for the disabled people to watch the parade. Way too much stress. We have seen it, it was a nice experience, but the long lines, high price and stressed crew doesn't attract us to come back.

reviews.title: Magic ... but some improvements are needed
reviews.review_text:
What I didn't liked and few improvements suggestions:
- Frozen themed events and attractions were missing. 
- Long waiting queues (particularly for meeting the characters and for the shows). 
- Very expensive souvenirs. 
- When is a bit windy the night show is not using the drones which makes the show a lot less spectacular... 
- The restaurants in the parks are closed in the evening 9most of them after 16:00) making it impossible to have dinner at a decent hour and then see the night shows (after the show is over - 22:00 is to late to grab dinner outside Disneyland Park because everything is closed so you end up starving in the night).
- After the night show the park is closing immediately so everybody is leaving the park at the same time making it very hard to get home with that huge crowd heading to the same busses/metro/shuttle stations.
- more surprise appearances of characters would be great. we only met Captain Hook. Maybe princesses (especially since for Princess Pavilion you have to wait so long in line and then meet whatever comes your way), fairies, no Frozen characters or shows available
- some sort of virtual queues would be nice

Paris Las Vegas.address: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
Paris Las Vegas.description: Experience everything you love about Paris, in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. The city of lights shine on the strip. One night with us is all it takes to realize everything's sexier in Paris. Give in to your every desire at Paris Las Vegas Hotel and Casino, whether you crave decadent dining, world-class entertainment or thrilling nightlife. Guest rooms at Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino have a distinctly chic European look, with Versailles-style fixtures and luxury romantic décor. Red Rooms are sophisticated and modern while the splurge-worthy Louis XV Suite features chandeliers and oversized bathtubs.
Paris Las Vegas.address_string: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109

reviews.title: Wonderfully Romantic..& read about my great check in experience
reviews.review_text:
We needed to fly in to Vegas in order to travel to Thanksgiving at relatives. I booked Paris Vegas in advance. I never go anywhere without first consulting my BFF Tripadvisor.... the review said the check in and out was long and hard.. I downloaded the Caesars app( Paris is owned by) that did not help - when I arrived at 8pm on a Tuesday night.. there was a amazingly long line for that time of night.. however I left my man in line while I went to the self check in Kiosks.. I had heard mixed review about this too... In literally minutes I was all checked in and had 2 room keys in my hand and was on my way to my room while is calmly and happily walked by the still very long line!! it was easy and fast... We had reservations at the Eiffel tower restaurant that we would have missed if we wainted. We also had access to a texting concierge which I had never used before.. OMG LOVE IT whomever got this idea I love you... any question about reservations, room service, check in I just texted and got an immediate answer... when we checked in there was not pen or paper in our room- I texted the conceirge and it was delivered within 5 minutes.. ordered room service this way and arranged to get bags bell checked this way. check out this way too... super easy!!

WIFI said only 2 devices so we could only do our 2 phones... when I tried to watch tv later it would not connect to the internet for regular hotel tv( which was internet) so I am not sure if this was because our 2 devices were used up with our phones... I ended up going to sleep instead but this is something if I was there longer I would have wanted fixed

3288P Bourdeux tower -was our room - it was the absolute best view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountain below.. such a gorgerous room - large bathroom with bidet. extra little make up table with magnifing lamp plenty of closet storage a beautiful living room with full 6 person dinner table.. nice quiet floor - none of the rooms are too fair from the elelvator as they feed inward. 

room service breakfast was tres expensive but expected and yummy. 
the hotel as everything you need cute things to buy in the gift shop- easy valet parking and easy bell check for luggage if you have a little time to spend after checking out. We took the very easy walk right across the street to the Bellagio to see the huge Christmas display!!! 
Highly recommend this room and hotel. I was nervous about check in after reading review but I experienced none of these problems. We made Eiffel tower restaurant reservations ahead of time... I highly recommend doing this as all the dining looked like it had lines and only had seating for reservations!! 

BOOK it and enjoy France without the extra trip to Europe.. I thought it was clean, friendly and wonderfully romantic.

reviews.title: Room need renovations
reviews.review_text: The hotel is old, but the entrance is fine. The rooms are very old, the furniture is old, the carpet overdue to be replaced and the wall plinth have to repainted. The toilet was renovated. Price of liquors (gin) at the bar is expensive 23 USD each. Still have a good experience at the casino. The personal was good.  No suprise. My friend only touched the Pringles and Reese to see the prices in the room and they were charged to his account. He asked to be credited ands they did. so be careful.

reviews.title: Terrible front desk , terrible customer service
reviews.review_text: Terrible customer service, terrible communication, let’s just start with the checkin it’s about 2 hours because they had like 6 desk workers an it was the day before thanksgiving, the kiosks don’t work we had prepaid, upon checking in we discovered that one of the rooms we paid for an resort fees etc. the tv doesn’t work so I call the front desk an was told someone would come up an work on it  , ok, so I’m in bed about 12:30 to 1:00 am an the worker shows up takes tv off wall , unplugs it etc. then informs me that he will have to send the tv crew up next day , well the next day I call front desk again an they say someone will come up , so we leave an go to thanksgiving buffet at Wynn , upon coming back some 4 or 5 hours later still no tv , call front desk 2 more times, finally the next day the front desk says if you wanna talk to management you must come downstairs you can’t talk on phone, so I go an I’m kinda out off at the front desk because the lady I walk up to shuts her stand down an walks in a door behind the counter, I ask the other lady on duty is she telling the manager or what , she mumbled something , anyway the manager finally comes out , April was her name she says yes I see where you called multiple times an we have sent 5 engineers up an none of them could fix it , my reply was can’t you just put a new tv in , anyway she says we can swap rooms which was a huge ordeal moving everything, no help offered, she says I can take off the resort fees she that’s like $200 plus so I say ok,  upon checkout today , another lady says only taking off $56 that’s it , no communication, nothing, we spend over $2500 on motel fees , this property has declined bad , read the other reviews, you will see I lot of the people saying the same thing, carpet is old, worn, nasty, we will be taking our business away from ceasers properties, Paris is only out to get your $$

reviews.title: Disappointing Experience at a Supposedly Four-Star Hotel
reviews.review_text:
1.	No Basic Amenities: The room lacked a coffee or tea maker, bottled water, and other basic conveniences you’d expect at this price point.
	2.	Horrible Check-In Process: We waited over an hour to check in, only to be met with a rude staff member who dismissed complaints by stating, “I’m tired too.”
	3.	Dead Door Lock Battery: One day, we couldn’t access our room because the battery in the door lock was dead. Reaching the front desk was impossible due to the endless line. After waiting for security and management, it took over an hour to resolve.
	4.	Broken Safe: The in-room safe didn’t work, requiring us to wait 60 minutes for management to arrive and fix it.
	5.	Housekeeping Issues: Our room was not cleaned two out of the five days we stayed. On the second day, we requested clean towels and soap to at least take a shower and waited 90 minutes for them to be delivered.

Overall, the lack of organization, poor service, and absence of basic amenities made this an incredibly frustrating stay. I would not recommend this hotel

reviews.title: Not what it used to be
reviews.review_text:
Our first room was not acceptable. We found gum on the bathroom counter and the room had a funky smell. That room also had the tiniest pillows on the two queen beds. After I complained, the second room was ok. But Atleast it had better pillows.

Checked out a couple days later and realized they charged me for refreshments I never ordered or purchased. Overall, the experience was annoying and an inconvenience.

Ritz Paris.description: Located on the iconic Place Vendôme, the Ritz Paris is one of the most legendary hotels in the City of Lights. Refinement of French art de vivre meets elegance of Belle Époque décor. Exquisitely appointed 71 rooms and 71 suites bear the name of F. Scott Fitzgerald or Marcel Proust. Ritz Paris is a place where dreams come to life. The famous Bar Vendôme welcomes guests to savor dishes at any hour of the day while the Ritz Bar is the perfect place to enjoy zodiac-themed cocktails. Ritz Paris Le Comptoir celebrates modern conviviality and French gourmandise, with exceptional pastries by Chef François Perret. At the École Ritz Escoffier, enthusiasts, from novice to professional, can perfect their approach to French cuisine and pastry-making. The Ritz Club & Spa and its sumptuous pool elevates well-being to an art form. Last but not least, Salon Proust is the place to enjoy a delightful teatime à la française and no visit to the Ritz Paris would be complete without stopping by the iconic Bar Hemingway.

reviews.title: Doorman doesn’t know what “hospitality” means
reviews.review_text:
We were hoping to come in and have lunch at the cafe in the lobby, but the employee who was standing just inside the revolving doors was on us the second we entered, asking why we were there and making sure we knew we weren’t allowed to go any further into the hotel. We had been out walking all day and weren’t wearing head to toe fur coats or carrying Louis Vuitton bags, so he clearly knew we weren’t good enough to be in the building and wanted to make sure to keep out the riffraff.

Plenty of other people walked by without his comment, their noses in the air, and that of course was no problem to the doorman because those people clearly belonged. It’s ironic that a space that ought to exist to make people feel welcome instead does the opposite. Stuffy, “exclusive” Parisian hotel culture at its worst.

reviews.title: If a mistake is made, quick reparations are done.
reviews.review_text:
I attended the Escoffier class in the morning and was escorted to the room personally, a lovely touch. However, another woman's purse and luggage was located within. 

Prompt apologies were communicated and my luggage was delivered within 15 minutes or so. My fatigue was overwhelming so I declined the offer to unpack. 

Later, I looked in the Hemingway bar which intimate but doesn't open up for conversation with its limited seats at the bar. You need to bring your friends with you.

I moved to the Vendome bar with lovely piano tunes and had a lively conversation with an attorney from Finland and later, a couple from Australia. Ambiance and environment were super.

reviews.title: Perfect in every way!
reviews.review_text:
This was my first stay at the Ritz, but it won’t be my last. Every staff member that I encountered was professional but friendly and made me feel quite welcomed. 

One of the great perks of a stay at the Ritz is that your room is ready when you arrive, regardless of the time (as long as you let them know your arrival time in advance).  Many flights from the US arrive quite early in the morning, so this was a huge plus for me. It is also possible to delay check out until 3 pm on your day of departure. 

I have already booked a second stay for January 2025

reviews.title: Beautiful place but food only average
reviews.review_text: Had lunch in the Ritz on Monday after Arc weekend.. Nice table in garden room.. very good Regnard wine.. we ordered 2 Croque Monsieur and  a chicken Caesar Salad.. the service was very good.. polite, friendly and professional... the food was a let down, unfortunately.. it was well presented and in a timely fashion.. but the salad was lacking in taste and flavour.. the Croque was described as average by those who ate it.. cocktails after lunch were lovely... it was a pity about the food.. fabulous place though.. our wine waiter, Axel, was the epitome of French charm at it's best..

reviews.title: Chapter and Verse of Comfort
reviews.review_text: As a bookworm, I was in heaven. Each floor was themed after a different literary genre, with quotes adorning the walls and books available to borrow everywhere. The cozy reading nooks scattered throughout were perfect for losing oneself in a story. The staff, well-versed in literature, were always ready with a recommendation. It was a bibliophile's dream come true!

The Paris Catacombs.address: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France
The Paris Catacombs.description: A genuine labyrinth in the heart of underground Paris, this ossuary houses the remains of approximately six million Parisians. The history of the Catacombs dates back to the late 18th century when the city's cemeteries were closed due to health reasons and its contents were moved to an underground site. Today, you can walk down the spiral staircase and take a guided tour of the network of tunnels or explore it at your own pace. It's recommended to buy skip-the-line tickets online to avoid snaking lines. You can easily reach the Catacombs by hopping on the Paris Metro. – Tripadvisor
The Paris Catacombs.address_string: 1 Avenue du Colonel Henri Rol-Tanguy, 75014 Paris France

reviews.title: Fun and interesting
reviews.review_text: Definitely a great thing to do with your teenaged kids. Great history lesson many stories down and just the right amount of creepiness that comes with 6 million people’s bones underground.

reviews.title: Definitely go !
reviews.review_text: A very surreal experience! Definitely not for those with limited mobility as there’s a lot of stairs and walking. Booked tickets a week in advance on the official website and got an audio guide included which was really factual. Definitely a bit spooky but gives a completely different view of Paris.

reviews.title: Scary and fascinating at the same time
reviews.review_text: It was very interesting, spooky and very well done. The place has a very mysterious vibe. If you want something creepy, come here! The only downside was it took a while to get to the actual skulls, and it isn’t very accessible. But if you are travelling in Paris, I would definitely recommend that you come here.

reviews.title: Great catacombs DO NOT USE HEADOUT TOURS
reviews.review_text:
Great experience and fascinating to understand the history behind the catacombs BUT don’t book through HEADOUT Paris is our advice. 
See HEADOUT Paris reviews for reasons.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.review_text: This is a must see. Save money and just go online and buy tickets for 29 Euros and take an Uber there-instead of over $100 on a tour formal tour. You wear an audio device that explains everything in great detail as you walk through. All the history around the catacombs.

Le Bristol Paris.address: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France
Le Bristol Paris.description: Faubourg Saint Honoré, au cœur du Paris de la mode, Le Bristol Paris écrit son histoire depuis 1925. Elle nous raconte l’élégance de son décor entièrement rénové, agrémenté de meubles XVIIIe, l’audace des soirées Bristol After Dark qui revisitent les codes des nuits parisiennes, la maitrise d’un service alliant art, chaleur et grand professionnalisme. Brasserie une étoile ou table triplement étoilée, nos Chefs subliment la gastronomie française. De l’extraordinaire piscine suspendue au-dessus des toits, aux 1200 m2 de verdure et de calme de son jardin intérieur, Le Bristol est un Palace unique où l’on se sent bien.
Le Bristol Paris.address_string: 112 Rue du Faubourg Saint Honore 8th Arr., 75008 Paris France

reviews.title: A unique place to stay in Paris
reviews.review_text: First and foremost: the staff is outstanding.  The building is incredible; the elevator, the pool, the garden, every single space is unique.  Very well located.  Expensive, but worth very much the stay.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.review_text: The incredibly smooth, friendly, and professional staff exceeded our expectations every day with their kindness and flawless teamwork and service. We were delighted with the little snacks and gifts placed in our room daily. The porters, room valet, room service, and concierge staff was perfect. Our check-in/check-out service was easy and pleasant. We were walked to our room when we checked in. The room was beautiful, the shower/water-pressure was amazing, huge fluffy white towels, comfortable bed. I wish we had time to experience the pool and spa.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.review_text: Wonderful service, beautiful hotel, the breakfast was awesome. It was an unforgettable experience of lifetime.

reviews.title: Hello Paris!
reviews.review_text: Great location, friendly service excellent housekeeping, overall a great experience! Definitely the best hotel in town.

reviews.title: Hotel Heaven
reviews.review_text: Once again another fabulous stay at Le Bristol! If heaven has a hotel this would be it. Every detail in the room from the bed to the towels is perfect. The concierge team is outstanding , they took care of all of our dining and tours. The staff is so friendly and sincere can't wait to return again.

Novotel Paris Les Halles.address: 8 Place Marguerite de Navarre, 75001 Paris France
Novotel Paris Les Halles.description: Notre hôtel se rénove et évolue pour sublimer votre expérience ! Chaque changement est pensé avec soin pour vous garantir un séjour agréable, dans un cadre confortable et accueillant. Équipées d'une télévision à écran plat, d'une climatisation et d'un minibar, les chambres du Novotel Paris Les Halles offrent tout le confort dont vous avez besoin. Vous pourrez même rester connecté grâce au wi-fi gratuit. L'hôtel dispose de nombreux atouts, tels qu'un service de chambre et une conciergerie. Le centre de fitness et le petit déjeuner contribueront à rendre votre séjour encore plus spécial. Que vous soyez en voyage d'affaires, d'agrément ou les deux, le Novotel Paris Les Halles rendra votre séjour à Paris inoubliable.
Novotel Paris Les Halles.address_string: 8 Place Marguerite de Navarre, 75001 Paris France

reviews.title: A great stay, lovely staff!!
reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful stay at the Novotel les Halles. The staff were incredibly attentive to us, from the moment we arrived with the help of the bellboy to the young woman at reception (Helena, I believe) who checked us in. Everything was perfect. The highlight was the concierge, Fabrice, who assisted us when we had an issue with our flight tickets. He took a lot of time to help us, and it truly saved the rest of our trip – thank you! The hotel is undergoing some construction on the ground floor, but it didn't affect our stay as we weren’t disturbed in our room, and the staff were so kind that we didn’t mind at all. The location is very central, allowing us to get everywhere quickly. It was a fantastic experience, and we will definitely return here every time we visit Paris!

reviews.title: We can’t sleep because of bad services.
reviews.review_text: Aircon is not working.  Telephone is not working. We spend two (2) nights without sleep because of a very hot room. We reported the issue on the receptionist twice.  They just promised to fix it never done anything. Me and my wife are very frustrated.  We don’t recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very  professional personal, very well placed, nearby everything, I’ll come back for sure!!!
reviews.review_text: Excellent, specially personal of the Hotel, particularly Paulo such a nice man, continuously worry about any need that we have, he helped us in many ways. Hope in my next visit all the amenities are set, like restaurant, the entrance, breakfast used to be better when I visited it in 2022, best regards to all the personal they’re the best!

reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Paris
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel in the heart of my favorite district of Paris! Convenient location (close to train, shopping, restaurants) yet quiet and charming. Breakfast was lovely, well stocked in-room coffee/tea, friendly staff, very clean hotel that is well maintained (elevators fast!)

reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff but currently baorded up as being renovated.
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a month long trip. Great location and as per other reviews the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, we were unaware that the hotel is currently being renovated. The front is all boarded up and the outdoor courtyard is not available. As a result there is no natural light coming into the hotel. When we arrived security had to come out and get us as they obviously saw we could not find the entrance. We didn't enjoy our stay as it felt dark and pokey.

reviews.title: Very convenient in Paris but with points for future improvement
reviews.review_text:
Rode the Paris Metro when I visited Paris in September 2024. And it was very convenient for me to travel from the hotel in the outskirts of the city (Gallieni) to different parts of Central Paris (including the Eiffel Tower, Trocadéro Square & Louvre Museum. The services were relatively frequent (at least every 4-5 minutes at peak times), it covers most areas of the cities with a dense coverage in Central Paris, the trains were relatively quick - even with older trains being used in Line 3, some of the modern lines are automated with cab/front views and have platform edge/screen doors, station spacing was relatively close without long distances (compared to parts of the London Underground), and they are also integrated with the RER Trains, buses and even trams (although I didn't ride the trams) - to which I can say Paris has an amazing public transport network on the whole (possibly one of the best in the world with its different modes).

However, my only issues with the Paris Metro was that accessibility in the older lines wasn't great as most of the old Metro stations didn't have lifts, escalators or level boarding with the trains (wasn't a major issue for me, but would be trouble for disabled and older people alongside people with heavy luggage/loads), the train reliability for Line 3 was variable (most of the time it was fine, but on the last day, there was a signal failure which really slowed down train speed & operations) and a few older stations looked a bit worn out & in need of better maintenance. I also thought it was a little bit weird that a few lines had rubber-tyred tracks although those lines were thankfully quite quick & reliable. But apart from those, the Paris Metro on the whole was very convenient for me.

reviews.title: Don't take the risk of getting on the metro
reviews.review_text: Last month, our family had a terrible experience on the Paris metro. As tourists with two minors, we were abruptly and disproportionately approached by four "metro agents". They demanded our tickets and, upon not finding one (which had been lost during the trip), accused us of fraud. Despite showing the purchase receipt and explaining that we had just arrived that morning, they ignored us and fined us (50 euros). This experience was very traumatic and left a bitter taste in our mouths, ruining what was supposed to be a short two-day trip. We felt a great sense of injustice. How many other people have gone through something similar? Paris is an empty shell without tourism and this is yet another demonstration of how badly the city treats those who keep it alive. -- Le mois dernier, notre famille a vécu une expérience terrible dans le métro parisien. En tant que touristes avec deux mineurs, nous avons été abordés de manière brutale et disproportionnée par quatre "agents de métro". Ils ont exigé nos billets et, n'en trouvant pas un (qui avait été perdu pendant le voyage), nous ont accusés de fraude. Malgré la présentation du reçu d'achat et l'explication que nous venions d'arriver ce matin-là, ils nous ont ignorés et nous ont infligé une amende de 50 euros. Cette expérience a été très traumatisante et nous a laissé un goût amer, gâchant ce qui devait être un court séjour de deux jours. Nous avons ressenti un profond sentiment d'injustice. Combien d'autres personnes ont vécu une expérience similaire ? Paris est une coquille vide sans le tourisme et c'est une nouvelle démonstration de la façon dont la ville traite mal ceux qui la font vivre.

reviews.title: Worst experience at Bir Hakeim Metro station
reviews.review_text:
We had to take the metro to reach our bus station, but the staff wouldn’t accept cash. Luckily, I had a virtual card, so we managed to pay. However, the ticket they gave us wouldn’t validate. When I went back to the staff for help, they told me to join the line again, even though it was super long and we were running late.

I politely asked for assistance again, but instead of helping, the staff started using foul language. I was with my sister, and we didn’t have time to argue, so I just let it go. In the end, they opened the gate for us, but it was a terrible experience.

I wouldn’t recommend using the metro if you’re short on time. The staff was rude and unhelpful, and honestly, it didn’t feel safe. It’s disappointing that behavior like this goes unchecked.

reviews.title: WARNING METRO STAFF SCAM AND BULLY TOURISTS
reviews.review_text:
Awful experience on Metro - we bought tickets which but my partners didn't validate for some reason. Just after going through we were surrounded by 3 guards aggressively wanting to check tickets. When my partners was said to be 'invalid' as if it had not gone through the barrier they demanded a €60 fine - no discussion. We explained we had just bought it with help from a staff member for the final journey we needed to make back to the Eurostar and asked if we could point her out. She stormed off and refused to let us point her out. When she returned she said the ticket office staff said no one helped!! They said they would call police which would raise the fine to €200. They were bullying and aggressive and it was very clear there was a genuine mistake as they had watched us the whole time buying the ticket and go through. 
We will never visit Paris again and if you are going avoid the Metro - there is definately scamming there with tourists from the very people who should be looking out for you. What an awful way to treat tourists. Made me appreciate the UK and Londons underground staff. We were glad to be home and will not visit France again ever.

reviews.title: Fantastic System
reviews.review_text:
Just back from a 3 night stay in Paris with 2 children aged 14 and 12. I had lived in Paris 30 years ago, but my wife and kids were new to the city.

The Paris Metro system is fantastic. If you are staying in the city you are probably less than 250m from an entrance into the Metro and your destination is equally close to a stop. If your destination is on the same line as your start location just follow the signs for that line - there will be 2 options, one for each direction, and the direction is indicated by the name of the last station in that direction. Sometimes they will also list out the stops in each direction, but not always. If its on a different line you will need to change - this involves getting off at a stop and following signs for the next line/direction you need to take. You won't have to leave the Metro system, so you don't need a second ticket. 
We used the phone app Bonjour RATP to see the best route (including transfers). I would suggest practice using this app before you go if you are new to subway systems.

We used paper tickets as we didn't know how much we'd use the Metro, but a Navigo Easy card each preloaded with tickets would have been cheaper and simpler. There are other options such as day passes etc. The paper tickets we bought were called t+ tickets and they cover any journeys within the metro system except to Orly Airport.

Hang on to your ticket until you leave the Metro system! Twice we had to use the same ticket twice as there was a second set of turnstiles for some reason. Also, while we didn't see any ticket inspectors, they do check tickets and you'll be fined if you have thrown your ticket away.

A few words of warning:

Take precautions against pick pockets - they will target tourists and its hard to look like a local! Carriages can be crowded so valuables need to be well secured. We didn't see any pickpockets, but there were warnings everywhere. I also bought any tickets in Republique rather than the more touristy stations.

We took the Metro from Universite Saint Denis to Republic and back as we arrived on the bus from Beauvais airport. I felt it was quite challenging travelling as a family with suitcases in rush hour. We had to manoeuvre to make sure we were near the carriage doors so we could get out in time (Parisiens are impressively polite though!) If the kids were younger I would have looked into another form of transportation for this journey.

The system is old, and unlike more modern systems it doesn't seem very accessible. If you are unable to use stairs then do your research before travelling - while some stations have lifts I didn't see many.

Some Metro journeys involve quite a bit of walking within the system (to/from platforms, between lines etc)

Some trains are very busy - so you'll find yourself quite squashed in. The longest wait time we saw was 4 minutes though, so if you are concerned about a train being excessively full, then wait for the next one.

Conclusion:
Overall we took 12 journeys on the Metro in 3.5 days, most journeys took less than 20 minutes. We stayed in Republique, which has a number of lines, so most journeys didn't need a transfer. We packed loads into our trip to Paris and there is no way we could have seen and done as much without such an efficient form of transportation, and the kids really enjoyed the novelty of it.

The Peninsula Paris.description: Exquisitely restored spaces are complemented by contemporary art installations, furnishings and technology. Dazzling rooftop spaces and private terrace gardens offer 360° views and glamorous extras that make The Peninsula Paris a decidedly 21st century palace.As with all Peninsula Hotels, location is of prime importance and Paris is no exception. Just steps away from the Arc de Triomphe and Avenue des Champs Elysées at 19 Avenue Kléber in the heart of the elegant 16th arrondissement, The Peninsula sits close to some of the world’s most famous monuments, museums and luxury shopping districts.

reviews.title: Tranquil Luxury in Every Detail
reviews.review_text: Stepping into this hotel felt like entering a peaceful oasis. The sophisticated decor and calming atmosphere instantly melted away our travel stress. The beds were heavenly comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were top-notch. What really stood out was how quiet and serene every space felt, despite being fully booked.

reviews.title: Absolutely a FANTASTIC time couldn't have been better!
reviews.review_text: Just got back from a fantastic time at the Peninsula Hotel in Paris. Everything was absolutely perfect. The place is beyond gorgeous and the staff is beyond anything I've experienced before. Everything and I mean everything about this place is great it's beautiful, it's a great location to see all the sites and the staff is as friendly as you could imagine. We went for our anniversary and boy did they treat us great... roses, candles, and chocolates it couldn't have been nicer . We'll be staying here every single time we go to Paris no need to look for anything else!

reviews.title: A wonderful break in Paris at a perfect hotel.
reviews.review_text:
We needed a break in Paris and chose the Peninsula with reliance on the high standards we have always had there. This trip met and exceeded the mark. The Peninsula is well stated elegance and cool and calm and serene with just enough edge of excitement.  The rooms are very nice and well supported by the technology that is part of their now standard array (we were at the new Peninsula in Istanbul in August and will provide a separate review). We were met at the door by Rana Martin form guest services and escorted to our room. The suite was nice and well appointed and very comfortable. A lovely selection of fruit and macrons awaited us and the flowers and appointments in the room were lovely and very proper and home. Rana is a gem in all respects.

The hallmark of The Peninsula has become its persons. Everyone greets you with a welcoming smile and treats you as an honored guest. The entire Concierge staff assisted with our flowers for our room and our challenging requests for restaurant reservations. This was handled by the entire team including Jeremie and Célia and Clotilde and Christophe (the entire very large and capable team is always happy and eager to be of assistance!). Pro traveler tip: get the WhatsApp contact to the Concierge Team and make your asks in real time and enjoy immediate and professional support before and during your stay. The service levels they provide are exactly why one stays at The Peninsula as they do everything with a smile and sense of pride that enhances the experience.

We caught up on much needed sleep at the hotel during our stay. It has been a long time since we traveled without our wonderful kids and the peace and quiet were spectacular. We enjoyed excellent room service breakfast daily and appreciated the highest quality linens and bedding and bath products. 

Thank you to the entire staff from front of house to housekeeping for a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: Glorious Hotel
reviews.review_text:
Fabulous hotel that’s been updated with a modern flair while still maintaining the stunning Parisian palace that it domiciles. The rooms have been incredibly soundproofed and designed with a comfortable elegance that is perfect for relaxing after a long day of perusing the streets. Additionally, the service is kind, helpful, and a delight. 

The only dings (and they’re small ones), are the firmness of the mattress, the tiny size of the gym, and, the Cantonese restaurant whose food is TERRIBLE. Also, if this is your first trip to Paris, it’s not in the most central location but the metro is so easy to navigate it shouldn’t matter.

reviews.title: Unworthy of a palace, terrible experience
reviews.review_text:
am deeply disappointed by my recent experience at the Peninsula Paris, supposedly the epitome of elegance and hospitality. I had chosen to go to the lobby while waiting for a friend, with the intention of having a drink right after. To my great surprise, I was simply “kicked out” of the lobby under the pretext that I was not drinking immediately and that I was not expecting anyone residing at the hotel.
People ask me who exactly I'm waiting for, what an indiscretion!
I have never been treated in such a humiliating manner in an establishment of this magnitude. I have gone very often to have breakfasts and even lunches in this establishment where I will never return, I will obviously tell my experience to other people around me
A man named SAÏD (I wonder how he was able to obtain such a position in charge of security) was arrogant, indelicate and disrespectful. I was made to feel like an unwanted intruder, even though I was planning to spend money at the hotel.
This behavior is unbecoming of a hotel of this reputation, and I strongly advise anyone not to go there if you expect a minimum of courtesy and professionalism. There are many other establishments in Paris that know how to treat their customers with respect and consideration, which is clearly not the case here.
Absolutely not worthy of a palace!

Bustronome Paris.description: Aboard a double-decker bus converted into a restaurant, guests will enjoy a friendly welcome and a wide variety of dishes in a fashionable setting. The BUSTRONOME : a Parisian invitation to rediscover some of the City of Light's most beautiful locations while enjoying fine French cuisine. This singular journey combines a visual experience with a treat for the taste buds; Paris residents and tourists alike can indulge their love of culture while savouring good food.

reviews.title: Amazing experience with fabulous food!
reviews.review_text: Loved this experience, we would highly recommend, food was of amazing standard considering it was made in a small bus kitchen.  Staff were friendly and helpful, sights were great and loved the extra stop by the Eiffel Tower.  There was a five course meal served with wine which included tuna, fish, beef, cheese and desert.  Tips: book in advance especially in busy times, you might need to request a non alcoholic or soft drink (outside of water) as these are not always served as standard, if you run out of wine we were able to request more, staying on after the small break stop is a must because this is when you will get the Eiffel Tower experience.

reviews.title: Sights of Paris and Dinner
reviews.review_text: Fabian and Lea our servers were spectacular. The whole idea of eating and seeing all the sites is just cool. The food was really good. A full 6 courses. They were also very accommodating to my dietary requirements. A wonderful experience.

reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.review_text: I booked this experience based upon the Frenchies YouTube review as they stated how great the food was and a lovely experience. The poached egg starter and strawberry dessert were good but everything in between was not that great, especially the fish and duck. The duck was overcooked and the fish wasn’t seasoned well. I had just left the Loire Valley and ate at some amazing restaurants and this just didn’t even compare. The wine was also poor. There was a couple seated behind us and I heard the gentleman telling the wait staff that the only good thing was the bread and he told them he didn’t even want the duck brought to the table because the food had been so poor. It is a very jerky experience and I gave up trying to figure out what I was looking at, as my information wasn’t loading. This was a very overpriced, underwhelming experience and I wouldn’t repeat it. It was extremely disappointing to stop at Invalides for pictures, instead of outside the Eiffel Tower.

reviews.title: Paris looks magical from the bus at night
reviews.review_text: great service, great experience, dinner exceeded all expectations, 6 courses of dinner, each one was very tasty.I will visit again.

reviews.title: Fabulous experience
reviews.review_text:
Amazing experience, especially following the Olympic Games

Staff were delightful, food was delicious 

We had a fabulous time, highly recommend

Tokyo Bay.address: 20 The Strand Takapuna Beach, Takapuna, Auckland 0622 New Zealand
Tokyo Bay.description: Tokyo Bay is located beachside, on Auckland's famous Takapuna Beach. Our Japanese team serve modern, not fusion, Japanese cuisine, of the highest standard.

reviews.title: Like dining in Japan
reviews.review_text: Tokyo Bay is like dining at a restaurant in Japan; it's our favourite in Aotearoa and we dine there often. I especially like the freshness of their sushi & sashimi; and their green tea ice cream is the best anywhere. The staff are friendly and attentive to our dietary needs.

reviews.title: Best Japanese Restaurant on The North Shore
reviews.review_text:
Welcome by the owner as usual so friendly and pleasant. Wait staff well trained and extremely pleasant as well as knowing and explaining any questions relating to the menu. Good quality wines to go with the food and we were not rushed through our dinner which was well paced,
Certainly, look forward to dining at Tokyo Bay again and as a note people who arrived with no reservations missed because the whole restaurant was fully booked all night.

reviews.title: Always a great experience
reviews.review_text: Our business party of four dined for lunch and as always the experience was superb. Service, menu and presentation was excellent and we will continue to come back here for more of Tokyo Bay.

reviews.title: The best Japanese Restaurant in Auckland
reviews.review_text: I have been going to Tokyo Bay for over 10 years. The service is always excellent and the food quality has always stayed the same. I love this restaurant and it has been my personal favorite for client entertainments or for family gathering! Its the best!

reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous
reviews.review_text:
Had a fantastic meal here on my birthday!
Lovely surroundings. Delicious fresh food. Attentive polite staff. Totally recommend!
‘Sugoi’.

Ninja Tokyo.address: 2-2-1 Otemachi Shinotemachi Bldg. B1F, Chiyoda 100-0004 Tokyo Prefecture

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.review_text: It is a nice place to come and get away from the crowds. The food is also very good they do magic tricks and fun activities before you eat.

reviews.title: Highly Recommended Experience
reviews.review_text: The experience was absolutely wonderful. The staff were so lovely and welcoming. I loved the maze you had to go through to get to your table. It is a bit expensive but well worth it for the experience you get.

reviews.title: Good food, friendly service and outstanding entertainment
reviews.review_text: Good food, friendly service and outstanding entertainment. The restaurant is pricy, but well worth the experience. It's a little bit difficult to find as it is located in the basement of a office (?) building.

reviews.title: Great time with the Ninja's
reviews.review_text: We had a great time here at the Ninja Restaurant  fro dinner.  We were shown to a private room for the 4 of us through the secret and and passages.  Food was excellent with service to match.  Not cheap but was a lot of fun.  Near the end a magical came in and did his routine.

reviews.title: Delicious theatre
reviews.review_text: A meal we will never forget for all the right reasons. We are a family of 5 (4 meat eaters and myself a vegetarian). The food and delivery was spectacular. We all agreed it was probably the best meal we have had. Steak was apparently perfection and my veggie courses were original and flavour filled. Combining that with humour and spectacle to conclude we had the most wonderful experience.

Tokyo.address: Al uruba Street, Riyadh 11323 Saudi Arabia
Tokyo.description: In October 1985, Tokyo restaurant opened its doors as the first Japanese restaurant in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia catering authentic Japanese dishes concocted with the finest and freshest ingredients, highlighting a value-oriented Japanese cuisine.

reviews.title: Riyadh Adventures
reviews.review_text: The dynamite shrimp (shrimp blast) is the best you’re gonna ever have. I also got the Ebi Furai and Crazy Crunchy Tempura which were all amazing

reviews.title: This place and food quality never gets old!
reviews.review_text: Top service and amazing quality value Japanese food. Setting on the veranda is very nice too. I have been visiting this place since 15 years and quality never goes down. I would go back without hesitation anytime.

reviews.title: Great food in an authentic setting
reviews.review_text: The food was superb and the staff are friendly. Portions are a reasonable size for the money and very good food with high quality ingredients. We’ll def be back

reviews.title: The food was very tasty specially the tempura and the potatoes cake was very delicious I ordered takeout extra order…
reviews.review_text: I use to dine in this restaurant since it was opened 1985 I’m not sure about the exact year it was my wife favorite Japanese restaurant…today all the old memories came back..

reviews.title: Healthy and Affable stay at Tokyo, Riyadh
