reviews.review_text: This is my seventh time at Tokyo Al Orouba and every time I have a great experience. Mehdi the supervisor and Nasser are always eager to assist with food choice and top notch service. Tokyo is special, since it is the first Japanese restaurant I have been to here in KSA nfanad I decided that it will be the only one That I will go to when craving Otoro Sashimi and/or Saad/Sultan rolls (My two Favorites here). I would advise you to get a Creamy Seafood soup for starters and Yuzu sorbet for dessert.

Tokyo Restaurant.address: 13 El Thawra St Korba, Cairo 4460242 Egypt
Tokyo Restaurant.description: A marriage of two cultures; a tale of two homes. Modern Japanese fusion cuisine in the heart of Korba.

reviews.title: Best in town and not only…
reviews.review_text: The best sushi I ate in my entire life. Hospitality and service is beyond elite. Highly recommend and a must visit when in Cairo.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.review_text:
Perfect place for everything…the food is amazing, the vibes is perfect …the staff is friendly
Flawless environment 🖤

reviews.title: Tokyo restaurant
reviews.review_text: I’ve been looking forward to trying Sushi at tokyo for a while now, and was so glad that I did! The food was so delicious and the service was really great, too

reviews.title: What amazing restaurant in Cairo
reviews.review_text: Really we had a wonderful delicious dinner at the Tokyo restaurant in Cairo , the service was great and elegance, food was very tasty and delicious, thanks for kerlos for his welcoming and his service, also I would like to thank the manager Mr Ramy of the restaurant for his welcoming and his recommend this dishes. Thank you all and I hope you all more successful.

reviews.title: One of the best restaurants in Cairo
reviews.review_text: this spot is great with friends and dates (it's upscale so it's not recommended to bring kids) the food is excellent the staff is attentive and professional, the dishes are well portioned and filling and flavorful. highly recommend.

reviews.title: Whisky Barrel-Aged Coffee
reviews.review_text: I visited Starbucks Roastery in Seattle WA many times but it was my first visit to Starbucks Roastery Tokyo. It has more variety of drinks than Seattle one. I tried their whisky Battel-Aged. It was very good.

reviews.title: Don’t miss it!
reviews.review_text: Loved this place . So glad i decided to come here instead of another crowded tourist trap. The mixed drinks are delicious. Im a bourbon fan so I had the New Tokyo Fashion. Excellent.

reviews.title: Best Starbucks well, worth the visit
reviews.review_text:
I’ve been to a lot of different Starbucks, but never a Roastery so this was so amazing. Located in Nakameguro it was just a short hop from our Shibuya hotel. This Roastery, sits along side the famous Meguro River Cherry Blossoms Promenade. I heard about this place on Instagram, but the recommendation was not to go during cherry blossoms season. However, that’s exactly when we went cause we came to Japan to see the cherry blossoms.
 No long cues but I did read something on instagram about needing a ticket or something to get in during peak times. We got there at about 11am and were told we needed to find a table before we could order. That took 15 to 20 minutes tops. Ordering took longer cause the line was long but still only took about 35 minutes including getting the order. I swear it took longer to use the bathroom cause there’s always a line for the ladies rooms. I think they only had two stalls on the third floor. Dumb!! Yes people were saving their tables with books, backpacks, coats, etc. WOW! This is probably the only country where you can do that. In the US, it would have been stolen or somebody would’ve moved it and taking the table without a second thought. So hats off to Japan. Seriously would love to live in Japan just to get away from all the violence here, but their system of trains drives me insane. All in all it was a nice experience having never been to a Roastery before, but the desserts are better by far  at the local bakeries. I’ve never been one for the baked goods at Starbucks cause they’re mediocre at best. The coffee was good, but then its Starbucks after all. I would’ve preferred their Sakura specialty drink but unfortunately, that wasn’t offered on the menu or I was ordering on the wrong floor. At least I can say I’ve been to a Starbucks, Roastery, and in Japan no less. Sweet!!

On your walk back to the train station make sure to check out the little Onigiri Shop along the way. The salmon with salmon roe is amazing and the rice is warm. I just had to give them a shout out.

reviews.title: Not your typical Starbucks
reviews.review_text: For those of you who have been to the Starbucks Reserve in Seattle, this location definitely makes the Seattle location feel small.  Multiple floors, great selection of food and drink, and a nice deck up top, it was certainly an enjoyable side trip.

reviews.title: Should visit when you are in Tokyo
reviews.review_text:
Huge coffee shop with variety coffee drink. Unique decoration and very inpressive coffee machine.
I try a cake and americano.

Tokyo Sushi.address: Rua de Alexandre Herculano 345, Porto 4000-055 Portugal

reviews.title: It is ok buffet Chinese sushi restaurant
reviews.review_text:
My favorite restaurant to eat Asian food in Porto is here. I have been their client since the lunch cost 8.80 euros until today 9.90 euros. It is a buffet system without drinks included. It is not mandatory to buy drinks. The buffet food has sobremesa and ice cream included.

Reservation is not needed if it is not the weekend. On the weekend, the restaurant is always full. Entrance is accessible for wheelchairs.

Cons
1. I wish they could have free wi-fi. Probably they do not provide wifi for the clients not to stay too long.

reviews.title: Perfect for family dinners
reviews.review_text: Great for night outs perfect destination for family gatherings or going out with friends the food is just 10/10 the service is good everything was perfect

reviews.title: Easy to find, its ok
reviews.review_text: All you can eat. Usual sort of experience. Stick to the authentic dishes, and don't fill up on rice. Sushi was good, Chinese portions a bit greasy. Sells soft drinks and beer. Cash only.

reviews.title: OK but strange
reviews.review_text: I have a pretty low standard for sushi.  For example, I eat grocery sushi often and think it's a fine meal. That being said, I'm really confused by people giving this place 5 stars.  Lots of subpar sushi with weird toppings like whipped cream, mangoes, and strawberry jam.  Every other sushi piece seems to have cream cheese.  Hot food is better, but I'm going to a sushi buffet for the sushi.  Got really busy so locals seem to dig this place more.

reviews.title: good sushi, fair price
reviews.review_text:
Good experience, good environment, nice staff!
It’s better to go there for lunch, dinner is really busy and there is always a queue.

Tokyo Japanese Restaurant.address: Str. Gheorghe Marinescu, Nr. 5, Cluj-Napoca 400000 Romania
Tokyo Japanese Restaurant.description: For 19 years in Cluj-Napoca, Tokyo Japanese Restaurant is the only place in town, besides a hotel, that is classified with 5*. Furthermore, Tokyo Japanese Restaurant is singular in Romania by following the original Edomae Sushi Style. Our owner and executive chef is Japanese Master Chef TSUCHIYA Naofumi, who is cooking his authentic style cuisine. Our recommendations are Tasting menu and Sushi Omakase Course. Both courses are serving 11 kinds of exquisite and beautiful dishes and deserts. Our menu also includes authentic Japanese drinks such as: Japanese beer (Asahi), Premium sake (Gynjo). As a tradition, our sushi chefs are participating annually at World Sushi Cup and Washoku World Challenge, organised in Japan, having great accomplishments. That been said, we are kindly expecting You on Marinescu Street, number 5 to enjoy our refined and original dishes!

reviews.title: High quality food, relaxed atmosphere, great service
reviews.review_text:
The food and service were great. Nice relaxed atmosphere where you can enjoy and talk. No loud music. Complements for quality and freshness of each ingredient. 
Our waitress Dipa was very polite and gentle. She was always around for anything we needed. It was very helpful and not disturbing. The kimono dressing is also very fascinating 👌 
Also, bonus from chef with complement tasting and mini dessert.

reviews.title: Dinner at Tokyo Restaurant Cluj
reviews.review_text:
I had an amazing experience at Tokyo. The sushi was fresh and flavorful, the gyoza perfectly crisp, and the sake paired beautifully with the meal, alongside a refreshing Asahi beer.
Our waiter was exceptional—attentive and knowledgeable, sharing fascinating insights about the sake production process, which elevated the experience.
With delicious food, great drinks, and outstanding service, Tokyo is a must-visit in Cluj.

reviews.title: Everything is nice
reviews.review_text: Excellent service! people are very nice (thank you Cristian) and the mood is very calm. For the food, there is good proportions and really good. 10/10

reviews.title: Worth every second here
reviews.review_text: Excellent customer service. Truly felt the Japanese culture , and the beautiful atmosphere made it feel like Tokyo. The food was very savoury.

reviews.title: From far best sushi in Cluj Napoca
reviews.review_text:
From far best sushi in Cluj Napoca. Every time I came here the food was very tasty, waiters  very professional and the ambient very warm. 
Every time I want to eat a good sushi I came here. Never disappoint. 
You should past by if you want to taste  a little taste from Japan food.

reviews.title: Worth the Trip
reviews.review_text: Excellent food, fun environment. Tried various dishes and enjoyed the meal. Wait staff was helpful with the process until you get the hang of it.

reviews.title: Great Night In Stillwater
reviews.review_text: A very fun evening. The food was really good - the Prime Rib & the Seafood - a nice sake selection & good service. It was an absolute treat & very well priced!!

reviews.title: Good, but needs some improvement.
reviews.review_text:
Have been here a few times. Food is good, but you are getting less than you used to.
Ladies' room is manky; they need to up their game in cleanliness. Eww.

reviews.title: Fun family night.
reviews.review_text: This was a fun experience. I have heard of Japanese cooking pots before but the experience of cooking your own food in one is so unusual. You have a choice of 3 different broths which is warmed at your table. The food is sliced very thinly and brought on platters ready to cook along with additional sauces. It was messy but tasty and fun.

reviews.title: Tasty FOOD, BUT OVERPRICED, PORTIONS SMALL FOR $23 per ENTRE, POOR AMBIANCE
reviews.review_text:
The outside looks interesting, like your entering a secret door, then BLAME!  A dreadful empty dirty 50 gallon fish tank, RIGHT WHERE YOU WALK IN, LOL.  Come on, clean it up or get rid of it, then a giant pokemon doll??!?,  whoever the owner is, AMBIANCE is VERY IMPORTANT.
Food and and our server was nice.  Food was great, but for $23, I expected twice as much.  Left stil hungry.
Im from the big city, and I feel restaurants like this take adavantage of Stillwater, because they know alot of people arent driving to OKC or Tulsa to eat. 

If this place was in OKC or Tulsa, they would be out of business, just based on what they charge.  and $3.50 for a Coke.  What is going on, this isnt New York!!

Little Tokyo.address: 2430 Teaster Ln Ste 212, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863-5274

reviews.title: Love the flame!!
reviews.review_text: Such a friendly and funny chef. He was very entertaining and the hibachi chicken was fantastic!! Came here with my family of 5 and we all enjoyed everything. So much food to take back to the cabin afterwards but definitely will be digging into it later.

reviews.title: The best hibachi ever
reviews.review_text: This place was so good I’m from Cincinnati Ohio I have never tasted such greatness buds of hibachi ever ribs on hibachi is so good !!!! I’ll be back the workers was very professional and proudly to service the guy at the front counter was excellent n very professional

reviews.title: A new favorite when in town!
reviews.review_text:
We visited Little Tokyo for the 2nd time tonight after having a great experience a few months ago when we were in town. 
We love the hibachi grill experience. It's like watching a little show with your dinner. The staff is great, and the portions are huge. We will probably get two more meals each out of our to-go plates. 
They have accommodated special dietary requests that we have heard asked with no issues. It is a small place, so you may have a wait time, but it is well worth the wait.

reviews.title: Little Tokyo--SHARE plates
reviews.review_text: Food was delicious and portion are huge!!!  SHARE... Everyone was taking home Togo containers!  We could have shared 1 meal with 3 people!  Price was incredibly great!  Some of the best "cook in front" that we've ever been to!!  Kids loved it and so did we!!

reviews.title: Some parts great and others not so much.
reviews.review_text: Went on a Tuesday evening. Took 20-30 minutes to get seated at a regular table. Overall wait wasn't too bad. It took 40 minutes to get our fried rice but drinks, salad, and soup came out immediately.  The sushi was subpar. Honestly, my wife brings me home sushi from Sam's Club that is better. It was edible but not what you would expect from this class restaurant. Everything else was delicious. We visit each year when we travel to the mountains

Tokyo Jo's.address: Kent Avenue Sandals Montego Bay, Montego Bay Jamaica

reviews.title: Highly recommend!
reviews.review_text: We visited on two consecutive nights. It was so good we came back again. Friendly and fast service with great cocktails. Absolutely delicious - highly recommend !

reviews.title: The best of a bad bunch of options at Sandals
reviews.review_text: Attentive service and good food.  It’s a very straightforward concept so you would expect Sandals to get it right.  The chefs at the wok stations were good.

reviews.title: Who doesn't like a great stir fry??
reviews.review_text: Who does not love a good stir fry??? It was so hard tp decide what goodies to put in it as there are so many selections. Levon our chef was wonderful and we had a great conversation as he was cooking our food. I wish I had more nights at the resort as I would have gone back again. Excellent!!!

reviews.title: Right outside our building, easy access
reviews.review_text: Quick Service, Great Wok Food and Apps.  Great locations and beautiful views of the Caribbean.  Great breeze and ambiance!

reviews.title: One of Our Favorites
reviews.review_text: We truly plan on making it to Tokyo Jo's a couple of times whenever we stay in the Montego Bay area however, mother nature did not cooperate this time and we got rained out the first try.  The second try was a success and the food was amazing as usual.  The service was more than accommodating and the chefs were amazing.  Excellent food for the Hibachi connoisseur.

Grand Hyatt Tokyo.description: Experience moments of more at a dynamic lifestyle destination hotel in the heart of Roppongi, Tokyo – a lively international district. With its central location directly connected to Roppongi Hills which houses 200 shops and restaurants, a cinema, an art museum and an observatory, Grand Hyatt Tokyo is the perfect base from which to comfortably explore and discover the city. What Makes Your Stay Grand: - Convenient location: Near famous Tokyo destinations, the hotel is just a three minute walk to the nearest subway station and 90 minutes by limousine bus from Narita International Airport and 40 minutes from Haneda Airport. - An abundance of dining options: Ten unique restaurants and bars offer seasonal Japanese and a range of international cuisine. - Luxurious award-winning accommodations: Unwind and relax in one of the 387 rooms and suites at this modern hotel. -Finding your inner harmony at Nagomi: Relax with Japanese healing traditions at Nagomi Spa and Fitness.

reviews.title: Another 5 Star Experience in Every Way.
reviews.review_text: I reviewed this hotel a year ago and said that we'd be back. Well we have just returned from Tokyo and spent another 10 days at the Grand Hyatt. Once again it did not disappoint and is every bit as good as it was a year ago, perhaps even better. This is a big hotel, but they still have that personal interaction with their guests and make you feel really welcome. The entire experience was flawless from check in to check out and nothing was too much trouble. All of the staff were outstanding but I do need to make special mention of Isaac in F&B, Samuel in The Oak Door Restaurant and Ashok in The French Kitchen. You guys rock!  Japan is the most amazing country and the people are so welcoming and gracious. Love it!

reviews.title: Awesome experience.
reviews.review_text:
I would like to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional communication and service provided by all teams during our recent stay. My wife, who has a hearing disability, traveled with a service dog, and while a few staff members initially inquired about her presence, they quickly understood the situation through effective communication.

Every team we interacted with, including the valet, front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping staff, demonstrated excellence in their roles. We could not have asked for a better experience.

Thank you for your kind and courteous service. We are already considering a return visit next year.

reviews.title: Great experience. Clean and comfortable hotel. Extremely kind and helpful staff
reviews.review_text: My room was large and spacious. They have balmain lotions and hair care. The bathroom is spacious. Amazing shower and large bathtub. Softest bedding. Love the turndown service. The breakfast buffet was superb with fresh tuna and grilled fish every morning.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review_text: We had an amazing stay at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo! The staff were all so friendly and helpful, making our trip more enjoyable. Our family had a wonderful time and the food was delicious. Will definitely return the next time we come back to Tokyo.

reviews.title: Great Hotel but Terrible Club Experience
reviews.review_text:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights  and paid extra for a grand club level room.  The hotel and staff were amazing but the grand club was disappointing.  On multiple occasions the club was completely full and we were told to come back later.  When asked if we could take food back to our room, we were told we can’t take the plates and there were no to go plates.  
Hyatt shouldn’t be upselling club level rooms if they can’t guarantee access due to capacity issues.

Hilton Tokyo.description: Hilton Tokyo is located in Shinjuku, the heart of Tokyo's business, shopping and entertainment district, and is an ideal place to experience modern Japan. A complimentary shuttle operates between the hotel and Shinjuku station and the Tokyo Metro subway is connected to the hotel. Relax in one of the modern Japanese-style rooms and admire stunning city views. The hotel offers WiFi and internet access throughout all rooms and public space. Rejuvenate in the 24-hour on-site health club and relax in the sauna or soothing whirlpool spa. Play tennis on the rooftop courts or swim laps in the indoor pool. Exercise with Technogym equipment, the official supplier of the Olympics and Paralympics. TSUNOHAZU expresses folkloric traditions and boundless energy of the Shinjuku neighborhood in an open-format space composed of colorful materials, surprising design elements and four distinct dining and entertainment zones.

reviews.title: Tokyo Hilton 2024
reviews.review_text:
I had an excellent stay at the Hilton Tokyo. The location is absolutely fantastic, with easy access to nearby attractions and transportation options, making it a perfect base for exploring the city. The staff were outstanding—always friendly, professional, and ready to assist with any request.

One of the highlights of my stay was the executive lounge. The variety of offerings was impressive, from delicious food options to a well-stocked selection of beverages, all in a relaxing and spacious setting. It really added to the overall experience.

The room was comfortable and well-appointed, providing everything I needed for a pleasant stay. Combined with the great location and the wonderful service, this hotel is an excellent choice for anyone visiting Tokyo. I’ll definitely be back!

reviews.title: SUPER HOTEL, LOVELY STAFF.
reviews.review_text: We had a great stay at this hotel. BIG shout out to Waly who greeted us every day of our stay whether we were just going out for the day, or returning from a day out,  he was there with a welcoming smile.  He couldn't have been more friendly or helpful.  Thank you Waly.  Being visitors to Tokyo, you made sure we were well looked after. This makes such a difference when you're a traveller in a new country. THANK YOU.

reviews.title: The Best Hotel
reviews.review_text: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in my whole life. The staff here all speak very good English and this was my first time in Japan but they kindly helped me in different ways including booking the tour for me and lending umbrella. The room I stayed was also very clean and nice. Highly recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Western Style Hotel Comfort
reviews.review_text:
Our second stay here in as many years, and again what a great choice!  Service is impeccable at the front desk, concierge desk, breakfast buffet and executive lounge.  Housekeeping was attentive to our requests for extra bedding.  Concierge helped us with arriving packages and making restaurant recommendations / reservations.

The location of this property couldn't be more perfect, with the underground passage to rail, the 10-minute Shinjuku shuttle, and the quiet business neighborhood.  On this visit we discovered a sprawling peaceful park, with Starbucks and a restaurant (and rare outdoor seating) just half a block away.

Guest rooms are tranquil with no noise from adjacent rooms, bedding is luxurious.  Bathrooms are equipped with all of the Japanese amenities, immediate hot water and great water pressure from shower, bath and sink.  Nespresso coffee maker and electric teapot were greatly appreciated.  More than enough electrical outlets in the room for charging all of our devices.

Definitely recommend booking with breakfast included, as the buffet cannot be beat.

We hold the Tokyo Hilton up as one of the very best hotels in which we've ever stayed.

reviews.title: Enjoyable stay
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 6 nights for a conference before moving to Kyoto. Excellent attentive staff in all areas. Breakfast -  a vast choice it was a great start to the day. We enjoyed the St. Georges bar many times which had a nice atmosphere and again consistently excellent service. Room had a nice view over trees to the front of the hotel. It was clean although the bathroom was a little small. However we enjoyed our stay.

Hyatt Regency Tokyo.description: Hyatt Regency Tokyo provides a wide range of services guaranteed to satisfy the needs of guests. Allow our staff to assist you with anything you might require during your stay – from restaurant reservations and tour arrangements to tea times, spa treatments, and professional planning for any types of events or social occasion. For business trips and holidays, Hyatt Regency Tokyo sets an unmatched standard for Tokyo luxury accommodation.
amenities: Photo Copier / Fax In Business Center

reviews.title: Under renovation
reviews.review_text: Hotel under renovation. Small unequipped gym, closed pool, expect to queue for breakfast but well served, tasty food.  Staff incredibly kind and helpful (probably a normal expectation for Tokyo but to not be taken for granted), renovated rooms are fine (would be great if the AC worked tho)

reviews.title: Excellent service. Great location.
reviews.review_text: Excellent customer service beyond expectations. We were given a renovated room with a park view. It has a spectacular view of the fall foliage color of the trees. On our last day, Mt Fuji gave us a stunning view with its snow capped cone.  Not gonna lie that the building is old that’s why it’s still under renovation. It didn’t bother us because of great location to shinjuku station.  Can’t wait to go back again.

reviews.title: Great Location & Wonderful Concierge!
reviews.review_text:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  The location is great.  The rooms are very  nice (I got one of the newly renovated rooms).  The staff are all very friendly and helpful.  

Shout out to the concierge, Yuki Harima who was incredibly helpful in planning my excursions!

reviews.title: Well-located and comfortable
reviews.review_text: I had a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Regency Tokyo in Shinjuku! The location is super convenient with easy access to the train station and many shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel also has a beautiful lobby and a calm, relaxing atmosphere, which is perfect after a busy day exploring Tokyo.

reviews.title: Terrible Globalist Stay
reviews.review_text: The hotel is under renovation and cannot enjoy the lobby and drilling noise can be heard during daytime which is normal but if you want to take a daytime nap or break is impossible. Terrible experience as a globalist from check in to breakfast. Hotel is clean but shower curtains had mold on the edges and dated. Pillows were terrible one extra hard and the other was so thin it dis not matter. Will not be my first choice next time i go to Tokyo. Thanks but no thanks.

Park Hyatt Tokyo.address: 3-7-1-2 Nishi Shinjuku, Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku 163-1055 Tokyo Prefecture
Park Hyatt Tokyo.description:
If you’re looking for a luxury hotel in Nishishinjuku, look no further than Park Hyatt Tokyo.
As your “home away from home,” the hotel rooms offer a flat screen TV, a refrigerator, and a minibar, and getting online is easy, with free wifi available.
Guests have access to a concierge and room service while staying at Shinjuku Hyatt. In addition, Hyatt Tokyo offers a pool and breakfast, which will help make your Nishishinjuku trip additionally gratifying. And, as an added convenience, there is parking available to guests.
While in Nishishinjuku be sure to experience local okonomiyaki & takoyaki favorites at Hiroshimaokonomiyaki Buchiumaya or Kobe Rokko-Michi Gyunta Shinjuku Lumine 1.
Nishishinjuku is also home to Statue Tamachan, a popular  that is not too far from Park Hyatt Tokyo.
The staff at Park Hyatt Tokyo looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.
Park Hyatt Tokyo.address_string: 3-7-1-2 Nishi Shinjuku, Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku 163-1055 Tokyo Prefecture

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
tldr: we were underwhelmed by our experience at the Park Hyatt Tokyo and won’t be back again.

Check-in: The hotel was very disorganized: there are many people in the hotel area frequenting its restaurant, bar and bakery besides the hotel guests; and there were insufficient signs and help from the staff. As we walked in, no one greeted us and we had to ask someone for the specific check-in location (the first person pointed us to the wrong place, a cake pick-up). The building entrance is overall confusing and feels like a convention center - sterile. At check in, we were not offered any help with luggage.

Room: The room has a great view, but it needs renovation: water leaking from shower stall, bulky wood furniture, torn sofa surfaces, walls with scratches, limited electrical outlets at odd locations, doors making sound when sliding, worn carpets, no rain shower head.

Amenities: The gym and pool are complimentary but has a tiny locker area. For a more spacious and comfortable ladies’ room, you need to pay extra for use of the spa. We felt nickled and dimed especially when comparing to other hotels we’ve stayed at in this trip—saunas, jacuzzi and steam room were complementary elsewhere except for this hotel. On the plus side, the in-room amenities are great: Dyson hair dryer, Bose bluetooth speaker, and aesop toiletries are provided.

Dining: The hotel bar “New York bar” had a 45 minute wait when we were there. Hotel guests can wait from the room, but oddly no one told us that. They assumed we were not hotel guests and told us to wait in line.

Overall, we felt the stay did not provide a luxury experience; we did not feel a personal touch in the service, or any service at all. I would rate this hotel as a 3.5-star and not 5-star for what they offer. Feels like a regular Hyatt or Grand Hyatt at best,  As Hyatt loyalists, we felt this property is a huge letdown. Japan and Tokyo in particular have a lot to offer so we would not be back at the PH Tokyo again.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.review_text:
First off, going to the lobby is quite tricky. You have to take the elevator up to the hotel lobby. As you come out of the elvator, you turn right and go all the way to the end of the hallway. Checking in is like sitting at a table and opening a bank account. Very personal service. The staff that greeted us was quite stiff yet professional. We were ushered up to our room (just like in St. Regis) and made sure we had everything we needed. 

The location is convenient.  It is just a few mins walk  to restaurants and shops. 

The room was fantastic with a great view! It was spacious. They had luxurious toiletries. Everything was all there. We didn't have to ask for more. They provided a pair of sleeping clothes in case you forget to bring some. 

The staff at the restaurant were all very friendly and attentive.  They provided excellent service. The food was all delicious.

Our experience was great overall. It's worth coming back. 

The room was fantastic with a great view! It was spacious. They had luxurious toiletries. Everything was all there. We didn't have to ask for more. They provided a pair of sleeping clothes in case you forget to bring some. 

The staff at the restaurant were all very friendly and attentive.  They provided excellent service. The food was all delicious.

Our experience was great overall. It's worth coming back.

reviews.title: Fantastic Park
reviews.review_text: This park is next level I visit with my family and friends atmosphere is very friendly and all people enjoying with atmosphere I will be visit again and again with family friend I am very relaxing in this time and enjoying with my time excellent

reviews.title: Really just adding this as a time capsule
reviews.review_text:
Currently in the process of renovations, the Park Hyatt Tokyo was a hotel that I long desired to stay in, and the chance to do so finally came after the pandemic restrictions were lifted. I was not disappointed. Even just staying in one of the regular rooms was special and I am glad to have experienced it before the hotel closed.

Located in the farther end of Shinjuku, the Park Hyatt Tokyo is located in a large office tower, with the main means of getting up to the lobby being an elevator lobby that took me up to the main floor, after which I navigated a series of art-laden corridors to the actual lobby. I was seated and checked at the individual desks that dotted the area. The entry really set the tone for my stay-- just arriving at the hotel and walking up felt exclusive. I was sent my way and received the luggage that the staff had collected from me earlier at the building entrance shortly after arriving at my room.

The halls and passageways were very elaborate. I could see some being frustrated having to go through several of them to get to their rooms but I dug the vibe. The many pathways also meant that sound couldn't travel very far, meaning that the hotel was intimately quiet outside of the lobby and restaurants.

As expected, the room was spacious, at least for a Tokyo hotel. While appearing dated (hence the hotel going its refresh now), the furnishings nonetheless look classic and well-maintained. The features one would expect from a luxury hotel were all there and nearly organized. With the Park Hyatt being situated at the top end of the tower, the room came with a panoramic view of Tokyo that's hard to beat; one can get a similar view from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building for free, yes, but one cannot wake up and watch the sun rise from there. The bed and furniture were comfortable and ensured a good night's rest each time. The only complaints I had were the lack of power outlets, which was not surprising given the age of the hotel, and the steep height of the bathtub. I'm sure the renovations will come with many more outlets in each room when they are complete. I'm also sure that even after renovations, I will still have trouble getting in and out of the bathtub, as I cannot magically grow longer legs. Overall, I enjoyed the room and would happily stay in it again.

While I didn't make full use of the hotel's food and beverage facilities (there were many and they were all expensive), I did have the chance to sample their room service for lunch and also head up to the New York Bar for a nightcap. I recall that room service menu had many options spread across their restaurants and I had a Croque Monsieur. The sandwich along with a side made for a sumptuous meal that would have easily taken me out for the afternoon had I not resolved to get in some last-minute sightseeing. After coming back from dinner, I went up to the bar for a few drinks. Seating was plentiful when we were arrived, so we settled in and got our orders in quickly. The drinks were expensive (I remember them being between 2,000 and 3,000 Yen per cocktail), but they were delicious and were a small price to pay for the atmosphere, as well as for the nighttime views of Shinjuku. The menu also included snacks and small bites, which were equally expensive, but satisfying. 

Throughout my stay, I was greeted and treated warmly by the staff. The service ties everything together; the hotel's facilities were fantastic but they certainly wouldn't be as great without the staff manning them. From check-in to check-out, I had a great time. I hope an opportunity arises to stay here again!

reviews.title: 1700 Bucks per night and it was worth it
reviews.review_text: I spent 2 nights at Park Hyatt Tokyo and didnt regret it. The view to the largest metropolitan area in the world is just fantastic. The rooftop pool a dream (especially at night) and the piano bar with the best whiskys (Hibiki Suntory) generated a Bill Murray feeling.

Mandarin Oriental Tokyo.description: With our covetable Nihonbashi address, we are closely located to some of Tokyo's most prominent business addresses and attractions. Blending futuristic luxury with an extraordinary sense of space, our rooms and suites capture the very essence of Japanese style and design. We offer an extensive choice of restaurants and bars with an enticing mix of mouth-watering cuisine, delicious drinks and stunning interior design. Don't miss out to visit our Spa situated on the 37th floor - a truly luxurious retreat offering a range of relaxing and rejuvenating treatments and therapies. From meetings to conferences, special occasions and weddings, we have the capacity, experience and technology to help every event run smoothly.

reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff
reviews.review_text: What a wonderful hotel! Such an incredible staff and beautiful views. Special shoutout to the hospitable, elegant and smart Elvira for making our stay extra special. She made sure we had an incredible stay and was the best possible host. See you again soon MO Tokyo!

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.review_text: They put me in the noisiest room I ever stayed in. Constant banging and drumming from above. All night long. Also breakfast was chaotic with a huge crowd and overwhelmed waiters. Everyone can get free breakfast by joining the MO Club. It was like a zoo.

reviews.title: Pleasant Surprises at Every TurnOFFICIAL
reviews.review_text: We were constantly discovering delightful surprises during our stay - from the complimentary afternoon tea service to the curated local art collection throughout the property. The staff seemed to know exactly when to appear and when to give space. The room's layout was incredibly thoughtful, with plenty of USB ports and a proper workspace.

reviews.title: Great service, slightly old school decor
reviews.review_text: There’s no question that this is a beautiful hotel in a great location with exceptional service. We stayed in a suite which was perfectly appointed but felt old fashioned in decor with huge televisions blocking the spectacular views etc. the bar area also felt tired compared to the Aman for example and we encountered ‘differences’ over what amounted to casual attire. All dealt with well however. The breakfast was superb.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
I had high hopes for this stay, and unfortunately was left disappointed. If it cost half as much, I probably would’ve loved it. But when you’re paying a premium price you expect a premium experience and it didn’t live up to that for me. 

The rooms are in desperate need of a renovation. Wood and furniture worn and scuffed everywhere. Dated design. Even the base rooms are large enough so that was nice. 

Expansive views of the city from one side of the hotel, the other mostly just sees other skyrises and a construction site. 

Spa was underwhelming and didn’t have a pool which would’ve been nice. The hot tubs weren’t that hot. 

Concierge seemed overwhelmed and was hit and miss. Major delays in response time pre-trip. They weren’t able to help with most of my exclusive restaurant and bar requests. They did surprise me with one reservation when I wasn’t able to get it online. 

The restaurants and bar were great. If you can get into pizza bar don’t miss the 3rd best pizza restaurant in the world. Breakfast buffet was too busy some of the days. 

Service was nice but when we had problems it didn’t seem like they cared. Most of the staff seemed very young. I ultimately had to escalate my issues to management and my travel agent which is the last thing I want to do on vacation, once that happened it at least felt like they tried to make it right.

HOSHINOYA Tokyo.description: Authentic Japanese omotenashi hospitality in the heart of Tokyo From the moment guests arrive and slip off their shoes to step onto fragrant tatami mats, HOSHINOYA Tokyo, in the prestigious Otemachi district, promises sublime and authentic Japanese ryokan hospitality.

reviews.title: Uniquely beautiful
reviews.review_text: The hotel is incredibly beautiful.  It’s a great experience as it had a ryokan feel in the heart of Tokyo.  It’s very unique and luxurious. The rooms are very large, the king size bed was huge.  The roof top onsen is to die for.  The service is impeccable.  Every detail has been studied to be refined.  The only downside for me is the bathroom. Shower pressure was not great and a heated floor would have been good.  The fact that the bathroom is in a glass case in the room is not ideal if one wants to stay in bed and sleep as even though you can make the glass obscur, light still goes through.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with quirks
reviews.review_text:
Pluses: great location and wonderful facility.  The rooms are a modern take on traditional Japanese style, high tech and very, very comfortable. The onsen is magnificent.  The staff are primarily very friendly young people who speak excellent English.  Laundry service and breakfasts were excellent.

Cons: there are unspoken rules and the hotel is not particularly good at communicating them.  Book ahead if you want dinner — book well before you get there!  We were there for five nights and were told on arrival there were no dinner bookings available for our entire stay.  Breakfast can be booked before 5 pm the previous night; if you forget you’re out of luck.  There are no instructions on the phone and we were unable to get through to the front desk except by going down there.  Wasn’t just us—other guests said the same.

Generally it seemed any request that did not fit their usual routine could not be met.

All this aside, the facility is wonderful, the rooms are terrific, the onsen phenomenal, the location great, and the young staff friendly.  Just don’t expect to be treated like a guest at the 4 Seasons or Aman.  You’re a bit on your own.

reviews.title: Not a ryokan, not a luxury hotel
reviews.review_text: The Hoshinoya in Tokyo is supposed to be a “ryokan experience “,which entails surrendering your shoes every time you come and go. To be fair we didn’t have to wait long to recover them any time we went out. The other element is the tatami mats in the room. However it does not have the intimate ambiance or dedicated service of a real ryokan. There is no dining room or bar, so breakfast, drinks and any meal must be consumed in your room, with the remnants staying there for some time. We were advised that the two bowls of udon we ordered would take an hour, so we didn’t have any meal except breakfast (ordinary). The bottle of wine we ordered took two phone calls and two visits from staff to establish that it was out of stock. I felt sorry for the poor waiter who tried to open a bottle of champagne with a corkscrew - not his fault that he hadn’t been properly trained. The rooms are fair sized and elegant, and the onsen on the 17th floor is authentic but for the money one can do a lot better in Tokyo. If you want a ryokan experience go to Shiraume in Kyoto and if you want a luxury hotel in Tokyo go to the Gajoen.

reviews.title: Great hotel, good location, very good staff !
reviews.review_text:
We loved our experience in Hoshinoya Tokyo , the staff is very friendly, rooms are a bit small but they are perfect. The architecture is also very nice, only comment I have  is the hallways smell kind of weird. 

4.5/5 amazing japenese experience and very luxurious

reviews.title: Unique Oasis in Tokyo
reviews.review_text:
My wife and I spent 11 days in Japan and 6 in the Hoshinoya. Choosing this hotel was the single best decision we made all trip. To be clear, this hotel is not for everyone. We didn't want a busy hotel like the Mandarin or IC. There are plenty of restaurants and bars all over Tokyo, we wanted a place to breathe and rest when we called it a day. 

The hotel is a traditional Japanese Inn which is unlike any place I have stayed. First, no shoes allowed in the hotel. You check them in by the entrance. If you want to wear other shoes, bring them down by hand. When I read that before staying I was a little apprehensive but after the first time doing so I looked forward to it every time we got back.

The common area and rooms are immaculate and well designed. Bedroom was spacious and the mattress was quality. Great shower and bathtub and great skin products.

This hotel is truly an oasis. Tokyo is lively and packed with people. Each floor is secluded and there is a common area with tea, coffee, and snacks. When you walk in you feel like you are entering a high end spa. It is centrally located and has fast access to Tokyo Station and Otemachi subway. The surrounding area is the financial district and gets very quiet at night which is a welcomed breather.

We went all over Tokyo and the Hoshinoya made it easy to get in and around. I will definitely be back.

karaksa hotel TOKYO STATION.description: The hotel is just five minutes' walk from Tokyo Station, the core of Japan's railway network including the Bullet Train lines. With some bus terminals also close by, this is the perfect place to begin your trip throughout Japan. The hotel also features many connecting rooms, which are popular among families and guests traveling in groups.

reviews.title: Great location and clean hotel
reviews.review_text:
Awesome hotel conveniently located near Tokyo station.
Rooms were spotless and space was well thought out. Beds were comfortable with amenities provided in the lobby.
Heaps of places to dine and find a drink all around.
Free drinks in the lobby
Would definitely recommend

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location
reviews.review_text: Nice hotel located on a side street just a couple minutes walk from the Tokyo Station Yaesu Central exit, so super convenient.  The hotel itself was clean, and the room size was actually fairly decent for Tokyo (considering I've stayed at 3 different hotels in the Tokyo Station area).  Would definitely consider staying here again if coming to Tokyo area.

reviews.title: Fantastic location, clean and practical
reviews.review_text: Fantastic location within walking distance from Tokyo station, Yaesu side near Character street. Lots of good value dining and shopping options nearby. Room is adequate size and well equipped. Toilet, shower and sink are in separate areas, which is convenient for sharing. Staff are nice and helpful. Coin-op laundry available but there is no monitor connected to TV.

reviews.title: Really great hotel and helpful staffs
reviews.review_text: This is a gem of a hotel. Really good location near to the station and walking distance to shops and the imperial palace. The staff are really friendly and helpful, they found and booked a great place to get a massage after a long flight for us. We rented a Japanese family room to get into the Japanese mood a bit. It was perfect for a small family and comfortable after a long flight. Western toilets.

reviews.title: Convenient location
reviews.review_text: We chose the hotel because of its location, 7 minuts walk from Tokyo station. We stayed there 3 times, a total of 5 nights, during July and August 2024. The first two stays we booked approx. 1 month in advance and then the price was reasonable, approx. 28,000 Yen per night. We only booked the last stay a few days in advance and then it was almost twice as expensive. There are many good things about the hotel, in addition to the location; The receptionists were friendly. We got free water dispensers in the room and hot and cold drinks at the reception. It was clean and quiet. What we were not so happy with was that the Standard Twin Rooms had an extra bed that took up a lot of space and lacked a proper bathroom. The sink was in the room so it was impractical and there were separate cubicles for the shower and toilet.

Conrad Tokyo.description: Welcome to the Conrad Tokyo hotel, where legendary Conrad excellence meets the calming and inspiring design of modern day Japan. The Conrad Tokyo hotel is conveniently located just 5 minutes from the famous Ginza Shopping Street. Stay in contemporary luxury at the Conrad Tokyo. All 290 guest rooms and suites boast minimalist Japanese design, the latest technology and panoramic views over Tokyo. Conrad Tokyo's TwentyEight is the stylish spot in Tokyo for breathtaking views, signature drinks, and afternoon tea. Dine at our acclaimed restaurants and order wine from our cellar for a superlative meal. More luxuries for your stay: Direct Shiodome station access Fine dining, casual eating, and a must-visit bar Beautiful guest rooms and suites with spectacular views Tranquil Mizuki Spa, fitness facilities, and a 25-meter pool Flexible event spaces for up to 450 guests

reviews.title: 5 Stars All the Way
reviews.review_text: Excellent hotel! Beautifully appointed rooms. Amazing staff! Great location. Cannot say enough good stuff about this hotel. If you are thinking about staying here, book now! The spa is also incredible! There is a beautiful gym, a lap pool, and steam rooms and saunas at your disposal. I could not have asked for a better stay in Tokyo.

reviews.title: The best of the best!
reviews.review_text: We can’t wait to return to the Conrad Tokyo. It is the best of the best. The hotel is absolutely beautiful everywhere you look and the views are wonderful. A pianist was playing in the extensive lobby lounge when we checked in, setting the most wonderful atmosphere. Everyone on the hotel staff was so especially nice to us the entire time we were there. Kai and Rene (with her especially keen and unique sense of humor) in Cerise made our mornings so much fun and so special. We truly looked forward to breakfast every day thanks to them! Sophie (the Quality Control that we met in Cerise) and Izumi, the Assistant Guest Relations Manager, were truly exceptional, personable, accommodating, welcoming and professional. They made us feel special and at home. Mina in the Executive Lounge was always gracious and outgoing. Finally, our housekeeping staff. Unfortunately, we don’t have our names, but our room was always beautifully taken care of. While the hotel itself is beautiful, these team members make the Conrad Tokyo extraordinary. Lastly, it was a pleasure meeting and speaking to Neil McInnes. The highest compliment we can give him is that he so reminds us of Eric Long, the longtime manager at the Waldorf Astoria in NYC back when it was in operation. The Conrad Tokyo has become one of our very favorite hotels anywhere. We absolutely loved our stay!

reviews.title: CONRAD TOKYO IS THE BEST
reviews.review_text:
Conrad Tokyo is Absolutely the Best!!

Huge credit goes to all of the amazing and wonderful teams:
Reservations: Nadia, Nguyen, Mai
Concierge: Tomoko, Hanako
Guest Relations: Fumie
Executive Lounge: Mika, Miyuki, Monica, Amika, Fukiko, Rena, Mina, Akiko, Endo Miyuki, Yuka, Sharma, Sho, Saya, Saeka, Fonseca, Tate

For context, this trip is special for my mother and I because we were supposed to travel here back in March for her birthday and the cherry blossom season as she always wanted to visit Japan. But unfortunately weren't able to celebrate it then. After months of planning, researching, and preparation we decided to stay at the Conrad Tokyo, and had high expectations based on all the previous great reviews. We have been completely floored and overwhelmed at the level of first class service from all of the amazing teams that they provided us everyday during our visit. 

Even before arrival, I was in conversations with some of the team (Nadia, Nguyen, Mai, Tomoko, and Hanako). They each provided invaluable helpful insights on questions I asked about the hotel, amenities, location, nearby attractions and more. Not only were they incredibly knowledgeable, but caring, empathetic, and customized their recommendations to our preferences. They even went above and beyond and created super helpful presentations that saved us hours in planning our trip to where to get items we forgot back home! (I do not know anyone who does that)

Then traveling from the US, arriving late, and being jet-lagged, and I was concerned if I had built up the hype too much - and was absolutely awe-struck from the team surpassing them! 

Literally from the moment we stepped foot at the property, we were greeted with unbelievable warmth and hospitality by Rena Nakagawa and the wonderful team. Rena made the check-in process incredibly convenient, simple, and easy. She was also prepared, aware, and took extra initiative to understand how this trip was the first for my mother and provided the best arrangement possible based on our loyalty and preferences to make her stay as comfortable as possible!

What is more is that she (and the overall team - Mika, Miyuki, Monica, Amika, Fukiko, Mina, Akiko, Endo Miyuki, Yuka, Sharma, Sho, Saya, Saeka, Fonseca, Tate) always came to us in the lounge to check-in how our stay is, if they and the team can do anything else to make the stay as comfortable as possible. Each one of their attention to care, compassion, emotional intelligence, and thoughtfulness is magnificent and heart-warming (Once again, no one is this attentive and goes this much above and beyond)

Additionally a situation came up (which happens to most travelers) when you realize you forgot so many items back home. We then met Fumie Murase and were incredibly moved by how attentive and took ownership of the situation from providing invaluable insights to get the needed items - to being so incredibly empathetic and caring when understanding this was a belated birthday trip for my mother. Although it was months ago, she went above and beyond to ensure my mother still got to celebrate her birthday with a wonderful present. 

On top of that, Rena also provided a terrific gift for her. It is those small gestures that make the most significant and substantial impact from the team.

I am sure I am forgetting names (and my sincere apologies as everyone has been absolutely wonderful), but this team of incredibly special talent exemplifies class, empathy, care, and understanding the importance of the customer experience. As someone who has stayed at countless hotels around the world - I have never been so in awe of this level of care, compassion, ownership, knowledge, and class. It is incredibly evident to me that they are the jewels in the crown of Conrad Tokyo and Hilton's overall customer service and ethos, and are incredibly invaluable assets for the organization. 

Based on this experience - I have recommended my family and contacts to stay at the Conrad Tokyo solely due to this team's stellar quality of service. There are great customer service professionals in every organization, but I have never been so thoroughly impressed, empowered, and enlightened from customer service experiences such as these. 

As someone who travels internationally frequently, my regret now is that I have not stayed in Tokyo, and especially the Conrad Tokyo before. But that is all changing due to this team's unbelievable warmth, support, and care. My family and I are updating our upcoming travel plans to stay specifically at this property, and hopefully partner with this phenomenal group again (cross-fingers)! Literally the only cons are that from the captivating views and style of the hotel, to especially being treated like family - it makes it very difficult to leave the property! Every time we go out, we are comparing the service, care, views, and food received from the hotel vs other aspects in the city (which are great) - but Conrad Tokyo is simply the best.

I hope the examples set by this team's first class quality of care, service, and help are the benchmark for all services across not only at the Conrad Tokyo , but for every organization - regardless of industry.

reviews.title: Next level service
reviews.review_text: Amazing facilities and service. Staff always ready to assist and willing to arrange with any special requests. Rooms a well appointed, spacious with beautiful views. Just a short distance and walk to Ginza where you can find pretty much anything you need or want to shop for.

reviews.title: Hilton at it's best!
reviews.review_text: The Conrad is a beautiful hotel near some gardens in Tokyo.  As stated in previous reviews, the lobby is located on the 28th floor of building.  The rooms offer great views and and our suite was spotless.  The employees are extremely welcoming and helpful with anything you need.  Breakfast was awesome but can be very busy.  Unfortunately we could hear train noise-even on the higher upper floors.  The trains do quit running though from around midnight to 5 am.  We felt that the location was very convenient.  Thank you Conrad for your hospitality!

Aman Tokyo.address: 1-5-6 Otemachi 1-5-6 Otemachi, Otemachi, Chiyoda 100-0004 Tokyo Prefecture
Aman Tokyo.description: Aman Tokyo is Aman's first urban retreat, located in the heart of the Financial District of Tokyo. No matter the rush outside its door, the 5-star and all-suite hotel offers a serene sanctuary high above Tokyo with just 84 guest suites. Iconic design represents the perfect balance of urban dynamism and cultural sensibility and is the epitome of Japanese minimalism - nonetheless, a dramatic lobby framed by a gigantic washi paper lantern and anchored by a zen garden of water, gravel and rocks will welcome the guests.
Aman Tokyo.address_string: 1-5-6 Otemachi 1-5-6 Otemachi, Otemachi, Chiyoda 100-0004 Tokyo Prefecture

reviews.title: Sustainable Luxury Meets Warm Hospitality
reviews.review_text: As someone with a deep appreciation for the little things, this hotel had me grinning from ear to ear. The handwritten welcome note, the perfectly fluffed pillows, the locally sFrom the moment we stepped into the lobby, we knew this place was special. The architecture seamlessly blends with the natural surroundings, and the staff operates like a family rather than employees. The attention to sustainability without compromising luxury was impressive. The spa treatments were divine, and the pool area felt like a private oasis. Every meal was a culinary journeourced toiletries - every detail sang of thoughtfulness. The staff remembered my name and my coffee preference from day one. It wasn't just a stay; it was a masterclass in the art of hospitality.

reviews.title: Exceptional
reviews.review_text: This is a stunning city property. Design, service and room are magnificent. Despite a hiccup on check in when are room was not ready I’d recommend this hotel over any other in Tokyo. The views, room size and service are what you hope for - but don’t always get - at an Aman property.

reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
reviews.review_text: Corner suite is spacious with a super nice bathroom. Not many choices for breakfast but the food is excellent. Housekeeping is flawless. Do not miss the indoor pool and the spa, definitely worth it! I chose this hotel because there’s smoking room.

reviews.title: Budget-Friendly Gem Exceeds Expectations
reviews.review_text: I gotta say, I was a bit skeptical at first cuz the price seemed too good to be true. But man, was I wrong! This place is an absolute bargain. Sure, it's not super fancy, but it's clean, comfortable, and has everything you need. The staff were always happy to help, even when I asked for directions like a million times (I'm terrible with maps lol). The free breakfast was

reviews.title: Pure bliss
reviews.review_text: Truly an amazing experience - the architecture, rooms (the views from the rooms) and ambiance are just stunning. Also the pool area with its views of the Imperial Palace and the city are beyond comparison. We received extremely personal service and are already thinking of our next trip to this unique oasis in the middle of Tokyo.

The Okura Tokyo.description: The Okura Tokyo will reprise the Hotel Okura Tokyo’s famed traditional Japanese beauty as well as its cherished simplicity and elegance to offer a new combination of “traditional luxury” and “contemporary luxury.” A total of 508 luxury rooms will be available in two buildings on the spacious central-Tokyo Okura property, about half of which will be covered with lush gardens and greenery. 【Awards and affiliations】 ・GBAC STAR™ Accredited Facility ・Member of The Leading Hotels of the World ・Condé Nast Traveler Top 10 Hotels in Japan Readers’Choice Awards 2022 #2 (#1 in Tokyo)【SDGs Action of The Okura Tokyo】 The Okura Tokyo coordinates with energy efficiently by being thorough implementation of energy saving measures as a mixed-use facility、and work to reduce CO2.
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center

reviews.title: A Truly Magnificent Hotel
reviews.review_text:
The Okura Tokyo - what can I say. I really couldn’t fault it. This truly is a Japanese classic and I would highly recommend it.

From the clean lines and minimalist look throughout the hotel, the rooms were comfortable and truly luxurious.

The Onsen spa on the 24th floor is fabulous and the buffet breakfast in the main restaurant was bountiful and very tasty.

A hotel I would definitely stay in again and a brand I would look out for in other parts of Asia.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.review_text:
We enjoyed staying here - lovely room, well appointed, nice little touches. However, the room could’ve been cleaner. I am really into cleanliness. I believe they showed our room to someone else and they used the toilet because one of the tissue rolls wasn’t prepped. In addition, the floor wasn’t clean enough for me.

Definitely don’t eat at their high end restaurant. Pricey and disappointing - very.

reviews.title: One of the finest hotel to Japan & perhaps Asia
reviews.review_text:
One of the most finest hotel in Tokyo, excellent overall

Room: 10/10 Great size, great layout, soft closed doors

Bath room: 10/10 stunning view of the city from bath tub

Breakfast: 11/10 one of the best buffet breakfast in Tokyo & excellent room service top notch

reviews.title: Quiet Relaxing Hotel in Tokyo
reviews.review_text:
My wife and I stayed 5 nights in a prestige room using the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts Package.  Our room was very spacious & clean, Wi-Fi worked well.  We had a view overlooking the US Ambassador residence.   We enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the Okura in the morning.  One odd thing is we would have thought for a 21st century hotel 5-star hotel we would not need to bring paper vouchers for our breakfast.  Most hotels have it covered through our room electronically.  

One piece of advice I have is use the office entrance to the hotel.  This is at the bottom of the hill, conveniently located near the subway, with escalators to make your way to the hotel lobby instead of walking up the steep hill with your luggage.

reviews.title: Hotel Perfection
reviews.review_text: Absolutely wonderful hotel on every level.  Service is top notch and staff very dedicated.  Rooms are beautifully done.  Superior bedding and comforts.  Serene atmosphere.  Excellent breakfast.  A very enjoyable experience in Tokyo.  Highly recommend

teamLab Planets TOKYO.description: teamLab Planets (Toyosu, Tokyo) is a museum where you walk through water, and a garden where you become one with the flowers. It comprises 4 large-scale artwork spaces and 2 gardens created by art collective teamLab. teamLab Planets Recognized by GUINNESS WORLD RECORDS™ as the most visited museum (single art group) in the world. A Massive “Athletics Forest” to Newly Open in Early 2025 ACCESS： 1 minute on foot from Shin-Toyosu Station 10 minutes on foot from Toyosu Station 5 minutes on foot from Shijoumae Station and Toyosu Market ※Currently, the ＜To-05-2 (Toei Bus)＞ from Tokyo Station, Ginza, and Tsukiji to Shin-Toyosu is experiencing heavy congestion. Please consider using other public transportation methods to visit.

reviews.title: Could be better
reviews.review_text: The expectations were greater than the reality turned out to be. The price is too high for this level. There are too few halls. However, the event organization was impressive.

reviews.title: An interesting experience but overcrowded and lacks important health warnings
reviews.review_text: It was an interesting experience, but nothing spectacular and it was over-crowded. If this is your first time attending this sort of display, it might be worthwhile. One thing I wish the website would mention is that you need to remove your shoes and walk through water, several times. Luckily, I was wearing shorts that day. They do offer shorts for rent, but what if someone prefers not to walk in the water? How hygienic is that? Additionally, they should warn people about the bright, flashing lights, as they could be a concern for people with certain health conditions. My friend did not feel well after the second phase/setup but was not much assistance was offered. There was no place to sit or rest, nor was she offered a refund.

reviews.title: A must visit place
reviews.review_text: This is a must visit place if you are in Tokyo. Both the garden section and the water section are amazing. Very well organized and the visit was very pleasant and relaxing.

reviews.title: One of my favourite Tokyo experiences!
reviews.review_text: This place is an absolute must-see - unlike any other experience I've ever had. Immersive from the very start, it brings a beautiful balance of wonder and calm. Each room takes your breath away and grounds you into the present moment. I felt like a little kid again!

reviews.title: It could have been better
reviews.review_text: TeamLabs planets has the potential to be great, a couple of the experiences can truly be mind blowing, but it’s ruined by allowing too many people in at the same time. We were herded from one room to another by a team member. With school kids and adults, shoving and screaming, it felt more like an overcrowded amusement park than an immersive experience. I was there on a Friday afternoon, wonder if I should have picked a different day. I hope that this review will motivate them amend their rules, restrict the number of tickets, ask guests to maintain silence and perhaps have a different time slot for kids or school trips.

Little Tokyo.description: Experience a slice of Japan at Los Angeles’ Little Tokyo, a Japanese-American cultural district brimming with shops and restaurants. Established in 1855, Little Tokyo is one of only three Japantowns in the United States. Spread over five blocks, the district is crammed with food gems, streetwear vendors, and manga and anime shops. Don’t miss the Japanese American Cultural Community Center, which hosts regular cultural performances and cooking classes. Time your visit around festivals such as Nisei Week (every August), when street dancing and parades fill the area. You can explore Little Tokyo on a walking tour, along with Chinatown. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Great Japanese Food in Little Tokyo, But a Bit Pricey
reviews.review_text: My friend and I were hungry and craving Japanese food, so we decided to visit this spot in Little Tokyo. While it didn’t quite match the flavors we’ve had in Japan, it was still pretty tasty. If it were a bit more affordable, I’d definitely give it five stars!

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.review_text:
I have been to Little Tokyo on two different occasions. Both of my dates here were boring, and the restaurants feel very basic. Everything that we saw in the stores looks like overpriced novelty junk. Calling Little Tokyo anything more than overrated would be a lie.

Not even the food is good enough to justify visiting Little Tokyo again. Don't let the long lines fool you; I can find better Japanese food just three miles away from my house in Thousand Oaks.

reviews.title: No public toilets
reviews.review_text: No public toilet, or if they have you need to buy a certain item if you want to use their toilet. Lot of Japanese and Chinese people they hard to speak English

reviews.title: No near public toilets.
reviews.review_text: Wouldn't recommend if you have a weak bladder. otherwise you have to eat in a restaurant to use the restroom. Nice little place to look around though.

reviews.title: Mr. Ramen, an unexpected delight!
reviews.review_text: We got to our hotel and hadn’t eaten and it was about 2:30 in the afternoon. We walked across the street seeing as there was an open Ramen shop on the Fourth of July and went in not expecting much. The service was impeccable and better than at the fancy restaurant we went to for dinner that night. We ordered three very different dishes, Tonkatsu rice, curry shrimp and kimchi miso Ramen and they were all fantastic! They had beer and wine and sake along with many nonalcoholic beverages. There were many hand drawn, 3 x 5 cards on the wall that kept us entertained…. would definitely go back!

reviews.title: This is a superb attraction in the centre of Tokyo after the Tokyo tower to see the entire 360 view from 350 m height. It offers
reviews.review_text: This is a superb attraction in the centre of Tokyo after the Tokyo tower to see the entire 360 view from 350 m height. It offers amazing views. Has coffee shop and various other attractions inside.  Be prepared to stand a long queue. And it's a ticketed entry but worth every minute of enjoyment.

reviews.title: Masterpiece
reviews.review_text: I visited Tokyo Tower, and it was beautiful, especially with the night lights. Honestly, I think I like it more than Tokyo Skytree because it has a warmer and more nostalgic vibe. Being there brought back old memories from the last time I visited

reviews.title: Tokyo Tower
reviews.review_text: Personally, I liked Tokyo Tower more than Skytree. The night lights were really stunning, and the location was super convenient. I’d definitely recommend checking it out!

reviews.title: Great tower from 1958
reviews.review_text: Was by far the best experience we had while in Tokyo. Unlike other tower in Tokyo this one was not as crowded and the experience was far greater including getting a photo taken at the top of the tower overlooking Tokyo. One of my favorite memories of Tokyo.

reviews.title: Enjoyable but overpriced
reviews.review_text:
Despite being the "poorer relation" these days to the Skytree, I have to say we enjoyed our time here more that its competitor.
Tickets are still way overpriced but the service seemed much friendlier and personal and sights more readily identifiable.
All in all if we went to Tokyo again and had to choose only one tower to visit then it would definitely be this one!

reviews.title: So freaking cool at night!
reviews.review_text: The nighttime views are among the best in the city.  A misty rain obscured the view from the top deck while I was there but it was still a most enjoyable visit. You get your picture professionally taken, get to view many different historical videos, drinks provided, etc. Spectacular views of the city all around plus multiple levels for different views. There was also a cute Halloween display on the main deck windows.

reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.review_text: This is by far the most incredible public transportation system we’ve seen that despite how complex it looks, it all somehow works and even on time! Fascinating to watch the amount of people it constantly transports flawlessly.

reviews.title: Great Metro System
reviews.review_text:
Stayed in Tokyo for one week and used the metro system extensively throughout the week. Seemed daunting at first, but as the week went on, started to pick up few tips as we gained more usage experience.
A few tips.
Always find it useful to peruse a decent printed copy of the metro system beforehand, and in Tokyo's case, one which shows the stations alpha numeric code.
Easiest way to pay fares for us, was the purchase of an IC card on arrival at the airport. We used Welcome Suica which is valid for 28 days from first use. The automatic machines located at Haneda airport are straight forward and easy to use. There is an English language option  available. The machines may say they accept credit cards,but not all international credit cards are accepted. Our VISA card did not work. So best to bring enough Yen notes to first purchase and top up the card. The same machines are located in all the other metro stations we visited, so you can tip up easily and conveniently.  6000 Yen was enough for us for one week, including trip to and from Haneda airport. If topping up card by cash, lowest denomination coin accepted appeared to be 100 yen. You tap in and tap out on each journey at the barriers. The barriers will display balance left on your card each time.
Metro system is run by two separate companies, but is not really relevant as the IC cards can be used on either system. Each line is named and colour coded. Eg Ginza Line is Orange. Each station on the lines is numbered sequentially from one end to another. So Ginza Line starts at Shibuya (G01) and ends at Asakusa (G19). Ginza station itself is G09, so if travelling from Ginza to Shibuya, you need the platform where the station number stops are going down. 
Ginza station itself is an interchange on other lines, so they are coded in similar fashion. So Ginza station on the silver Hibuya line is stop H09.
So when first entering the metro, first find the colour circle for the line on the signage, Ginza Line will be an Orange Circle with a G inside. Hibuya line a Silver Circle with a H inside. Pass through the gate barriers for the respective line. Many stations have separate gate barriers for each line if an interchange station.  Large signage on the approach to platforms will show which direction platform you'll need.
Entering some metro stations at Street Level, you need to ensure you enter from correct side of road as you can't reach the other platform once in the Metro. Hisgashi-Ginza is like this on the A Asakusa line.
Many Tokyo metro stations are very large with many exits and long walks between interchanges. Some interchanges are two different named stations close together where you will need to exit to street level and walk between. Signage is always very clear.
Once on the metro, clear electronic signage announces each stop both in Japanese and English. The alphanumeric station code is also clearly displayed. What is also displayed is an exit plan station layout for each stop.
Recommend that you use say Google Maps to view your destination station and make a note of the exit number you will need. Some stations have many, many exits going in all compass points. Exits are referenced in Black Font on Yellow background and follow alphanumeric system, ie A5, B10, C3 etc. Knowing the exit you require will save huge amount of time trying to get your bearings as you depart the metro. Especially if you look at the display on the metro train itself as it approaches the station, it will tell you whether you need to go left or right as you leave the train.
Some exits involve lots of steps, but I think all the stops we used did have elevator access at some exits. These are sometimes marked on Google maps with elevator symbol.
Once you have your bearings, you be whizzing around like a local within a day or so.

reviews.title: Always on time
reviews.review_text: The metro system is just wow and the metro are always on time which make the travel so smooth. Can of course be crowded during the morning

reviews.title: From A to B in Tokyo.
reviews.review_text: The best way to get around Tokyo is to use the train system. Negotiating the metro can be daunting but the system is logical and not too difficult to figure out. Routes are mostly circular. Ticket counters have optional English displays. Train and subway lines are colour coded. Stations have a unique symbology and numbering system that makes me wonder why I have not seen this elsewhere. Major routes to airports are marked on the station floor. However, my most memorable experience has to be when a smartly dressed train driver came by and could see my confusion. He asked me where I wanted to go and in perfect English told me which platform to go to! Wow, respect to you and your company JR!

reviews.title: Get the Subway Pass!
reviews.review_text:
The best Subway with the best 72 hour Pass!
I had to travel a lot around different parts of Tokyo such as Shibuya, Shinjuku,  and Akihabara.
The Subway system is very convenient!

Tokyo Disneyland.description: Tokyo Disneyland—the Kingdom of Dreams and Magic. This is one of the world’s largest theme park with great access from central Tokyo, located only 15 minutes away by train from Tokyo Station. You’ll find numerous exciting attractions that will sweep you away into the world of the Disney films, enthralling entertainment that will take your breath away, adorable food and merchandise themed to the Disney Characters, and so much more. Don’t miss this opportunity to spend an amazing day at a Disney theme park that you won’t find anywhere else!

reviews.title: Magical
reviews.review_text:
Absolutely magical, I have never experienced anything so lovely , it’s a wonderful experience for young an old . 
So many different experiences and everything very well organised.  The only thing we had to wait for was the beauty and the beast castle it was a long wait but if you are a fan of beauty and the beast it’s so worth it absolutely fantastic. 
Lots of food options in the park , clean tidy and beautiful people . I just hope one day I get to visit this amazing place again .

reviews.title: A Magical Day at Tokyo Disneyland!
reviews.review_text: I finally visited Tokyo Disneyland, and it was such an amazing experience! The rides were so much fun, and the parades were even more beautiful than I expected. The whole place felt magical, like stepping into another world. It was a bit crowded, but the staff were so friendly and kept everything running smoothly. If you’re a Disney fan or just looking for a fun day, you have to visit, it’s totally worth it!

reviews.title: Loved Tokyo Disneyland!
reviews.review_text: I personally liked Disneyland over Disney Sea. We really loved walking in site and it was the happiest place in the Earth. We had to wait in the massive line though...

reviews.title: Great park for everyone.
reviews.review_text: The park is beautiful. We were fortunate to go during the Halloween season and the dedication to costumes by visitors is unmatched! Tokyo Disney is the only Disney park with a glass overhang on Main Street. The park shops are heavily themed towards confectionaries. If the shop isn't only a confectionary, a huge portion of it will be confectionary. Mobile orders work great and there is a good amount of seating. I was shocked that we only needed to pay for one ride and used the free 40th anniversary pass for another, otherwise we stood in line no more than 20 minutes. The only complaints I have are the number of school kids there and how we could not buy just the popcorn bucket without popcorn and the popcorn tweezers can only be purchased one per bucket. The school kids were a bit rude. They constantly bumped into us, pushed past us, stepped in between us, and tried to cut in line. The popcorn bucket I can understand, they are probably trying to prevent people from buying buckets to sell online or whatnot but we wanted the halloween bucket which we only found at one stand and we had 0 interest in the flavor of it. I planned to buy 3 popcorn tweezers but was only able to but the 1. Loved the park and the experience.

reviews.title: Overated and extremely disappointing!
reviews.review_text: Highly overrated, very unhelpful and resort guests are treated poorly in the parks. So disappointed in how negative a trip to Japan and TDL is turning out. Be forewarned, Japan doesn’t want American tourists. As a same sex couple we were discriminated against at the airport. We were met with a racist attitude from Disneyland Park Guest Service supervisor. If you are reading reviews about TDL, you need to realize that even booking a vacation at the TDL resort is an absolute nightmare. Their technology is very poor, outdated and slow. Extremely hard to book a vacation. Our trip is 4 nights, needed to be booked in 2 separate 2 day packages. Incredibly limited park access. Poor information from their website and cast members.  Horrible in park APP, so limited on merchandise, you need to attempt to use a virtual queue. Nightmarish…. Dropped us out of 2 queues. We made a big mistake coming to Japan and visiting TDL. Don’t bother. At least Japanese tourist can know that they will be treated much better in the US than TDL and their countrymen treat Americans. Yes that is another thing that has disappointingly changed….6 years ago I told everyone I knew how poliet people were in Japan…. Not the case anymore. They are rude and inconsiderate.

Waho-An NATURE Tokyo.description: The concept of Waho-An NATURE Tokyo is to provide superior healing through targeted treatments that enable clients to enjoy a healthy life that is free from physical discomfort.
