Our therapies provide healing while at the same time relieving symptoms such as stiffness in the shoulders, lower back pain and knee pain. We can solve problems that have caused discomfort for many years and improve our clients’ health by dealing with issues related to poor posture and tiredness. We welcome overseas visitors and encourage you to visit us and relieve yourself of the tiredness from your strenuous travel itinerary. Please ensure your body is relaxed and healthy to enable you to enjoy your time in Japan and take home many happy memories. Reservations are available on the phone. (English ok)But when we are doing massages, we can not answer your calls. At that time, please email from the CONTACT US page from our website. Thank you.

reviews.title: Great experience!
reviews.review_text: After receiving the treatment, my posture improved surprisingly, and my back muscles were strengthened. As a Japanese I am proud of the owner Ryo san.

reviews.title: You’ll regret not trying this place sooner!
reviews.review_text:
Ryo is the absolute best! We heard and read amazing things about Ryo and I can confidently say that it is all true. 

My husband and I came with our baby so we had to do the appointments back-to-back. Our baby was not making it easy as she was crying and screaming pretty loudly, but Ryo was extremely accommodating and  understanding. We felt so welcomed in his clinic!

Treatment-wise, Ryo was able to fix my posture and help me stand up straighter than when I walked in. I could stretch my back and arms further than I could ever have done. All in ONE session! I could not believe it myself. 

Our only regret is not booking multiple appointments with Ryo. He is highly sought after, and deservingly so. If you’re coming to Tokyo, do yourself a favour and book at least one appointment with him!! Make sure to book in advance as he is usually booked up at least a month in advance.

reviews.title: Wish Wa Ho massage was in Perth. Australia.
reviews.review_text:
I gave up going for a massage for the past 2-3 years because I usually left feeling disappointed. But i am glad i did give Wa Ho massage a chance during my trip in Tokyo, it was just what I needed! Shiatsu was on the point and the chiro session was full of surprises, (great surprises)

My shoulders feeling way less tight, my whole body basically was relaxed after the 60mins session. I wish i could do more sessions like this. I said to Ryu, 'If you were in Perth, i would definitely visit you every 2 weeks!' 

The experience was that great 👍 10/10

reviews.title: Greatest Chiro/Massage in Japan A++++
reviews.review_text:
This massage place is absolutely AMAZING - had the pleasure to have my back corrected by RYO. I walked out of here feeling like a new person. I recommend anyone coming to Japan to try this place. 

Ryo speaks english and has an great knowledge about spine and back pain - EXTREMELY happy with the service

Jarrad

reviews.title: Impressive Shiatsu Training in English!
reviews.review_text:
I had the pleasure of attending 4 Shiatsu classes with Ryotaro, who owns Waho-An Nature Tokyo. I can't say enough positive things about the experience. Ryo is an exceptional teacher (Takumi in Japanese) who combines deep knowledge with incredible patience. Ryo took the time to ensure that I understood and could demonstrate the techniques thoroughly. His English language is exceptional so he was always able to answer questions and offer guidance.

What impressed me most was Ryo's ability to create a supportive and encouraging learning environment. I was a complete novice in Shiatsu, having only been trained in Swedish massage previously; Ryo met me at my level and helped me grow. I still have a lot to practice but the way Ryo explained complex concepts in a clear, accessible way made my learning process smooth and enjoyable.

I walked away from the class feeling confident in the skills I had learned. I am planning a follow-up practice class in a few weeks and treat myself to a massage! If you're considering taking a Shiatsu class, I highly recommend learning from Ryo. You won't find a more dedicated or effective English-speaking teacher in Tokyo!

Tokyo Localized - Free Walking Tour in T.address: Meeting Place: AKB48 Cafe, Chiyoda 110-0006 Tokyo Prefecture
Tokyo Localized - Free Walking Tour in T.description: Coming to our Free Walking Tour, you will have an amazing opportunity to get to know history, culture, food, and lifestyle of an Old and New Tokyo. We would like to bring you a truly local experience so that you would love Tokyo as much as we do. Get Tokyo Localized Now!
Tokyo Localized - Free Walking Tour in T.address_string: Meeting Place: AKB48 Cafe, Chiyoda 110-0006 Tokyo Prefecture

reviews.title: HUGE
reviews.review_text: HUGE! A great place to explore. Beautiful from the outside and in. You really feel like you’re in one of the world’s most populated cities. I’d recommend heading down to floor B1. There’s a little food market selling traditional food, coffee, and some of the best tasting pastries I’ve ever eaten.

reviews.title: Know where to go
reviews.review_text: Soon busy, but that is to be expected. Definitely do you research beforehand and you should be fine. Beautiful building.

reviews.title: Bustling Station
reviews.review_text: This was a massive station with tons of people. There are many areas to eat and shop as well, but quite easy to get lost too.

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.review_text:
Tokyo Central Railway Station is a WOW! from inside and outside. Beautiful architecture. It's one of the metro stops and we were in awe of the bustle within the station. The many retail outlets and eateries. The vastness of the interior with the many entry/exit points.

We spent time just walking from one end to the other end of the station. Exit into Marunouchi Square and a 20 minute walk from the station will bring you to the parameters of the Imperial Palace.

Simply majestic!

Highly Recommended to visit or make a stop for a look see...at the very least.

reviews.title: Tokyo station
reviews.review_text: Historic and iconic landmark of Tokyo other than the Tower. Very conveniently located in the centre of the city but there is not much to look at and spending time for tourist.

Edo-Tokyo Museum.description: 【NOTICE】 The Edo-Tokyo Museum is closed for major renovations during the following period: April 1, 2022, through fiscal 2025 (tentative schedule) === The Tokyo Metropolitan Edo-Tokyo Museum opened its doors in March 1993 as a space to reflect on the history and culture of Edo-Tokyo and envision the city and life of the future. Housed in a unique building modeled after an elevated-floor type warehouse, the museum has been a landmark and popular tourist attraction in Tokyo since its opening. The permanent exhibition, showcasing original objects and replicas, offers visitors a journey through the 400-year history of Edo-Tokyo since Tokugawa Ieyasu entered Edo. In addition to the permanent exhibition, the museum holds special exhibitions at the first floor gallery five to six times a year and carries out various other events, including lectures and workshops on the history and culture of Edo-Tokyo.

reviews.title: Important guide
reviews.review_text: Crowded and eye-catching. I got stuck behind a random guide. He gave very good information. I don't think I would understand this place without him. I think this is a detail that needs attention.

reviews.title: Well worth the trip!
reviews.review_text:
Well worth a trip   - lovely exhibition, amazing building. I spent around 3 hours looking at the various displays. Truly fascinating and gives a great understanding of the Edo period.

Staff were fantastic. 

I visited in October 2019...just never wrote the review.

reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.review_text:
Reasonably priced, indoors with air-con, and has some interesting history such as replicas of homes early 1900s, the first "family computer", and relics from both modern and ancient history. It was a good hour taking in and worth the visit. Convenient to Ryogoku station.

Note: with any Japan national exhibit, check the calendar in advance. This country is weird and places will close completely on Monday or Tuesday as routine.

reviews.title: The past, present, and future of Edo-Tokyo.
reviews.review_text:
This is a very well planed museum that covers the history of Tokyo from the days it was once a sleepy village called Edo till the modern day megacity we know today.   

The building itself is a architectural marvel far larger than photos give it credit for.  The amount of interior space allows for many life sized exhibits.  Beyond practicality, its interesting shape almost suggests it could walk away at any moment.  

Inside the museum a well planned path of different historical eras of Edo/Tokyo are covered from past till present.  Its a very interactive space with many hands on exhibits, and life sized recreations of homes and buildings.  You can get a feel for what a typical home in old Edo, or 1950's Tokyo was like.

reviews.title: So much to see - Edo period brought to life!
reviews.review_text:
Museum in a bit strange modern building turned out to be one of the highlights of our Tokyo visit. It houses several life size models of Edo period bridges, houses, ships, etc. as well as fantastic miniatures in various scales. Inside the houses you can see models of Edo period people living their lives, peasants, kabuki actors, teachers, chefs, craftsmen… Authentic historical items are at display, too, such as the letter declaring Ieyasu Tokugawa as the Shogun. You can even interact with some of the models, try to lift portable sushi booths and the like.

The museum is divided in two parts: Edo and Tokyo. The history continues in Tokyo part up to late 20th century and is interesting as such, but I have to admit I went there mostly for the Edo part. The museum shop sells some nice souvenirs at reasonable prices. Overall, a superb museum, highly recommended!

Tokyo.description: Tradition collides with pop culture in Tokyo, where you can reverently wander ancient temples before rocking out at a karaoke bar. Wake up before the sun to catch the lively fish auction at the Toyosu Market, then refresh with a walk beneath the cherry blossom trees that line the Sumida River. Spend some time in the beautiful East Gardens of the Imperial Palace, then brush up on your Japanese history at the Edo-Tokyo Museum. Don’t forget to eat as much sushi, udon noodles, and wagashi (Japanese sweets) as your belly can handle.

reviews.title: Exquisite Dining Experience
reviews.review_text:
Lecrin Ginza truly excels in creating a culinary experience that lingers in our memory. The menu features an array of meticulously crafted dishes that highlight fresh, high-quality ingredients and inventive flavor combinations. Each bite showcases the chef’s artistry and passion, seamlessly blending traditional and modern techniques.

Moreover  the curated wine list and bespoke cocktails are thoughtfully matched to enhance every dish, elevating the flavors to a whole new level. Whether it’s a rich red wine that complements a hearty dish or a refreshing cocktail that balances delicate flavors, the pairings demonstrate an exceptional understanding of taste and harmony. It’s a dining experience that’s as luxurious as it is unforgettable.

It’s a must-visit in Tokyo .

reviews.title: Not just underwhelmed, disappointed.
reviews.review_text:
Nothing was good about this place. I'm a big fan of Uighur food. But this was so underwhelming. 

The flat bread tasted like it had been frozen and reheated in a microwave. 

The skewers were just OK. 

The tomato salad was a bunch of terrible quality tomatoes covered with a quarter inch of white sugar. (?!?!) An it was not cheap. 

I was extremely disappointed and have no idea how this place retains such a high rating.

reviews.title: Mouthwatering wagyu
reviews.review_text: The Wagyu steak was divine and just melted in your mouth — we couldn’t have enough of it (5/5). We also had the tenderloin, which we found a little tough and not too tasty/juicy (2.5/5). Very friendly and competent service.

teamLab Planets TOKYO.description: teamLab Planets (Toyosu, Tokyo) is a museum where you walk through water, and a garden where you become one with the flowers. It comprises 4 large-scale artwork spaces and 2 gardens created by art collective teamLab. teamLab Planets Recognized by GUINNESS WORLD RECORDS™ as the most visited museum (single art group) in the world. A Massive “Athletics Forest” to Newly Open in Early 2025 ACCESS： 1 minute on foot from Shin-Toyosu Station 10 minutes on foot from Toyosu Station 5 minutes on foot from Shijoumae Station and Toyosu Market ※Currently, the ＜To-05-2 (Toei Bus)＞ from Tokyo Station, Ginza, and Tsukiji to Shin-Toyosu is experiencing heavy congestion. Please consider using other public transportation methods to visit.

reviews.title: Could be better
reviews.review_text: The expectations were greater than the reality turned out to be. The price is too high for this level. There are too few halls. However, the event organization was impressive.

reviews.title: An interesting experience but overcrowded and lacks important health warnings
reviews.review_text: It was an interesting experience, but nothing spectacular and it was over-crowded. If this is your first time attending this sort of display, it might be worthwhile. One thing I wish the website would mention is that you need to remove your shoes and walk through water, several times. Luckily, I was wearing shorts that day. They do offer shorts for rent, but what if someone prefers not to walk in the water? How hygienic is that? Additionally, they should warn people about the bright, flashing lights, as they could be a concern for people with certain health conditions. My friend did not feel well after the second phase/setup but was not much assistance was offered. There was no place to sit or rest, nor was she offered a refund.

reviews.title: A must visit place
reviews.review_text: This is a must visit place if you are in Tokyo. Both the garden section and the water section are amazing. Very well organized and the visit was very pleasant and relaxing.

reviews.title: One of my favourite Tokyo experiences!
reviews.review_text: This place is an absolute must-see - unlike any other experience I've ever had. Immersive from the very start, it brings a beautiful balance of wonder and calm. Each room takes your breath away and grounds you into the present moment. I felt like a little kid again!

reviews.title: It could have been better
reviews.review_text: TeamLabs planets has the potential to be great, a couple of the experiences can truly be mind blowing, but it’s ruined by allowing too many people in at the same time. We were herded from one room to another by a team member. With school kids and adults, shoving and screaming, it felt more like an overcrowded amusement park than an immersive experience. I was there on a Friday afternoon, wonder if I should have picked a different day. I hope that this review will motivate them amend their rules, restrict the number of tickets, ask guests to maintain silence and perhaps have a different time slot for kids or school trips.

Little Tokyo.description: Experience a slice of Japan at Los Angeles’ Little Tokyo, a Japanese-American cultural district brimming with shops and restaurants. Established in 1855, Little Tokyo is one of only three Japantowns in the United States. Spread over five blocks, the district is crammed with food gems, streetwear vendors, and manga and anime shops. Don’t miss the Japanese American Cultural Community Center, which hosts regular cultural performances and cooking classes. Time your visit around festivals such as Nisei Week (every August), when street dancing and parades fill the area. You can explore Little Tokyo on a walking tour, along with Chinatown. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Great Japanese Food in Little Tokyo, But a Bit Pricey
reviews.review_text: My friend and I were hungry and craving Japanese food, so we decided to visit this spot in Little Tokyo. While it didn’t quite match the flavors we’ve had in Japan, it was still pretty tasty. If it were a bit more affordable, I’d definitely give it five stars!

reviews.title: Overrated
reviews.review_text:
I have been to Little Tokyo on two different occasions. Both of my dates here were boring, and the restaurants feel very basic. Everything that we saw in the stores looks like overpriced novelty junk. Calling Little Tokyo anything more than overrated would be a lie.

Not even the food is good enough to justify visiting Little Tokyo again. Don't let the long lines fool you; I can find better Japanese food just three miles away from my house in Thousand Oaks.

reviews.title: No public toilets
reviews.review_text: No public toilet, or if they have you need to buy a certain item if you want to use their toilet. Lot of Japanese and Chinese people they hard to speak English

reviews.title: No near public toilets.
reviews.review_text: Wouldn't recommend if you have a weak bladder. otherwise you have to eat in a restaurant to use the restroom. Nice little place to look around though.

reviews.title: Mr. Ramen, an unexpected delight!
reviews.review_text: We got to our hotel and hadn’t eaten and it was about 2:30 in the afternoon. We walked across the street seeing as there was an open Ramen shop on the Fourth of July and went in not expecting much. The service was impeccable and better than at the fancy restaurant we went to for dinner that night. We ordered three very different dishes, Tonkatsu rice, curry shrimp and kimchi miso Ramen and they were all fantastic! They had beer and wine and sake along with many nonalcoholic beverages. There were many hand drawn, 3 x 5 cards on the wall that kept us entertained…. would definitely go back!

Grand Hyatt Tokyo.description: Experience moments of more at a dynamic lifestyle destination hotel in the heart of Roppongi, Tokyo – a lively international district. With its central location directly connected to Roppongi Hills which houses 200 shops and restaurants, a cinema, an art museum and an observatory, Grand Hyatt Tokyo is the perfect base from which to comfortably explore and discover the city. What Makes Your Stay Grand: - Convenient location: Near famous Tokyo destinations, the hotel is just a three minute walk to the nearest subway station and 90 minutes by limousine bus from Narita International Airport and 40 minutes from Haneda Airport. - An abundance of dining options: Ten unique restaurants and bars offer seasonal Japanese and a range of international cuisine. - Luxurious award-winning accommodations: Unwind and relax in one of the 387 rooms and suites at this modern hotel. -Finding your inner harmony at Nagomi: Relax with Japanese healing traditions at Nagomi Spa and Fitness.

reviews.title: Another 5 Star Experience in Every Way.
reviews.review_text: I reviewed this hotel a year ago and said that we'd be back. Well we have just returned from Tokyo and spent another 10 days at the Grand Hyatt. Once again it did not disappoint and is every bit as good as it was a year ago, perhaps even better. This is a big hotel, but they still have that personal interaction with their guests and make you feel really welcome. The entire experience was flawless from check in to check out and nothing was too much trouble. All of the staff were outstanding but I do need to make special mention of Isaac in F&B, Samuel in The Oak Door Restaurant and Ashok in The French Kitchen. You guys rock!  Japan is the most amazing country and the people are so welcoming and gracious. Love it!

reviews.title: Awesome experience.
reviews.review_text:
I would like to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional communication and service provided by all teams during our recent stay. My wife, who has a hearing disability, traveled with a service dog, and while a few staff members initially inquired about her presence, they quickly understood the situation through effective communication.

Every team we interacted with, including the valet, front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping staff, demonstrated excellence in their roles. We could not have asked for a better experience.

Thank you for your kind and courteous service. We are already considering a return visit next year.

reviews.title: Great experience. Clean and comfortable hotel. Extremely kind and helpful staff
reviews.review_text: My room was large and spacious. They have balmain lotions and hair care. The bathroom is spacious. Amazing shower and large bathtub. Softest bedding. Love the turndown service. The breakfast buffet was superb with fresh tuna and grilled fish every morning.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review_text: We had an amazing stay at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo! The staff were all so friendly and helpful, making our trip more enjoyable. Our family had a wonderful time and the food was delicious. Will definitely return the next time we come back to Tokyo.

reviews.title: Great Hotel but Terrible Club Experience
reviews.review_text:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights  and paid extra for a grand club level room.  The hotel and staff were amazing but the grand club was disappointing.  On multiple occasions the club was completely full and we were told to come back later.  When asked if we could take food back to our room, we were told we can’t take the plates and there were no to go plates.  
Hyatt shouldn’t be upselling club level rooms if they can’t guarantee access due to capacity issues.

Hilton Tokyo.description: Hilton Tokyo is located in Shinjuku, the heart of Tokyo's business, shopping and entertainment district, and is an ideal place to experience modern Japan. A complimentary shuttle operates between the hotel and Shinjuku station and the Tokyo Metro subway is connected to the hotel. Relax in one of the modern Japanese-style rooms and admire stunning city views. The hotel offers WiFi and internet access throughout all rooms and public space. Rejuvenate in the 24-hour on-site health club and relax in the sauna or soothing whirlpool spa. Play tennis on the rooftop courts or swim laps in the indoor pool. Exercise with Technogym equipment, the official supplier of the Olympics and Paralympics. TSUNOHAZU expresses folkloric traditions and boundless energy of the Shinjuku neighborhood in an open-format space composed of colorful materials, surprising design elements and four distinct dining and entertainment zones.

reviews.title: Tokyo Hilton 2024
reviews.review_text:
I had an excellent stay at the Hilton Tokyo. The location is absolutely fantastic, with easy access to nearby attractions and transportation options, making it a perfect base for exploring the city. The staff were outstanding—always friendly, professional, and ready to assist with any request.

One of the highlights of my stay was the executive lounge. The variety of offerings was impressive, from delicious food options to a well-stocked selection of beverages, all in a relaxing and spacious setting. It really added to the overall experience.

The room was comfortable and well-appointed, providing everything I needed for a pleasant stay. Combined with the great location and the wonderful service, this hotel is an excellent choice for anyone visiting Tokyo. I’ll definitely be back!

reviews.title: SUPER HOTEL, LOVELY STAFF.
reviews.review_text: We had a great stay at this hotel. BIG shout out to Waly who greeted us every day of our stay whether we were just going out for the day, or returning from a day out,  he was there with a welcoming smile.  He couldn't have been more friendly or helpful.  Thank you Waly.  Being visitors to Tokyo, you made sure we were well looked after. This makes such a difference when you're a traveller in a new country. THANK YOU.

reviews.title: The Best Hotel
reviews.review_text: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in my whole life. The staff here all speak very good English and this was my first time in Japan but they kindly helped me in different ways including booking the tour for me and lending umbrella. The room I stayed was also very clean and nice. Highly recommend staying here.

reviews.title: Western Style Hotel Comfort
reviews.review_text:
Our second stay here in as many years, and again what a great choice!  Service is impeccable at the front desk, concierge desk, breakfast buffet and executive lounge.  Housekeeping was attentive to our requests for extra bedding.  Concierge helped us with arriving packages and making restaurant recommendations / reservations.

The location of this property couldn't be more perfect, with the underground passage to rail, the 10-minute Shinjuku shuttle, and the quiet business neighborhood.  On this visit we discovered a sprawling peaceful park, with Starbucks and a restaurant (and rare outdoor seating) just half a block away.

Guest rooms are tranquil with no noise from adjacent rooms, bedding is luxurious.  Bathrooms are equipped with all of the Japanese amenities, immediate hot water and great water pressure from shower, bath and sink.  Nespresso coffee maker and electric teapot were greatly appreciated.  More than enough electrical outlets in the room for charging all of our devices.

Definitely recommend booking with breakfast included, as the buffet cannot be beat.

We hold the Tokyo Hilton up as one of the very best hotels in which we've ever stayed.

reviews.title: Enjoyable stay
reviews.review_text: Stayed here for 6 nights for a conference before moving to Kyoto. Excellent attentive staff in all areas. Breakfast -  a vast choice it was a great start to the day. We enjoyed the St. Georges bar many times which had a nice atmosphere and again consistently excellent service. Room had a nice view over trees to the front of the hotel. It was clean although the bathroom was a little small. However we enjoyed our stay.

Hyatt Regency Tokyo.description: Hyatt Regency Tokyo provides a wide range of services guaranteed to satisfy the needs of guests. Allow our staff to assist you with anything you might require during your stay – from restaurant reservations and tour arrangements to tea times, spa treatments, and professional planning for any types of events or social occasion. For business trips and holidays, Hyatt Regency Tokyo sets an unmatched standard for Tokyo luxury accommodation.

reviews.title: Under renovation
reviews.review_text: Hotel under renovation. Small unequipped gym, closed pool, expect to queue for breakfast but well served, tasty food.  Staff incredibly kind and helpful (probably a normal expectation for Tokyo but to not be taken for granted), renovated rooms are fine (would be great if the AC worked tho)

reviews.title: Excellent service. Great location.
reviews.review_text: Excellent customer service beyond expectations. We were given a renovated room with a park view. It has a spectacular view of the fall foliage color of the trees. On our last day, Mt Fuji gave us a stunning view with its snow capped cone.  Not gonna lie that the building is old that’s why it’s still under renovation. It didn’t bother us because of great location to shinjuku station.  Can’t wait to go back again.

reviews.title: Great Location & Wonderful Concierge!
reviews.review_text:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  The location is great.  The rooms are very  nice (I got one of the newly renovated rooms).  The staff are all very friendly and helpful.  

Shout out to the concierge, Yuki Harima who was incredibly helpful in planning my excursions!

reviews.title: Well-located and comfortable
reviews.review_text: I had a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Regency Tokyo in Shinjuku! The location is super convenient with easy access to the train station and many shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel also has a beautiful lobby and a calm, relaxing atmosphere, which is perfect after a busy day exploring Tokyo.

reviews.title: Terrible Globalist Stay
reviews.review_text: The hotel is under renovation and cannot enjoy the lobby and drilling noise can be heard during daytime which is normal but if you want to take a daytime nap or break is impossible. Terrible experience as a globalist from check in to breakfast. Hotel is clean but shower curtains had mold on the edges and dated. Pillows were terrible one extra hard and the other was so thin it dis not matter. Will not be my first choice next time i go to Tokyo. Thanks but no thanks.

reviews.title: This is a superb attraction in the centre of Tokyo after the Tokyo tower to see the entire 360 view from 350 m height. It offers
reviews.review_text: This is a superb attraction in the centre of Tokyo after the Tokyo tower to see the entire 360 view from 350 m height. It offers amazing views. Has coffee shop and various other attractions inside.  Be prepared to stand a long queue. And it's a ticketed entry but worth every minute of enjoyment.

reviews.title: Masterpiece
reviews.review_text: I visited Tokyo Tower, and it was beautiful, especially with the night lights. Honestly, I think I like it more than Tokyo Skytree because it has a warmer and more nostalgic vibe. Being there brought back old memories from the last time I visited

reviews.title: Tokyo Tower
reviews.review_text: Personally, I liked Tokyo Tower more than Skytree. The night lights were really stunning, and the location was super convenient. I’d definitely recommend checking it out!

reviews.title: Great tower from 1958
reviews.review_text: Was by far the best experience we had while in Tokyo. Unlike other tower in Tokyo this one was not as crowded and the experience was far greater including getting a photo taken at the top of the tower overlooking Tokyo. One of my favorite memories of Tokyo.

reviews.title: Enjoyable but overpriced
reviews.review_text:
Despite being the "poorer relation" these days to the Skytree, I have to say we enjoyed our time here more that its competitor.
Tickets are still way overpriced but the service seemed much friendlier and personal and sights more readily identifiable.
All in all if we went to Tokyo again and had to choose only one tower to visit then it would definitely be this one!

reviews.title: So freaking cool at night!
reviews.review_text: The nighttime views are among the best in the city.  A misty rain obscured the view from the top deck while I was there but it was still a most enjoyable visit. You get your picture professionally taken, get to view many different historical videos, drinks provided, etc. Spectacular views of the city all around plus multiple levels for different views. There was also a cute Halloween display on the main deck windows.

Park Hyatt Tokyo.address: 3-7-1-2 Nishi Shinjuku, Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku 163-1055 Tokyo Prefecture
Park Hyatt Tokyo.description:
If you’re looking for a luxury hotel in Nishishinjuku, look no further than Park Hyatt Tokyo.
As your “home away from home,” the hotel rooms offer a flat screen TV, a refrigerator, and a minibar, and getting online is easy, with free wifi available.
Guests have access to a concierge and room service while staying at Shinjuku Hyatt. In addition, Hyatt Tokyo offers a pool and breakfast, which will help make your Nishishinjuku trip additionally gratifying. And, as an added convenience, there is parking available to guests.
While in Nishishinjuku be sure to experience local okonomiyaki & takoyaki favorites at Hiroshimaokonomiyaki Buchiumaya or Kobe Rokko-Michi Gyunta Shinjuku Lumine 1.
Nishishinjuku is also home to Statue Tamachan, a popular  that is not too far from Park Hyatt Tokyo.
The staff at Park Hyatt Tokyo looks forward to serving you during your upcoming visit.
Park Hyatt Tokyo.address_string: 3-7-1-2 Nishi Shinjuku, Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku 163-1055 Tokyo Prefecture

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
tldr: we were underwhelmed by our experience at the Park Hyatt Tokyo and won’t be back again.

Check-in: The hotel was very disorganized: there are many people in the hotel area frequenting its restaurant, bar and bakery besides the hotel guests; and there were insufficient signs and help from the staff. As we walked in, no one greeted us and we had to ask someone for the specific check-in location (the first person pointed us to the wrong place, a cake pick-up). The building entrance is overall confusing and feels like a convention center - sterile. At check in, we were not offered any help with luggage.

Room: The room has a great view, but it needs renovation: water leaking from shower stall, bulky wood furniture, torn sofa surfaces, walls with scratches, limited electrical outlets at odd locations, doors making sound when sliding, worn carpets, no rain shower head.

Amenities: The gym and pool are complimentary but has a tiny locker area. For a more spacious and comfortable ladies’ room, you need to pay extra for use of the spa. We felt nickled and dimed especially when comparing to other hotels we’ve stayed at in this trip—saunas, jacuzzi and steam room were complementary elsewhere except for this hotel. On the plus side, the in-room amenities are great: Dyson hair dryer, Bose bluetooth speaker, and aesop toiletries are provided.

Dining: The hotel bar “New York bar” had a 45 minute wait when we were there. Hotel guests can wait from the room, but oddly no one told us that. They assumed we were not hotel guests and told us to wait in line.

Overall, we felt the stay did not provide a luxury experience; we did not feel a personal touch in the service, or any service at all. I would rate this hotel as a 3.5-star and not 5-star for what they offer. Feels like a regular Hyatt or Grand Hyatt at best,  As Hyatt loyalists, we felt this property is a huge letdown. Japan and Tokyo in particular have a lot to offer so we would not be back at the PH Tokyo again.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.review_text:
First off, going to the lobby is quite tricky. You have to take the elevator up to the hotel lobby. As you come out of the elvator, you turn right and go all the way to the end of the hallway. Checking in is like sitting at a table and opening a bank account. Very personal service. The staff that greeted us was quite stiff yet professional. We were ushered up to our room (just like in St. Regis) and made sure we had everything we needed. 

The location is convenient.  It is just a few mins walk  to restaurants and shops. 

The room was fantastic with a great view! It was spacious. They had luxurious toiletries. Everything was all there. We didn't have to ask for more. They provided a pair of sleeping clothes in case you forget to bring some. 

The staff at the restaurant were all very friendly and attentive.  They provided excellent service. The food was all delicious.

Our experience was great overall. It's worth coming back. 

The room was fantastic with a great view! It was spacious. They had luxurious toiletries. Everything was all there. We didn't have to ask for more. They provided a pair of sleeping clothes in case you forget to bring some. 

The staff at the restaurant were all very friendly and attentive.  They provided excellent service. The food was all delicious.

Our experience was great overall. It's worth coming back.

reviews.title: Fantastic Park
reviews.review_text: This park is next level I visit with my family and friends atmosphere is very friendly and all people enjoying with atmosphere I will be visit again and again with family friend I am very relaxing in this time and enjoying with my time excellent

reviews.title: Really just adding this as a time capsule
reviews.review_text:
Currently in the process of renovations, the Park Hyatt Tokyo was a hotel that I long desired to stay in, and the chance to do so finally came after the pandemic restrictions were lifted. I was not disappointed. Even just staying in one of the regular rooms was special and I am glad to have experienced it before the hotel closed.

Located in the farther end of Shinjuku, the Park Hyatt Tokyo is located in a large office tower, with the main means of getting up to the lobby being an elevator lobby that took me up to the main floor, after which I navigated a series of art-laden corridors to the actual lobby. I was seated and checked at the individual desks that dotted the area. The entry really set the tone for my stay-- just arriving at the hotel and walking up felt exclusive. I was sent my way and received the luggage that the staff had collected from me earlier at the building entrance shortly after arriving at my room.

The halls and passageways were very elaborate. I could see some being frustrated having to go through several of them to get to their rooms but I dug the vibe. The many pathways also meant that sound couldn't travel very far, meaning that the hotel was intimately quiet outside of the lobby and restaurants.

As expected, the room was spacious, at least for a Tokyo hotel. While appearing dated (hence the hotel going its refresh now), the furnishings nonetheless look classic and well-maintained. The features one would expect from a luxury hotel were all there and nearly organized. With the Park Hyatt being situated at the top end of the tower, the room came with a panoramic view of Tokyo that's hard to beat; one can get a similar view from the Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building for free, yes, but one cannot wake up and watch the sun rise from there. The bed and furniture were comfortable and ensured a good night's rest each time. The only complaints I had were the lack of power outlets, which was not surprising given the age of the hotel, and the steep height of the bathtub. I'm sure the renovations will come with many more outlets in each room when they are complete. I'm also sure that even after renovations, I will still have trouble getting in and out of the bathtub, as I cannot magically grow longer legs. Overall, I enjoyed the room and would happily stay in it again.

While I didn't make full use of the hotel's food and beverage facilities (there were many and they were all expensive), I did have the chance to sample their room service for lunch and also head up to the New York Bar for a nightcap. I recall that room service menu had many options spread across their restaurants and I had a Croque Monsieur. The sandwich along with a side made for a sumptuous meal that would have easily taken me out for the afternoon had I not resolved to get in some last-minute sightseeing. After coming back from dinner, I went up to the bar for a few drinks. Seating was plentiful when we were arrived, so we settled in and got our orders in quickly. The drinks were expensive (I remember them being between 2,000 and 3,000 Yen per cocktail), but they were delicious and were a small price to pay for the atmosphere, as well as for the nighttime views of Shinjuku. The menu also included snacks and small bites, which were equally expensive, but satisfying. 

Throughout my stay, I was greeted and treated warmly by the staff. The service ties everything together; the hotel's facilities were fantastic but they certainly wouldn't be as great without the staff manning them. From check-in to check-out, I had a great time. I hope an opportunity arises to stay here again!

reviews.title: 1700 Bucks per night and it was worth it
reviews.review_text: I spent 2 nights at Park Hyatt Tokyo and didnt regret it. The view to the largest metropolitan area in the world is just fantastic. The rooftop pool a dream (especially at night) and the piano bar with the best whiskys (Hibiki Suntory) generated a Bill Murray feeling.

Mrs London's.description: Located in the heart of historic Saratoga Springs, Mrs. London's Café and Bakery is dedicated to using the freshest, finest, natural ingredients. Whether it's our decadent pastries and desserts, artisanal handmade breads, sandwiches, and soups, we put much thought into everything we make.

reviews.title: A well managed long line
reviews.review_text: We stopped in here with family on Black Friday in the afternoon as we were from out of town and family wanted to show it to us. We ordered to go as the place was rammed with people. Even though the line was long, it was well managed. We ordered peppermint tea, almond croissants and tree hugger cookies. All were great!  The almond croissants had the almond baked throughout, not the usual almond paste in the middle. The tree higher was crispy and felt healthy.

reviews.title: Wonderful sweet spot
reviews.review_text: Wow! My husband and I came here for coffee and pastries and we were in for a treat! There wasn’t a lot of indoor seating but we were lucky to get a table at the window. I chose the almond croissant which was delightful, a generous size filled with sweet almond flavor paired with buttery layers. My husband enjoyed a cranberry scone with jam and butter.  It was moist but not overly sweet. It’s a good thing we don’t live too close by because it would be very easy to become  regulars at this place!  It has a steady stream of willing customers. Too bad there’s not a little more seating.

reviews.title: Excellent bakery and cafe
reviews.review_text: We wanted to have pastry for later in the evening. The prices are high but the pastry was excellent. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Top Notch in Saratoga Springs
reviews.review_text: I have worked in a fine German bakery owned by a native.  The baked goods at Mrs. London's are of the finest quality.  We took the Nicoise salad which was also excellent just like the coffee.  It's worth standing in line!

reviews.title: Mind-blowing selection of breads, sweet treats
reviews.review_text: Don't go here hungry. You will leave with your belly full but your wallet empty! The cookies and sweet treats are a bit on the expensive side but the selection is mouth-watering. We had to stop ourselves from ordering stuff that we know we could not have for health reasons but it was tempting! Definitely worth visiting if you are in town.

Bustronome London.address: 40b Victoria Embankment 40b Victoria Embankment, London WC2N 6PB England
Bustronome London.description: Fine Dining on the move. A new way to experience London. The Bustronome is a high-end dining experience aboard a custom designed double decker bus, featuring a panoramic view of the city. A unrivaled combination of aesthetics and leisure, this luxury bus/restaurant provides an extraordinary experience, discover the most beautiful views in London while enjoying the best of its gastronomy.

reviews.title: Fine Dining on Wheels
reviews.review_text:
This experience was amazing, Alex was such a great host and the food was beyond what we were expecting. 
Tyrique was also exceptional and so professional. 

The tunes that they played made the experience so much greater. My girlfriends and I had a blast on this little bus sight seeing experience.

reviews.title: Bustronome London review
reviews.review_text: The bustronome London was a great experience; Jackson was excellent value, the food was great and got to see all the sights!

reviews.title: Awesome experience
reviews.review_text: Awesome evening with great food and fantastic staff who were committed to ensuring everyone had a great experience. Organising the event for our 20 guests was so easy.  Massive thanks to Maelys and Ali.

reviews.title: For great food and a unique experience, book it!
reviews.review_text: Fantastic experience for people who love good food and are looking for a different (and lazy!) way to admire some of London’s best sights. The food surpassed our expectations and our waiter/host Jackson was brilliant - so polite, fun and just full of energy. Thanks to Jackson and Bustronome- the highlight of our weekend in London!

reviews.title: Amazing experience
reviews.review_text: Good was stunning, bus is fabulous but the staff were incredible! Our waiters were funny, informative, efficient, knowledgeable and great fun!  Would highly recommend.  Ali was one of the waiters. Attended on Friday 22nd November 2024

The London.description: The London Een nieuwe gastronomische beleving op 't Eilandje in Antwerpen. De naam verwijst naar de Londenbrug, gelegen pal naast ons restaurant. Maar ook naar London, de stad waar alle keukens van de wereld samenkomen. Dit is het vertrekpunt van een culinaire ontdekkingsreis. 'Sit back and relax'. Dat is het gevoel dat we je willen geven op het moment dat je bij The London binnenstapt. We hebben een unieke plek gecreëerd waar gastronomisch genieten en gemoedelijkheid hand in hand gaan. Of het nu voor een zakenlunch, een intiem etentje of een uitgebreid diner is, we stellen de beleving van onze gasten voorop. Met het unieke zicht op het Havenhuis van Zaha Hadid, ons met zorg ingericht interieur en een attente en discrete bediening. Het evenwicht tussen ontspannen uit eten gaan en je verrassen met unieke smaakbelevingen, dat is waar we naar op zoek gaan in restaurant The London. De dagelijkse stress mijden we, om zo unieke momenten van culinair genot te creëeren.

reviews.title: Sublime dining experience
reviews.review_text: Exceptional experience in every respect. Treat yourself to the taster menu - perfectly balanced and accompanied by fantastic wines. Lovely staff and ambiance.

reviews.title: Simply amazing
reviews.review_text:
We went with friends on Sunday evening to this restaurant after having run the half
Marathon in Antwerp. We chose the 6 course menu and it was simply amazing. Every dish was delicious and an explosion of taste in the mouth. The cheffe surprised us as well with an amazing white wine !! I can only recommend this restaurant. The personal are very friendly. Last but not least the decoration is amazing and the carpet on the wall in the restroom is worth to see it :-). I will definitively go back to Antwerp to have dinner in this restaurant.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.review_text:
I’m so glad to had beautiful experience with this restaurant.
I could tell, every single dish has owner chef’s passion and dedication.
Delicious food and so comfortable atmosphere. I miss the restaurant.
Went to this restaurant was our one of memorable in this trip.

reviews.title: Delicious dinner at top level
reviews.review_text:
My wife and I had a gorgeous dinner at the London in early September. We chose the 6 course menu, which definitively was worth every Euro. The first dishes where all seafood-based and simply outstanding. Mostly raw white fish, ceviche-style with delicate textures and flavours. Although difficult to top, the main course - slices of charcoal barbecued Spanish beef was the icing of the cake. Wonderfully tasty and very tender it probably was as good as the Wagyu Steak that was also on the the menu, but that we didn‘t have. The deserts could be improved upon, but that really didn’t matter anymore. 
We have eaten in many Michelin-star restaurants and the London certainly deserves one.
Last but not least, I need to mention the very professional but still very personal staff, especially the chef and his wife.

reviews.title: Bad experience
reviews.review_text:
Unfriendly and discriminatory.  Do not recommend this place !

There are much better places in Antwerp to eat ,  good luck and save yourself the trouble !

Max London's Restaurant + Bar.description: Max London’s is a casual restaurant & bar committed to a high standard of food and drink. Our passion to provide real food from real farms in our area inspires our seasonal menu. You can enjoy a classic or signature cocktail, a glass of artisanal wine or locally brewed craft beer in an atmosphere that’s warm, welcoming and comfortable. We make all of our organic breads & Max’s mom, Wendy, Mrs. London herself, makes all our desserts, including our incredible sorbets & ice creams. Our Friday, Saturday & Sunday BRUNCH specialties include blue corn buttermilk pancakes, authentic yeast-raised Beligian waffles, omelettes made with the eggs from the heritage breed chickens of American Masala Farm in Hebron, duck hash, & cheeseburgers made from local grass-fed beef. Other features include a soup, pasta & risotto of the day, a slow-roasted pork or smoked beef brisket sandwich, chickpea polenta fries, steak frites from the potatoes of Sheldon Farms in Salem (we make our own ketchup) & smoked salmon (we make our own bialys). Our DINNER offerings always include fish & shellfish, steak, vegetarian fishes, salads, small plates & all of our wood fired pizzas, which are always available, even on our bar menu between lunch and dinner. The pizzas include the classic margherita (yes, we even make our mozzarella), mushroom, sausage, clam and a BLT pizza with Bacon, Leeks, roasted cherry tomatoes and Coach Farm goat cheese. Max London’s is Real food, Real fun & the Real deal. And we at Max London’s hope to see you again Real soon.

reviews.title: Excellent Food and Nice Place
reviews.review_text: Had dinner there twice in a week. Returned because the food was really good. Fresh salads, very tasty sauces and properly cooked. It's not a t-shirt place but still casual. Jeans and sport shirt or nice t-shirt can work. Also, they have a nice bar, good atmosphere. Staff nice and helpful. Excellent experience.

reviews.title: GET THE BRUNCH BURGER
reviews.review_text:
Everything was great but the Brunch Burger 
Grilled 8oz Wagyu burger, Vermont cheddar, bacon, griddled English muffin, rosemary aioli, + sunny egg, choice of side salad or frites

was the best thing I've ever had.

reviews.title: The maple pizza is everything.
reviews.review_text: Maple Pizza… sounds weird but it was simply delicious. The sausage was incredible, the sauce, the mushrooms, the cheese. Just a marvelous meal!! Loved it!

reviews.title: Great Lunch Spot
reviews.review_text: Loved the lunch we had.  The food was excellent as was the service.  If you are downtown, this is a great spot to get a fabulous lunch.

reviews.title: Dining in Saratoga Springs.
reviews.review_text: We were hosting a graduation dinner and made a reservation at this restaurant. The experience was under-whelming. Other than Pizza and drinks, all else were average. We had a bad experience with the appetizers, they were not worth ordering. However, pizza was nice.

Tattu London.address: The Now Building Rooftop, Outernet, Denmark Place, London WC2H 0LA England
Tattu London.description: Welcome to our Courtyard House. Our London concept was inspired by the traditional Chinese Courtyard House, a historic structure in which four residences would surround a beautiful central garden, blending residential opulence with the true beauty of the outside world. At the entrance gate to our courtyard dwelling, an ornate 'spirit screen' depicts our four mythical Tattu creatures, the Phoenix, Koi Carp, Dragon and Tiger. Superstition holds that these protective spirits bring good fortune to those that pass over our threshold. Unwind into our Outer Courtyard Terrace & Bar taking in unrivalled city views, journey through our Flower Hung Gate and onto the ornate pathway connecting each of our opulent dining room Residences. Each Residence opens out onto the stunning Inner Courtyard, where diners can watch the stars under our infamous cherry blossom and shelter from the sun under intricate timber awnings. We look forward to welcoming you soon.

reviews.title: Amazing night
reviews.review_text: This is my second time in this place. To be honest, the best restaurant in London and the staff is really nice specially Victor, who served us in the bar. Thanks so much for the experience!

reviews.title: Food good service poor
reviews.review_text: The food was delicious but the service was abrupt with the idea of getting as many people in and out of the restaurant in as short a time as possible. I went for my birthday celebration with my husband and at the end of the almost £400 meal (which only took 1 hour 25 mins) I was hastily asked to write a Google review and/or a Tripadvisor review immediately in the restaurant by scanning a QR code. Not what I had in mind at the end of my birthday meal. Rather desperate, tacky and pressurising.

reviews.title: 10/10 Service from Lin!!
reviews.review_text: I went to Tattu with my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary and it did not disappoint. The food was amazing, I personally enjoyed the truffle bao buns. On top of amazing food we had a fantastic waitress (Lin) who catered to all our needs, going out of her way to make our day special. Overall I am very pleased with my experience here and would highly recommend visiting.

reviews.title: Lovely lunch
reviews.review_text: We had a lovely lunch. Food was delicious and easy to select from the set menu for a table of 6. Staff were all very polite, friendly and attentive, especially our waiter Raul. Great views from outside bar.

reviews.title: Bad
reviews.review_text:
expensive restaurant, very bad service 
Restaurant Crowd  :African prostitutes
Was there on Saturday night  was is full of prostitute  with cheap look !
Not classy restaurant at all as mentioned

Amazonico London.address: 10 Berkeley Square Mayfair, London W1J 6BR England
Amazonico London.description: A Latin American restaurant in the heart of Mayfair, taking customers on a sensory and culinary journey through the Amazon River.

reviews.title: Great Latin American Experience
reviews.review_text: A visit to the place can make you feel the effect from the ambiance. Latino character combined with local cuizine. Extraordinary, unique flavours and palletes. Do not miss the desserts.

reviews.title: Bad food - won’t return
reviews.review_text:
The food was awful! 
We had the doversole, which wasn’t deboned properly and my boyfriend had to be sick in the toilet because he choked on a bone! 
ALL of the rest of the food came out cold and we didn’t finish it. 

The only thing I can praise is our waiter on the table, and also at the bar, and the drinks were good. 
Other than that, we will not be returning!

reviews.title: Well worth a try for great night out
reviews.review_text: This is a very vibrant and lively restaurant in thd heart of Mayfair. The food was amazing,tasty and expensive. Our waiter Jonatan was very attentive, professional and fun. He made our experience a great one. Well done Jonatan. We had empanadas to start followed by chicken and steak. The food was beautifully flavoured and the sides were amazing and a little different. Cocktails were a little different and hit the spot. Was it expensive? yes. Would I return? Absolutely!

reviews.title: Nicely designed but fairly average food experience
reviews.review_text: A beautifully designed restaurant  in the heart of Mayfair. Staff are very attentive and friendly and the  restaurant band hit the right notes! Food wise however for me was somewhat disappointing. Prices are high but very few of the dishes (if any) unfortunately were memorable.  Based on that would probably choose not to return.

reviews.title: Hit: One of my 3 favourite restaurants
reviews.review_text: One of my favourite restaurants in the world (there is also one in Madrid). Venue is beautiful, great live bands and spectacular food. It really cannot get better than this. Fab place for date nights, but also for a night out with friends

Zuma London.description: Zuma in London's Knightsbridge offers a sophisticated twist on the traditional Japanese izakaya style of informal eating and drinking. The ethos behind Zuma is to deliver an authentic, contemporary flavour of the east while respecting the traditions of the past.

reviews.title: Exceptional service from Kostas and staff
reviews.review_text:
Went to Zuma Thursday evening for the first time, we got off to a good start with a warm greeting on arrival. The atmosphere was fab, good music and vibes which we love. 
We were unsure what to order but were given some help from our  waitress and Kostas. 
The food was spectacular, a real taste bud treat ! 
So thank you very much Kostas, your recommendations were perfect and the service and attention to detail was exceptional.
We will for sure be back.
Thank you.

reviews.title: Downright obnoxious service
reviews.review_text: This restaurant should get the lowest rating because it takes its customers for granted . It always gives an impression that it is full and difficult to get a table when in fact many tables are empty. The food has also deteriorated. People only come here for the music and a club like atmosphere. Not worth the money spent on the food . Stay away from it

reviews.title: excellent but you pay for it!
reviews.review_text: Have been coming here since it opened in 2004. Staff are so friendly, always welcoming, even if i have not been for a while. The food is excellent, there is no denying that, however it has become very very expensive. I found a bill from 2013 and its now 100% more expensive. So its more of a special treat now! best when you are not paying the bill!

reviews.title: Lovely food but ned more time
reviews.review_text:
An amazing place and food could not be faltered.  

Don't order the tasting menu if have table for 2 hours. Amazing amount of food but feels rushed at 2 hours

reviews.title: Night in London
reviews.review_text: Zuma is always excellent. Service, food and specially the atmosphere are unique. Everything was as our expectations. We will come back sure.

Happy London.address: 25 -29 Coventry Street Piccadilly, London W1D 7AG England
Happy London.description: A family-friendly casual dining group with over 40 sites across Europe. Located at the heart of London, you can’t miss our bright and beautiful flagship restaurant in Piccadilly Circus, London. Happy London recently won Best Restaurant in London and Best Hospitality Team in the UK at the British Restaurant Awards.

reviews.title: A great night out at Happys highly recommended
reviews.review_text:
We had a wonderful evening the service was impeccable.our sever Rosie made us very welcome and was warming and so helpfull she deserves a compliment  she went out of her way when the ice cream had ended she made sure our daughter had  one scoop of cholate icream with a candle.
 Thank you to all the staff who made my daughters birthday complete recommend to everyone. Just make sure you reserve as it gets very busy.

reviews.title: MY FAVORITE PLACE
reviews.review_text:
Helloooo everyone ! 
Happy is my favorite place in London. The team is very cool and fast !
Keep right and keep the smile brooo 😛

reviews.title: Great !
reviews.review_text:
We all had varied foods and was cooked very well 
I had the philly beef and would thoroughly recommend 
various cocktails to wash it all down!

reviews.title: Food ok, miserable staff
reviews.review_text: Was ok.. expensive for what you get.. but that’s London.. the staff member serving us couldn’t have been more miserable.. no hello, no smile, just grunts and attitude.. not sure if this is acceptable in Albania, but it’s not here

reviews.title: Rich man’s TGI Fridays
reviews.review_text:
Piss poor!!! Rich man’s TGI Fridays 
Got served raw chicken for one of my children and they refused to sing happy birthday to my daughter because we wouldn’t buy desert after not wanting to due to the poor main meal. 
Very poor and over priced 
£200 for a bog standard meal

Won’t be back

Uzumaki London.address: 107 Great Russell Street, London WC1B 3NA England
Uzumaki London.description: Uzumaki London is the iconic Anime & Manga Themed Japanese Restaurant serving Naruto Ramen, Itachi Dango, Sushi & Bubble Tea. Uzumaki London is bringing anime food to life. New Location: 107 Great Russell Street WC1B 3NA

reviews.title: Lunch At Uzumaki
reviews.review_text: Went to Uzumaki with our 3 adult boys who are all Anime fans. An excellent meal in great surroundings and we were fabulously looked after by Rita who made sure that we had a great visit.

reviews.title: Perfect experience!!! <3
reviews.review_text:
A 10/10 experience for my partner and I - we love ramen and anime, so this was the perfect place for us weebs to shlurp some soupy goodness and enjoy the vibes.
The ramen (Uzumaki and Halal Uzumaki!) and milk boba (Geto Tiramisu ;D) we ordered were so delicious, we will be dreaming about it until next time we can come here again! 
We also tried dango (Itachi's favourite!) for the first time here and it was a sweet and chewy delight.
Our waitress named Rita was especially lovely and so sweet, she made the overall experience even better, it was already perfect! <3 thank you so much!! 
Lastly, the wall art was so cool to look at, kudos to the artist :D I also loved that Jinx paid a visit to the women's bathroom! xD

reviews.title: Great themed restaurant with great atmosphere.
reviews.review_text:
Excellent themed restaurant. It was lovely inside and had a good atmosphere. The staff were amazing and very accommodating. 
The food was amazing, we were there at lunch time and it was delicious. I loved the extra little touches like the chopstick rests and the decoration. There was plenty of choice for food.

reviews.title: Unique venue with lovely staff
reviews.review_text: We had a very enjoyable meal here and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Beautiful decor , unique place to visit. Cute little memorable things to buy in the shop.

reviews.title: Fun dining
reviews.review_text: Had a very good time here! Atmosphere was great, our waiter Steven was really lovely and patient with us, even cracking jokes. Food was delicious, drinks were amazing. Will defo come back and recommend to everyone.

London Steakhouse Co..description: The London Steakhouse Company is a traditional steakhouse in the heart of the Square Mile, serving a mouth-watering choice of steak cuts and a range of timeless English dishes. Its discreet entrance, just off bustling Bishopsgate, leads you into an archetypal steakhouse dining room, complete with a stylish cocktail bar. As well as the finest quality steaks, the menu features grilled and roast meats, fish mainboards and classic English puddings. The London Steakhouse Company is popular during the week with the City for client entertaining and boasts a private dining room that seats up to 22 guests. At the weekend, local residents and discerning steak lovers enjoy great food at this hip location just off Spitalfields.

reviews.title: Zlatica + Sticky toffee pudding 5*
reviews.review_text: Food mostly good, but the sticky toffee pudding by far the best bit. Bourguignon better than the steak. Zlatica was a really great waitress which made our visit very enjoyable - thank you Zlatica!

reviews.title: Nice but no wow factor
reviews.review_text:
We came lunch on a Friday. The atmosphere was pleasant and the front of house staff friendly. 
We had a 3 course including cocktail set menu as a gift. 
The cocktails were very nice but a limited choice. 
We were slightly disappointed of the number of items on the set menu that required a supplementary charge especially that no side dishes were included. For a set menu at a steak house restaurant it was surprising that only the rump steak was an option without additional and that option was literally just the steak. All sides including chips were additional charge of £8.50 each. 
The waiter Oveen was friendly and gave us plenty of time to choose our courses and we never felt rushed. 
Overall I would recommend but be warned the additional charges are significant.

reviews.title: Outstanding dining experience and service
reviews.review_text: We had an amazing birthday lunch at London Steakhouse Co. The atmosphere was perfect, and the food was delicious. A special shoutout to Jose, whose professionalism and attention to detail truly made our experience unforgettable. He went above and beyond to ensure everything was just right, making the celebration even more special. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for excellent service and a memorable dining experience!

reviews.title: Excellent service and food
reviews.review_text:
Excellent service, Oveen was very attentive to our needs and was a very good host.Will come again to the 5 course lunch 
Grant

reviews.title: Best lunch to date
reviews.review_text: Leo Zhang and the rest of the team were so lovely and very professional. It was mine and my girlfriend’s first time here and we felt very looked after and the food was spectacular. Give Mr Leo Zhang a pay raise he was very knowledgeable and so helpful. He made the whole process seamless.

Rosewood London.description: Rosewood London combines English heritage with contemporary sophistication in the very heart of the capital. The Grade II-listed, building has been renovated to provide accommodation with the feel of a stylish London residence. The guestrooms and suites are inspired by a traditional British manor house. The restaurants and bars are destinations in their own right. Recreational facilities include the Sense, A Rosewood Spa, Rosewood's signature spa brand, and a well-equipped fitness suite.

reviews.title: ROSEWOOD? DEADWOOD.
reviews.review_text: Is this the worst hotel in London? Terrible check in, left waiting in reception as room wasn’t ready. Nobody got us so we waited 15 mins and spent a further 10 minutes queuing to find out room was in fact ready. This after we emailed ahead to make sure room would be ready at 3pm sharp. Room service included a tragic miniature £14 ham and cheese toastie that looked like it was stolen from little Johnny’s lunchbox. What is going on at this 5 star hotel? Even the premier inn would be ashamed. Then there was interminable buzzing in the room every 5/10 mins so difficulty sleeping. Gritty oysters was a first at a restaurant where I swear some of the staff looked like they wanted to taser the guests. Not friendly. Breakfast was another shambles passed from empty uncleared restaurant to another. Only saving grace was Scarfs Bar where you needed a drink after all the above. Rosewood? More Deadwood. Avoid.

reviews.title: Wedding @ Rosewood
reviews.review_text:
We attended a wedding @ Rosewood 
The ballroom was stylish and looked fabulous for the wedding.
Food looked impressive but not 5 * which is disappointing as the premises were 5* plus .
Beautiful wedding ❤️
The staff were helpful but unfortunately you had to use stairs to get to the ballroom which made it difficult for me as I had a knee operation 8 weeks before .
The dessert table was awesome ❤️❤️

reviews.title: Great Afternoon Tea
reviews.review_text:
We have had an excellent afternoon tea here. The menu was extraordinary and the staff was very attentive and super friendly. The atmosphere was very nice, professional and quiet, just as we like it.
Just one remark for the GM: some of the sofas were not just worn out but are in dire need of a refresh.

reviews.title: Incredible service!!!!
reviews.review_text: We love this hotel and the staff already but when I suffered a medical emergency the other day, they took things to the next level. Filippo, Gabriella and Bruno and the whole team could not have been kinder and more accommodating. As soon as it happened, they rushed upstairs, made sure I got to the hospital quickly and I came back to a spotless room with a huge bouquet of flowers. Everyone was so helpful and understanding and I felt so safe. They will have our loyalty forever.

reviews.title: Sanctuary of Serenity and Style
reviews.review_text: This hotel understands the art of hospitality. The lobby's ambient music and subtle fragrance created an immediate sense of calm. The beds were cloud-like, and the soundproofing was exceptional - I've never slept better in a hotel. The spa services were top-notch, and the indoor pool area felt like a private paradise. Every staff member seemed genuinely happy to be there,

Park Grand London Kensington.description: Finding an ideal charming hotel in London does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Park Grand London Kensington, a nice option for travelers like you. Free Wi-Fi is offered to guests, and rooms at Park Grand Kensington offer a flat screen TV, a minibar, and air conditioning. During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and room service. Guests of Park Grand Kensington are also welcome to enjoy a fitness center and breakfast, located on site. For those interested in checking out popular landmarks while visiting London, Park Grand Kensington Hotel is located a short distance from Harrods (1.3 mi) and Buckingham Palace (2.2 mi). During your visit, be sure to check out one of London's popular schnitzel restaurants such as The Wolseley, Oslo Court, and Granger & Co, all a short distance from Park Grand London Kensington. If you’re looking for something to do, Natural History Museum (0.7 mi), V&A - Victoria and Albert Museum (0.9 mi), and Science Museum (0.7 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Shaftesbury Kensington. Park Grand London Kensington puts the best of London at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center

reviews.title: Good hotel!
reviews.review_text: Decent stay and a nice breakfast. Staff are friendly and helpful, am Bonvoy Silver and requested a 2pm checkout for my 2 night stay which was granted with no fuss. Comfortable room although basement room I was given was a bit dark and a -slightly- musty smell, TV a bit dated. Great location near Earls Court tube! -plenty of pubs/restaurants/shops nearby- and price was competitive. Am staying again in December.

reviews.title: Very bad stay
reviews.review_text:
I stayed two nights in the Kensington Grand Park Hotel and it was my worst experience with any Marriott Hotel ever. I had booked two months in advance. On checkin I did not get an a room upgrade as a Bonvoy member - which is ok as its subject to availability. But instead I was downgraded. I was put into a basement room, under the restaurant kitchen with a window to a a dirty light shaft. While the room itself was clean, the whole area in the basement was damp, smelly and the hallway dirty. WiFi did not work in my room and as it was in the basement, there was no cellular reception either. Whenever the kitchen flushed warter, it sounded like it was coming down into my room. Also, there are no power outlets anywhere near the bed to charge a phone. 
I would have loved to show the manager on duty the room and try him to explain what the „superior room“ features were. But the Management was not on duty when I arrived in the evening, not when I left the next morning, not when I came back the next evening and not on the morning of checkout. The receptionists apologized but could only put me in a better room the next day.
I arrived and checked in at the Hotel around 8pm on 2024-09-16. My reservation was done and confirmed 2024-07-24, so nearly 2 months before. With a reservation roughly two months in advance and bonvoy gold status, I really expect more than the worst and least room in the hotel.
On checkout, I again stated I wanted to speak to management, but they were unavailable.I insisted, that I am not willing to pay full price (507 GBP = 614 Euro) for this, but the front desk said they could do nothing about it as the amount was already charged on the credit card upon arrival. I was also not given a printed receipt/invoice for the stay, which I need for my bookkeeping/tax office, as the front desk said their system was not working at that time. They promised to send the receipt via email. They also promised that Management would follow up with me via email. Neither happened. Nothing.
My email address is very well on file with the hotel, as the booking was from the Mariott Website, logged in to bonvoy which has all the required info. They also read out my correct email out to me during checkin, so it is very well in their system.
Not providing a receipt, not following up on the stay and complaints leaves a VERY bad taste.Please get in touch with me to discuss how to resolve this situation.

reviews.title: Avoid if the basement rooms are the only ones available.
reviews.review_text:
I recently stayed at this hotel while traveling with a tour group.  The trip was broken into two separate stays at the beginning and end of the trip. 

The first 3 nights, I had a room in the basement.  Let's just say avoid this area at all costs. Getting to the room was a chore, as the elevator didn't go there, and there were several flights of stairs and multiple fire doors. The room and hallways stink of mold and mildew. The room was kept clean, but everything was just shabby. 

I got a room on the 5th floor on the tail end. This room was much better,  but the bathroom was showing signs of mold. 

The attached restaurant is separate,  so charging to the room is not an option.  The food and service were very good. 

The only saving grace for the hotel was that the staff were very friendly.

reviews.title: Do not stay here!
reviews.review_text: This hotel needs to understand the term service.  The room was OK, the location OK but the level of service for a hotel attracting this price was abysmal -  I arrived to a receptionist who tried 3 times to allocate me to a room in the basement with no windows.  I eventually was given a room on the first floor - the amenities in the room were no better than a motel with an empty fridge set to minimum temperature so pretty useless, cheap coffee n tea and no water.  I called the ' so called room service' for water and was told 'we don't provide water you will have to call the restaurant.'  I did and was presented with a luke warm bottle of water I had to pay for at my room door as the restaurant is a separate business!  I then discovered the Wi-Fi did not work as too many users on it at the same time the response to this was to send the receptionist to my room who had no knowledge of how to get it started and could only suggest I move rooms.  At this point I only had 45 mins left to get ready to go out.  I then got a call from front desk asking if I would meet with the Duty Manager, which I agreed to do if I had time, which I didn't, as he arrived in reception as my driver turned up.  Could it get any worse - oh YES.  On my return to the hotel I asked the front desk to order me a cab for the morning.  At 1.30am they decided to call the room to tell me Uber was not answering the phone and I would have to call the front desk again in the morning.  I slept well (only saving grace) then repeated my cab request to the morning staff who sorted it, but does it end there oh NO.  The Mini cab driver, did not know London, needed to rely on satnav and when got to my destination he struggled to find anywhere to pull over so took me on a 15-minute circuit of Euston whilst on the phone to a courier who was trying to deliver something to his house.  I eventually got out of the car, a 15-minute walk away from my desired location.  To say this was an uncomfortable journey, after a very poor overnight stay is an understatement.  Def NOT recommend.

reviews.title: Tired, damp and disappointing
reviews.review_text:
A disappointing Marriott experience. I was in a basement room, the room and corridor smelt very damp, carpet was stained, tired, shabby,
Old furniture
I would not stay here again  and would not recommend it to others. 
It was a Very poor experience, Marriott should know better

DoubleTree By Hilton London Tower Of Lon.description: At DoubleTree by Hilton, we know that the little things mean everything. These days, travel can be hard. At DoubleTree by Hilton we understand that, and every little thing we do adds up to creating a rewarding experience for our guests. This is evidenced through the signature warm chocolate chip cookies guests receive upon arrival, the advantages of the award-winning Hilton HHonors(R) guest reward program and our industry-recognized Culture of CARE that's been part of our DNA since 1985.

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.review_text:
Stayed here several times. Great location for ease of getting around either by walking as the Thames Path is only 2 mins away, by Train with Tower under ground being just around the corner and by Boat from the Tower of London pier. Hotel has a roof top bar which we did not use this time but have in the past with great views.

Staff are always friendly and welcoming and I would particularly like to thank Aridub who today went above and beyond to help resolve a query with our exit bill. Such a gentlemen who took time to sort out an error making sure it was corrected before we left.

reviews.title: Okay hotel in a great location!
reviews.review_text:
Stayed for three nights with my family; we had two rooms to accommodate the four of us.  It was an okay experience, but definitely not as good as the Hilton we had come from in a different city. 

 From the start, the customer service was lacking.  Upon arriving, the rotating front door got stuck and the staff member that assisted us acted as if we were ruining his day.  He was definitely annoyed.  That door got stuck on and off our entire stay, not just with us, but for other customers as well.  

At check in, the woman that assisted us was very nice but did not even consider our request for an early check in (we were only a couple hours early) and instead had us drop off our luggage.  The man that we left our luggage with was very annoyed and not very helpful.  We had a lot of luggage (five suitcases), but there was four of us and we had two rooms, so it was expected.  

When we did finally get to our rooms, the carpets were very outdated and dirty.   The hallway to our rooms made us feel like we were staying at a 1 star hotel.  The carpet outside the elevators had big stains on it.  It definitely needs replacing.  Other reviews mentioned updates; the updates clearly haven't made it to the third floor yet.  Also, the shower doors were very hard to get completely closed, causing water to get on the floor. A little updating will fix this problem.  The hotel was clean otherwise.  

As gold members, we had free breakfast every morning.  No perks or upgrades for gold other than breakfast.  However, the breakfast was very good.  They saved all their good staff members for that because everyone there was very nice and helpful.  The breakfast was also very good!

Overall, the hotel was sufficient for what we needed but definitely needs updating.  The location is good.  It is right next to the tube and Tower of London.  

Also, make sure to not touch the laundry bag in the room.  We were going to get some laundry done but ended up not having enough time because we had to leave a day early.  The bag was wrinkled (it was a paper bag) because we had put the laundry in it, so we did not hang it back up.  It was in the room, but not back on the hanger.  They charged us 10 pounds for the paper laundry bag!  There should be a sign on the closet door stating that - we would have re-hung the wrinkled bag!  

Overall, we would probably not stay there again with the many other choices available, but it was okay.  When all of the updates are completed, it will probably be much better.

reviews.title: Friendly Service
reviews.review_text: Sangare is an incredibly friendly and attentive staff member who went above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience at the hotel. He took the time to guide us through the breakfast buffet and made sure we had everything we needed. His excellent service truly enhanced our stay. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Another excellent hotel stay
reviews.review_text: Excellent staff here at this hotel who look after you perfectly. Special mention to Kurian, Sai, Susannah, Lee, Rishi, Uri, Rachid who always make us feel special and go the extra mile to make your stay awesome. They all work so hard and are always smiling.
