Lindsey & Anne-Marie 1043! We will be back!! Always stay at this hotel for the reasons listed above and always will.

reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin :-)
reviews.review_text: Delivers exactly as expected. We chose the hotel principally for its location as we had dinner in the area, followed by brunch the next day. We wanted a functional but clean, trusted hotel without having to pay through the nose and the Hilton name tends to do just that. We got it right I am happy to say. We aren't tourists but, if you are, the location is perfect for The Tower Of London, Tower Bridge and all things in that area of London. The room was clean, comfy and the staff were welcoming, efficient and helpful. If you fancy a tipple, the bar is fab with great views over the Tower and the Thames. Heartily recommended.

Royal Lancaster London.description: As one of the few remaining independently owned hotels in the capital, Royal Lancaster London stands proudly on the border of Hyde Park, offering breathtaking views of the famous London skyline. All 411 beautiful guestrooms have been impeccably designed to combine timeless style and comfort, ensuring every stay in London is truly unforgettable, whether you’re looking for a romantic weekend away or exploring the capital together as a family. Did we mention that kids under 12 get breakfast on us?! Guests can enjoy a selection of restaurants and bars onsite including the brand new Blooming British Afternoon Tea in collaboration with the Natural History Museum and the award-winning Nipa Thai, serving the most authentic Thai food outside of Bangkok. Superbly located in the heart of London, the hotel is adjacent to Lancaster Gate Underground Station and a 10 minute walk away from Paddington Station, offering easy access to Heathrow Airport in just 15 minutes.

reviews.title: Incredible Stay
reviews.review_text:
Once again an incredible stay. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The star rating in this hotel truly reflects its rating unlike some 5 stars.

The breakfast is probably one of the best out there.

Definitely worth a stay when visiting london for a rememberable trip. 

Couldn’t recommend it enough.

reviews.title: Memorable stay at the Royal Lancaster
reviews.review_text:
We had such a wonderful stay at the Royal Lancaster for our birthday weekend. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel really special.

Our room was  lovely with incredible views over London and Hyde Park, there were even thoughtful gifts waiting for us, which was such a nice touch. Throughout our stay, everyone we met was so polite, friendly, and professional. A lot of the team even wished us a happy birthday, which made the experience feel really personal.

As parents, this was a rare child-free getaway, and it turned out to be one of the most relaxing and enjoyable breaks we’ve had in ages. The attention to detail the hotel has and the effort from the team didn’t go unnoticed—we felt so well looked after.

Thank you to everyone at the Royal Lancaster for making our weekend so memorable. We’re already looking forward to our next stay!

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.review_text: The service in The Hyde Cafe was excellent. Trina paid attention to our needs and made sure we were comfortable. Jules, Daniela and Tiana all helped in making our experience great. We were not rushed and enjoyed our time. Thank you so much!!!

reviews.title: One of the best afternoon Teas I’ve ever had
reviews.review_text: Wonderful afternoon  the at The Hyde Cafe with the best team to welcome you: thank you to Trina, Jules, Daniela and Tiana for the amazing care they gave us during our time, I would definitely recommend and will definitely come back… we felt really comfortable !

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
reviews.review_text:
Disappointed with the overall experience so far. Pre arrival was great, had great expectations but on arrival we found out that all communication up front was useless… we were a group of 10 with 5 deluxe rooms but nothing had been done with our (approved) request  for twin beds.
Then at the bar we waited for a beer with the bartender getting 2 bottles and then did other orders before just grabbing the other 8 bottles out of the fridge. Why?
In the evening I must say they did arrange twin beds but  what I find the most shocking is that they put some of us in a classic room and not in the paid for deluxe room! 
This cannot be true? I travel a lot and am a luxury travel host but I have never experienced this in a 5 star hotel.
Great breakfast, classic rooms are great and staff is friendly but too many misses to be recommended. Great value for money but not the luxury feel and service from renowned labels in the city.

Sea Containers London.description: Sea Containers London, formerly Mondrian. Experience sophisticated design, unique boutique hotel, luxury dining and award-winning bars. Book Direct & Save!

reviews.title: quality, stylish hotel on the banks of the Thames
reviews.review_text: quality hotel in very good location - rooms very stylish and clean. the public areas are well maintained and the hotel has a modern, upmarket feel. the roof top bar music would be overpowering if its not your scene - we settled on the ground floor bar where the service was excellent

reviews.title: Great little gem by the river
reviews.review_text:
I booked this hotel for my wife’s birthday weekend - we arrived on a Friday and left on Sunday.
The hotel is a 5 minute black cab ride from London Waterloo (about £11) or a 10 minute walk. 
When we arrived at Waterloo, we decided to get a cab as we had bags and were tired from traveling but over the weekend chose to walk to the Lyceum Theater and Covent Garden, which was only about 15 minutes along south bank and over the bridge. 

The hotel looks prestige and really beautiful, the service and staff are excellent and really helpful. As it was my wife’s birthday, we were welcome with a glass of Prosecco before going up to our room. 
I booked a Deluxe room with a river view and it was beyond what we expected. The view was absolutely beautiful and it was so peaceful and quiet. The room was spotless and although it advertised the bed as a queen bed, it felt more like a super king sized bed.
A coffee machine with capsules is available, as well as a mini bar fridge. 
The TV has all functions to stream off your phone if you need to and there is an indoor heating/cooling which goes from 19 degrees up to 24. It didn’t appear to be an a/c but as it was mild out, we didn’t really need it.
The bathroom was equipped with all towels, soap and complimentary shampoo and shower gel.

Housekeeping did a great job making it all look great and clean again, replenishing towels and coffee capsules.

The breakfast buffet was absolutely amazing, ranging from all juices and coffees to hot and cold dishes. You can also order things such as avocado with poached eggs etc but the breakfast was more than enough for us.

The fact that you could WhatsApp reception or concierge whilst you’re staying with anything you needed and they responded really quickly was so helpful. 

I have no complaints and if I had to give some feedback it’s to get more elevators working, there were 4 but one was out of service. 
We would definitely return and the entire experience was great. Beautiful hotel, quiet but local enough with staff who have excellent knowledge and customer service.

reviews.title: Guest experience
reviews.review_text: Good stay again . Special mention to Lamesh who was a great concierge . Hotel delivered and the room was fantastic value for money. Will definitely stay again. Highly recommend the 12th knot bar. One improvement could be the air con in the room.

reviews.title: Amazing employees
reviews.review_text:
Very impressed with the hotel overall. Rooms, common spaces, decoration, approach from employees at the hotel.
All the employees were smiling, were very kind and willing to help.

Specifically, Lamesh took it personally to help find a package that went missing. Even though we did not find it, his persistence and patience were comforting and very well appreciated and exemplify kindness and work ethics.

reviews.title: Amazing service from Mr Gunes!
reviews.review_text:
We had our Thanksgiving dinner at Sea Containers London last night, and as always, it was an exceptional experience! A special shoutout to Mr. Emre Gunes, who we believe is the SeaCo restaurant manager. His hospitality and attention to detail were truly remarkable.

Mr. Gunes ensured all our needs were met and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. He was personable, attentive, and made the evening even more special. Although we come here often, it was our first time meeting him, and we’re so glad to have made that connection.

Thank you, Sea Containers London, for consistently providing amazing food, a warm atmosphere, and outstanding service. We’ll be back soon!

The Langham, London.address: 1C Portland Place Regent Street, London W1B 1JA England
The Langham, London.description: With a history of delighting guests and providing personalised service since 1865, The Langham, London is truly a London icon. With the recent addition of deluxe suites, British tavern, The Wigmore, new spa and Michel's Roux restaurant the reimagining of Europe's first Grand Hotel is ever evolving.
The Langham, London.address_string: 1C Portland Place Regent Street, London W1B 1JA England
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.review_text: The service we received from each member of the staff at this property was unmatched! As someone who has traveled quite a bit, and works in the travel industry, this property is definitely one of the top properties I have stayed in. Will absolutely return!

reviews.title: The best hotel in London
reviews.review_text: This is by far the best hotel in London. We're always welcomed with open arms and the staff are friendly and extremely helpful.

reviews.title: Sisters pre-Christmas trip 2024
reviews.review_text:
Just returned from an amazing stay at the Langham in London. We took advantage of a special offer so stayed for 4 nights for the price of 3.  
This hotel is so well placed for easy access to Oxford Street and beyond. Only a five minute walk to Oxford Circus underground. 
We stayed in an executive room so had access to the lounge where food and drink are served. This was I think our fourth or fifth stay and staff greet you as old friends and it was lovely to see some the same people. Gee (not sure of spelling) from Latvia makes a great passion fruit martini and was amazing as everyone is. Ivan (the terrible) is not at all terrible and makes a mean Tom Collins.  He anticipates your every need and the service from all staff is second to none. Would highly recommend upgrading to an executive room. 
The rooms are so comfy and the housekeeping team are very helpful and were happy to get us extras of things we asked for. The bookmarks in the room have seeds in them so when you finish using it you can plant them, I can’t wait to see the flowers that appear. 
The check in process was quick and efficient and the team are happy to look after your bags until your room is ready and they were waiting in our room when we returned.
Would recommend using the pool and gym, well I used the pool and my sister used the gym, maybe next time. 
The Christmas trees and decorations were amazing and loved to see them.
We will be back, think this is my happy place!! 
Thank you to everyone in the hotel you are all amazing.

reviews.title: Lovely, luxurious stay at The Langham
reviews.review_text:
A happy chance took us to The Langham. It's a beautiful building, inside and out. The lobby was twinkling as the Christmas trees had been put up. The location is incredible: at the top of Regent Street, only minutes away from Oxford Circus tube station. We spent most of our time out reconnecting with wonderful London, but it was easy to pop back to the hotel for a break during the day when we needed one.

We qualified for The Langham Club lounge and had our breakfasts there. We required vegan and gluten-free food and I'm glad to say that The Langham rose to the challenge and gave us tasty smashed avocado toast and delicious creamy mushrooms. My son's normally bottomless appetite was satisfied as plenty of food was on offer. Each morning, we were ably looked after by our cheerful and helpful waiter, Luis. In fact, all of the staff we met during our stay were extremely warm and welcoming.

Our room was spotlessly clean and well kitted out with everything we needed. The attention to detail was superb: the bed was turned down at night, Classic FM was switched on and playing softly in the background, a fresh bamboo pillow was left on the bath each evening, a plate of delicious fruit placed on the desk. With the hotel being quiet and the beds comfortable, we slept really well. What a relaxing, stress-free visit we had. Thank you to all at The Langham.

reviews.title: A perfect blend of traditional and modern
reviews.review_text:
There are so many excellent hotels in London that it is hard to decide which one to pick. This was our seventh visit to the city and we enjoy trying different properties each time. The Langham turned out to be an excellent choice because, as I said in the title of the review, it was a perfect mix of both traditional English style and modern facilities and amenities. 
Our room was excellent and had an extremely comfortable bed, very nice furnishings and a fully equipped and spacious bathroom.
The staff at the hotel really were wonderful from the front desk staff to the concierge, the housekeepers, bell staff and all. They really made us feel welcome and appreciated.  
The location of the hotel is great too as it i located at the top of Regent Street and we were able to walk everywhere that we were interested in.

Kimpton Fitzroy London.description: At Kimpton Fitzroy London, history and modernity intertwine seamlessly. Nestled in the heart of central London, this iconic hotel occupies the entire eastern side of Russell Square Gardens, inviting guests to experience the authentic charm of Bloomsbury. The 19th-century architecture, with its palatial grandeur, sets the stage for chic and contemporary interiors that beckon the discerning traveler. Whether you enjoy a cocktail at Fitz's Bar & Parlour, a cup of coffee at Burr & Co., or a delightful meal at Fitz's Brasserie, you'll find the perfect setting to unwind. The vibrant local culture of Bloomsbury is just moments away, offering an enchanting retreat where you can explore literary history, lush gardens, and lively cafés. Kimpton Fitzroy London provides a luxurious base to experience London's rich history in style, with key attractions and landmarks just a stone's throw away. Discover the perfect blend of elegance and contemporary comfort at this extraordinary hotel.

reviews.title: A beautiful hotel
reviews.review_text:
This was my second stay at the Kimpton Fitzroy and I loved it as much as the first time.  Just walking into the amazing lobby makes you feel you are in for a treat.  The staff is warm and friendly.  In fact, I mentioned the trip was a 70th birthday gift to myself and they sent a lovely chocolate tart up to my room the first night.

I will definitely come here again.  I also loved my room (714) which is a solo room although the bed is set up so that the headboard blocks the window.  Otherwise, it was a good size and a welcome spot to come back to after a long day walking around.

reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.review_text: I had such an AMAZING time at the Kimpton. Angela and the guest relations team gave me an unforgettable experience with their attention to detail and impeccable customer care skills. My first time there and most certainly not my last! Thank you so much Angela and team

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!! Outstanding service!
reviews.review_text: If you want to have a first class experience at a hotel with a touch of coziness then Kimpton Hotel is the one for you! I had the most enjoyable and luxurious stay and the service provided by Angela and the guest relations team was impeccable. I will definitely be returning as it was the most wonderful stay I have had at a central London hotel!

reviews.title: Great experience.
reviews.review_text: The bed was amazing. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Jack. The cocktails were great and strong. We will 100% be back someday soon. Stunning internal architecture. We had such a great time, thank you very much for such a great stay!!

reviews.title: A Wonderful time
reviews.review_text:
In a few words, Hotel was fantastic and the location on Russell Square was perfect for us. Period.

The room was spacious and all the equipment in the room was a very high-quality.

If I had to pick one thing that stood out for us was the service. It was truly superb. We have stayed in many hotels over the years and I can honestly say the service at the Kimpton was the best we’ve ever had. All the people serving us were excellent and two stood out in particular, Joseph and Haroon.

 Next time we visit London, we will stay at the Kimpton for sure. We can recommend it without any hesitation at all.

Travelodge London City Hotel.description:
Travelodge London City hotel is an excellent choice for travelers visiting London, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.
You’ll enjoy relaxing rooms that offer a flat screen TV, and you can stay connected during your stay as Travelodge London City hotel offers guests paid wifi.
Plus, Travelodge London City hotel offers an on-site restaurant, providing a pleasant respite from your busy day.
Nearby landmarks such as Covent Garden (2.1 mi) and Coca-Cola London Eye (2.1 mi) make Travelodge London City hotel a great place to stay when visiting London.
While in London, you may want to check out some of the restaurants that are a short walk away from Travelodge London City hotel, including Coppa Club - Tower Bridge (0.5 mi), Duck and Waffle (0.3 mi), and Aqua Shard (0.9 mi).
Looking to explore? Then look no further than Tower of London (0.5 mi), Sky Garden (0.5 mi), and The View from The Shard (0.9 mi), which are some popular London attractions – all conveniently located within walking distance of the hotel.
Enjoy your stay in London!

reviews.title: Always a warm welcome from Niv and Lachu
reviews.review_text:
I've been staying in London for 1 night a week in a number of different hotels/accommodation for almost 9 months and Travelodge London City has become my go-to choice.

It's the best balance I've found between value and comfort. The rooms are clean and spacious, especially compared to other budget hotels I've used. Beds are comfortable and I always have a quiet nights sleep here.

Back to the title of my review... I generally have a warm welcome from everyone on checking in but the stand out people are Niv and Lachu. Thanks for making my weekly stint of having to commute to the office a little more brighter and happier, it's much appreciated!

John G

reviews.title: Warm, welcoming stay
reviews.review_text:
Whenever I am in London whether business or leisure I  stay at Travelodge London City. It is always a comfortable stay.
Just want to say a big shout to  to the warm welcoming staff in reception and a great big thank you to Esrat for helping me out this evening. It is the small things that make guests want to return.

reviews.title: Great hotel, and good lokation
reviews.review_text:
Thanks to Beauv for the great service, we really enjoyed the stay at the hotel. Had some minor issues with the door and key which were quickly sorted out by the reception staff.
The hotel is located a 10 minute walk off Liverpool Street and is a brilliant choice ud you arrive from tx STN

reviews.title: Super god and nice service
reviews.review_text: the fantastic place, you quickly feel the warm and good service you get from Beau, he always has a smile on his face and is ready to help. 5 stars from here, not the first nor the last time I come here. thank you for another fantastic experience...

reviews.title: Hospitality and warmth
reviews.review_text: Today on the reception Taslima showed great hospitality and helped us to experience comfort and coziness. Thank you, Taslima for making our stay in London unforgettable! People like Taslima makes us choose the same place and Travelodge when we visit the city and country again!

Sunborn London.address: Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1AA England
Sunborn London.description: Sunborn London is located at the western end of the Royal Victoria Dock overlooking the Docklands, Canary Wharf O2 Arena, London City Airport, and the ExCel where one can enjoy the panoramic views of their private settings. Travelling on the DLR towards Beckton alighting from Custom House Excel DLR station, it is a 3-5 minute walk which is a short distance from the main entrance of the ExCel London. For a more scenic journey one can enjoy taking the Emirates Cable Car journey from the North Greenwich O2 Arena to the Royal Victoria Dock, where you can enjoy a walk along the pier t taking in what the local area has to offer whilst visiting Sunborn London.
Sunborn London.address_string: Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1AA England

reviews.title: Thank you so much. Our stay was amazing.
reviews.review_text:
Thank you so much. Our stay was amazing. 

I surprised my partner with a night stay on the Sunborn for her Birthday. We arrived early on the day, left our bags and went into the West End for some lunch. When we returned, the Assistant Meeting and Events Manager Amara Fouade was waiting for us. 

To our amazing surprise, he had upgraded our room to one of the executive suites for her Birthday. I cannot thank you enough, the experience was incredible, I've not stayed in a room like it before, especially on a boat. We were both over joyed and the whole evening and night stay was so special, followed by a lovely breakfast in the morning. Everything in the suite was of a very high standard, very clean and all working. I cannot pick a fault. 

Once again, thank you so much, we had the best stay and I would highly recommend to anyone that they stay on the Sunborn.

reviews.title: Incredible Stay
reviews.review_text: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for my birthday. My partner had booked the hotel and restaurant for dinner and it did not disappoint! The room itself was gorgeous, nice and spacious. The dinner was incredible and they had gone the extra mile to do some add on’s for my birthday. The staff were very friendly and approachable. Precious, who was working in the bar area that evening, was a particular stand out to us. She was very welcoming, and has a lovely character. We wanted to talk to her all night long! Precious is a great asset to the team. Thank you again, we will be back!

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing stay with amazing staff, comfy bed, excellent views and amazing food one person who really stood out was Bela and another lady who served us for dinner and breakfast nothing was too much trouble for them and bela was so approachable and professional

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.review_text:
What an amazing place to stay!  Highly recommend to anyone. Huge rooms, excellent customer service, food was brilliant, excellent location.

Couldn’t fault it.

Handy for DLR, cable cars, O2.

Whilst we were there we went to Greenwich, used the Thames clipper and cable car to get back to boat.

reviews.title: A Fabulous Stay
reviews.review_text:
An absolutely fabulous stay.  The yacht is beautiful, cabins are large and the beds are very comfortable.
The bar is lovely and nice cocktails.  Delicious cream tea too.
Only complaint is that for us tea drinkers he like a cup of tea in bed in the morning the really silly tiny cups for coffee are wholly inadequate.  Please put mugs in the rooms for tea.

Corinthia London.description: Welcome to Corinthia London, where history meets contemporary luxury. Our hotel’s walls hold tales of illustrious guests, from politicians to spies. With 279 rooms, including 55 suites and seven two-storey penthouses, we offer accommodations designed for your comfort. Enjoy exceptional dining at our renowned restaurants and relax at the award-winning ESPA Life spa. Our attentive staff is dedicated to providing outstanding service. Located near cultural treasures, Corinthia London is your sanctuary for creating unforgettable memories in the heart of the city.
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center
Photo Copier / Fax In Business Center

reviews.title: Dissapointing
reviews.review_text:
This time The Garden Restaurant was disappointing. 
The service was under pari for a five star hotel. The staff need more training and knowledge. In addition the food did not match the standard. 
I was here two years ago and then it was great. Noe the whole concept is shaking. 
Don’t waist your time and money here.

reviews.title: When everything falls into place it's just magical
reviews.review_text: We had such an enjoyable lunch.  Firstly the Hotel is in a location that would be hard to beat.  So central to all that London has to offer.  Yet the other side of the doors is a warm, calm and friendly atmosphere.  The staff are impeccable, very efficient, attentive but not too intrusive, friendly, polite and genuine.  Our visit coincided with the Christmas decorations being up, so much to admire.  We ate from the Christmas lunch set menu which was excellent.  Generous portions of well cooked food, beautifully presented with lots of flair.  With apologies to family this was the best Christmas lunch we had ever eaten.  Full marks!

reviews.title: Stunning hotel with incredible service.
reviews.review_text:
As my husband’s birthday gift I booked him on a Wine course which was held at the Corinthia hotel over a weekend. We decided to stay at the hotel for Saturday night and it was a fabulous experience. 
We booked dinner at the Tom Kerridge restaurant and had drinks later in the Velvet Room bar. The following day I experienced the amazing spa and had a facial. We also had breakfast in the North Hall and lunch in the Garden restaurant.  We really didn’t want to leave or go anywhere else. The service was outstanding throughout the hotel. The staff are knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. In particular we would like to mention Marco de Simone who welcomed us and made us feel like VIPs!! 
We will definitely be returning and have already booked lunch in the North Hall with our family in December.

reviews.title: Five star Christmas afternoon tea
reviews.review_text:
From the moment we entered the Corinthia the warmth from the amazing staff and ambience exceeded every expectation.  

So good I am going back again in a couple of weeks.

The sandwiches and cakes were superbly fresh and the scones divine.

Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Excellent in every way
reviews.review_text:
From arrival to departure a few days later this was yet again a unique experience, for all the right reasons. We have enjoyed many hotels throughout Europe, and even the best in Monte Carlo, and Italy recently do not quite compete with the Corinthia in terms of location, service, comfort, dining, friendliness and helpfulness in literally every department. 
We will not hesitate to recommend it and return at first opportunity.

London Eye.address: Westminster Bridge Road Riverside Building, County Hall, London SE1 7PB England
London Eye.description: Located along the Thames River, this iconic observation wheel offers unobstructed views from its glass pods. During the 30-minute ride, you'll be able to see London's well-known buildings like Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, and The Shard. On a clear day, you can see up to 25 miles from the top—where Windsor Castle is. Sunset views here are otherworldly, but nightfall views of the twinkling lights are great too. London Eye can be reached easily by taking the Tube to Waterloo station. You might want to buy fast-track passes online in advance to skip the queues. – Tripadvisor
London Eye.address_string: Westminster Bridge Road Riverside Building, County Hall, London SE1 7PB England

Tower of London.description: The Tower of London is a 1,000 year old castle that protects the Crown Jewels. Throughout its long history, it was a secure fortress, a royal palace, and an infamous prison. Kings and queens demonstrated their power from here, shaping society and influencing our world. Today within the walls of this mighty fortress you can see the spectacular displays of the Jewel House, the Tower’s Mint and the Royal Armouries (including the armours of Henry VIII). Meet the Yeoman Warders, who have guarded this castle for centuries, and the Tower’s symbolic guardians – the Ravens.

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.review_text:
I'd have to say this was one of my least favorite of the attractions I went to.  

For people who have never been to London I'd say its a take it or leave it attraction.  While very impressive from the outside there is not a terrible amount to see or do on the inside.  Definitely not worth the cost of entry.

Despite having a timed ticket for later in the day, they were quite flexible on entering earlier.

I spent maybe 2 hours there.  There were neat things like the Tower Crows, the graffiti from the prisoners, the armor and coin machines.  The crown jewels were kind of eh as compared to the French crown jewels.

This is more worth a stop at as an add on to other things in the area .

- Food: There are fantastic and reasonably priced Fish and Chips stands right outside, next to the on site box office.
- The London Wall is right near the entry/exit of the subway station
-  Tower Bridge - quick and easy walk to and across from the Tower

Other easy walking distance attractions:
- The Clink Prison Museum
- Jack the Ripper Museum
- The Borough
- All Hallows by the Tower
- St Dunstan in the East Church Garden
- Church of Saint Magnus the Martyr

London Underground.description: London Underground, better known as the Tube, has 11 lines covering 402km and serving 270 stations. Opened in 1863, it is the world's oldest underground railway network, and one of the largest.

reviews.title: Picadilly Line Worst TFL line.
reviews.review_text:
Picadilly Line
Worst line of TFL, i used this everg single day as commute for 20 years. I wanna start with people who does not have problem with the line is using from central london zone 1 area or from hounslow/heathrow side but i unfortunately use it from Rayners Lane/Uxbridge side. For commute to work i only take this from Sudbury Hill to rayners lane and it takes me more than 10 mins for the 2 stops because of the red lights or whatever reason. I get cofused sometimes that i went pass these 2 stops but have not even reach the first stop. You have to wait 10 minutes each time for the train to arrive and when they do come the next on is after 2 minutes, it is ridicuolous. You waited kong enough for 10 mins then next one is arriving in 2 minutes so basically everyone jumps into the first train the 2 mins later train will be empty with less passengers. And ofcourse if you miss that then good luck waiting for another 10 minutes again.
I have use Metro line for a couple years as i moved out from my family home and they are proper good, i mean you do faces like this but very rarely. Picadilly line are only good for the heathrow side because they give priority for the airport so for example from acton town most picadilly lines you will get is for Heathrow not Uxbridge/Rayners Lane. And ofcourse travelling around zone 1 in picadilly lines is not an issue because multiple trains from all side feeds into central area.
Just fyi, you can get refunds for delays from tfl website but you cannot get the time back unfortunately. Who likes to run late to work due to delays right?

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.review_text:
Always felt safe and was easy to find our way around, we only got on the wrong train twice.
The staff was always ready to help.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: I spent the day in London, visiting the st Paul's COVID memorial. I was a little worried about the tubes , but I needn't of been, the staff were so helpful, I travelled from Euston to Oxford Circus to st Paul's and back. The staff helped me every step of the way , telling me platforms how to tap and go. The tube stations were clean and tidy. There was not one negative. Thankyou for making my day lovely

reviews.title: London Underground travel
reviews.review_text:
Helpful staff along the way either at the stations or nearby
Some trains can get busy at times although most of them are frequent

reviews.title: Good service
reviews.review_text: The more I travel here from Lincoln the more I get to understand how the tube stops and lines work..Don't have to bother with an oyster card just tap a debit card..checked my bank account and the price is reasonable..trains are clean and OK to hop on and off.

The London Dungeon.address: Westminster Bridge Road County Hall, London SE1 7PB England
The London Dungeon.description: The London Dungeon, one of the UK’s most iconic attractions, has reinvented itself now as a bigger, bolder and better attraction in the vast underground vaults of County Hall on the South Bank, next to the EDF Energy London Eye. The all new multi-million pound attraction will bring 1000 years of authentic London history to life with a unique mix of talented live actors performing in scarily funny shows, stunning special effects, edge of your seat surprises and two exciting thrill rides. Guests will embark on a journey through a dramatic London landscape going back ten centuries. They will be guided through ghastly plague-ridden streets, witness Guy Fawkes’ dramatic plot to blow up Parliament, travel back to Jack the Ripper’s bleak Whitechapel and walk beneath London’s foreboding medieval gates. There are new shows and rides which are more dramatic and surprising than ever, new funnier scripts, more theatrical costumes and styling and more talented actors to play even more colourful villains and blaggards.
The London Dungeon.address_string: Westminster Bridge Road County Hall, London SE1 7PB England

London Zoo.address: Outer Circle The Regent's Park, London NW1 4RY England
London Zoo.description: London Zoo is packed full of wonder and amazement, with over 650 species of animals to meet and thousands more surprising and fascinating facts just waiting to be discovered. Find yourself face-to-face with our Asiatic lions and our friendly giraffes whilst they enjoy a spot of lunch. Wander through our Madagascan shrub forest and see how many of our ring-tailed lemurs you can spot before heading down to Tiny Giants to quiz our insect experts on the importance of insects to our ecosystem. Then, if you're feeling brave, you can get up close and personal and take a Spider Selfie with our resident arachnids in Europe’s only walk-through spider experience. Not to mention firm favourites Gorilla Kingdom, Penguin Beach and Tiger Territory. This is a place where fun days help us fund raise. Where your visit will help support our conservation work in over 50 countries around the world. Where really great days out can make a really positive difference to the wildlife we work to protect.
London Zoo.address_string: Outer Circle The Regent's Park, London NW1 4RY England

reviews.title: Enjoyable
reviews.review_text: We entered early so the monkey house was empty of other visitors except for a keeper as these 4 types of mammal were free to roam which was unusual but great to see them very close up.  Other highlights included the family of asiatic lions, camels and otters.

reviews.title: Sort out case storage
reviews.review_text: They need to keep up with tourist needs. To advertise case storage then have less than ten must really mess up plans. draging case around is no joke. Alter your text on web or install more like other zoos have dome. £10 for over 2 hour is twice the rate in London museums

Liberty London.address: Regent St Main entrance, Great Marlborough Street, London W1B 5AH England
Liberty London.description: The Tudor-inspired exterior of this upscale department store is a treasure. Inside, find curated designer fashions, homewares, fragrances, and the iconic floral prints for which it is famed.
Liberty London.address_string: Regent St Main entrance, Great Marlborough Street, London W1B 5AH England

reviews.title: Christmas decoration
reviews.review_text: Love this store have been 5 times leading up to Christmas,  love the Christmas decoration on the top floor,  restaurant experience but nice

reviews.title: Has Liberty lost its lustre
reviews.review_text: On a Christmas walkabout with my friend … we walked into liberty excited and full of anticipation for a bit of Christmas cheer …. But oh dear … how disappointed were we . Overall the shop had lost its world renowned lustre and in its place was v poor decorations especially the Christmas trees throughout .. some goods were of poor quality , very expensive and lots of dead space . Being greeted by the wizard in the main hallway was neither Christmassy nor joyful .. who is buying for Liberty these days ?? Mr Liberty no business is untouchable in these uncertain times .. v disappointing

reviews.title: Are you really the pinnacle of customer service? Because this experience doesn't reflect it.
reviews.review_text: Been here many many times. Beautiful shop.  BUT I now live in Sussex and have had to phone Customer Services about a problem. You can't speak to a person in the store.. you have to speak to someone in SOUTH AFRICA? Sorry what?? I just want someone to nip down to the shop floor, but no - they are 9000 miles away!! . I expected a lot more from a place known for its high standards and iconic reputation.

reviews.title: Give me Liberty…
reviews.review_text: The Tudor Revival façade and font of the logo are unmistakable, as are the floral prints for which Liberty is renown.  It is a luxury department store, to be sure—but one nevertheless is startled by the high prices (£400 scarves). Belying  the Arts and Crafts interior, traditional UK labels such as Barbour and Pringle are not to be found. In their place are sparse islands of designer clothes, all securely fastened to their racks. The contrast is disconcerting: hewn beams and expensive brands.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.review_text:
This is another beautiful building and it self Heritage 
They have lot of nice things to get to buy and prize were not mega expensive… I love building …

Westfield London.description: Unlike its Stratford branch, the original Westfield has a special wing, The Village, devoted to 30+ luxury brands like Louis Vuitton and Prada, plus the usual mall staples, restaurants, and a cinema.

reviews.title: Missed a staff member from previous review.
reviews.review_text: Wrote a review yesterday Monday 28th October I forgot to  mention manager Daniel. He is recent to this venue and is worth a good write up as he is very polite, efficient and very good with the staff {from an observasion point of view.}.          Many thanks.         Terry Burrows  .

reviews.title: Stay clear of driving to Westfields
reviews.review_text: Have been in the car park for 1 and half hours total grid lock and still no sign of any cars moving great shopping centre but very bad experience at the end of the day

reviews.title: It has the feel of an attraction that has lost its shine and certainly needs to be reimagined.
reviews.review_text: Located ten minutes from Shepherds Bush Station. This shopping centre attracts a young crowd. Before entering there is a row of restaurants. The inside is very busy on weekends. It has two floors with most shops that tend to be overcrowded. There are busy seating areas. Many shops are empty and the staff inside look sad. Unless you are looking for something specific you can window shop in thirty minutes. It has the feel of an attraction that has lost its shine and certainly needs to be reimagined.

reviews.title: Big
reviews.review_text: Westfield Shopping Centre is an amazing place for a shopping spree. With a range of anything from clothes to phones to cafés. If you're a West ham fan then you can visit the stadium as it's right beside it.

reviews.title: Lovely Family Day Out
reviews.review_text: Lovely family day out, lots to see and so much to choose from for lunch. Will be back for Christmas shopping. Great selection of stores all under one roof.

reviews.title: Important Landmark
reviews.review_text: London Bridge may not be the prettiest but its rich history makes it a fascinating place to be. Standing where London began, on the fourth incarnation of the bridge after the Great Fire and the Blitz, adds a sense of significance. We walked over it from Borough Market to the Tower of London, and it was a great experience.

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.review_text: We were in the area and had a walk along here. It was quiet when we went across which the bridge is ok and the views are ok of the surrounding area. It can get busy which can make it difficult to cross over

reviews.title: Very busy
reviews.review_text:
We walked along London Bridge on a Sunday afternoon, it was a really hot day and the bridge was packed full of people.
You can see Tower bridge and there is a lovely view across the Thames. You can get an Uber boat or stop for a drink or bite to eat.

reviews.title: Just a bridge
reviews.review_text: Just a bridge.  Wasn't as fun as Millennium or London Bridge but we walked it as part of our Tourist activities.  I would recommend to skip it.

reviews.title: Bridge is a link to England's largest city
reviews.review_text: We took the Hayes Line train from London Bridge to Lewisham every evening. Lewisham is regarded as being a large suburb of London. The line goes to Hayes, in Kent. The trip to Lewisham is taken quickly approaching this large village; Lewisham has some notable pubs. Lewisham's NHS -- National Health Service -- is nearby. The NHS hospital is known as a large public service hospital. London Bridge is a quick connection to London, England's largest city, it's easy to find.

London's Farmers Market.address: 900 King Street, London, Ontario N5Y 5P8 Canada
London's Farmers Market.description: Open every Saturday 8:00am - 3:00pm and Sunday 10:00am - 2:00pm, year round. The Market at Western Fair District is located at 900 King St. in the Confederation Building, featuring two floors of high-quality, farm fresh goods and unique products. Enjoy a selection of produce, meats, prepared foods, baked goods, apparel, jewellery and much more! So bring your friends and family and enjoy the Market experience. We promise you won’t go home empty handed! 2018 Winner of “Best of London - Best Flea/Farmers Market” No pets allowed, only service animals.
London's Farmers Market.address_string: 900 King Street, London, Ontario N5Y 5P8 Canada

reviews.title: Very impressed
reviews.review_text:
Excellent  products bought baked goodies as well as meats fair prices for sizes
Went Sunday morning young guitar player at front entrance was very impressive new Justin Bieber
Even though I am from out of town will be back

reviews.title: Fresh, friendly, local
reviews.review_text:
This is definitely a smaller farmers market vs those in cities like Toronto or Ottawa. 
The market building is two floors with most of the food on the main floor and housewares and crafts people upstairs There is a nice selection of products available; produce, bakeries, meat, cheese, gluten free bakery, cooked food stands, rugs, furniture, jewelry, beauty products etc. 
it takes 1-2 hours to walk around and see all the stalls and figure out what you want. Advise taking a reusable shopping bag.
There is a lovely bakery cafe (the Artisan Bakery) just down the road from the market that had gorgeous breads & pastry, was worth a visit

reviews.title: Not Covid Safe
reviews.review_text: Usually, the London Farmer’s Market is a great place to visit on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon. However, it was absolutely packed and did not seem to follow Covid protocols at all. There did not seem to be any arrows on the floor to direct the flow of traffic, and there seemed to be way too many people for the size of the building. There were people counting the number of people in and out, but the limit seemed to be excessive. The individual booths, however, were doing there best to limit people in and out of their area and maintain social distancing. Overall, the limit should definitely be lowered because myself and the others I visited with were very uncomfortable with the number of people inside.

reviews.title: Great Farmer's Market
reviews.review_text: Nice variety of food to choose from. We had the ice cream, which was fabulous. It is mostly food, some plants, not many crafts.

reviews.title: London's farmers' market
reviews.review_text:
Yesterday, we visited Covent Market, so today we went to London' Farmers Market and Trails End market. LFM was a huge disappointment. Where are the farmers? It was 2pm on Saturday of a long weekend in the summer and no negotiating on prices? What will happen to the produce if left unsold? A gentleman was selling balsamic vinegar and had no bread for tasting. Furtermore, it was sold as Tuscan product from Modena (a lesson in geography would help). 
Anyway, if you want grocery store products sold at individual stalls, this is your place. I would rather go to Farmboy or Remark Farms.

London Walks.description: London's unrivalled, award-winning, signature walking tour company. "London's best guided walks" Time Out "the premier walking tour company in the entire world" American Tour Guides convention

reviews.title: Brilliant.
reviews.review_text: Excellent facts and stories . 4 children and 4 adults thoroughly enjoyed it . We did the disastrous london walk and went to st Bartholomew church and many other places. Will go on more walks with this company! The guide (Citlalli) was so brilliant and lovely to listen to. Thank you.

reviews.title: History with a side of prejudice
reviews.review_text:
Very informative, especially for those interested in history. I would book another tour with them, but only with a different guide.

‼️Our guide, Simon, was engaging and knowledgeable, however, he came across as very condescending and made quite a few racist comments.

Perhaps the team could address this and Simon could educate himself on topics such as Inclusivity, Stereotypes and Unconscious Bias.

reviews.title: Great tours
reviews.review_text: Took two London Walks, one on royal scandals and one at the National Gallery. Both were two hours long and I wish we had been able to take more of their tours. The tours were informative and it was fun interacting with the other attendees. It's a great way to pick up information that you won't get from a book or a display on a wall. It's also a great value.

reviews.title: David is a walking ad for why you should definitely book a walking tour!
reviews.review_text: Had the great pleasure of David P’s Dickens walk. He is a skilled and informative guide painting a varied and interesting picture of Dickens’s London, his life and work as a writer while taking us off the beaten track to see behind the scenes. I don’t understand why more people don’t take walking tours to get the back story on the places they visit and a tour with David is testament to why you absolutely should!

reviews.title: Great way to learn about Hampstead Village
reviews.review_text:
I've been taking walking tours with this company for 20 years; as with any guided walk, the leader is critical and sometimes you get ones that are better (or more in sync with you) than others but they are all knowledgeable.  I think their walks are a great way to learn about specific neighborhoods or themes (e.g. the Blitz, Marylebone, etc).

I took a Hampstead Village walk with Richard III (there are 5 Richards who are leaders) which was great.  I particularly enjoyed it because we did a fair amount of walking, versus standing in one spot for 20 minutes while the leader talks.  It's an area that would probably be difficult to do on your own since you wouldn't know what streets to walk down, where to turn or what you're looking at.  He had a wealth of background information about the history and inhabitants which helped paint a picture of the area through the ages.  He didn't seem to appreciate questions - I guess because sometimes they interrupted his flow but it was a great walk.  At the end, he offered suggestions for places to eat and transportation options.

London.description: You’ll see double-decker buses and even the River Thames, but while London, Ontario, has clearly been inspired by its British namesake, this is a distinctly Canadian destination. Attractions like Fanshawe Pioneer Village, Banting House and Eldon House will captivate history buffs. Or indulge your, shall we say, slightly less cerebral side with a tour of the Labatt Brewery.

reviews.title: Very bad the south location in London
reviews.review_text:
The worst place to eat, 
Very bad food special the chicken. Not enough employees the manager he looks like lost !!!
Bad food.
Bad service.
Not enough people to work.
Location is the south London

reviews.title: Good food, good staff, good times
reviews.review_text:
This was our first time at this location. Four of us met for lunch. 
We were told to sit anywhere we wanted. We chose a window booth. It was a little chilly so my advice is to not sit near a window. That was our choice, not against the restaurant at all.
Two of us had fish and chips and 2 of us had chicken wings. The food was hot and we didn't have to wait to long. The meal was good and our server makes delicious Caesars!! The guys liked their beer as always.
Looking forward to going back.

reviews.title: Disappointed with reservation delivery
reviews.review_text: Booked a 2 bed room, confirmed later check in time and when we arrived all they had was a 1 bed room for the 3 of us.  We did receive a 'free' cot.  We were beside a noisy ice machine and across from a very loud group of teenage boy hockey players who kept us up most of the night.  Very disappointed with our service.  The dining room staff were exceptional.

reviews.title: 100% recommendations
reviews.review_text:
Visit this place for the first time, and it was so tasty. Enjoying all the food, and drinks.
The atmosphere was great.
Definitely would recommend this place.

reviews.title: Another Amazing Stay! Thanks Cindy!
reviews.review_text: Amazing stay as ALWAYS! We're repeat customers as we always have the greatest stays! Beds are comfy! Rooms are clean and fresh! Food is exceptional! Staff always go above and beyond! Cindy is by far the greatest Delta employee. Remembers your name, always personable and easy to chat with! She's a gem!

London Eye.address: Westminster Bridge Road Riverside Building, County Hall, London SE1 7PB England
London Eye.description: Located along the Thames River, this iconic observation wheel offers unobstructed views from its glass pods. During the 30-minute ride, you'll be able to see London's well-known buildings like Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, and The Shard. On a clear day, you can see up to 25 miles from the top—where Windsor Castle is. Sunset views here are otherworldly, but nightfall views of the twinkling lights are great too. London Eye can be reached easily by taking the Tube to Waterloo station. You might want to buy fast-track passes online in advance to skip the queues. – Tripadvisor
London Eye.address_string: Westminster Bridge Road Riverside Building, County Hall, London SE1 7PB England

reviews.title: One of must do thing in London
reviews.review_text: One of my most fav things in London. Worth to have an experience of Londoneye ride. Incredible London city views from the top specially at sunset time.

reviews.title: One of must do thing in London
reviews.review_text: One of my most fav things in London. Worth to have an experience of Londoneye ride. Incredible London city views from the top specially at sunset time.

Tower of London.description: The Tower of London is a 1,000 year old castle that protects the Crown Jewels. Throughout its long history, it was a secure fortress, a royal palace, and an infamous prison. Kings and queens demonstrated their power from here, shaping society and influencing our world. Today within the walls of this mighty fortress you can see the spectacular displays of the Jewel House, the Tower’s Mint and the Royal Armouries (including the armours of Henry VIII). Meet the Yeoman Warders, who have guarded this castle for centuries, and the Tower’s symbolic guardians – the Ravens.

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.review_text:
I'd have to say this was one of my least favorite of the attractions I went to.  

For people who have never been to London I'd say its a take it or leave it attraction.  While very impressive from the outside there is not a terrible amount to see or do on the inside.  Definitely not worth the cost of entry.

Despite having a timed ticket for later in the day, they were quite flexible on entering earlier.

I spent maybe 2 hours there.  There were neat things like the Tower Crows, the graffiti from the prisoners, the armor and coin machines.  The crown jewels were kind of eh as compared to the French crown jewels.

This is more worth a stop at as an add on to other things in the area .

- Food: There are fantastic and reasonably priced Fish and Chips stands right outside, next to the on site box office.
- The London Wall is right near the entry/exit of the subway station
-  Tower Bridge - quick and easy walk to and across from the Tower

Other easy walking distance attractions:
- The Clink Prison Museum
- Jack the Ripper Museum
- The Borough
- All Hallows by the Tower
- St Dunstan in the East Church Garden
- Church of Saint Magnus the Martyr

Rosewood London.description: Rosewood London combines English heritage with contemporary sophistication in the very heart of the capital. The Grade II-listed, building has been renovated to provide accommodation with the feel of a stylish London residence. The guestrooms and suites are inspired by a traditional British manor house. The restaurants and bars are destinations in their own right. Recreational facilities include the Sense, A Rosewood Spa, Rosewood's signature spa brand, and a well-equipped fitness suite.

reviews.title: ROSEWOOD? DEADWOOD.
reviews.review_text: Is this the worst hotel in London? Terrible check in, left waiting in reception as room wasn’t ready. Nobody got us so we waited 15 mins and spent a further 10 minutes queuing to find out room was in fact ready. This after we emailed ahead to make sure room would be ready at 3pm sharp. Room service included a tragic miniature £14 ham and cheese toastie that looked like it was stolen from little Johnny’s lunchbox. What is going on at this 5 star hotel? Even the premier inn would be ashamed. Then there was interminable buzzing in the room every 5/10 mins so difficulty sleeping. Gritty oysters was a first at a restaurant where I swear some of the staff looked like they wanted to taser the guests. Not friendly. Breakfast was another shambles passed from empty uncleared restaurant to another. Only saving grace was Scarfs Bar where you needed a drink after all the above. Rosewood? More Deadwood. Avoid.

reviews.title: Wedding @ Rosewood
reviews.review_text:
We attended a wedding @ Rosewood 
The ballroom was stylish and looked fabulous for the wedding.
Food looked impressive but not 5 * which is disappointing as the premises were 5* plus .
Beautiful wedding ❤️
The staff were helpful but unfortunately you had to use stairs to get to the ballroom which made it difficult for me as I had a knee operation 8 weeks before .
The dessert table was awesome ❤️❤️

reviews.title: Great Afternoon Tea
reviews.review_text:
We have had an excellent afternoon tea here. The menu was extraordinary and the staff was very attentive and super friendly. The atmosphere was very nice, professional and quiet, just as we like it.
Just one remark for the GM: some of the sofas were not just worn out but are in dire need of a refresh.

reviews.title: Incredible service!!!!
reviews.review_text: We love this hotel and the staff already but when I suffered a medical emergency the other day, they took things to the next level. Filippo, Gabriella and Bruno and the whole team could not have been kinder and more accommodating. As soon as it happened, they rushed upstairs, made sure I got to the hospital quickly and I came back to a spotless room with a huge bouquet of flowers. Everyone was so helpful and understanding and I felt so safe. They will have our loyalty forever.

reviews.title: Sanctuary of Serenity and Style
reviews.review_text: This hotel understands the art of hospitality. The lobby's ambient music and subtle fragrance created an immediate sense of calm. The beds were cloud-like, and the soundproofing was exceptional - I've never slept better in a hotel. The spa services were top-notch, and the indoor pool area felt like a private paradise. Every staff member seemed genuinely happy to be there,

Park Grand London Kensington.description: Finding an ideal charming hotel in London does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Park Grand London Kensington, a nice option for travelers like you. Free Wi-Fi is offered to guests, and rooms at Park Grand Kensington offer a flat screen TV, a minibar, and air conditioning. During your stay, take advantage of some of the amenities offered, including a 24 hour front desk, a concierge, and room service. Guests of Park Grand Kensington are also welcome to enjoy a fitness center and breakfast, located on site. For those interested in checking out popular landmarks while visiting London, Park Grand Kensington Hotel is located a short distance from Harrods (1.3 mi) and Buckingham Palace (2.2 mi). During your visit, be sure to check out one of London's popular schnitzel restaurants such as The Wolseley, Oslo Court, and Granger & Co, all a short distance from Park Grand London Kensington. If you’re looking for something to do, Natural History Museum (0.7 mi), V&A - Victoria and Albert Museum (0.9 mi), and Science Museum (0.7 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Shaftesbury Kensington. Park Grand London Kensington puts the best of London at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

reviews.title: Good hotel!
reviews.review_text: Decent stay and a nice breakfast. Staff are friendly and helpful, am Bonvoy Silver and requested a 2pm checkout for my 2 night stay which was granted with no fuss. Comfortable room although basement room I was given was a bit dark and a -slightly- musty smell, TV a bit dated. Great location near Earls Court tube! -plenty of pubs/restaurants/shops nearby- and price was competitive. Am staying again in December.

reviews.title: Very bad stay
reviews.review_text:
I stayed two nights in the Kensington Grand Park Hotel and it was my worst experience with any Marriott Hotel ever. I had booked two months in advance. On checkin I did not get an a room upgrade as a Bonvoy member - which is ok as its subject to availability. But instead I was downgraded. I was put into a basement room, under the restaurant kitchen with a window to a a dirty light shaft. While the room itself was clean, the whole area in the basement was damp, smelly and the hallway dirty. WiFi did not work in my room and as it was in the basement, there was no cellular reception either. Whenever the kitchen flushed warter, it sounded like it was coming down into my room. Also, there are no power outlets anywhere near the bed to charge a phone. 
I would have loved to show the manager on duty the room and try him to explain what the „superior room“ features were. But the Management was not on duty when I arrived in the evening, not when I left the next morning, not when I came back the next evening and not on the morning of checkout. The receptionists apologized but could only put me in a better room the next day.
I arrived and checked in at the Hotel around 8pm on 2024-09-16. My reservation was done and confirmed 2024-07-24, so nearly 2 months before. With a reservation roughly two months in advance and bonvoy gold status, I really expect more than the worst and least room in the hotel.
On checkout, I again stated I wanted to speak to management, but they were unavailable.I insisted, that I am not willing to pay full price (507 GBP = 614 Euro) for this, but the front desk said they could do nothing about it as the amount was already charged on the credit card upon arrival. I was also not given a printed receipt/invoice for the stay, which I need for my bookkeeping/tax office, as the front desk said their system was not working at that time. They promised to send the receipt via email. They also promised that Management would follow up with me via email. Neither happened. Nothing.
My email address is very well on file with the hotel, as the booking was from the Mariott Website, logged in to bonvoy which has all the required info. They also read out my correct email out to me during checkin, so it is very well in their system.
Not providing a receipt, not following up on the stay and complaints leaves a VERY bad taste.Please get in touch with me to discuss how to resolve this situation.

reviews.title: Avoid if the basement rooms are the only ones available.
reviews.review_text:
I recently stayed at this hotel while traveling with a tour group.  The trip was broken into two separate stays at the beginning and end of the trip. 

The first 3 nights, I had a room in the basement.  Let's just say avoid this area at all costs. Getting to the room was a chore, as the elevator didn't go there, and there were several flights of stairs and multiple fire doors. The room and hallways stink of mold and mildew. The room was kept clean, but everything was just shabby. 

I got a room on the 5th floor on the tail end. This room was much better,  but the bathroom was showing signs of mold. 

The attached restaurant is separate,  so charging to the room is not an option.  The food and service were very good. 

The only saving grace for the hotel was that the staff were very friendly.

reviews.title: Do not stay here!
reviews.review_text: This hotel needs to understand the term service.  The room was OK, the location OK but the level of service for a hotel attracting this price was abysmal -  I arrived to a receptionist who tried 3 times to allocate me to a room in the basement with no windows.  I eventually was given a room on the first floor - the amenities in the room were no better than a motel with an empty fridge set to minimum temperature so pretty useless, cheap coffee n tea and no water.  I called the ' so called room service' for water and was told 'we don't provide water you will have to call the restaurant.'  I did and was presented with a luke warm bottle of water I had to pay for at my room door as the restaurant is a separate business!  I then discovered the Wi-Fi did not work as too many users on it at the same time the response to this was to send the receptionist to my room who had no knowledge of how to get it started and could only suggest I move rooms.  At this point I only had 45 mins left to get ready to go out.  I then got a call from front desk asking if I would meet with the Duty Manager, which I agreed to do if I had time, which I didn't, as he arrived in reception as my driver turned up.  Could it get any worse - oh YES.  On my return to the hotel I asked the front desk to order me a cab for the morning.  At 1.30am they decided to call the room to tell me Uber was not answering the phone and I would have to call the front desk again in the morning.  I slept well (only saving grace) then repeated my cab request to the morning staff who sorted it, but does it end there oh NO.  The Mini cab driver, did not know London, needed to rely on satnav and when got to my destination he struggled to find anywhere to pull over so took me on a 15-minute circuit of Euston whilst on the phone to a courier who was trying to deliver something to his house.  I eventually got out of the car, a 15-minute walk away from my desired location.  To say this was an uncomfortable journey, after a very poor overnight stay is an understatement.  Def NOT recommend.

reviews.title: Tired, damp and disappointing
reviews.review_text:
A disappointing Marriott experience. I was in a basement room, the room and corridor smelt very damp, carpet was stained, tired, shabby,
Old furniture
I would not stay here again  and would not recommend it to others. 
It was a Very poor experience, Marriott should know better

DoubleTree By Hilton London Tower Of Lon.description: At DoubleTree by Hilton, we know that the little things mean everything. These days, travel can be hard. At DoubleTree by Hilton we understand that, and every little thing we do adds up to creating a rewarding experience for our guests. This is evidenced through the signature warm chocolate chip cookies guests receive upon arrival, the advantages of the award-winning Hilton HHonors(R) guest reward program and our industry-recognized Culture of CARE that's been part of our DNA since 1985.

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.review_text:
Stayed here several times. Great location for ease of getting around either by walking as the Thames Path is only 2 mins away, by Train with Tower under ground being just around the corner and by Boat from the Tower of London pier. Hotel has a roof top bar which we did not use this time but have in the past with great views.

Staff are always friendly and welcoming and I would particularly like to thank Aridub who today went above and beyond to help resolve a query with our exit bill. Such a gentlemen who took time to sort out an error making sure it was corrected before we left.

reviews.title: Okay hotel in a great location!
reviews.review_text:
Stayed for three nights with my family; we had two rooms to accommodate the four of us.  It was an okay experience, but definitely not as good as the Hilton we had come from in a different city. 

 From the start, the customer service was lacking.  Upon arriving, the rotating front door got stuck and the staff member that assisted us acted as if we were ruining his day.  He was definitely annoyed.  That door got stuck on and off our entire stay, not just with us, but for other customers as well.  

At check in, the woman that assisted us was very nice but did not even consider our request for an early check in (we were only a couple hours early) and instead had us drop off our luggage.  The man that we left our luggage with was very annoyed and not very helpful.  We had a lot of luggage (five suitcases), but there was four of us and we had two rooms, so it was expected.  

When we did finally get to our rooms, the carpets were very outdated and dirty.   The hallway to our rooms made us feel like we were staying at a 1 star hotel.  The carpet outside the elevators had big stains on it.  It definitely needs replacing.  Other reviews mentioned updates; the updates clearly haven't made it to the third floor yet.  Also, the shower doors were very hard to get completely closed, causing water to get on the floor. A little updating will fix this problem.  The hotel was clean otherwise.  

As gold members, we had free breakfast every morning.  No perks or upgrades for gold other than breakfast.  However, the breakfast was very good.  They saved all their good staff members for that because everyone there was very nice and helpful.  The breakfast was also very good!

Overall, the hotel was sufficient for what we needed but definitely needs updating.  The location is good.  It is right next to the tube and Tower of London.  

Also, make sure to not touch the laundry bag in the room.  We were going to get some laundry done but ended up not having enough time because we had to leave a day early.  The bag was wrinkled (it was a paper bag) because we had put the laundry in it, so we did not hang it back up.  It was in the room, but not back on the hanger.  They charged us 10 pounds for the paper laundry bag!  There should be a sign on the closet door stating that - we would have re-hung the wrinkled bag!  

Overall, we would probably not stay there again with the many other choices available, but it was okay.  When all of the updates are completed, it will probably be much better.

reviews.title: Friendly Service
reviews.review_text: Sangare is an incredibly friendly and attentive staff member who went above and beyond to ensure we had a great experience at the hotel. He took the time to guide us through the breakfast buffet and made sure we had everything we needed. His excellent service truly enhanced our stay. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Another excellent hotel stay
reviews.review_text: Excellent staff here at this hotel who look after you perfectly. Special mention to Kurian, Sai, Susannah, Lee, Rishi, Uri, Rachid who always make us feel special and go the extra mile to make your stay awesome. They all work so hard and are always smiling. Lindsey & Anne-Marie 1043! We will be back!! Always stay at this hotel for the reasons listed above and always will.

reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin :-)
reviews.review_text: Delivers exactly as expected. We chose the hotel principally for its location as we had dinner in the area, followed by brunch the next day. We wanted a functional but clean, trusted hotel without having to pay through the nose and the Hilton name tends to do just that. We got it right I am happy to say. We aren't tourists but, if you are, the location is perfect for The Tower Of London, Tower Bridge and all things in that area of London. The room was clean, comfy and the staff were welcoming, efficient and helpful. If you fancy a tipple, the bar is fab with great views over the Tower and the Thames. Heartily recommended.

Royal Lancaster London.description: As one of the few remaining independently owned hotels in the capital, Royal Lancaster London stands proudly on the border of Hyde Park, offering breathtaking views of the famous London skyline. All 411 beautiful guestrooms have been impeccably designed to combine timeless style and comfort, ensuring every stay in London is truly unforgettable, whether you’re looking for a romantic weekend away or exploring the capital together as a family. Did we mention that kids under 12 get breakfast on us?! Guests can enjoy a selection of restaurants and bars onsite including the brand new Blooming British Afternoon Tea in collaboration with the Natural History Museum and the award-winning Nipa Thai, serving the most authentic Thai food outside of Bangkok. Superbly located in the heart of London, the hotel is adjacent to Lancaster Gate Underground Station and a 10 minute walk away from Paddington Station, offering easy access to Heathrow Airport in just 15 minutes.

reviews.title: Incredible Stay
reviews.review_text:
Once again an incredible stay. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The star rating in this hotel truly reflects its rating unlike some 5 stars.

The breakfast is probably one of the best out there.

Definitely worth a stay when visiting london for a rememberable trip. 

Couldn’t recommend it enough.

reviews.title: Memorable stay at the Royal Lancaster
reviews.review_text:
We had such a wonderful stay at the Royal Lancaster for our birthday weekend. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel really special.

Our room was  lovely with incredible views over London and Hyde Park, there were even thoughtful gifts waiting for us, which was such a nice touch. Throughout our stay, everyone we met was so polite, friendly, and professional. A lot of the team even wished us a happy birthday, which made the experience feel really personal.

As parents, this was a rare child-free getaway, and it turned out to be one of the most relaxing and enjoyable breaks we’ve had in ages. The attention to detail the hotel has and the effort from the team didn’t go unnoticed—we felt so well looked after.

Thank you to everyone at the Royal Lancaster for making our weekend so memorable. We’re already looking forward to our next stay!

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.review_text: The service in The Hyde Cafe was excellent. Trina paid attention to our needs and made sure we were comfortable. Jules, Daniela and Tiana all helped in making our experience great. We were not rushed and enjoyed our time. Thank you so much!!!

reviews.title: One of the best afternoon Teas I’ve ever had
reviews.review_text: Wonderful afternoon  the at The Hyde Cafe with the best team to welcome you: thank you to Trina, Jules, Daniela and Tiana for the amazing care they gave us during our time, I would definitely recommend and will definitely come back… we felt really comfortable !

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
reviews.review_text:
Disappointed with the overall experience so far. Pre arrival was great, had great expectations but on arrival we found out that all communication up front was useless… we were a group of 10 with 5 deluxe rooms but nothing had been done with our (approved) request  for twin beds.
Then at the bar we waited for a beer with the bartender getting 2 bottles and then did other orders before just grabbing the other 8 bottles out of the fridge. Why?
In the evening I must say they did arrange twin beds but  what I find the most shocking is that they put some of us in a classic room and not in the paid for deluxe room! 
This cannot be true? I travel a lot and am a luxury travel host but I have never experienced this in a 5 star hotel.
Great breakfast, classic rooms are great and staff is friendly but too many misses to be recommended. Great value for money but not the luxury feel and service from renowned labels in the city.

London Underground.description: London Underground, better known as the Tube, has 11 lines covering 402km and serving 270 stations. Opened in 1863, it is the world's oldest underground railway network, and one of the largest.

reviews.title: Picadilly Line Worst TFL line.
reviews.review_text:
Picadilly Line
Worst line of TFL, i used this everg single day as commute for 20 years. I wanna start with people who does not have problem with the line is using from central london zone 1 area or from hounslow/heathrow side but i unfortunately use it from Rayners Lane/Uxbridge side. For commute to work i only take this from Sudbury Hill to rayners lane and it takes me more than 10 mins for the 2 stops because of the red lights or whatever reason. I get cofused sometimes that i went pass these 2 stops but have not even reach the first stop. You have to wait 10 minutes each time for the train to arrive and when they do come the next on is after 2 minutes, it is ridicuolous. You waited kong enough for 10 mins then next one is arriving in 2 minutes so basically everyone jumps into the first train the 2 mins later train will be empty with less passengers. And ofcourse if you miss that then good luck waiting for another 10 minutes again.
I have use Metro line for a couple years as i moved out from my family home and they are proper good, i mean you do faces like this but very rarely. Picadilly line are only good for the heathrow side because they give priority for the airport so for example from acton town most picadilly lines you will get is for Heathrow not Uxbridge/Rayners Lane. And ofcourse travelling around zone 1 in picadilly lines is not an issue because multiple trains from all side feeds into central area.
Just fyi, you can get refunds for delays from tfl website but you cannot get the time back unfortunately. Who likes to run late to work due to delays right?

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.review_text:
Always felt safe and was easy to find our way around, we only got on the wrong train twice.
The staff was always ready to help.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: I spent the day in London, visiting the st Paul's COVID memorial. I was a little worried about the tubes , but I needn't of been, the staff were so helpful, I travelled from Euston to Oxford Circus to st Paul's and back. The staff helped me every step of the way , telling me platforms how to tap and go. The tube stations were clean and tidy. There was not one negative. Thankyou for making my day lovely

reviews.title: London Underground travel
reviews.review_text:
Helpful staff along the way either at the stations or nearby
Some trains can get busy at times although most of them are frequent

reviews.title: Good service
reviews.review_text: The more I travel here from Lincoln the more I get to understand how the tube stops and lines work..Don't have to bother with an oyster card just tap a debit card..checked my bank account and the price is reasonable..trains are clean and OK to hop on and off.

Mrs London's.description: Located in the heart of historic Saratoga Springs, Mrs. London's Café and Bakery is dedicated to using the freshest, finest, natural ingredients. Whether it's our decadent pastries and desserts, artisanal handmade breads, sandwiches, and soups, we put much thought into everything we make.

reviews.title: A well managed long line
reviews.review_text: We stopped in here with family on Black Friday in the afternoon as we were from out of town and family wanted to show it to us. We ordered to go as the place was rammed with people. Even though the line was long, it was well managed. We ordered peppermint tea, almond croissants and tree hugger cookies. All were great!  The almond croissants had the almond baked throughout, not the usual almond paste in the middle. The tree higher was crispy and felt healthy.

reviews.title: Wonderful sweet spot
reviews.review_text: Wow! My husband and I came here for coffee and pastries and we were in for a treat! There wasn’t a lot of indoor seating but we were lucky to get a table at the window. I chose the almond croissant which was delightful, a generous size filled with sweet almond flavor paired with buttery layers. My husband enjoyed a cranberry scone with jam and butter.  It was moist but not overly sweet. It’s a good thing we don’t live too close by because it would be very easy to become  regulars at this place!  It has a steady stream of willing customers. Too bad there’s not a little more seating.

reviews.title: Excellent bakery and cafe
reviews.review_text: We wanted to have pastry for later in the evening. The prices are high but the pastry was excellent. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Top Notch in Saratoga Springs
reviews.review_text: I have worked in a fine German bakery owned by a native.  The baked goods at Mrs. London's are of the finest quality.  We took the Nicoise salad which was also excellent just like the coffee.  It's worth standing in line!

reviews.title: Mind-blowing selection of breads, sweet treats
reviews.review_text: Don't go here hungry. You will leave with your belly full but your wallet empty! The cookies and sweet treats are a bit on the expensive side but the selection is mouth-watering. We had to stop ourselves from ordering stuff that we know we could not have for health reasons but it was tempting! Definitely worth visiting if you are in town.

Tatel Madrid.address: Paseo de la Castellana, 36, 28046 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Excellent experience
reviews.review_text: An excellent experience at tatel madrid .. the service was impeccible and the food was mouth watering ... Highly recommended
