reviews.title: Lunch for one person
reviews.review_text: Tasty, high level service, trained waiters, very good menu. Crab, tuna and homemade bread were awesome;) quite a cozy, well designed hall. It was 100% what I expected from a good restaurant in Madrid.

reviews.title: Halloween night inTatel
reviews.review_text: Second time in Madrid,i didn't expect too much ,if itsn't was for the great evening in Tatel...staff,manegment,show.

reviews.title: Wonderful night out
reviews.review_text: Wonderful place, great ambiance and live music, very good food, truffle risotto 😍 must visit in madrid, not sure how anyone could give it a bad rating.

reviews.title: Excelente
reviews.review_text: Beautiful restaurant, very trendy, amazing singer during our dinner which made the experience even better.  Food was great.  Would tatally come back !

Angelita Madrid.address: C. De La Reina, 4, 28004 Madrid Spain
Angelita Madrid.description: Angelita is the new project of the Villalón brothers. The wine bar and the american bar, are the heart of this place. All of this without giving up to the food, they present us dishes with traditional roots brought up to date. They offer more than 500 wine references. And signature cocktails created by the team, with more than 500 distilled options.

reviews.title: Amazing food and wine. Disappointing server.
reviews.review_text: Food and wine were excellent. Waitstaff (Javier) was incredibly rude and arrogant. I look forward to interacting with knowledgeable waitstaff to discuss wine and food. He had no interest in speaking with us and couldn’t be bothered to say good night, thank you, or any thing else at the end of the meal. Things seemed to go down hill after I politely declined a $400 euro bottle of wine. It’s unfortunate because the food and wine otherwise live up to their reputation of being exceptional.

reviews.title: Cocktail perfection!
reviews.review_text: We came for cocktails and were taken aback by the inventiveness and link to home grown produce. So creative. Considering the quality, very good pricing too. We also tried some food and loved the courgettes flowers and home grown tomatoes. Service was super professional and friendly. Loved it!

reviews.title: Wow - what a wine card
reviews.review_text:
We were a group of 7 that visited this wonderful restaurant. The service was were nice and with Sommelier that knew what he was talking about and who actually tasted the wine before serving.  Nice.
Tasting menu was 7 small dishes and very good value.
Will like to go again

reviews.title: Best food in Spain with a great wine list
reviews.review_text: David, one of the owners took care of us. We were only able to get a reservation at the bar due to the popularity of the restaurant. It was worth every minute! We had incredible service, the most fabulous wines and the food was the best I had had in Spain! It was very evident that David and his brother take good care of his staff and his customers. I highly recommend Angelita when you travel to Madrid. It was the food highlight of our two weeks in Spain! Thank you David!!

reviews.title: Amazing food and a really great atmosphere
reviews.review_text: Our lively hotel booked for us as we couldn’t get a table on line. We were seated at the bar which we always enjoy and the barman was friendly and helpful. We chose cocktails to start followed by the chef selected dishes with cheese, dessert and matching wines. Every course was absolutely delicious and the wines perfect. Each one we were given a taste of to see if we liked which was a nice surprise. Wouldn’t hesitate to come back here.

reviews.title: Authentic peruvian food and very reasonable
reviews.review_text: The food was excellent and we had a great selection with 'el barco'  highly recommended.  Such a shame the restaurant wasn't busy, maybe because it's so difficult to make a reservation, as the telephone no. is hardly ever answered.  We tried dozens of times, so they need to find out why.  One of the best Peruvian restaurants we've eaten.

reviews.title: Peruvian in Madrid!
reviews.review_text: Good Peruvian restaurant that serves a delicious and extensive seafood menu but also a wide variety of meat offerings as well.  The appetizer Tamal Criollo that we ordered was really good - it was maize containing chicken that came wrapped in a leaf. For entree we opted for the Orgia Marina which is a seafood sampler tower of sorts that is for 2 to share.  About 50 euro and it came with a lot of goodies.  The rice pudding dessert con le leche was quite good. Service could have been more attentive. Overall a good restaurant that is close to the university part of Madrid and a close walk to the Temple of Degod.

reviews.title: Peruvian food in Madrid
reviews.review_text: This was Peruvian food in the heart of Madrid.  Everything was amazing, from the Pisco Sours, Classico and Passion Fruit, to the large appetizer plate to the large platters of food we ate family style.  There was platters for 2 people and platters for 4 people and we ordered one of each for our group of 4 and ate every bite.  The rice pudding for dessert was huge and delicious.  It’s a little different for Madrid but we loved that about it.  The people were very welcoming and we had a great evening there, with many Pisco Sours.

reviews.title: Beautiful presentation and very tasty.
reviews.review_text: Peruvian cuisine is known to be one of the most popular in Latin America, it is a mix of Inca cuisine, Chinese and Japanese cuisine. Pituca Restaurant positions itself as the number 1 restaurant of Peruvian cuisine in Madrid. To check if this is the case, you need to live in Madrid for a long time, but the restaurant is really good. From the design to the dishes themselves. Without further ado, I ordered the "Sea Trio", bearing in mind that Peruvian cuisine is famous for seafood. Beautiful presentation and very tasty. The farewell dinner in Madrid was a success!

reviews.title: Great bday celebration!
reviews.review_text: I booked for my boyfriend birthday… Amazing food, delivered with passion and cariño. Shout out to Jonathan for his súper nice service!

Vinitus Gran Via Madrid.description: NO HACEMOS RESERVAS ANTICIPADAS. GRACIAS. WE DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS. THANK YOU. A new place in the heart of Madrid, with an eclectic desing between modern and cozy, our proposal is a market tapas and a wide variety of Montaditos with fresh and quality products where the presentation is taken care of by our chefs, but where premium flavor always prevail, a combination that provides a unique expereince that culminates exceptionally with a selection of great wines.

reviews.title: Unexpected incredible food!!
reviews.review_text: The doorman at our hotel recommended upon our arrival.  Rolled the dice and ended up going a second time.  The tapas options are no overly traditional yet the place was mobbed with locals.  I had an apple foie gras tapas that was beyond words.  Just outageously delish.  So many options and all equally well prepared and presented.  Service was excellent.  I was a skeptic based on it's modern appearance but blew us away.  You can't go wrong.  They offered an asian fusian rice special that they could barely. meet the demands.  My husband had and devoured.

reviews.title: Wonderful welcome and great service
reviews.review_text:
Excellent suggestion from reception desk at hotel. Great service and great tapas too. 

Really recommend a visit if you are close

reviews.title: Excellent modern tapas institute
reviews.review_text: We chose this place for our last dinner in Spain and it was all that we could wish for. A very popular institute dedicated to tapas but in a refined style and classy atmosphere. Wide range of menu options including both classical dishes as afell as more modernized offering (take for example fillet mignon with fois gras tapa). The menu details the most popular 'best seller' options to help you choose. We sat at the bar and got a great service together with the option to see how the staff prepares the food. All the food and wine we tried were excellent. No reservations available so expect a short wait but turnover is fast. If you tell them you want to sit at the bar this can get you seated earlier. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Our best tapas experience in Spain.
reviews.review_text: We arrived in Madrid around noon after a long overnight international flight. Our hotel clerk said "you want to eat now?" Yes, we were in need of a small meal and were looking forward to trying tapas in Spain. Vinitus was recommended and it was just two blocks from our hotel. We want and tried a  couple of their bestsellers and had a glass of wine and some water. It was very good and later, we realized that we had the Spanish version of chicken fingers and fries. We were, however,  so impressed that we had tapas at Vinitus two more times during our stay Madrid and we were not disappointed. Great food, good service and a charming atmosphere. Not to be missed in Madrid.

reviews.title: Tapas Lunch
reviews.review_text:
We really enjoyed the tapas particularly given they had some traditional tapas, but also their own and daily specials. The server started off great and was very helpful and the only down side was a wine I was charged for that didn’t receive (and couldn’t be bothered explaining to the new waiter that took over).
Good atmosphere with lively floor and modern decor also made it a different experience to others.

BiBo Madrid.description: BiBo’s menu is spread over various sections: “Brioches & Tapas” with very Mediterranean options; a section of cold soups, salads and “Lovin’ Green” dishes; a “Raw & Oyster Bar”; “Andalusian Fry”, applying the technique used for croquettes to crispy prawns, and two sections with seafood dishes and plates for meat lovers. That’s 80 recipes in total which transport the diners on a trip around the world without even leaving Madrid.

reviews.title: Image over content
reviews.review_text: Were seated in a table where almost every server banged on our table and got sick with the crab leg. Do not go, it is style over content. Only suitable if you want to take pictures, which is not what a restaurant should strive for.

reviews.title: This Andalusian fusion restaurant features a menu crafted by a three-star Michelin chef
reviews.review_text:
This Andalusian fusion restaurant features a menu crafted by a three-star Michelin chef. The interior is uniquely designed, drawing inspiration from the Malaga Expo. While the staff offers professional service, the small size of the space can lead to longer wait times.

I tried the "Menú Fast Good," available on weekdays for 39 EUR, which includes a drink, appetizer, small starter, main course, and dessert of your choice. I opted for the Ceviche Amarillo de Corvina, Magret de Pato Asado, and Cheesecake Bibo de Queso Payoyo. Each dish was artfully presented and delivered exceptional flavors.

For those seeking an affordable Michelin dining experience, this restaurant is a must-visit. The stunning interior, along with the generous portions and reasonable pricing of the set menu, make it well worth it. However, due to the longer service times, I recommend allowing extra time to fully enjoy your meal.

reviews.title: A great place in Madrid if you have a plane to catch
reviews.review_text: The place does everything tot position itself as a Michelin star restaurant, but is not there yet. I must admit the look and feel of the place is worth 3 stars; great lighting, abundant flower decorations and well dressed staff promise a top experience. Having said that, their choice of music was more suitable for the nearest roller disco and the volume was too loud for me. The food was nice but I had the impression that the chef was trying to impress the guests with all kinds of "exclusive" taste combinations, hoping to filter out 2 or 3 that could stay. My #1 suggestion is to spend time more looking in their pans than on their spotwatch, because that was my biggest complaint. We were in and out in 1 hour 20 (starter and main course!), thanks to staff constantly looking to take away empty plates (getting ready for the 2nd shift?). All in all it was a nice experience, but as for me an only-once-in-a-lifetime.

reviews.title: Fab!
reviews.review_text:
All Danis restaurants have an amazing kitchen! 
And also a well chosen staff ! Friendly attentive but not intrusive!

We had some ceviche to start wich was truly amazing!

But the pluma iberico was just from another planet! 

Great choices of wines for all budgets and tastes!

Higly higly recommend it!

reviews.title: Good overall experience - does not disappoint.
reviews.review_text:
Overall a good experience - service was excellent with a great Maître D’ and waiter taking turns to ensure we were properly attended to. 

Food was also consistently good - we tried quite a selection, all well executed. A firm favourite is the table-side guacamole. 

Wine list is pretty decent with a mix of options across almost all budgets. Cocktails were well done and prompt to arrive. 

Overall, a family-favourite at each visit to Madrid.

Platea Madrid.description: Platea is a unique gastronomic leisure space. A magical place, where the excitement never stops. A place to relax, enjoy yourself and meet friends in a setting where everything comes together and makes perfect sense. Platea is all about excellence and creativity. The culmination of a project that marries both entertainment and gastronomy in all their splendour. With entrances on Calle Goya, Calle Hermosilla and Calle Marqués de Zurgena, Platea boasts almost 6,000 square metres arranged over two floors, three galleries and a patisserie area, and aims to become the reference point for gastronomy and leisure in Madrid and a landmark destination for both domestic and international visitors. The very best chefs from the culinary world. We are also all about performance, hosting a grand variety of live entertainment. We want every visit you make to be a unique experience. Join us in our passionate quest for perfection. So that when you leave us, you leave with a smile.

reviews.title: Missing you too much
reviews.review_text: Please please tell me open to the public . My favourite go to in Madrid . So sad it has closed . Simply a beautiful place with fantastic ambience, food and drink .

reviews.title: Fun place for drinks
reviews.review_text: Super fun bar!  We went with friends after spending the day running around the city and having dinner.  This was a late night on a Saturday and we wanted to unwind.  The place is super interesting as it is an old theater.  We had a couple of rounds of drinks, had a little show of a girl hanging from ribbons from the 3 floor, no net, she was amazing!  Good music, fun atmosphere, overall a great time!

reviews.title: Needs revitalisation !
reviews.review_text:
Return visit after covid chaos . Disappointed that only a fraction of the original food /drinks vendors are open. 
It has lost its appeal, it’s like a ghost town. 
Owners / management need to get together and sort out their business plan. This fantastic venue needs regeneration. 
🤞🤞🤞

reviews.title: recommended
reviews.review_text: We stopped for lunch in the middle of a shopping trip.  Wonderful atmosphere, excellent service and the dishes were meticulous and delicious.  Definitely an unusual place and highly recommended.

reviews.title: Excellent --for a short break!
reviews.review_text: Fabulous location , hotel staff excellent and very friendly. Cannot wait to return!--Highly recommend.

Caluana Madrid.address: Calle De La Bolsa 12, 28012 Madrid Spain
Caluana Madrid.description: Caluana es la historia de un viaje entre Italia y España, pasando por sus regiones, sus productos y su magia. Lo mejor de cada cocina en unas propuestas únicas que respetan la tradición pero mirando al futuro

reviews.title: NO COGEN EL TELÉFONO
reviews.review_text:
NO COGEN EL TELEFONO.
Y SALTA EL BUZON LLENO
.NO COGEN EL TELEFONO.
Y SALTA EL BUZON LLENO
NO COGEN EL TELEFONO.
Y SALTA EL BUZON LLENO

reviews.title: Rude staff
reviews.review_text: I have made the reservation ,to celebrate my birthday with friends and wrote it when making the booking. The waiters were ignoring us and we couldn’t order for nearly 30 mins , then we understood we have 2 hours slot , and I was pushed a bit rude to pay ! Food was good , indeed the special experience I wanted to share with friends on my occasion , went really poor due  to the e staff behavior .

reviews.title: Date night dinner.
reviews.review_text: The restaurant was beautiful inside.  My husband and I went for dinner on our last night in Madrid.  The zucchini appetizer was delicious.  We both ordered fish dishes and they were delicious as well.  We arrived right at 8pm for our reservation and were seated promptly.  We were not rushed and enjoyed the atmosphere.  We were treated to some entertainment as well, a woman dancing with fire!  We thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

reviews.title: Horrible Experience
reviews.review_text:
Waiters do not know the difference between milk and gluten, and the restaurant does not provide any alternatives for individuals with food allergies. 
Vegan options are not actually vegan, they contain cheese and butter. 
The chef is not willing to make slight changes to make sure allergic people can consume certain dishes. 
For individuals with lactose intolerance/dairy allergy only 2 dishes are available from the menu. 
All pasta dishes contain milk, even though traditional Italian pasta should not.
We tried speaking to chef who would not show outside of the kitchen, and was not willing to talk to us and offer any other alternatives.

reviews.title: Amazing Food
reviews.review_text:
Amazing food. Every course was delicious.
Staff were very attentive and we wasn’t made to feel rushed, so we enjoyed another glass of wine when we had finished.
Decorated lovely throughout and a cosy ambiance.

Zuma Madrid.address: P.0 De La Castellana, 2 Located in Hotel Fénix Gran Meliá - The Leading Hotels of the World, 28046 Madrid Spain
Zuma Madrid.description:
Disfruta la experiencia de la mundialmente conocida cocina contempor�nea Japonesa en Madrid. Ubicado en el glamoroso distrito de Salamanca, junto a tres de las principales calles de tiendas de lujo.
Podr�s degustar el estilo de cocina Japonesa Izakaya con platos como el bacalao negro marinado en Miso y envuelto en una hoja de Hoba, delicioso sushi, Sashimi de pez limon y muchos platos mas.

reviews.title: Lovely dinner with a group of friends
reviews.review_text:
I had tried Zuma in whichever countries it is located in, and honestly, its something you must try to experience the vibe and ora.

Unfortunately I was unable to capture our food but because we were hungry the only thing that was taken was the receipt.

As a group of friends our bill was affordable to what we had ordered.

Those that are planning to visit Zuma firstly;

1. Book in advance 
2. And request outside
3. What to order:

Black Cod is a must!
Salmon Sashimi
Tiger prawn
Handrolls California and Salmon

The weather was amazing for November, not too hot not too cold but for evening its best to take a jacket incase it gets chilly.

reviews.title: Tasty
reviews.review_text: The miso soup was not tasty at all however I really enjoyed the sushi and the zuma cake, the waiters are a bit annoying always asking if the food is finished but thats their job so ok

reviews.title: Zuma keeps its super high standards
reviews.review_text:
The dishes are exquisite; the tuna and salmon tartare, for example, are poetry. The service is incredibly pleasant, efficient, and professional. The atmosphere is enhanced by cool music played by a DJ, accompanied by a percussionist, which made the entire experience feel fun, unique, and memorable.

The price is high, but this is what I call money well spent (-:

reviews.title: Zuma  a place to visit when in Madrid
reviews.review_text:
Delicious food , amazing service and the place just rock 😊
I loved the cocktails and my husband and I enjoyed our dinner ! 
Can’t wait to visit the Zuma in Abu Dhabi on our next trip .

reviews.title: Zuma Madrid: Stylish Ambience, Exceptional Service, but we expected better from the sushis
reviews.review_text:
For a comprehensive breakdown of our visit, you can read the full review on Instagram  at @Gotham.hospitality.

In brief, Zuma Madrid offers an inviting atmosphere and exceptional service. The staff's hospitality is notable from the moment you arrive, with no wait and a warm welcome. 

However, while the menu features a variety of well-executed dishes, the sushi offerings, particularly at their price point, did not meet our expectations for quality. The Otoro tuna was a highlight, yet overall, the sushi lacked the exceptional taste and refinement one might anticipate given the cost.

For those considering a visit, Zuma excels in many areas, but if sushi is your primary interest, it may be worth exploring other options in the city. For more insights and details, check out our full review on Instagram!

reviews.title: Fine dining with a good vibe
reviews.review_text: Appealing from the entrance, with an industrial chic decor, limited noise and excellent service. The food was delicious. I can recall the grilled avocado salad, the anchovies and the sole. The wine list was nice with nicely selected Spanish wines and not only.

reviews.title: Terrible welcome.
reviews.review_text:
The restaurant opens at 8 pm.
We arrived at 7.55 pm and were sent back on the street.
5 minutes later we were given a table in a backroom . The waitress put her two fingers up and said Two hours. Next to our chairs were big window shutters that did not allow us move our arms. Without asking they
 brought us two glasses of cava and some amuses, wich they
 probably would put on the bill if you don't refuse them.
We asked for another table but the other one was next to a passage where the waiters came out of the kitchen.
So we left and found a restaurant with friendly caring staff.

reviews.title: Melt in your mouth beef and superb service
reviews.review_text:
We stumbled into this place. We didn’t have a reservation and they were very accommodating (I do recommend having a reservation). The head chef set up a table for us outside in the beautiful courtyard. We were met with complimentary champagne, which was a thoughtful and nice touch. We ordered everything the head chef recommended. Highlights include: scallops, octopus (biggest and best I’ve ever had), artichokes and beef tartar that melt in your mouth. There were five of us so we ordered a T Bone and a ribeye. The meet was perfectly cooked (medium rare, on the rarer side how we like it). The beef was incredibly flavorful and you could taste the difference of their specially selected wood for their grill fires. We paired the meal with two bottles of a reserve Rioja. The dessert was a terrific way to end the evening. 

The service was impeccable and proactive. My mom speaks Spanish very well, but she is not Spanish and she speaks slowly. Often times servers speak quickly with no regard to her comprehension. The servers spent time with us, shared their story and genuinely seemed to enjoy our company. 

Far and away one of the best dining experiences we have ever had. This is a must place stop for dinner while in Madrid.

reviews.title: Best dinner in Madrid.
reviews.review_text: Best dinner I’ve ever had. The wine was great, the steak was cooked medium rare which I never enjoy and it was perfect, and the sides were amazing. The service was excellent, with friendly staff who took good care of us. The restaurant had a nice, relaxed atmosphere. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience, and I highly recommend it if you’re looking for a great meal. Worth the €.

reviews.title: Don't bother
reviews.review_text:
Not a good experience at all. 
Opens at 8pm. We arrived at 7.55 and were told to go away ! 
Returned at 8.05 and it appeared our early arrival had upset someone - we were steered to the worst table in the rear of the restaurant despite perfectly good tables up front. "All booked" they said. They were still empty when we left 90 minutes later.
The food was below average. One steak was fine but two others were full of gristle and were left uneaten. The Cod was mushy (may have spent too long in the freezer) and it too was left uneaten.
Our bottle of Rioja was great - the only first class thing about the meal.
Give it a miss

Charrua Madrid.address: Calle Del Conde De Xiquena, 4, 28004 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Beautiful romantic atmosphere, great food
reviews.review_text: A really fantastic central spot with great food (even for vegetarians like me!!) and a really unique and beautiful atmosphere.

reviews.title: Excellent steak restaurant!
reviews.review_text:
Lovely restaurant with a really beautiful interior and great food. Can highly recommend the nino salad as a side to the steak!
Definitely worth a visit if you’re in Madrid!

reviews.title: Mediocre experience not worth it
reviews.review_text:
Beautiful restaurant more personnel than numbers of tables and the service is mediocre. If at the end, you will ask for a cheese plate, better call an hour ahead for it to be room temperature and not very cold. Review the check before paying they are so busy (few tables) but they will charge a side dish that you ordered and never came. 
For sure are better choices in any city in the world.

reviews.title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE 100% ISLAMAPHOBIC
reviews.review_text:
We reserved with the restaurant over the phone and they had confirmed and everything, when we arrived to the restaurant they took one look at my mother (who is a hijabi) and started acting like we didn’t have a reservation 
The restaurant was EMPTY and they wouldn’t seat us

reviews.title: An overall great experience!
reviews.review_text: We had a group of 12 people and they were able to accommodate us in a beautiful kings table. Food is great, along with equally good service. Limited liquor, but a great list of wines.

The Principal Madrid.address: Calle Marques De Valdeiglesias, 1, 28004 Madrid Spain
The Principal Madrid.description: The Principal Madrid Hotel is much more than a luxurious modern boutique hotel. Its prime location in the heart of Madrid, its exclusive entrance, its 76 elegantly appointed rooms, the stunning Terraza (rooftop terrace,7th floor) with what may be the best views in Madrid, and its Ático (penthouse, 6th floor) where avant-garde haute cuisine meets classic cocktails in a space with the best music are reasons enough not to miss the opportunity of discovering this renovated building, now one of the capital’s must-see sights. The hotel’s impressive Ático and Terraza boast the best panoramic views of downtown Madrid. In both, amid large, lush garden areas, you can sip a cocktail or order from the menu concocted by Ramón Freixa (2 Michelin stars), soak up some sun in the Solarium or enjoy the sound of the overflow pool and the best ambient music or our outdoor showers in summer… and always with the finest service to ensure that your every wish is granted.
The Principal Madrid.address_string: Calle Marques De Valdeiglesias, 1, 28004 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Wonderful place to be in Madrid
reviews.review_text:
The Principal is a hotel with a lot of charm and style and - even more important - with a professional as well as very kind and focused staff.
The restaurant Atico is also worth staying for dinner there.
The hotel is perfectly located for visiting Madrid by foot.
Why also not five points? Well, for me five points mean that everything is more than perfect, especially for a 5 ***** hotel like The Principal. But: We will come back, in any case.

reviews.title: Wonderful city .. wonderful hotel.
reviews.review_text:
In a word “Wonderful”
Everyone was terrific!
Fabulous location.
Great food, great breakfast  and lovely terrace for an evening drink. 
We wish you the best if you are able to stay at this location.  We certainly were treated very well. 
We recommend it.

reviews.title: The loveliest stay!
reviews.review_text: Wonderful stay. Rooms are super comfortable and elevated. The staff was very accommodating to our every need and the most friendly. The hotel location is quiet while still a short walk to main sites, restaurants and shopping in Madrid. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text:
Great experience.  Awesome from the start.  Though a small lift/elevator, there were no waits and a really cool spiral staircase that was more fun than the lift. 
 It is a beautiful building retrofitted to a wonderful hotel with amazing Terrace views. 
 
Concierge was excellent and really made the experience enjoyable.  Terrific cocktails at the bar and on the terrace.  Love the place (towel warmers in the bathroom!) and would highly recommend to others. - Mike

reviews.title: Loved it here
reviews.review_text:
Wow - this hotel is perfect for Madrid exploring - I will return! 

Special mentions to the hotel staff:
Sergio at breakfast 
Luis on the door getting me transportation sorted 
Viorel was excellent - so helpful and always friendly to everyone.

The bar patio is just ace and the rooms all are beautiful - I miss the place already!

amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center
Free Wired Internet in the Business Center

reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel in a fantastic location
reviews.review_text: Loved our time staying here for the first time in Madrid! We could walk to so many restaurants and shops from this location. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Great cocktail bar and nice breakfast.  It was clean and comfortable. We would absolutely stay here again!

reviews.title: Beautiful & Cosy Stay
reviews.review_text: This hotel is not just one of the most beautiful I have stayed at so far, but it definitively has the most wonderful service I experienced! Everbody in the hotel is charming and very attentive. The breakfast is fantastic and so are the drinks at the bar!

reviews.title: Madrid hotel at its best
reviews.review_text: Great experience! Authentic design, very good service, comfortable room. The hotel is perfectly located for all kind of excursions. The staff was very friendly and professional. The recommendations for nearby coffee shops and restaurants had been very helpful

reviews.title: What a trip
reviews.review_text: In the center of the city, only the YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid provides a distinctive and fashionable stay. It is a unique option because of its stylish furnishings, first-rate service, and comfortable accommodations. Additionally, its proximity to a dispensary(stonerpharmdispensaryonline.com) makes it more convenient for people who want to unwind and explore. I heartily endorse this treasure!

reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Madrid
reviews.review_text:
Wonderful service and a super-clean junior suite.  The location was also great, with shops & bars all within a block or two.... I would recommend to anyone that wants to have an stress-free visit to Madrid.

Staff from the front office to the maid service were all very kind.

ARTIEM Madrid.address: Calle Juan Perez Zuniga, 20, 28027 Madrid Spain
ARTIEM Madrid.address_string: Calle Juan Perez Zuniga, 20, 28027 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Excellent in service and value
reviews.review_text: Guests are friendly, rooms are spacious and clean, comfortable, free of charge snack and drink offer was amazing. Location is not bad but need to take metro to major tourist attractions. Great value for money.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.review_text:
Exquisite hotel.
Super comfy beds, excellent shower quality, the shower amenities are really nice and amazing smell.
They have a delicious breakfast and also an area where you can grab some snacks, fruits, coffee, sparking water for free - that was REALLY handy!

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.review_text:
Staff are very helpful and friendly. Location is very good with a short walk to metro station and a bus stop right in front. Area is very quiet and tranquil. Although some construction is currently happening during the day. Hotel is kept very clean and the room is spotless. On offer are light snacks, coffee, tea and bottled nonalcoholic drinks 24/7 which is very comfortable, alcohol drinks also available at a small fee. Room was a good size and quiet. Underground parking is available, tight but not impossible. Very competitive pricing.
Only gripes were that the heat turned off during the night and the Wi-Fi was a bit hit and miss at times.
Would still gladly return.

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.review_text: Nothing unique or special that would warrant a return. Grab and go is a good idea sadly it seems poorly executed, with no consideration for the customer and how they travel through the hotel from room to door. I called reception multiple times after leaving the hotel, each call went unanswered (rang until the dial tone disconnected), which is fairly unacceptable. Per night cost was higher than the Meliá Avenida America (where my colleagues were staying), which was a premium hotel experience. I would not recommend this place to a colleague.

reviews.title: Thank you
reviews.review_text: We really enjoyed our stay here, excellent staff and comfortable room and bed,, we are looking forward to returning one day soon.

Dear Hotel Madrid.description:
Welcome to Dear hotel,the new design boutique hotel in Madrid’s downtown,with astonishing views over Gran Via and Plaza de Espana.At floor 14th,Nice to meet you Restaurant&Lounge features a panoramic terrace,360º views and a sky pool.Contemporary cuisine in a cosmopolitan and relaxed ambience,cocktails and DJ music.
Located in Gran Via 80, 10 min walk to Palacio Real and 15 to Plaza Mayor or Puerta del Sol

reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location - recommend!
reviews.review_text: Lovely boutique hotel, well designed rooms, comfortable bed, coffee and tea facilities (a must!), great shower and temperature in room just right.  Suggest an extra blanket in cupboard as duvet still summer one we think, but it was fine. Staff all excellent from check in to check out.  Great breakfasts, friendly attentive staff and great views of city and Royal Palace.  We would return definitely!

reviews.title: Lovely rooms, tasty breakfast and friendly helpful staff.
reviews.review_text:
My son and I had a wonderful city break in Madrid and chose Dear Hotel Madrid as it’s situated in the centre of everything allowing us to explore Madrid on foot and only needing to use the Metro for our return trip to the airport and to visit The Real Madrid Stadium. 

Our room had everything we needed and the breakfast room had splendid views and tasty breakfast options to keep us full for most of the day. 

The staff were friendly and willing to put right any mistakes, which unfortunately on our first morning during breakfast there was a long delay with our cooked order but staff made up for it on our last 2 days. Elena who covers reception was extremely friendly and helpful and willing to take as much time as required to help us to access our smart television as we were having connection issues. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Madrid.

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.review_text:
We had a wonderfull stay in Dear Hotel Madrid. Adrian from reception upgrade our room for a higher category (and also for anice terrace), but the weather in Madrid was not that good to enjoy it. Sunset in the rooftop bar was also very nice (just a little bit crowded during the sunset).

I will come back again for sure.

Julia.

reviews.title: Comfortable Stay in Madrid
reviews.review_text: We loved this hotel, super convenient location in the center of Madrid, the rooms are comfy, and the staff is super friendly. Elena at the front desk deserves a super shout-out for being extremely helpful and giving us great tips for dining and places to go. It has a great rooftop and great views of Madrid's city center. The pool is only a dipping pool, so don't hold your breath on that one, but it's good for that Instagram shot. We didn't dine in the restaurant, so can't give an opinion on that, but the room was well stocked with everything you might need, and there is a water fountain on every floor to fill up your water bottles. Overall a great stay, the only thing to be aware is that it is right on Gran Via, so you will definitely hear the sirens at night.

reviews.title: Amazing stay!
reviews.review_text: Wow! What an amazing place this is! From the upscale food and drinks (check out the rooftop bar at sunset. Superb!. To the top notch staff. They will make you feel at home at all times. Hey, a special shoutout to my mainman, mr. Alvaro, for sorting our transportation out in no time. Kudos, Madrid!

BLESS Hotel Madrid.description: Located in the heart of the sophisticated Salamanca district, right in the Golden Mile, BLESS Hotel Madrid is situated in one of the most exclusive areas of the capital. Alongside the hotel are fashion boutiques, luxury restaurants, and art galleries, making the hotel a hub of elegance and style. The building housing BLESS Hotel Madrid is a prime example of classic Madrid architecture, giving it a unique character that seamlessly blends history and modernity.

reviews.title: NO TEMPERATURE CONTROL IN ROOMS BAD EXPERIENCE
reviews.review_text:
This hotel has a big issue with the room temperature. They don’t allow you to change the temperature from the room, you have to call the front desk and then they call some other department. So each time you feel the temperature isn’t right, for example at 1:00 am when your small child is sleeping in the room, you have to make a phone call that may wake everyone up instead of using the thermostat on the wall. They do have one, but it’s fake. It doesn’t actually change the temperature. 

On our first night here the room was almost 23 degrees. After thinking I could change it myself and it waiting a few hours wondering why it wouldn’t work, I called. They then lowered it. An hour later my room was 18 degrees and we were freezing. I called again and they explained they are the ones that can change it, not you in your own room where you’re sleeping. The man was very rude.By then it was already 11:00 pm and we couldn’t sleep due to the ridiculous temperatures. They said they would set it at 20. 

Another hour goes by and the temperature is still 18.5 which is about 64 Fahrenheit. I call again, still unable to sleep and they say again they’re going to adjust it. Then a few minutes later someone knocks on my door, past midnight, asking if I called for an issue with the tv!!! Meanwhile the issue I did have wasn’t being resolved. 

I would caution guests to not stay here if they want to sleep at all. It has been an absolute nightmare.

The hotel is also mostly catering to people from outside so if you need a table at the rooftop or at the lobby restaurant you have absolutely no priority being a hotel guest. In fact if you are a guest waiting in the lobby for any reason, they will tell you very rudely to move because the tables are reserved for outsiders who have reservations and you can’t sit there to wait for your taxi even though they don’t have any other seating for their own guests.

Every single decent hotel I have stayed at gives its guests priority for all hotel amenities. This place has no idea what customer service means for a luxury hotel, which clearly they are not.

reviews.title: Spectacular hotel and experience
reviews.review_text: My family and I had a wonderful visit. The hotel is elegant but not stuffy, and the staff are terrific. The rooftop has wonderful views and is great for coffee, cocktails and dinner. The lobby area is also great place to visit and relax. Also special shoutout to the concierge team. They secured museum tickets and made excellent restaurant recommendations.  It may be our favorite hotel experience ever.

reviews.title: Best Guest Experience Department
reviews.review_text: There are many good things about this hotel including its location, cleanliness, restaurants, nice staff and many more. But my experience in this hotel is different which made me to thank its management and also Guest Experience Department specifically Cristina and Lidia. We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and on November 8th we left to Istanbul to spend several days there. The day after we arrived in Istanbul I realized that I left one of my Hermes bags in our room at the hotel. I was so disappointed but called the hotel and put the Massage for Guest service and unbelievably they answered me that they found my bag🥹. Also they told me that they can keep it for 2 months or arrange with a shipping company to send it to me. I’m a frequent traveler all over the world and absolutely It was one of my best experiences. One more time I want to thank Bless hotel management and staff, specifically dear Cristina and Lidia at Guest experience department.

reviews.title: Lovely stay in the heart of Madrid
reviews.review_text: Excellent service, from check-in, to valet/bell staff, to housekeeping, and checkout. This is great location for accessing great restaurants and shops. Beautiful accommodations with extraordinary amenities. Wish I could have stayed longer than one night!

reviews.title: Excellent hotel - a soundproof stay.
reviews.review_text:
Excellent location. We had a room facing the entrance street. Very, very soundproof.
Nice and friendly staff. The light in the restaurant could be adjusted especially in the evening. Otherwise a very good hotel experience and we will return!
Carl C

The Madrid EDITION.description: A stunning microcosm of Madrid featuring recognized culinary concepts including a signature restaurant with a world-renowned chef partner, an elevated cocktail bar, a lobby bar and a unique culinary concept at the rooftop terrace.
amenities: Free Wired Internet in the Business Center

reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.review_text:
Stunning hotel with exceptional service. I broke something in my room and they fixed it right away. 
If I could give 4.5 I would, for me it loses a point because it’s quite dark inside the rooms making difficult to see yourself when getting ready plus the full length mirror is inside the wardrobe which doesn’t help!  I was on the 2nd floor facing the road and didn’t hear any noise. Extremely central. Lobby bar gets busy on the weekend with young people.

reviews.title: Perfect Madrid hotel!
reviews.review_text: Amazing hotel in Madrid! The location is perfect for all attractions, restaurants, etc. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff is amazing. Huge shoutout to the concierge Jefferson who understood all of our requests immediately and hit them spot on. Every meal he suggested was absolutely perfect.

reviews.title: Staffs Accused Me for Complaining About My Room But I Never Did or Say Anything
reviews.review_text:
Let me just say that this hotel is without doubt luxurious. Location is perfect. Room is beautifully minimalistic. The service? Unfortunately down the drain... and I literally just checked in.

I checked in early to be told that I was upgraded to one of the Suites that wasn't ready to be occupied yet. I told them it was fine, I'll just go out and get lunch first. Around an hour later, the app told me it was ready for check-in, I came back to the hotel, received my key, and got into the room.

The staff told me that the bag was already on the way to my room and I should just wait in my room. I waited for 20 minutes and my luggages still didn't arrive, so I came to the receptionist and ask them if I can just bring the luggages on my own because it took them too long. I waited for another 10 minutes before the manager and the staffs - now more people are coming - said that the bags were already in my room.

The manager then said to me the delay was because I was having an issue with my original room and they had to figure out which room I moved to to deliver my luggages. For me, this was such a huge accusation because I never - at any point during check-in - had any problem with my room. I was simply waiting for too long for my luggages and I just want to get them as quickly as possible into my room.

I literally just checked into this hotel and the check-in experience has been extremely dismal to a point that it has soured my experience before I even get to experience my stay here. To say that this hotel is, so far, all styles over substance seems to be true. Unless everything is so spectacular for the next couple of days, I will never stay in this hotel again because this is a hotel with slow service and the staffs will accuse you for something you never said or did in the first place.

reviews.title: Worth visiting this place at least once in your trip in Madrid
reviews.review_text: A oasis in center of a metropolitan city. I you are visiting Madrid I recommend you to visit this place at least once. Staff is welcoming, good food and amazing drinks. Apart of the amazing infinity pool with views you can find a huge terrace, unique indoor dining areas and list goes on.

reviews.title: All night long!
reviews.review_text: If you’re offered a room on the first floor (more specifically room 135 and around) refuse it. Noise from the newly opened nightclub will keep your room vibrating until it closes at 5:30AM. The hotel is also in a very touristy location that is hard  to reach by car during prime hours. It’s also surprising how worn the hotel already is, considering it’s only 2 years old. If you’re visiting Madrid and are considering staying here, I would recommend checking Urso Hotel before you book — a much better hotel on all accounts.

Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid.description: Sleeping in the historic centre of Madrid, in a baroque building in the most iconic square in the city. It’s an experience only possible at the Pestana Plaza Mayor, an exclusive hotel of the Pestana Collection brand that combines the baroque architecture of the 17th Century with a sophisticated decor and the amenities of the 21st century. Madrid is a city with a life of its own, where there is movement, noise and people. But if you want to relax for a moment, all you need to do is close the windows. The hotel is your refuge whenever you want, simultaneously at the centre of everything is the centre of tranquillity. With its spectacular Spa, an inner patio lit with natural light, its own library, a Rooftop bar with seasonal pool with views over the most genuine neighbourhood in the city, a terrace right on Plaza Mayor and rooms that prime for supreme comfort, this is the place to stay in the centre of Madrid. The Pestana Plaza Mayor Madrid is a unique and unrivalled luxury hotel, located a stone’s throw away from the main monuments and tourist attractions, such as Puerta del Sol square, the Royal Palace, Madrid Cathedral, Gran Vía, Plaza del Callao square, the Temple of Debod, or the iconic El Rastro flea market. The Paseo del Arte, where you’ll find the main museums such as the Prado, Reina Sofía, and Thyssen, is only a 20-minute walk away.

reviews.title: Amazing stay in Madrid!
reviews.review_text: I would like to thank the front office staff and especially Alejandro Villa, Carlos, Anita, Ruben, Tamara and the rest of this fantastic team. They made sure my stay in the hotel was special and they made me and my partner feel like home. Big Love Pestana❤️

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.review_text: Beautiful place, great location. Staff very friendly and highly service oriented, Lorena and  Mafalda made the breakfast experience top notch and a great start of the day! Had a bit of an issue with the air conditioning in the room but it was fixed immediately, perfect.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.review_text: Wonderful place with great service. Lorena, in the restaurant was especially helpful and friendly. The front desk folks were very efficient and quick to respond to our requests. We are very happy with our choice and would highly recommend it to all. Thanks!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience in Madrid with Pestana brand hotel located at Plaza Mayor.
reviews.review_text: The staff was very helpful and especially the restaurant staff Ms. Lorena was so kind and friendly 😊.  The hotel location is an excellent place where you can walk around and many restaurants options next to you. Room so clean and spacious enough with very nice balcony.

reviews.title: Best Location in City Center
reviews.review_text: Two nights here before business meetings and for a special occasion. You simply can't beat this location - you can walk out of the hotel and emerge into the spectacular Plaza Mayor! All of the main attractions are within easy walking distance. The staff was attentive and accommodating. The restaurant was beautiful, but the food was just okay (fine for snacks or quick tapas and wine). The gym is limited, with a treadmill, elliptical, and a (very) small set of dumbbells (max 10 kg - ???) and bench, but you're there to relax and see the city, so it's okay! Will return!

The Westin Palace, Madrid.address: Plaza De Las Cortes 7, 28014 Madrid Spain
The Westin Palace, Madrid.description: Built by order of King Alfonso XIII in 1912, The Westin Palace, Madrid was recently restored to its original splendor. Situated near the Prado museum, historic monuments and some of the best tapas restaurants in town, It is listed in the Condé Nast Traveler "Gold List 2010" as one of the best hotels in Spain.
The Westin Palace, Madrid.address_string: Plaza De Las Cortes 7, 28014 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Underwhelming Stay
reviews.review_text: We choose the Westin Madrid to start our honeymoon because of the gorgeous lobby where we would enjoy brunch with a performance by opera singers on Sundays but unbeknownst to us prior to arriving, the lobby was all under construction. The room was nice and the staff were helpful but disappointed about the construction.

reviews.title: WIP - under renovation
reviews.review_text:
The Westin is currently under renovation and was one of the worst hotel experiences I have had. There was absolutely no mention of the renovation when I booked (otherwise I wouldn’t have booked!) nor any communication in the lead up to our stay. The experience is not worth it for the premium price. 

Firstly, the front of house staff (reception, security and porters) were not as attentive or friendly as I would have expected of a Westin hotel. They looked annoyed to be there, and treated you as such. Besides one of the younger staff members, there were no friendly smiles or hellos to be had by the staff in the lobby area. 

The lobby is a makeshift space in an old function area. 
The reason I booked the Westin was for the beautiful La Rotonda, but this is also currently under renovation. 
Breakfast is served in another function room with no windows or natural light. 
To get to your room, you’ll have to navigate a confusing route via a couple of different lifts. 
Finding your way to the gym is even more confusing. 
To top it off, majority of the roads surrounding the hotel were under construction so getting a taxi to/from the Westin was not easy. 

When I gave feedback on the disappointment of the renovation and the lack of transparency/communication about the ongoing renovation, the staff agreed and was also disappointed that there was no communication about the renovation. Looks like it might be a head office decision? 

On the upside, the rooms are beautiful and the decorative details are very complimentary of the style. The location is great and close to everything you need. The cleaners were super friendly, and the staff on breakfast were great!

reviews.title: Perfection
reviews.review_text:
COMPLETE PERFECTION!!  I had an incredible stay and am hoping to return.  Prior to arrival Marta was very responsive and made sure that I had a room that I would love.  She picked a fantastic room-absolutely beautiful.  Upon arrival the staff who checked me warmly greeted me and made the process not just efficient but also informative and enjoyable.  This was much appreciated after a very long 2 days of travel.  The breakfast buffet is too good and my waisline shows it.  I do not know her name but a young woman who took me to my table each day was a joy to start the day with.  The concierge Oscar was very helpful and had great recommendations.  Housekeeping is spectacular.  Honestly, each staff member I encountered was very hospitable, helpful, and a pleasure to interact wih.  
Without hesitation, I highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: Bad experience
reviews.review_text:
Building and rooms are perfect 

Service people in restaurants , especially breakfast are terrible !

House keeping is average , non English spoken at all .. 

In breakfast many of my orders not even served even I repeated them several times. 

Concierge is acting like posh elites of Spanish royal dynasty.

Again I will never ever stay there again

reviews.title: One Hundred Percent Perfect
reviews.review_text: One hundred percent perfect stay. Although the hotel is under renovation, the rooms are completed, gorgeous, and comfortable. The public areas still have work to do, but it won't interfere with your stay. Lots of beautiful details everywhere you look. The front desk went above and beyond to find a room ready for 2 very early weary travelers. Thanks you so much. The breakfast buffet has everything you can imagine. We really hated to checkout. What an amazing  stay.

Four Seasons Hotel Madrid.description: History comes to life with modern energy at Four Seasons Hotel Madrid. In the very heart of the capital - within walking distance of all the key attractions - seven historic buildings have been transformed into one dynamic destination. With rooftop dining by Spanish celebrity chef Dani García, Asian-Mediterranean cuisine at our award-winning modern cocktail bar and restaurant Isa, and a four-level Wellness Centre with a sun-splashed pool terrace, Four Seasons is bringing a new level of luxury and service to locals and guests alike.

reviews.title: A bit lengthy but it's why they are a top hotel in the world!
reviews.review_text:
I'm so ashamed to be posting 6 months after our stay, but the benefit is that our amazing stay hasn't left our minds.  We stayed as a family with teens for 3 nights this past June and Four Seasons Madrid is one of our top hotels that we've ever stayed in and perhaps, the top.  We have stayed at Waldorfs, Ritzs, Rosewoods, Fairmonts, LHCs and various independent high quality hotels; all of whom are lovely.  But Four Seasons Madrid was truly special.  

It is gorgeously designed and a great location.  The beds were clean and comfortable.  Everything was immaculate.  They couldn't have been kinder to us Americans.  While my teenage daughter fits in perfectly with style and class, I'm not so hip and lean more to comfort clothes, no makeup, and no flash and their treatment to each one of us was spectacular.  Maybe any negative reviews are the result of ones behavior to others because we were only treated as royalty.

Who to thank?  I always regret forgetting names, but we remember a few.  First impressions... the doormen.  Just fabulous (Dani is one who was all smiles and courtesy all the time).  The concierge!  With people who have obtained clef d'or I learned the lengths they go to assist us.  Jose, Giovanni, and Raul among others.  We had waited for years to get an art piece and knew we wanted one from Spain for an empty wall.  They set us up with a gallery, but it was a bit more modern for my taste so they kept working and sent us to a different gallery where we bought 2 pieces!  They now hang on 2 different walls in our home.  Unfortunately, there was also a young gentleman who was working over the summer and he was such a delight, but I utterly forgot his name!  I'm so sorry.  He was a pleasure and we enjoyed talking to him each day.  He even wrote us a letter upon departure.  

We desperately hope to revisit one day and would stay nowhere but here.  Thank you !

reviews.title: Magical Stay
reviews.review_text: This was recommended by Blaise Montandon, GM of Four Seasons KL. What an exceptional hotel and spectacular stay. Like the Four Seasons KL the staff is what makes the hotel. From the bell desk (Daniel is the go to man) to the concierge (Juan, Joel, Raul plus more) to Luisa the Guest Experience AM, the staff here go above and beyond. It has been an absolute pleasure to stay here. Highly highly recommended. We stayed here for our landmark wedding anniversary and everything FS Madrid did from Anniversary pillows, bubbly, personal gifts and touches and the bespoke Christmas dessert cannot be described in words. Branka the FB manager and the restaurant staff, so attentive, courteous and warm. Fabulous breakfast. The rooms are well appointed, plush and so private. Amenities and toiletries are fantastic (love the body wash). Set in an old bank and refurbished to the highest standard, this is the place to stay in Madrid. The location is in the heart of everything that is Madrid. So close to all the landmarks. Our stay here was quite magical. Well done FS Madrid!

reviews.title: A great and beautiful  hotel
reviews.review_text: A beautiful building, with paintings at each corner , very comfortable bedrooms, and a perfect service!  Also a great location, at a walking distance from the shopping streets, the teatro real  and the Prado.  Nothing to complain of except that in  our bedroom  (room 677) we could  hardly get any natural light in

reviews.title: Top notch hotel
reviews.review_text: Four Seasons Madrid is extremely impressive.  From the moment you walk into the hotel you are greeted by staff that go above and beyond.  The building is gorgeous and in a great location.  I highly recommend staying here to anyone traveling on business or vacation.

reviews.title: Outsiders not welcome
reviews.review_text:
As Americans spending some time in Madrid, we were offended and disappointed by a hotel chain that has always surprised us with its extreme customer service in every corner of the world: Four Seasons. 

This weekend, taking advantage of the fact that we were passing by the Four Seasons Hotel in Madrid, we decided to go in and have a coffee. From the beginning we felt unwelcome:

- They took a long time to serve us, we had to call someone to come and get us.
- The waiter came and the first thing he asked us was the room number of the hotel, we told him we were not staying there and he quickly changed his attitude.
- He brought us the American coffee and tea we had ordered. It was to be expected that because of the place (and the price, almost 30 euros) they would be served with the appropriate teapot and a pitcher of water for the Americano. But no, everything was served directly in the cups. By the way, the smallest American coffee I have ever had.
- As soon as we finished our drinks, the waiter came over and asked us if he could take everything away, as if he was in a hurry for us to leave.

So that's what we did, we left with the idea of never going back to that place again. Such an attitude and service made us think that maybe the hotel cafeteria is only for guests, but then they should say so from the beginning.

An unfortunate experience in a hotel chain that is known for its elegance and kindness. Sincerely, anywhere in the world except except in Madrid.

Hard Rock Hotel Madrid.description: Hard Rock Hotel Madrid is located next to Atocha train station and across from Reina Sofia National Art Center Museum, in the heart of the exciting city of Madrid. With 161 stylish rooms and suites, the hotel features modern, sleek design with music-inspired touches through décor, art and special brand amenity programs such as Picks, that allows guests to borrow Fender® guitars, Spanish guitars and Ukuleles. For dining and entertainment, the offerings include a lobby bar, terrace dining, a panoramic rooftop bar and private dining. For the warm days, the outdoor pool and garden are the highlight. Amplify your Madrid experience with easy access to art, culture, and the trendy Madrid neighborhoods. Parking is available on site for an extra charge.

reviews.title: Excellent experience!
reviews.review_text: I travel to Europe mainly for business and at the time they booked Hard Rock hotel, I was a little bit reluctant. Well, I was wrong. Hotel is located in a centric area with plenty to see  and visit.  Staff was friendly. Room was quiet and clean. Lobby had the prefect balance between good ambiance and lay back environment. I will definitely come back!

reviews.title: Experience of a Lifetime!
reviews.review_text: This was a wonderful/beautiful experience! The hotel orchestrated my whole engagement with just a budget in mind. They absolutely blew it out of the park and my fiancé was so surprised/happy! I recommend any future engagements/parties/ or even events be planned here. The people is what really made our whole experience! We hope to see them again soon.

reviews.title: Positives - A modern hotel, food is good, staff are pleasant.
reviews.review_text:
Modern hotel in a run down area. 
Hard sell on upgrades, over charges to my credit card.

Staff in Sessions and GMT+1 are excellent as is the food in Sessions.

Rooftop bar was shut more than it was open on the basis it has been raining  / was wet. Really! Put a canopy up there and some heaters and make it a useable space.

The record player and records to the room was a nice touch (upon request). However there is only one small table and one plug socket which meant there was no other space to put anything or charge items.

The fact that there is a bottle opener provided free in the room is standard, why then provide another with a Hardrock logo with a tag that says you can but it for 5 euros!!!! How many do you lose? Pointless exercise in my opinion.

This hotel was special occasion for my niece which failed to meet my expectations. If all Hardrock hotels are like this then I cant see them surviving. I doubt that I will visit any others based on this experience.

reviews.title: One of the best hotels we've stayed in!
reviews.review_text:
100% recommend! We stayed for 2 nights in May and were blown away by the hotel. The rooms were so modern and clean and had everything you could ask for. Comfortable beds, excellent shower etc. 
Staff were unbelievable - due to a delayed flight we didn't check in until almost 2am but were met with smiles and a fantastic service. 
Very gutted we didn't have time to check out the terrace but will be returning for sure! 
Location is great - approx 15 min walk to the main shopping area.

reviews.title: This hotel has zero respect of people and health and safety. It should be avoided at all costs. Stay elsewhere in Madrid
reviews.review_text: This hotel safety in the room is very poor and does not protect the guest at all. Moreover the hotel equally accepts requests for improvements. Incident happened with us, hotel simply dodged us to protect themselves with no respect of their obligations. Stay at your own peri.

Royal Palace of Madrid.address: Calle de Bailen s/n, 28071 Madrid Spain
Royal Palace of Madrid.description: Luxurious, over-the-top rococo palace with over 2,000 opulently gilded rooms.
Royal Palace of Madrid.address_string: Calle de Bailen s/n, 28071 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Don't miss the Royal Palace of Madrid
reviews.review_text:
This is an eight euro taxi ride from the train station and is something you should NOT miss when visiting Madrid.  There is a bit of walking as the palace is huge.  We are seniors and have limited climbing ability, so we asked a guard for instructions, he took us by the hand and put us in a private elevator to the upper floors.  (we thank him)

Be sure to bring a camera, you will be taking dozens if not hundreds of great photos.  

Location ****, entry security ****, cost ****, attractions *****+

reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.review_text: Perfect destination for an afternoon of opulence. Incredible art work, huge rooms showing off the glory of the Spanish empire.

reviews.title: Very much recommended
reviews.review_text:
Beautiful and charming, we nearly didnt have time to visit but lucky and so happy we did.

Dont miss the opportunity
We loved everything

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: One of the most beautiful palaces I've ever been. So much richness, so much gold, so many fresco's. Great stradivarious violin collection. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.review_text:
I had limited time in Madrid and wanted to see the palace.  I could only go at 10am and didn't book in time to get the slot -- so book earlier than 2 weeks in advance.  I took a chance and went an hour early to wait in the standby line.  Well, I was the first one there and didn't even know where to stand, but I got great pictures of the palace without any people in my pictures.  People started lining up at the first building in the courtyard, which is clearly labeled Entrance at 9:30am.  I easily got in, but the line by 10am circled around the courtyard, so don't be late!

I was only able to do the self-guided audio tour, but I thought that was sufficient.  I  enjoyed seeing inside the palace and thought it a good value for the money.

Parque Warner Madrid.address: Autovia A-4, Exit 22, 28330 San Martin de la Vega Spain
Parque Warner Madrid.description:
This place is temporarily closed.

Check our official calendar on our website to confirm the opening days. Theme Park located in the town of San Martín de la Vega, Madrid (Spain). With the fourth highest drop tower in the world and 42 attractions. It was inaugurated on April 5, 2002 and is divided into 5 themed areas set in movie and cartoon scenes produced by Warner Bros. and DC Comics, as well as in various areas of the United States, such as the beaches of California, Los Angeles (including Hollywood studios and the Beverly Hills neighborhood) or New York.
Parque Warner Madrid.address_string: Autovia A-4, Exit 22, 28330 San Martin de la Vega Spain

reviews.title: NOV2024 19°C sunny minimal ride queues - wonderful
reviews.review_text:
Visited on a Sunday early November. All the rides were open apart from the water rides which are seasonal anyway. There was no need to buy fast passes the park was busy but not too busy only one long queue the rest were ten minutes tops. Some were even walk ons.

The park is really clean and tidy and the themeing is really cool and there's so much and in so much detail for example in the queue for the Road Runner coaster there are loads of chalk board plans for how Wiley is going to catch Road Runner with boulders and stuff. You queue up through the daily planet offices, arkham asylum all sorts.

The app is a bit temperamental and hard to translate to English but it's usable and gets you around.

The shows are pretty cool we saw the LAPD stunt show at the end of the day there's loads to choose from.

My only 2 issues were that due to the time of year there wasn't as many food and drink outlets/ restaurants open so the ones that were open had huge queues. Longer queueing for food than rollercoasters so we ate from wherever had no queues. Chocolate waffles and big bags of crisps. We wanted chicken but we'd have lost an hour getting lunch.

Also the merchandise could he better. We did manage to find some cool Parque Warner hoodies but it was all very Warner Bros generic and could have more Parque Warner memorabilia like water bottles/ tshirts/ mugs etc. branded with the rollercoasters or the park.

Only minor faults though. Me 40 two kids 8 and 9 both 135cm+ had a great day out.

Recommend the coach and ticket combo from parque warner website if staying in the city.

reviews.title: Family day out.
reviews.review_text: A good theme to the park but queues were crazy upto 2hrs waiting for the better rides. Spent most the day waiting. Had some extra things on for Halloween but had to pay extra for some. Could buy fast track for rides but that was a fortune and i personally dont think its fair to do that. Food expensive and junk food, but can't take in your own. Long day for not going on many rides due to queues.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
I came here with a group of friends from Portugal and it was just disappointing. All the rides had a 2 hour (at least) waiting line. Two roller coasters broke down several times and one was even closed due to how many times it stopped working. All of these setbacks were announced only in spanish, we only had an idea from what was going on from the people waiting in line explaining it to us. There’s also rides which you have to pay additionally inside the park which is nonsense. I guess the sideshows made up the mess that this day was.

This park might be fun if you have small kids, but if you’re an adult and want to ride the hardcore stuff be ready to wait 2 hours in line and not be able to ride it at all.

I can emphasise on a positive note how safe I felt on just the 2 rides that I was able to get on. The food was expensive but nothing out of this world. There’s a bus from Madrid centre until midnight but we just ended up leaving earlier. There are also a lot of vending/coffee machines located all over the park.

reviews.title: Terrible experience due to huge wait times
reviews.review_text:
Terrible experience. We went on a Saturday and the lines were super long. Everywhere more than 60.minutes if wait !!! What a waste of time. Kids were very disappointed if not furious. Don't go on weekends...
Even buying food took more than 45.mimutes

reviews.title: Upgraded Disney
reviews.review_text: AMAZING! We went on a monday in september, so the lines were small and streets were spacious. The rides and shows are really fun, plus the theme is on point (specially in the Old West)! Very worth it.

reviews.title: The best metro with 12 lines 🚇🚉
reviews.review_text: The metro is a little old,but it’s big and fast.There are 12 metro lines and all of the trains are clean.The metro stations have 2 platforms.

reviews.title: Great Rail System
reviews.review_text: An excellent metro system mostly underground so not good for a view of the area!  Regularly very very busy so prepare to stand. Very regular and very efficient.

reviews.title: Best way to travel in Madrid!
reviews.review_text:
An efficient and well connected system that makes getting around the city incredibly easy. Stations are well-marked and located near major attractions. The trains are generally clean, spacious, and run frequently, especially during peak hours.

It is quite affordable with reasonably priced tickets and various options for day passes, we bought a 4 day pass for our 4 day trip in Madrid.

However, some stations do lack accessibility features, which could be challenging for those with mobility issues. 

But overall, it’s a reliable and affordable way to navigate and imo the best way for tourists.

reviews.title: SERIOUS DISCRIMATION AGAINST PEOPLE WITH MOBILITY ISSUES!!!!!!!!!
reviews.review_text: From Chamartin Station to Airport. Signage terrible at the train station. In addition, it is unbelievable that a metro connection from/to a train station to the Airport, all wagons have four steps up or down. How are people supposed to carry luggage pulling them up or down steps. In addition people with limited mobility or elderly are unable to go up or down those steps. WHO is the genius that decided to use those wagons!!!!!!

reviews.title: Clean, efficient and extremely cheap with Tarjeta Multi
reviews.review_text:
Madrid metro is a great option to travel around Spain capital in a clean, safe and efficient way.
First advice is to buy the Tarjeta Multi card at the machine kiosks at every station. The card itself costs 2,50 Euros, a one time cost, unrefundable. Load your card with 10 viajes (trips) for 6,10 Euros - it means every ride costs 0,61 Eur which is a bargain.
The card works on both, metro and bus and you can easily reload again.
Downside is there's no time limit, so if you need to change metro/bus for one direction you must spend two trips from your card.

Hammam Al Andalus Madrid.description: Hammam Al Ándalus Madrid are the only Arab Baths in Madrid, located in the historic center of the city, close to Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. Our Hammam is the recreation of ancient Arab baths in Al Ándalus. Its decor and ambience created a climate that takes us to a distant past, inviting us to pause in our daily life, to enjoy a moment of relaxation and tranquility. An oasis for relaxation in the heart of Madrid. The Arab Bath consists of a free 90 minutes tour across three baths with different temperatures. Thermal contrasts in water offer relaxation and promote circulation. There is also a steam room and the rest room with a source of tea and the Aromas corner to choose the scent for the relaxing massage, between rose, lavender, violet and red amber. The tour can be completed with our relaxing massages, the Zalema massage or traditional kessa service. Come to Hammam Al Ándalus and immerse yourself in History.

Free Walking Tours Madrid.description: ¡Hola! Come on our 2h30 Free Tour and discover the best overview of Madrid’s history, lifestyle, and tips to make the most out of your visit! Craft Tours Spain promotes tours and activities with young and dynamic tour guides. Our proposal is for you to join the Free Tour of Madrid, and at the end you decide how much the experience was worth for you! :) We meet every day at 11am and Friday and Saturday at 3:30pm at Plaza del Callao, for tours in English and Spanish. We cannot ensure your participation in the tour without a reservation, a 3€ fee will be applied in order to book your spot and secure your tour.

reviews.title: Easy and interesting
reviews.review_text: Miguel did an awesome job of teaching ys about the city - he was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Also, some too recommendation!

reviews.title: Great tour of Madrid
reviews.review_text: Our tour of Madrid was taken by Miguel, who was super friendly, informative and easy to listen to.  He showed us some great sights that we wouldn't have found ourselves.  I think these walking tours are a must and thoroughly recommended. Thank to Miguel 👍

reviews.title: Great way to see Madrid
reviews.review_text:
This walking tour of Madrid was the perfect way to start our visit to Madrid and to get one's bearings.

Miguel, our guide, was very knowledgeable and brought the city to life, sharing so much information about the history of Madrid and Spain.

The tour itself is free - you can (we think "should") give a donation at the end. We gave €20 (€10 each) which we felt was more than deserved. There were about 18 of us in the group. I think almost everyone - if not, everyone - happily gave a good donation.

Would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Must do tour!
reviews.review_text: We did this walking tour in Madrid. Our tour guide, Ian, was excellent at keeping us all engaged. He was knowledgeable, personable, informative, and hilarious. He took us to all of the major tourist points of the city and taught us some interesting facts. He also shared with us his recommendation lists of places to try in Madrid, and we went to many of them after the tour. Everything was perfect. This is a must do if you are in Madrid!

reviews.title: The best experience I've ever had in a walking tour.
reviews.review_text:
Be careful with Miguel! You’re going to fall in love with his way, haha. I did the walking tour on November 8, 2024, and it was the best way to get to know Madrid. Besides being very fun and friendly, he keeps the entire walking tour interesting. He truly knows everything about the city and is funny. I would recommend his walking tour to everyone. If you want to discover unique places in Madrid that usually go unnoticed, Miguel is the answer.

Madrid is beautiful people are really friendly.

Parque Madrid Rio.address: Paseo de la Ermita del Santo 14-16, 28011 Madrid Spain
Parque Madrid Rio.address_string: Paseo de la Ermita del Santo 14-16, 28011 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Better in Warmer Weather
reviews.review_text: Probably best to go in the summer when there is more to see.  It was a LONG walk from one end to the other with small stops along with way with some parks and bridges.  A nice afternoon if you got several days in Madrid and want to venture out to another park area besides Retiro Park.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.review_text: Parque Madrid Rio is a wonderful park area that's most definitely well worth checking out if you're in the area, either side of the River Manzanares ( more a trickle than a river ) its a great urban park area with lovely well kept park lands ,water features and two great looking bridges to admire namely Puerto De Toledo and Puerto De Prago ,its an area population with walkers,joggers and cyclists and is a beautiful walk ,best views are from the bridges ,all in all its a great park area to check out if you're in the area or planning a holiday to Madrid.

reviews.title: Great time
reviews.review_text: For a capital city Madrid is pretty relaxed. It feels safe and the traffic volumes are pretty low with many electric vehicles, which helps. Wonderful architecture, good food. plenty of parks. Taxis and busses were relatively cheap. I did not use the underground. In October temperatures were still in 31-35 C range so probably not a place to visit. in July/Aug

reviews.title: Nice area for a walk.
reviews.review_text: There are plenty of benches and paths for walking. Not very much shade, so if very sunny or hot, be prepared for the weather conditions.  It was very clean when we were visiting.

reviews.title: Much Better!
reviews.review_text:
The park has undergone extensive renovations to make it the impressive space it is today.  There is something for pretty much everyone, whether it’s enjoying the gardens, walking a dog, or just taking a leisurely stroll.

Tip:  early morning is quite peaceful.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
This could have been a fun experience, however the website provides incorrect hours for the exhibits. According to the website, the exhibit we were interested had morning hours on our day (10:00-13:00). However, when we arrived at the exhibit, the hours are only in the evening (17:00-20:30). It was a waste of our morning as we could have planned something else to do, but no longer had the opportunity as we had an early afternoon train.

I will admit that it was a fabulous reinvention of the historic space.

reviews.title: Former slaughterhouse now an arts and food center
reviews.review_text: Interesting multi-use plaçe in a cool part of town.  Wonderful that it was not destroyed for urban renewal.  We did not have time to att3nd a concert of dançe,performance, but ate at a restaurant.

reviews.title: Cool Hang Out with Food, Shows
reviews.review_text: We only ended up here because we happened to be staying nearby. If you are in the neighbourhood and are looking for a place to chill for a while, this is pretty cool. There is a restaurant inside and they host shows/ music at night. There’s an open courtyard with some interesting architecture to explore and places to sit and relax away from the busy streets.

reviews.title: bad tiiming
reviews.review_text: The place is quaint, far away from the city center... we just didn't get it.  There wasn't a lot going on,  the staff was not the friendliest so it was hard to figure out what to do.  There were a few exhibits,  but for some you had to buy tickets, for others you didn't...  lots of empty space.... we just didn't get it!

reviews.title: A place of contrasts
