reviews.review_text: Goes from a windswept desert in midwinter to a vibrant experimental cultural centre when the sun shines.....with its theatres, exhibitions, cineteca, cafés. and outdoor life.

SANDEMANs New Europe - Madrid.address: Plaza Mayor Paraguas rojo frente a la oficina de Turismo, 28012 Madrid Spain
SANDEMANs New Europe - Madrid.description: Offering free walking tours of some of the best cities in Europe and the Middle East, SANDEMANs NEW Europe is the best way to start your stay.
SANDEMANs New Europe - Madrid.address_string: Plaza Mayor Paraguas rojo frente a la oficina de Turismo, 28012 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: A must do
reviews.review_text: Great tour with our knowledgeable and friendly guide Jovan. He gave lots of history and information about Madrid today. Well worth it ( of course we tipped!)

reviews.title: Great tour with Joaquin
reviews.review_text: Great tour with Joaquin in Madrid, he's very knowledgeable, clearly passionate about history, funny and had great suggestions

reviews.title: Nice walking tour
reviews.review_text: Sebastian was patient to tell the history of the attractions on the walking tour. He tried to find shaded areas for us to stay while explaining. (37 degrees throughout the week I stayed) It’s good that he recommended some nice restaurants in Madrid.

reviews.title: SANDEMANs never disappoints⭐️
reviews.review_text: Again, another brilliant introduction to a city. Sebastian was a fab guide, armed with facts and the obligatory Sandeman sense of humour. A snippet of the city, a peak into history & a great start to the day. Do it⭐️

reviews.title: It’s a huge complex!
reviews.review_text: The convention centre is located close to the airport and its huge. It has about 10 different areas for multiple conferences.

reviews.title: Poor
reviews.review_text:
This event has the most ridiculous entrance procedures which does take ove 60 to go truth security 
Definitely the best they do have a lot to learn compared to similar event like London or Berlim

reviews.title: A fantastic convention center.
reviews.review_text:
This is a fantastic convention center, where we attended two events - Desafio Dali (pavilion 5.1 - an interactive journey through Dali's life) and El Mago Yunke (pavilion 1 - a fantastic magic show).
The convention center is easily accessible by Metro (Feria de Madrid station).

reviews.title: Terrific Tutankhamun Exhibit
reviews.review_text:
For those who cannot make it to Egypt this year, do make a trip to the Tutankhamun Exhibit, which includes a plethora of fine examples of Egyptian art, history and traditions. The exhibit is impressive given its scale, with a large swath of objects from various time periods and beautifully exhibited sets.
The exhibit is large scale and offers a glimpse into the awesome age of the power of Egypt.
IFEMA itself is easy to find and has plenty of parking.

reviews.title: Good venue for the ARCOMadrid art fair
reviews.review_text:
We visited IFEMA in late-February and found it a spacious, clean, and comfortable venue for the for the ARCOMadrid art fair.  The venue is large enough for displays from over 200 galleries (33% from Spain, the rest from other countries), including the works of over 1,300 artists.  Most of the art is contemporaneous and very modern.  Even for those of us who were merely window shopping, it was a great experience.

Located on the northeastern outskirts of the city, near the airport, IFEMA can be reached by car, bus, and metro.

Madrid Airport Transfers.description: Madrid Airport Transfers provide pre-arranged taxi transfers in private hire vehicles from Madrid Barajas airport to your accommodation in Madrid, Segovia, Toledo, and any other accommodations in and around Madrid. Pre-book your Madrid Airport Transfer without paying anything in advance. Just pay the driver when you arrive at your accommodation in Madrid. Your driver will meet you at Barajas Airport arrivals. All of our transfers are pre-booked online. We are not affiliated with the standard white taxis at Barajas Airport. Madrid Airport Transfers use fully licensed taxi and private transfer vehicles that are registered in Madrid. We take you to any location in Madrid city by transfer and back to Madrid Airport for your return transfer.

reviews.title: Pre payment weirdness
reviews.review_text:
The actual taxi service: amazing and 5 stars. We booked a car for the Madrid Airport to Toledo: the driver and experience was on time, professional, and perfect.

I'm docking a point on this review because of the payment process. In big letters at the top of https://madridairporttaxis.com/ it says "book now and pay later", and this message is repeated in several other locations. This is not accurate: my trip required pre-payment. Worse yet, there is no payment integrated with the web site, and the email they send to request payment looks a lot like a scam. I'm from USA so I had to make a couple international calls to verify it was legit. 

Also note: https://madridairporttaxis.com is one and the same as SOLHOP, and this is who I was able to speak to.

reviews.title: Highly recommended.
reviews.review_text: We booked our transfer from airport. Great service. Clean van. The driver is on time and courteous. We’ll use again for our our return transfer to airport.

reviews.title: Excellent airport transfer to our hotel
reviews.review_text: Our driver, Jesus, was well-dressed and very professional. He was there when we arrived, helped us with our luggage and guided us through the Madrid airport. The Mercedes van was nice and super-clean. Jesus offered us water and provided a smooth ride to our hotel. When we arrived, he went inside and got the porter to help with the luggage. He was very kind and pleasant. We highly recommend!

reviews.title: Airport-hotel-airport transfer in Madrid
reviews.review_text: Excellent service, they were punctual and very professional. Highly recommended. Their booking site is very easy to navigate and receive confirmation in very little time. They respond to emails, the communication is great.

reviews.title: Excellent transfer experience
reviews.review_text: This  service made my arrival in Madrid very easy.  I was kept informed about the driver and pickup point for my transfer via WhatsApp, starting the day before my pickup and continuing until I connected with the driver at the Madrid airport. The driver, Carlos, was on time, holding a sign with my name. He confirmed my name and hotel destination, then took my bags and led me to the car which was just a short walk from the terminal. He didn’t speak English, but that wasn’t a problem at all. Carlos is an excellent driver. My hotel was in an awkward location in a square and cars can’t pull right up to the front. Carlos skillfully backed the car up through a small side street so he could get me as close to the hotel door as possible. He took my bags and led me to the hotel doorman. The service was wonderfully efficient. I had a few communications with them at the time of booking and their replies were prompt and thorough. I would definitely use this service again and recommend it to others.

Madrid.description: So many of Madrid’s buildings look like castles, you’ll think you’ve stumbled into a fairytale. Even City Hall is astounding, with its white pinnacles and neo-Gothic features. A self-guided architecture tour can begin by the great bear statue in the central Puerta del Sol. Wander by the fanciful Royal Palace before absorbing the natural beauty of Retiro Park, then visit one of the city’s many museums. You could happily cap off each day by nibbling on forkfuls of paella while sipping Spanish rioja.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with great location
reviews.review_text: Everything in the hotel was extremely good. The staff was very polite, friendly and able to always help; rooms were extremely comfortable and well insulated sound and temperature wise; the bed was very good and the overall space was extremely pleasant and the best part is the location. Extremely easy to go to anywhere in Madrid.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, excellent service and location
reviews.review_text: I highly recommend this hotel, it is beautiful, the service is excellent  and the location is great, close to the main attractions!

reviews.title: Good food and service!
reviews.review_text: Great food, fun drinks, nice atmosphere/cute space. Joselin our waiteress was so nice to us english speakers! Would go again!

Royal Palace of Madrid.address: Calle de Bailen s/n, 28071 Madrid Spain
Royal Palace of Madrid.description: Luxurious, over-the-top rococo palace with over 2,000 opulently gilded rooms.
Royal Palace of Madrid.address_string: Calle de Bailen s/n, 28071 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Don't miss the Royal Palace of Madrid
reviews.review_text:
This is an eight euro taxi ride from the train station and is something you should NOT miss when visiting Madrid.  There is a bit of walking as the palace is huge.  We are seniors and have limited climbing ability, so we asked a guard for instructions, he took us by the hand and put us in a private elevator to the upper floors.  (we thank him)

Be sure to bring a camera, you will be taking dozens if not hundreds of great photos.  

Location ****, entry security ****, cost ****, attractions *****+

reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.review_text: Perfect destination for an afternoon of opulence. Incredible art work, huge rooms showing off the glory of the Spanish empire.

reviews.title: Very much recommended
reviews.review_text:
Beautiful and charming, we nearly didnt have time to visit but lucky and so happy we did.

Dont miss the opportunity
We loved everything

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: One of the most beautiful palaces I've ever been. So much richness, so much gold, so many fresco's. Great stradivarious violin collection. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Worth a visit
reviews.review_text:
I had limited time in Madrid and wanted to see the palace.  I could only go at 10am and didn't book in time to get the slot -- so book earlier than 2 weeks in advance.  I took a chance and went an hour early to wait in the standby line.  Well, I was the first one there and didn't even know where to stand, but I got great pictures of the palace without any people in my pictures.  People started lining up at the first building in the courtyard, which is clearly labeled Entrance at 9:30am.  I easily got in, but the line by 10am circled around the courtyard, so don't be late!

I was only able to do the self-guided audio tour, but I thought that was sufficient.  I  enjoyed seeing inside the palace and thought it a good value for the money.

The Principal Madrid.address: Calle Marques De Valdeiglesias, 1, 28004 Madrid Spain
The Principal Madrid.description: The Principal Madrid Hotel is much more than a luxurious modern boutique hotel. Its prime location in the heart of Madrid, its exclusive entrance, its 76 elegantly appointed rooms, the stunning Terraza (rooftop terrace,7th floor) with what may be the best views in Madrid, and its Ático (penthouse, 6th floor) where avant-garde haute cuisine meets classic cocktails in a space with the best music are reasons enough not to miss the opportunity of discovering this renovated building, now one of the capital’s must-see sights. The hotel’s impressive Ático and Terraza boast the best panoramic views of downtown Madrid. In both, amid large, lush garden areas, you can sip a cocktail or order from the menu concocted by Ramón Freixa (2 Michelin stars), soak up some sun in the Solarium or enjoy the sound of the overflow pool and the best ambient music or our outdoor showers in summer… and always with the finest service to ensure that your every wish is granted.
The Principal Madrid.address_string: Calle Marques De Valdeiglesias, 1, 28004 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Wonderful place to be in Madrid
reviews.review_text:
The Principal is a hotel with a lot of charm and style and - even more important - with a professional as well as very kind and focused staff.
The restaurant Atico is also worth staying for dinner there.
The hotel is perfectly located for visiting Madrid by foot.
Why also not five points? Well, for me five points mean that everything is more than perfect, especially for a 5 ***** hotel like The Principal. But: We will come back, in any case.

reviews.title: Wonderful city .. wonderful hotel.
reviews.review_text:
In a word “Wonderful”
Everyone was terrific!
Fabulous location.
Great food, great breakfast  and lovely terrace for an evening drink. 
We wish you the best if you are able to stay at this location.  We certainly were treated very well. 
We recommend it.

reviews.title: The loveliest stay!
reviews.review_text: Wonderful stay. Rooms are super comfortable and elevated. The staff was very accommodating to our every need and the most friendly. The hotel location is quiet while still a short walk to main sites, restaurants and shopping in Madrid. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text:
Great experience.  Awesome from the start.  Though a small lift/elevator, there were no waits and a really cool spiral staircase that was more fun than the lift. 
 It is a beautiful building retrofitted to a wonderful hotel with amazing Terrace views. 
 
Concierge was excellent and really made the experience enjoyable.  Terrific cocktails at the bar and on the terrace.  Love the place (towel warmers in the bathroom!) and would highly recommend to others. - Mike

reviews.title: Loved it here
reviews.review_text:
Wow - this hotel is perfect for Madrid exploring - I will return! 

Special mentions to the hotel staff:
Sergio at breakfast 
Luis on the door getting me transportation sorted 
Viorel was excellent - so helpful and always friendly to everyone.

The bar patio is just ace and the rooms all are beautiful - I miss the place already!

reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel in a fantastic location
reviews.review_text: Loved our time staying here for the first time in Madrid! We could walk to so many restaurants and shops from this location. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Great cocktail bar and nice breakfast.  It was clean and comfortable. We would absolutely stay here again!

reviews.title: Beautiful & Cosy Stay
reviews.review_text: This hotel is not just one of the most beautiful I have stayed at so far, but it definitively has the most wonderful service I experienced! Everbody in the hotel is charming and very attentive. The breakfast is fantastic and so are the drinks at the bar!

reviews.title: Madrid hotel at its best
reviews.review_text: Great experience! Authentic design, very good service, comfortable room. The hotel is perfectly located for all kind of excursions. The staff was very friendly and professional. The recommendations for nearby coffee shops and restaurants had been very helpful

reviews.title: What a trip
reviews.review_text: In the center of the city, only the YOU Boutique Hotel Madrid provides a distinctive and fashionable stay. It is a unique option because of its stylish furnishings, first-rate service, and comfortable accommodations. Additionally, its proximity to a dispensary(stonerpharmdispensaryonline.com) makes it more convenient for people who want to unwind and explore. I heartily endorse this treasure!

reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Madrid
reviews.review_text:
Wonderful service and a super-clean junior suite.  The location was also great, with shops & bars all within a block or two.... I would recommend to anyone that wants to have an stress-free visit to Madrid.

Staff from the front office to the maid service were all very kind.

ARTIEM Madrid.address: Calle Juan Perez Zuniga, 20, 28027 Madrid Spain
ARTIEM Madrid.address_string: Calle Juan Perez Zuniga, 20, 28027 Madrid Spain

reviews.title: Excellent in service and value
reviews.review_text: Guests are friendly, rooms are spacious and clean, comfortable, free of charge snack and drink offer was amazing. Location is not bad but need to take metro to major tourist attractions. Great value for money.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.review_text:
Exquisite hotel.
Super comfy beds, excellent shower quality, the shower amenities are really nice and amazing smell.
They have a delicious breakfast and also an area where you can grab some snacks, fruits, coffee, sparking water for free - that was REALLY handy!

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.review_text:
Staff are very helpful and friendly. Location is very good with a short walk to metro station and a bus stop right in front. Area is very quiet and tranquil. Although some construction is currently happening during the day. Hotel is kept very clean and the room is spotless. On offer are light snacks, coffee, tea and bottled nonalcoholic drinks 24/7 which is very comfortable, alcohol drinks also available at a small fee. Room was a good size and quiet. Underground parking is available, tight but not impossible. Very competitive pricing.
Only gripes were that the heat turned off during the night and the Wi-Fi was a bit hit and miss at times.
Would still gladly return.

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.review_text: Nothing unique or special that would warrant a return. Grab and go is a good idea sadly it seems poorly executed, with no consideration for the customer and how they travel through the hotel from room to door. I called reception multiple times after leaving the hotel, each call went unanswered (rang until the dial tone disconnected), which is fairly unacceptable. Per night cost was higher than the Meliá Avenida America (where my colleagues were staying), which was a premium hotel experience. I would not recommend this place to a colleague.

reviews.title: Thank you
reviews.review_text: We really enjoyed our stay here, excellent staff and comfortable room and bed,, we are looking forward to returning one day soon.

Dear Hotel Madrid.description:
Welcome to Dear hotel,the new design boutique hotel in Madrid’s downtown,with astonishing views over Gran Via and Plaza de Espana.At floor 14th,Nice to meet you Restaurant&Lounge features a panoramic terrace,360º views and a sky pool.Contemporary cuisine in a cosmopolitan and relaxed ambience,cocktails and DJ music.
Located in Gran Via 80, 10 min walk to Palacio Real and 15 to Plaza Mayor or Puerta del Sol

reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location - recommend!
reviews.review_text: Lovely boutique hotel, well designed rooms, comfortable bed, coffee and tea facilities (a must!), great shower and temperature in room just right.  Suggest an extra blanket in cupboard as duvet still summer one we think, but it was fine. Staff all excellent from check in to check out.  Great breakfasts, friendly attentive staff and great views of city and Royal Palace.  We would return definitely!

reviews.title: Lovely rooms, tasty breakfast and friendly helpful staff.
reviews.review_text:
My son and I had a wonderful city break in Madrid and chose Dear Hotel Madrid as it’s situated in the centre of everything allowing us to explore Madrid on foot and only needing to use the Metro for our return trip to the airport and to visit The Real Madrid Stadium. 

Our room had everything we needed and the breakfast room had splendid views and tasty breakfast options to keep us full for most of the day. 

The staff were friendly and willing to put right any mistakes, which unfortunately on our first morning during breakfast there was a long delay with our cooked order but staff made up for it on our last 2 days. Elena who covers reception was extremely friendly and helpful and willing to take as much time as required to help us to access our smart television as we were having connection issues. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Madrid.

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.review_text:
We had a wonderfull stay in Dear Hotel Madrid. Adrian from reception upgrade our room for a higher category (and also for anice terrace), but the weather in Madrid was not that good to enjoy it. Sunset in the rooftop bar was also very nice (just a little bit crowded during the sunset).

I will come back again for sure.

Julia.

reviews.title: Comfortable Stay in Madrid
reviews.review_text: We loved this hotel, super convenient location in the center of Madrid, the rooms are comfy, and the staff is super friendly. Elena at the front desk deserves a super shout-out for being extremely helpful and giving us great tips for dining and places to go. It has a great rooftop and great views of Madrid's city center. The pool is only a dipping pool, so don't hold your breath on that one, but it's good for that Instagram shot. We didn't dine in the restaurant, so can't give an opinion on that, but the room was well stocked with everything you might need, and there is a water fountain on every floor to fill up your water bottles. Overall a great stay, the only thing to be aware is that it is right on Gran Via, so you will definitely hear the sirens at night.

reviews.title: Amazing stay!
reviews.review_text: Wow! What an amazing place this is! From the upscale food and drinks (check out the rooftop bar at sunset. Superb!. To the top notch staff. They will make you feel at home at all times. Hey, a special shoutout to my mainman, mr. Alvaro, for sorting our transportation out in no time. Kudos, Madrid!

BLESS Hotel Madrid.description: Located in the heart of the sophisticated Salamanca district, right in the Golden Mile, BLESS Hotel Madrid is situated in one of the most exclusive areas of the capital. Alongside the hotel are fashion boutiques, luxury restaurants, and art galleries, making the hotel a hub of elegance and style. The building housing BLESS Hotel Madrid is a prime example of classic Madrid architecture, giving it a unique character that seamlessly blends history and modernity.

reviews.title: NO TEMPERATURE CONTROL IN ROOMS BAD EXPERIENCE
reviews.review_text:
This hotel has a big issue with the room temperature. They don’t allow you to change the temperature from the room, you have to call the front desk and then they call some other department. So each time you feel the temperature isn’t right, for example at 1:00 am when your small child is sleeping in the room, you have to make a phone call that may wake everyone up instead of using the thermostat on the wall. They do have one, but it’s fake. It doesn’t actually change the temperature. 

On our first night here the room was almost 23 degrees. After thinking I could change it myself and it waiting a few hours wondering why it wouldn’t work, I called. They then lowered it. An hour later my room was 18 degrees and we were freezing. I called again and they explained they are the ones that can change it, not you in your own room where you’re sleeping. The man was very rude.By then it was already 11:00 pm and we couldn’t sleep due to the ridiculous temperatures. They said they would set it at 20. 

Another hour goes by and the temperature is still 18.5 which is about 64 Fahrenheit. I call again, still unable to sleep and they say again they’re going to adjust it. Then a few minutes later someone knocks on my door, past midnight, asking if I called for an issue with the tv!!! Meanwhile the issue I did have wasn’t being resolved. 

I would caution guests to not stay here if they want to sleep at all. It has been an absolute nightmare.

The hotel is also mostly catering to people from outside so if you need a table at the rooftop or at the lobby restaurant you have absolutely no priority being a hotel guest. In fact if you are a guest waiting in the lobby for any reason, they will tell you very rudely to move because the tables are reserved for outsiders who have reservations and you can’t sit there to wait for your taxi even though they don’t have any other seating for their own guests.

Every single decent hotel I have stayed at gives its guests priority for all hotel amenities. This place has no idea what customer service means for a luxury hotel, which clearly they are not.

reviews.title: Spectacular hotel and experience
reviews.review_text: My family and I had a wonderful visit. The hotel is elegant but not stuffy, and the staff are terrific. The rooftop has wonderful views and is great for coffee, cocktails and dinner. The lobby area is also great place to visit and relax. Also special shoutout to the concierge team. They secured museum tickets and made excellent restaurant recommendations.  It may be our favorite hotel experience ever.

reviews.title: Best Guest Experience Department
reviews.review_text: There are many good things about this hotel including its location, cleanliness, restaurants, nice staff and many more. But my experience in this hotel is different which made me to thank its management and also Guest Experience Department specifically Cristina and Lidia. We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and on November 8th we left to Istanbul to spend several days there. The day after we arrived in Istanbul I realized that I left one of my Hermes bags in our room at the hotel. I was so disappointed but called the hotel and put the Massage for Guest service and unbelievably they answered me that they found my bag🥹. Also they told me that they can keep it for 2 months or arrange with a shipping company to send it to me. I’m a frequent traveler all over the world and absolutely It was one of my best experiences. One more time I want to thank Bless hotel management and staff, specifically dear Cristina and Lidia at Guest experience department.

reviews.title: Lovely stay in the heart of Madrid
reviews.review_text: Excellent service, from check-in, to valet/bell staff, to housekeeping, and checkout. This is great location for accessing great restaurants and shops. Beautiful accommodations with extraordinary amenities. Wish I could have stayed longer than one night!

reviews.title: Excellent hotel - a soundproof stay.
reviews.review_text:
Excellent location. We had a room facing the entrance street. Very, very soundproof.
Nice and friendly staff. The light in the restaurant could be adjusted especially in the evening. Otherwise a very good hotel experience and we will return!
Carl C

Parque Warner Madrid.address: Autovia A-4, Exit 22, 28330 San Martin de la Vega Spain
Parque Warner Madrid.description:
This place is temporarily closed.

Check our official calendar on our website to confirm the opening days. Theme Park located in the town of San Martín de la Vega, Madrid (Spain). With the fourth highest drop tower in the world and 42 attractions. It was inaugurated on April 5, 2002 and is divided into 5 themed areas set in movie and cartoon scenes produced by Warner Bros. and DC Comics, as well as in various areas of the United States, such as the beaches of California, Los Angeles (including Hollywood studios and the Beverly Hills neighborhood) or New York.
Parque Warner Madrid.address_string: Autovia A-4, Exit 22, 28330 San Martin de la Vega Spain

reviews.title: NOV2024 19°C sunny minimal ride queues - wonderful
reviews.review_text:
Visited on a Sunday early November. All the rides were open apart from the water rides which are seasonal anyway. There was no need to buy fast passes the park was busy but not too busy only one long queue the rest were ten minutes tops. Some were even walk ons.

The park is really clean and tidy and the themeing is really cool and there's so much and in so much detail for example in the queue for the Road Runner coaster there are loads of chalk board plans for how Wiley is going to catch Road Runner with boulders and stuff. You queue up through the daily planet offices, arkham asylum all sorts.

The app is a bit temperamental and hard to translate to English but it's usable and gets you around.

The shows are pretty cool we saw the LAPD stunt show at the end of the day there's loads to choose from.

My only 2 issues were that due to the time of year there wasn't as many food and drink outlets/ restaurants open so the ones that were open had huge queues. Longer queueing for food than rollercoasters so we ate from wherever had no queues. Chocolate waffles and big bags of crisps. We wanted chicken but we'd have lost an hour getting lunch.

Also the merchandise could he better. We did manage to find some cool Parque Warner hoodies but it was all very Warner Bros generic and could have more Parque Warner memorabilia like water bottles/ tshirts/ mugs etc. branded with the rollercoasters or the park.

Only minor faults though. Me 40 two kids 8 and 9 both 135cm+ had a great day out.

Recommend the coach and ticket combo from parque warner website if staying in the city.

reviews.title: Family day out.
reviews.review_text: A good theme to the park but queues were crazy upto 2hrs waiting for the better rides. Spent most the day waiting. Had some extra things on for Halloween but had to pay extra for some. Could buy fast track for rides but that was a fortune and i personally dont think its fair to do that. Food expensive and junk food, but can't take in your own. Long day for not going on many rides due to queues.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.review_text:
I came here with a group of friends from Portugal and it was just disappointing. All the rides had a 2 hour (at least) waiting line. Two roller coasters broke down several times and one was even closed due to how many times it stopped working. All of these setbacks were announced only in spanish, we only had an idea from what was going on from the people waiting in line explaining it to us. There’s also rides which you have to pay additionally inside the park which is nonsense. I guess the sideshows made up the mess that this day was.

This park might be fun if you have small kids, but if you’re an adult and want to ride the hardcore stuff be ready to wait 2 hours in line and not be able to ride it at all.

I can emphasise on a positive note how safe I felt on just the 2 rides that I was able to get on. The food was expensive but nothing out of this world. There’s a bus from Madrid centre until midnight but we just ended up leaving earlier. There are also a lot of vending/coffee machines located all over the park.

reviews.title: Terrible experience due to huge wait times
reviews.review_text:
Terrible experience. We went on a Saturday and the lines were super long. Everywhere more than 60.minutes if wait !!! What a waste of time. Kids were very disappointed if not furious. Don't go on weekends...
Even buying food took more than 45.mimutes

reviews.title: Upgraded Disney
reviews.review_text: AMAZING! We went on a monday in september, so the lines were small and streets were spacious. The rides and shows are really fun, plus the theme is on point (specially in the Old West)! Very worth it.

Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen.address: 90 Folly Road Blvd Suite B-4, Charleston, SC 29407
Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen.description: Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen is a tribute to Florence Powell, the Great Grandmother of Jonathan and Patrick Kish of 82 Queen Restaurant established in 1982. Florence Mosley was born in 1908 in Charleston and worked at The American Tobacco Company’s Cigar Factory, where she met and married Plant Manager Jesse Powell. They enjoyed their life in the Lowcountry, crabbing, fishing, visiting the Limehouse Farmers Market on Wapoo road, and creating delicious home-cooked southern meals. They passed their recipes down to their granddaughter Tyler Kish, wife to Steve Kish chef/owner of 82 Queen. Florence and Jesse’s favorite dishes to cook were Deviled Crab Cakes, Seafood Gumbo, and Johnny Cakes. For every holiday Florence would make her famous punch, which we now served and call Grannies Punch.

reviews.title: Good food, underperforming bar with no personality
reviews.review_text: Worst bartenders in history, but decent food. On the top of the list is Mel, so full of herself it’s painful…. You’re on James Island, there’s nothing special about you! Succeed in a large city… wait that’s impossible. It’s hilarious how small city people think they’re competent for a major metro… NOPE

reviews.title: NO LONGER THE FLORENCE'S LOWCOUNTRY KITCHEN WE ONCE LOVED!
reviews.review_text:
How the mighty have indeed tumbled! Remember when FLK was the place to be, nestled in that charming strip mall at Windermere and Folly Road (near Osaka Japanese Restaurant)? With a hip menu, a crowd that looked like they stepped out of a magazine, and service that was as smooth as butter, dining there was always a delight.

Then, just like that, they closed up shop. Cue the sad trombone.

But wait! They reopened, five miles down the road in what used to be a Mexican restaurant. We were thrilled, albeit a bit confused. We made the trek a few times, only to notice the vibe had shifted. Where did all the customers go? The food still held its own, but something felt... off.

Today, we decided to give it another shot. We ordered the Lowcountry Shrimp Dip to share, and the Gumbo and Smashburger for mains.

- The dip? Pretty tasty.
- The burger and fries? Saltier than a sailor on shore leave.
- And the gumbo? Oh boy, it was a culinary tragedy—a barely seasoned tomato soup with a sprinkle of Andouille sausage. We should've sent it back and demanded a redo!

The only reason we ever ventured this far down Folly Road was for Gillie's Seafood (now sadly closed) or Rita's in Folly Beach. At this rate, we can’t see ourselves making that trip again. It’s a shame to see
FLK go downhill in our opinion.

reviews.title: Mediocre
reviews.review_text: We went twice while on vacation so that tells you it wasn’t terrible. Pros:  the shrimp in all the dishes we had was so good!  The apple cobbler was fabulous, but the bread pudding needed to be warmer. They offered a special of scallops and caviar that my husband loved. The green bean side dish was really good. Cons:  the fried tomatoes were not good at all, and the Seafood Florentine was cold and “gluey”.    I couldn’t even eat it and had the flavors been better I would have asked to have them warm it up. Pecan pie was ok. Service is good.

reviews.title: I love Florence’s
reviews.review_text:
Casual dining with friends. 
They use to serve a great Ruben sandwich at the Windermere location. 
I look forward to it when they get there feet up under them on James Island

reviews.title: STILL JUST AS GOOD AS OLD LOCATION
reviews.review_text:
One of our go-to spots before they closed and finally re-opened in the old Jalisco Restaurant last December.

Happy to discover that its new incarnation is just as good as the last, the food choices are innovative and delicious (not to mention not Charleston expensive like most places) and the Bloody Mary's are still terrific.

Added benefit is the larger outside dining area, which was perfect the day we visited (and they allow dogs).

Can't wait to go back.

Only glitch was that the credit card charge still says Jalisco.

reviews.title: The chicken is always good the sides ok . I give the food 8/10
reviews.review_text: I got a to go order and I purposely didn’t tip the waiter .When I got the receipt the waitress had tipped herself Not good! The chicken is good but the servers need to do a better job and NOT STILL TIPS FROM CUSTOMERS I CALLED  AND COMPLAINED !!!

reviews.title: Wow Mac and cheese. WOW yam chicken.
reviews.review_text: Our first time here after hearing for years how good it is. So the Mac and cheese is one of the best I ever had and I have had a lot. Fried chicken was excellent.  Couple people got the yam chicken, no empty plates there. There was collar greens butter corn black eye peas.  All very good. Now keep in mind this is a lunch place, when we got there they were out of a couple items.  But dinner did not disappoint. They have some liquor but we were not there to drink.  Small beer selection but again it’s family night.  Server was very friendly. Food was hot and fresh. So we will go here again.

reviews.title: Delicious!
reviews.review_text: My husband and I tried Florence's for the first time this afternoon and everything was delicious!  We both had fried chicken and between us, our sides were cabbage, yams, mashed potatoes/gravy, dressing (Tues. special), and side salads.  The gravy was a little underseasoned but other than that everything was a homerun!  We had been wanting to try Florence's for a while, and we were so happy to have such a good home-cooked meal.  My mother-in-law always made fried chicken with the smallest fryers she could find.  I remember her complaining when it started getting hard to find fryers that weren't too big.  They are called 'fryers' for a reason...the small birds are tender and fry up perfectly.  The chicken pieces at Florence's may be smaller than at other restaurants...but they are cooked perfectly just like my MIL used to make!  YUM!!!!

reviews.title: LONG WAIT, COLD FOOD AND BAD SERVICE
reviews.review_text: Monday at 11:00 am we arrived we were seated quickly and placed our order.  We waited for over 2 1/2 hours for our food to arrive!!! When we asked about our order the waitress argued with us, NO APPOLOGY!!!  When the food finally arrived, it was cold and no mashed potatoes or bread.  I will never eat there again!!!

reviews.title: Great Fried Chicken
reviews.review_text: 5. Great fried chicken and all the fixings. Not fancy. Clean, neat and simply great food! Best fried chicken in this area!

reviews.title: Unacceptable Lack of Communication and Poor Customer Service
reviews.review_text: I am extremely disappointed with the experience we had at Florence Restaurant  today. We had tickets for a Greek music evening, and upon arrival, we were informed by the manager that the concert had been canceled. No one bothered to call us or inform us about the cancellation in advance. And there was no mention about cancellation on their FB or Instagram. This lack of communication and consideration is unacceptable and has left a very bad impression. I would not recommend this place to anyone expecting reliable service and proper customer care.

reviews.title: Highest praises to the Chef
reviews.review_text: The food was fantastically tasty. Elsewhere something might be tasty something not, but here, everything is ecstatic. The highest praises to the Chef.

reviews.title: Wedding in June
reviews.review_text:
Do NOT go to this restaurant,I went to a wedding there in June and everyone got sick.
They had the air conditioning basting cold air, and everyone had a sore throat the next day, two days later, we all had coughs. Who knows when they cleaned their a/c unit or changed the filters. I ended up with a bacterial infection, white mucus, and I needed a puffer so I could breath. These 3rd world countries have no idea how to do maintenance on their buildings.

reviews.title: Everything was great !!!
reviews.review_text: Luxurious and comfortable halls with delicious cuisine and high quality service. Everything was really high level, thank you.

reviews.title: Good for a wedding party
reviews.review_text:
I have been here for a wedding party.
The closed hall was very big and convenient for a big party.
Food was very good and service too. The music and entertainment also were good.

reviews.title: Delicious seafood pasta
reviews.review_text:
Delicious food (I had “Wayne’s Special which is lobster sauce with penne), swift service, and a nice atmosphere. Credit card payment is possible, which is a rare treat. 

The ambiance could be enhanced by the waiters not wearing street clothes but rather having a sort of uniform, but no big deal.

reviews.title: Yummy yummy for my tummy
reviews.review_text:
What can I say but awesome.
Stopped for a drink, a view, fresh air and the best seafood ever.
The carpaccio is still hands down the best and the Lobster kebab  cannot be compared with anything anywhere.
So relax and enjoy.

reviews.title: Reservation Sunday lunch
reviews.review_text: Booked Sunday lunch with hubby, ordered in advance as recommended after the first bad experience for not booking. Arrived on time, got two seats in the blazing sun with plenty spaces in the shade. At last placed in 2 reserved seats in the shade. Ordered lobster kebab 1kg, only to be informed that the lobster chosen for us weighs more than 1 kg and the price is 40% higher?  We had excellent lobster kebab 2x before, for the set price in the menu regardless of the weight of the lobster(s) ? Management on duty confirmed that the lobster will be weighed before it is cleaned and prepared as a kebab, stating that it is hard to find a lobster that weighs exactly 1 kg ;-)  Capitulating we ordered a bottle of wine and waited to see what will be served. Nothing came. No wine, no food.  Left hungry (again) ...

reviews.title: Short drive from a Freetown to a small piece of paradise
reviews.review_text:
This hotel is a short drive from Freetown, between Lakka and River 2.  I have heard about this for a year and finally went for Sunday lunch.  The restaurant is on a lagoon the tide was going out and out so you could wade out a bit.  It is protected from the open ocean.  The restaurant is nice and the food was great.  I had shrimp and my colleague had mackerel.  I was also surprised it wasn’t too expensive.

The lunch crowd got busy so I think if I went again I would reserve but we went early enough to get a table but the place was packed.

reviews.title: King prawns
reviews.review_text:
I ordered king prawn, and it came as the size of small lobster, and they gave me two!!

I was the happiest guy on the table that day. Would love to come as often as I can!!

Crown of India - Indian Restaurant in Fl.description: Typical Indian menu in a welcoming and elegant restaurant in Florence. We are located 5/6 minutes from Fortezza,SMN Station and Via Nazionale. You will find a typical Indian menu with all its colors and flavors to combine with the best Indian,Italian and international wines, beers and spirits. This and much more together with the professionalism and courtesy of the staff always at your disposal

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.review_text: Genuine Indian food with a great service . Beautiful interior . Staff is very kind and makes you feel at home . Thanks for a great experience.

reviews.title: Best Indian restaurant
reviews.review_text: The restaurant provided an amazing dining experience with delicious food and a cozy atmosphere, and Radika our server was incredibly friendly and attentive.

reviews.title: A Crowed Indian Dinner
reviews.review_text:
This restaurant was recommended to us by the staff at our hotel! (Number Nine).
We enjoyed a very nice meal, with authentic indian flavours!
The staff were very helpful in selecting a shared meal of our choice. Plenty of food, and hot! Make sure to order the raita or a delicious mango lassi.

reviews.title: Florence a must do
reviews.review_text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left everything lived upto our expectations. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We did the Duomo and tower both right to the top, we also did arnolfo tower. We did several churches and museums but not all of them because it’s another excuse to visit Florence again

reviews.title: Nice food
reviews.review_text: I recently visited this place with my friends and I really liked the place and food of here. The staff was really friendly and the service was also responsive

reviews.title: Diamond in the ruff !!!
reviews.review_text: This is a diamond in the ruff. Grits cooked to perfection . Corn beef hash , eggs just as good . Two thumbs up !! Will be back when I return to Az.

reviews.title: Floored in Florence at the Florence Cafe
reviews.review_text: What an unexpected pleasure , Superior dining options and very reasonable pricing. My bride and I took a friend to Florence to check out their legendary Hardware Store. The Mrs had a gift certificate for a raffle at a GFWC's function and it was time to use it. After grabbing a couple household items at Ruggerios, we zoomed over to the F CAFE as the close at 2pm. WHAT a delight. Small town atmosphere, snapp[y waitress which helped make it even more fun and great MIDWEST STYLE COMFORT Food in ample portions

reviews.title: Wife not happy
reviews.review_text: My breakfast was basic but fine while my wife's was not. It was a Monday in early February so maybe that's why her breakfast was dismal. She ordered the meat skillet & it had only a few squares of ham & the portion was about 1/3 of the skillet. Even the waitress mentioned that it looked more like a veggie omelette. Not going back.

reviews.title: Great home cooked food
reviews.review_text: A good welcome and excellent food. My wife and I had a really good experience here. The menu has plenty of choice and service was pleasant. We will return.

reviews.title: Small Town Place
reviews.review_text: It was busy and came recommended.  We had just had a tour of the jail and needed food before heading back to Mesa.  All four of us were happy with our food.

reviews.title: Birthday Lunch
reviews.review_text:
We took my Dad for his 95th birthday lunch and they made it very special! We reserved a private dining space, which made a huge difference, since he's very hard of hearing. We only had 6 people,  but I'd guess the room could easily accommodate 12-18.

The service was outstanding! The starters, pizza, and burgers were all very good. The dessert plating was pretty, although they were just average tasting.  We had flights of their wines, which substituted as an informal tasting, and were lovely. We will definitely be back!

reviews.title: Beautiful venue and excellent meal and servers!
reviews.review_text: A friend of mine and I finally made it to celebrate being mothers. We picked the Vineyard at Florence because of the beautiful setting and brunch. It did not disappoint. Their menu is unique and small but something for every taste. I had the Loaded Croissant which was excellent...the best I remember ever having! My friend had the green salad which was fresh, beautifully presented and delicious... several items right out of their garden. And to make our experience even better were our excellent servers Marisol and Josh... 5 star service! Thank you both for a most enjoyable time. We'll be back! (PS  reservations are a must.)

reviews.title: The Farmer's Commons is anything but common ...
reviews.review_text: Had a delightful lunch at Farmer's Commons.  The staff was warm and friendly, the service was perfect ... attentive but not intrusive!  We had white wine and appetizers to start, the wine was good, perfectly chilled!  The appetizers were awesome!   We started with fried green tomatoes, and the jardiniere salad, both muy delicioso!  We followed that with the truffles and mushrooms pizza and the uncommon burger, both were wonderful.  The space is artful and airy, very nice on a weekend afternoon.

reviews.title: Don’t let the exterior fool you.
reviews.review_text: Dirty and rundown room.  The exterior in the pictures looks fantastic but inside it was not worth the money.  There were empty bottles that housekeeping missed, bugs, a stained ironing board, and hair in the shower.  I contacted management about it and nothing was done hence this review.  If you’re reading this management, big mistake, HUGE.

reviews.title: Perfect wedding/event venue
reviews.review_text:
My husband and I just had our wedding here in December. From the planning stages through the day itself the staff was wonderful and helpful in any way possible. The venue itself is beautiful and both the event spaces and accommodations (including the Winemaker’s Villa, hotel rooms, and Villa Botticelli) were stunning. There is also an amazing farm-to-table restaurant on site named Farmer’s Commons where we had an amazing breakfast the morning of the wedding. 

The whole day was charmed and it was in large part to the facilities and staff here at the Vineyard.

306 Barbecue-Florence.description: We serve authentic fresh off the pit, smoked and dry rubbed meats cooked on-site daily along with a dozen of delicious side items. Some favorites include brown sugar green beans, mac & cheese, Brunswick stew, chicken salad, banana pudding and chocolate mousse.

reviews.title: Smell BBQ coming up the street
reviews.review_text: You get within just a few blocks of this place and you will start smelling the BBQ being smoked. We had the pulled pork and 1/2 order of a full chicken with a couple of sides. We split the meal with two drinks for a total cost of around $20.  It’s a walk up style ordering system when you go inside then they bring you the food. There is seating outside where we sat and enjoyed the music playing on the street. Food was excellent and the order takers at the counter are willing to explain their product to you. Our sides were mustard slaw and maple green beans. Great tasting

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.review_text: Got into Florence around dinner time, and decided to grab some BBQ at this place. Great decision. Easy to order. The cashier was great. Reasonable prices, and the food came out quick. The pulled pork was delicious, and sides were good. Good meal.

reviews.title: Had to go get more food because I left hungry.
reviews.review_text: I ordered the dark meat quarter smoked chicken meal. The leg and thigh delivered were well smoked but hey were extremely small. The meat was greasy. The baked beans were not good. The fries were pretty good but an order of fries and about 6 bites of meat are not a dinner plate. Another guest at my table order a chicken salad and when it arrived there were two (2) small bites of chicken on the salad. Not a good value for the money.

reviews.title: Open, but closed ?🤔🙄 Which is it ? Who knows ? Never got to eat, so can’t give a review of the food.
reviews.review_text: Found 306 BBQ on TripAdvisor, which stated they were open until 10 pm. Went thru the door at 8:37 pm to be told that they in fact do close at 9 pm, but they were already closed at the counter, but that we could order “back there” wherever that was. I am possibly assuming incorrectly that 306 BBQ updates their TripAdvisor entry since it clearly gave a 10pm closing time.  Regardless, we still arrived BEFORE the closing time on their door only to be basically turned away. Can’t give a review on the food since we didn’t get to try it, but the service - if you want to call it that - was useless. It should be against the law to turn customers away before closing time, especially at a fast food restaurant. I think the staff just didn’t want to work anymore. Y’all lost money tonight !! Hope it was worth it !!

reviews.title: BBQ done right
reviews.review_text: Good BBQ.  Nice place in downtown Florence.   The BBQ is done right. Tried the combo with Ribs Chicken and turkey.  All were great.  Sides also very good.  Second trip here and will come back.

reviews.title: In love with this place
reviews.review_text: I am consistently impressed by the incredible gata and delicious desserts at Florence Gyumri. The grilled chicken and 'Hayraqaghaqayin' salad are always prepared to perfection. The warm and inviting atmosphere, combined with its aesthetic charm, makes each visit truly special. Whenever I am in Gyumri, Florence Gyumri is my go-to spot for dinner.

reviews.title: Amazing dinner in Florence Gyumri
reviews.review_text:
We had a dinner in Florence Gyumri. The food was amazing. We had a dish named .Marmelad. Never had so tasty and unique dish. Desert, especially gata was very good. Staff was very pleasant and professional. I really enjoyed a unique design warm atmosphere of the restaurant. 
Excellent place10 out of 10. Strongly recommend. 
Lianna from Brussels

reviews.title: Stylish and tasty
reviews.review_text: The perfect hospitality! The staff were super friendly. The food was displayed beautifully and full of  lovely flavors. I literary was feeling myself in atmosphere of Armenian deliciousness with European esthetic touch. We were in four and each of us really enjoyed the place and the food. I can recommend Florence restaurant as the most classy location in Gyumri❤️

reviews.title: Fascinating place totally the best in the area and worth visiting!
reviews.review_text: Extremely fascinating interior design with wonderful design and decorations. Very rich choice of dishes and drinks. Everything was very delicious and the athletes was magical. Worth visiting for sure!

reviews.title: An amazing place
reviews.review_text: I highly recommend to visit this place. You can eat inside and outside and the food is super tasty. The service is on top as well! :)

Hotel Calimala Florence.description: Hotel Calimala is situated in the heart of the historic center of Florence, occupying two adjacent historic buildings, the East and the West. We offer a range of room categories, spanning from 16 sqm superior rooms to spacious 50 sqm executive suites. Renovations led by designer Alex Meitlis involved the use of authentic materials such as pietra serena and Tuscan marble, along with contemporary furniture, to leave the Florentine soul of the building intact. The rooms and common areas are characterized by high quality prints and masterpieces by international talents: a true compendium of contemporary art, in which you will immerse yourself in every moment of your day in Florence! The hotel also has two restaurants: Meze, which is in the west wing, offers a special Mediterranean sea cuisine experience that our chef has reinvented. A stunning perspective of Florence's City and a Mediterranean-style cooking are paired together at Angel RooftopBar&Dining in the East wing.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.review_text: This is a great hotel, the staff is wonderful, the hotel is right downtown walking distance to everything.  Restaurant upstairs is fantastic, drinks at night are wonderful, watching the sunset over the city.  The rooms are comfortable, and the bathrooms are amazing

reviews.title: Amazing family vacation stay
reviews.review_text: The rooms were new and beautiful. Nice showers with great water pressure. The customer service was simply the best!  The staff at the lobby bar and Angel Rooftop could not have been friendlier.   Amazing location in the middle of everything!  Walk from train as well. Perfect place to stay in Florence!

reviews.title: Amazing stay!
reviews.review_text: The hotel and staff exceeded all my expectations. Beautiful hotel in a perfect location. Walking distance from most points of interest. The staff, Leonardo, Veronica, Chiara, Luis and all the staff, always with smiles and eager to assist. Stayed for 3 nights in the balcony room. Loved it.

reviews.title: Wonderful Florence Trip!
reviews.review_text: Great and friendly staff. Rooms were very comfortable and well decorated. Enjoyed the bar in the lobby. Within steps to the wonders of this beautiful city. Book your tours in advance as you may find your dates are not available. Wear comfortable shoes for the walk up the Bell Tower (a little steep) and Dome.

reviews.title: Great old hotel now modernized in great location
reviews.review_text: This is a really great hotel in a perfect location.  We stayed in the annex (where the rooftop bar/lounge/restaurant is located).  We had a complimentary drink at their main hotel which has the first floor bar/restaurant.  Really we designed and updated hotel while maintaining it's old vintage look.  Really nice friendly service and great restaurant recommendation they offered was Buca Poldo.   Walking distance to everything!

Luxor Florence.description: In Florence, Hotel Luxor Florence, opened in 2015, is within walking distance of the train station Santa Maria Novella, near the Exhibition Centre of Fortezza da Basso and Palazzo dei Congressi, as the old town and the main shopping streets. Its rooms have been designed streamlined and stylish. The interior design has a great attention to detail and the quiet, relaxing atmosphere is matched by the friendliness and warm hospitality that will make your stay memorable in the city of Renaissance. In addition to the 24h reception and the splendid breakfast room, you will find a custom-tailored services. Our goal is to make you feel at home, offering you double superior rooms , triple superior rooms, junior suites some of which with balcony and studio apartment different from each other but also by offering assistance and service worthy of the best hotels. Professionalism, and courtesy of the staff make finally Luxor Florence a perfect destination for any type of stay either you are visiting the city for pleasure either for those who seek a business hotel.

reviews.title: Good choice!
reviews.review_text:
Thank you for everything. The location is good, the room was clean and comfy, staff is very friendly and want to help you. Breakfast was good, I will advise you to add some more things but in all everything was great and tasty. 
P.S. the elevator was the great one 😂

reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE
reviews.review_text: STAY AWAY! TERRIBLE. The Hotel rooms do not match the description in the web page. The bathroom door does not close. as a family of 4 people there weren't enough toiletries, only 2 mini soaps. The AC in the middle of August is not working and they won't chenge our room.. The staff does not answer the phone and does not speak Italian. We asked for a room change and despite the hotel being empty we were denied service.  There is no drinking water.

reviews.title: A big NO!
reviews.review_text:
Pathetic, cheap, 0.5 star hotel with ridiculously noisy setup

The only positive is that it's at a 10 min walk to the metro station FSMN. Everything else is just sad. It's a small crammy converted-looking space at one corner of the road. Here are a few things to know..

- No lift! My room was on the first floor and the person at the reception had to lug the bag all the way up.
- The staircase is super dingy, worn, and smelly.
-  My room category: Junior Suite with Balcony
  The "suite" is just a sizeable room with 3 beds (1 double + 2 single)
- There's a small sitout-type area which looks at other surrounding buildings in your face - just a few meters away all of them!
- The rooms are across from each other separated by a 2-3 feet hallway which means you're almost sleeping in a large dorm with paper-thin walls. Noise travels from all the rooms and even the reception if someone were to speak slightly loudly
- Room phone doesn't work!
- The doors of the rooms shut with a loud click and thud  - so each time anyone on the floor opened theirs, you feel someone's entering your room!
- Breakfast was a tiny spread of stale breads, cakes, and fruits. So don't bother considering it free breakfast.
- The Italian lady at the reception was quite friendly and helpful - but even she couldn't make up for the total scam of this "3-star" hotel!

There are plenty of hotels closer to the station on the same route as this hotel. I suggest dig a little deeper and find the right hotel for you. because, Luxor Florence is definitely not it!

reviews.title: Had a memorable experience and  time , comfortable like home!
reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Luxor in Florence's! The staff and team were incredibly kind, generous, and cooperative, creating a friendly and warm environment throughout my visit. Their hospitality truly made my experience memorable. I appreciate their efforts and look forward to visiting again.

reviews.title: Huge disappointment
reviews.review_text:
The staff at reception depending on you get is either a very friendly guy or extremely rude....but rest was all a disappointment as it's definitely not a 3 star place as advertised...its a 1 star cheap place
There are no extra blankets or even tissues even if you request..if you loose the key card... yes the simple swipe thing they charge you 15 Euros as apparently its written in their fine print somewhere...
The rooms are actually in an adjoining apartment building on 3 floor..otherwise be ready to drag suitcases on the staircases for the few rooms..
The free breakfast is ok as regards the sealed stuff...fruits and croissants are stale and don't feel they change it every day... 
nice coffee machine though
And train track is right outside the window so hear trains all the time...

Chose this as was close to station and advertised as 3 star....Will not recommend to anyone for even one night and the pictures and descriptions are deceptive...
... huge disappointment....

The Westin Excelsior, Florence.description: With the Piazza della Signoria and Uffizi just steps away, The Westin Excelsior, Florence sits at the center of Florentine culture. Browse boutiques along the Ponte Vecchio, have an espresso at a local café, and enjoy the best Florence has to offer. Take in the vibrant flavors and sweeping views in SE·STO on Arno, our glass rooftop bar and restaurant. You can stay fit in the WestinWORKOUT® Fitness Studio, elevate your meeting in one of our unique venues and enjoy seven centuries of Italian history all inside our doors. Relive history in one of our 171 elegant guest rooms and suites recently renovated, some of which feature private balconies. Stunning views of the Arno and our Heavenly® Bed relax the senses, while high-speed internet access inspires peaceful productivity

reviews.title: Best hotel in Florence! A must stay that’s entirely worth it.
reviews.review_text: This hotel went above & beyond our expectations. Couldn’t recommend it enough for a long or short stay in Florence. The rooms were extremely spacious and kept up so well throughout our 4 days. We looked forward to heading back to our home away from home to escape the long days and unwind. Worth the money! Make sure you have a cocktail and enjoy the live piano player if you get a chance.

reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City
reviews.review_text: We felt wrapped in luxury from the minute we stepped through the revolving door into the beautiful lobby.  Porters took our luggage and showed us to the front desk where the clerk went over and above assisting us, answering our many questions. Our room was large and luxurious and the large beautiful bathroom offered a separate shower and oversized bathtub, with all the amenities you could want. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and all assistance was done with a smile. We were located across from the Arno near a wide variety of restaurants and within easy walking distance of Ponte Vecchio, the Duomo, and the Ufizzi Gallery. We hope to return to beautiful Florence and would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

reviews.title: horrible experience. definitely not a 5 star hotel.
reviews.review_text:
what a horrible experience. this is supposed to be a five star hotel? paid for a superior upgraded room and received a different room. the hotel justified it by stating that the room faced the river which is what i booked. no, i booked an upgraded room with a river view. 
more importantly, we were placed on the first floor right above the restaurant and the lobby and could hear everything happening below us well into the night. we could even hear the chairs dragging across the floors, the lobby music that played past midnight, and the constant conversation occurring below us and in the neighboring rooms. 
my wife and i never request service to our room as we prefer to not have people in our room. in turn, we ask for the normal replacement of water and towels every other day or so. we had to request this over and over again before we eventually just went downstairs and retrieved it ourselves. when we tried to speak to the hotel about the issues, they advised they didn't have a solution other than moving us to a new room the day before we checked out or providing us free buffet breakfast for our stay. this was priced at $55/person for a cold mediocre continental breakfast. we were staying there for 6 days and our stay cost over $6000. what a disappointment. 5 star hotel? more like 3 star. we stayed at the Marriot in Rome right before this that is considered a 4 star and it was SIGNIFICANTLY better in all avenues. 
if you're looking for a 5 star experience, stay away from this property.

reviews.title: Don’t hesitate to stay here
reviews.review_text: Such a wonderful hotel. Beautiful location on a plaza and on the Arno.  Easy walk to most locations.  Staff so friendly and really went out of the way to make us feel welcome.  Room is beautiful and they go the extra mile, leaving chocolates and even a bottle of wine and snacks.  Breakfast buffet is wonderful.  You can’t go wrong if you are looking for a luxury hotel in Florence.

reviews.title: Best trip ever!
reviews.review_text:
We loved Florence so much! We loved our time visiting the Westin. My family and i were so eager to arrive to see Salvatore at the Westin. This is a huge part of why we decided to visit the Westin, because we made connections with Salvatore at the St Regis, on a prior vacation. We absolutely adore him, and he treats our family so nicely and helps us with dinner recommendations and is so helpful and kind throughout our  whole stay! 
Everytime we come back, we look forward to seeing him, and we would never come to Florence without seeing Salvatore!

Plus Florence.address: Via di Santa Caterina D'Alessandria 15, 50129, Florence Italy
Plus Florence.address_string: Via di Santa Caterina D'Alessandria 15, 50129, Florence Italy

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text:
Excellent 
Room was clean tidy and we had 3 single beds with fully walk in wet room staff at check in fantastic polite helpful 
Sleep was great bar great but barman preferred to serve the younger clients before older ones 
Facilities great pool , restaurant, first time staying in a hostel type place 
Highly recommend this better than a hotel we stayed in in Pisa 
Check out do easy and polite 
Well done

reviews.title: Great position and I definitely recommend it.
reviews.review_text: Great position. Excellent facilities, pool, terrace, breakfast... I definitely recommend it. Excellent location of the hotel, only a 10-minute walk from the main train station. Excellent facilities, pool, terrace, breakfast, staff... I definitely recommend it for a stay. The room was clean, the view from the upper terrace wonderful, suitable for both young and old. It certainly exceeded expectations.

reviews.title: Great visit
reviews.review_text:
This was a repeat visit to Plus Florence, perfect for exploring and lots of amenities. Private rooms and dorms for everyone's needs.
I have stayed here a couple of times solo and also taken friends at different times as well. Works well.
Sells out quickly

reviews.title: Great value for money hostel
reviews.review_text: Lovely accomodation, really good for the price. Clean and comfortable room. No privacy curtains on beds. Staff helpful and accomodating. Washing facilities clean and easy to use but lots of machines out of order. Outdoor pool clean and enjoyable, indoor pool was closed.

reviews.title: Family Dorm was ok
reviews.review_text: Overall and excellent stay, good location; not far from all the fun of Florence and only 15 minutes from the train station. We had a 4 sleeper dorm for a family of 4 which was fine, a little sparse but clean and spacious. The pool and roof terrace were nice additions to our stay.

Hilton Florence Metropole.description: Hilton Florence Metropole is a contemporary hotel with a strategic location adjacent to all important traffic hubs. It is only 3 km (10 minutes) away from the Florence International Airport and the city business district. Hop on our 34-seats shuttle bus from/to the city centre (not bookable and at € 5.00 per room per stay) in order to reach in only a few minutes Florence major attractions like the Uffizi Gallery and the Duomo Cathedral. The 15-floors building offers, from the Executive Lounge’s terrace, a breathtaking view of Florence. It has 212 guestrooms - including 32 Executive rooms, 22 deluxe and 4 suites. Each guest room is furnished with a warm, contemporary style; wooden floor and spacious marble bathrooms can ensure maximum comfort for both business and leisure travellers. The hotel is provided of a complimentary external parking (50 boxes) and a charged covered garege (80 boxes), at € 10.00 per day per vehicle.

reviews.title: Ok stay at Hilton Florence Metropole
reviews.review_text:
The Hilton Florence Metropole is a decent hotel not far from FLR airport. The surrounding area does not present very well, nevertheless we always felt safe. We reserved a standard king bed room and received a complimentary upgrade to a “nicer” king bed room. Nicer I guess because it was a corner room with a “better view” but not much else was different to the standard king bed room. 
The common areas are beautifully decorated and well maintained. Front Desk staff were always informative and helpful. 
The Executive Lounge, with indoor and outdoor seating, always had snacks, drinks, and small bites available throughout the day.
We had dinner in the restaurant there and it was just ok. Not bad but also not very good. The servers, though, were very attentive and friendly. 
We did take advantage of the complimentary shuttle provided and were dropped off at the local train stop, just across the street from a mall. When we returned later that evening, I called the hotel to let them know we were back at the same drop-off location, but we still had to wait about 40 minutes for the driver to pick us up. Not a major inconvenience, until the rain started falling. Thankfully it was very light rain but there’s no place to seek shelter at that drop-off location. 
Overall, we enjoyed our stay in Florence but will definitely stay somewhere else if we do return. 

As for the local train, it was very easy and inexpensive. About €1.70 per person each way, and it took us straight to the main station, Santa Maria Novella (S.M. Novella) where we enjoyed walking around, visiting the Duomo, and stopping for a most enjoyable lunch then gelato.

reviews.title: Hilton Metropole Florence
reviews.review_text:
Just outside the city center, the Metropole would be great for a business trip but in our case it was great for our family of 8 people. Really great staff that were super hospitable and competent.

Rooms were probably a 4+ but the location and shuttle service to the train station makes up for any inefficiency of staying away from the center city. Restaurant and bar were lively and the Executive Lounge had great views of the Florence City Center.

Would definitely recommend based on the affordability, comfort and value overall.

reviews.title: Less than perfect but a good Honors point redemption deal
reviews.review_text:
Just returned from a 5 night stay.  The lobby/bar/restaurant and second floor appear to have been recently refreshed but the guest rooms are pretty shabby by Hilton standards.  The poorly-designed nightstands are incredibly low relative to the bed, and they're glass.  An accident waiting to happen.  Mattress/bedding were good.  Room was furnished with a coffee maker, slippers, large soap/shampoo/lotion dispensers and the A/C was without issue in mild autumn weather.  I can't comment on the executive lounge, which looks really dated in the photos, because I was denied an upgrade despite availability.  This property gives little recognition to Hilton Honors members.  I was even hassled when getting bottled water, which is a benefit.  The front desk staff was consistently aloof in contrast to the friendly, earnest staff in the breakfast room.  The morning spread included an ample selection.  

The shuttle van was always at the ready and the trams were frequent so the distance wasn't a big inconvenience.  A taxi from SMN station at 10:30 pm was 19 euros on the meter but 28 after a surcharge was tacked on.

reviews.title: Great hotel with friendly staff
reviews.review_text:
A warm Hilton welcome, very friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms with fluffy towels and the usual amenities 
Minibus that takes you to the nearest tram stop was a life saver as the hotel is a little way out of the city
Bring your swim suit as the whirlpool is heaven after a day on your feet

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review_text:
Stayed for six nights to attend a family wedding as a party of four. We were not given any hotel information on check-in, 
also no hotel information in rooms.  Rooms fine, breakfast plentiful. Disappointed to have to pay €20 each to use the pool. Asked hotel to book return taxis to wedding venue.  You don't seem to be able to book return journeys with any taxi companies. Shuttle service to tram very good...especially Samuel the driver...he was very helpful.  Hotel refused to order us a taxi from the tram after we missed the Shuttle bus one night.  Samuel told us the next day we could have got a bus. No one at the hotel mentioned this. We used Google maps to walk back, but would have been left stranded by the hotel reception if we were not able to walk. Not the best hotel...if you are visiting Florence stay in the city centre

The St. Regis Florence.description: Standing on the banks of the Arno River with views across to the Ponte Vecchio and the picturesque hills of Tuscany, The St. Regis Florence is the epitome of elegance and refined hospitality, and the preferred stop of tastemakers and luxury hotel travelers since the 18th century. Impeccably placed in the city’s historical center, our 5-star hotel offers an unrivalled immersion into the cradle of the Renaissance. Lavishly appointed accommodations at The St. Regis Florence feature decidedly modern amenities and services, all elevated by the St. Regis hallmark butler service, offering visitors a myriad of storied Florentine aesthetics. Local flavors infuse a gourmet Tuscan cuisine in the hotel’s restaurants and bars, and a selection of elegant venues lend distinction to weddings, social celebrations and business events. When it is time to wind down, the Iridium Spa Suites in partnership with MyBlend, present unique, bespoke treatments and in-depth therapies

reviews.title: Could Use a Refresh, But Nice Stay Anyway
reviews.review_text: Our stay was, overall, enjoyable, but we were a bit disappointed with the property. Not with respect to the staff or cleanliness or comfort, but instead simply because the hotel feels dated and could use a refresh. This is a small quibble really, but rooms are priced at the very top of the Florence market, and as such, should feel fresh and new. Again, staff was great and the hotel is well maintained. It's just probably due for an overhaul sometime in the not too distant future.

reviews.title: Business Meets Bliss
reviews.review_text: I travel frequently for business, but this stay made me feel like I was on a luxury vacation. The rooms were sanctuaries of calm, and the property's attention to technological needs while maintaining an elegant atmosphere was impressive. The staff's ability to be attentive without being intrusive made every moment feel special.

reviews.title: 5 star arrival!
reviews.review_text:
I’ve just arrived for a 2-night stay at the St. Regis Florence, and I feel compelled to share an early review because of the exceptional check-in experience. It might be the best service I’ve ever received upon arrival at a hotel. From the moment I stepped in, every staff member nearby warmly welcomed me, making me feel genuinely valued.

Gabriella (I hope I got her name right) provided a detailed introduction to the hotel and its amenities, guided me to my room, and ensured I had all the information I needed for a smooth and enjoyable stay. She was incredibly helpful and friendly throughout the process.

So far, I’m incredibly impressed and eagerly looking forward to a wonderful experience ahead.

reviews.title: Review
reviews.review_text:
Room was very nice, very clean 
Reynardo the butler was such a gentleman and wish I could’ve talked to him more.

The one night we stayed for our anniversary we did not get the evening turn down service. When asked downstairs there was someone named Mr. Park who clearly was not only judging us by asking “where did we eat for the evening” as one of the first comments, but also judging my spouse and I when it came to our clothes. By giving us constant up and down looks.
Mind you that we were dressed very nice at least in our opinion and my spouse even had her Louis V bag, but that’s besides the point. 

When he asked I just said “somewhere” because we felt we were getting harrassed. To which he started laughing and saying “sure, sure”

this was when we asked another employee about the turn down service and Mr Park came very aggressively to our conversation as if we were asking a lot.

We did end up getting two free drinks at the bar downstairs while they did the service 
but I felt it was to shut us up while they cleaned our room for the service.

Mr Park was not seen again as we also felt that the other employees handled it very professionally and kept Mr Park and ourselves separate in order to keep the peace.

Hotel is very very nice and we were grateful for the room, but Mr Park needs some corrective training on customer service when it comes to the customer,

Bottom line is that  we were asking for a service that was included in our stay but when asked, the employee (Mr Park) was very aggressive for no reason.

I only write this so future guest may know what to expect,
We have stayed all over the world in various Marriot Locations from the Ritz to even courtyards but that one incident made our stay not a memorable one on our Anniversary night.

reviews.title: Not as exceptional as the Four Seasons Florence
reviews.review_text:
We divided our stay in Florence between the St Regis (for 4 nights ) and Four Seasons (5 nights ) so I will compare the two.
Location: The St Regis is an easier walk to shops and restaurants and is next to the Arno River. They do not provide any shuttle service to the historic center like the Four Season does. The Four Seasons has gorgeous, large peaceful gardens but the St Regis has no outdoor areas for relaxing.

Rooms: Although some of this is personal preference, we feel Four Seasons easily wins this category in terms of meticulous upkeep, outlets, bathroom design and ease of climate control. The St Regis was overall very well maintained but had more of an antique/grandma’s house feel with some sagging cushions, heavy dragging drapes, scuff marks on wood floor in our room and older- looking carpet and slight dings in hallways. We also preferred the overall ambiance of our Four Seasons room as it was lighter and brighter. Our St Regis room was large and very nice but had darker, bulkier furniture and heavy, very ornate closet doors. The St Regis had a slightly better shower stall size/ water pressure but Four Seasons had bigger/better towels. Both had very comfortable beds and pristine linens. The Four Seasons has electronic buttons for housekeeping and “do not disturb” but the St Regis has a paper sign you hang on the door.  It was more circuitous to get to our St Regis room and required  navigating some stairs, whereas, the Four Seasons was more convenient in this regard. However, this would likely depend on exact location of specific rooms. Both hotels have gorgeous impressive lobbies.

Service: The Four Seasons definitely wins this category . At the St Regis we were never offered any water by the doormen or generally were not asked by them if we needed help ( except  when we had suitcases). The Four Seasons doormen constantly asked us if we wanted water or needed assistance with anything. They were very proactive. One night we ordered soft drinks and appetizers in the St Regis restaurant bar area and actually felt ignored.
