We were never asked if we wanted any additional drinks, our dirty dishes were not removed, and we had to ask for the check. Service at breakfast each day was average. We felt servers performed their jobs on autopilot, whereas, the Four Seasons waiters were much more personable and service oriented. The St Regis did give us a bottle of Prosecco for our anniversary but no sweets or snacks to go with it like the Four Seasons did (plus other thoughtful surprises).  Also, while we noticed the St Regis staff had placed a stopper in our open Prosecco bottle in the room, they also had emptied the water in the bucket but never replaced the ice. Laundry service came back packaged more nicely at the Four Seasons (but it was also more expensive). These are nitpicking items but shows the difference in level of service. I will say the St Regis concierge and front desk staff were excellent when we had questions and that a maintenance issue we had at St Regis was also quickly rectified.

Food: We felt St Regis was average for bar snacks and the breakfast buffet for a luxury hotel. Nothing wowed us. The cooked to order breakfast entrees were much better at the Four Seasons in our opinion and more authentic. Coffee/cappuchino was always served lukewarm at St Regis. Room service meals at Four Seasons were outstanding in terms of taste, presentation and service. We did not order any room service at St Regis. 

Summary: If we had not stayed at the Four Seasons Florence the first part of our vacation we probably would have thought the St Regis was wonderful. However, we kept comparing the two hotels and kept saying to ourselves that we wished we had stayed at the Four Seasons our entire trip. The Four Seasons had a higher price point but we felt it was worth every penny as it was truly flawless and kept exceeding our expectations. It may sound snobbish but our St Regis experience fell slightly below our expectations for a luxury hotel which is why I gave it four stars instead of five (I know, first world problem).

Glance Hotel In Florence.description: Glance Hotel in Florence is located on the historical neighborhood of San Lorenzo, place of the famous "Food Market". Accademia Museum, Uffizi Gallery, The Duomo Cathedral and the Old Bridge are easily reachable by walk. A few steps faraway from Congress Centre and the main Station Santa Maria Novella, the Glance Hotel is the perfect location both for business stays and discovering the cradle of Renaissance. The mid-century building, creation of the famous Florentine Architect Italo Gamberini, is now completely renovated. Our Glance Hotel offers you everything you need with 68 rooms, one meeting room for up to 40 people, Lounge bar overlooking a beautiful terrace, Roof Top Bar on the sixth floor with an amazing, modern and exclusive designed heated swimming pool. Free wi fi all over the building and a private Garage available on request.

reviews.title: Cold Water and Poor Lighting
reviews.review_text: While this hotel is convenient to the train station and Mercato Centrale, the rooms are small, the lighting was terribly dark and oddly placed and the bathroom tiny.  Worst of all was the lack of hot water we had in the bathroom.    It was explained that because it was winter, the water is cold (October visit with high 70s F /21 C each day), or because others were showering and using the hot water.  Three days in a row?  Frustrating! Complimentary bottled water, daily was nice.  Likely better options in Florence!

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.review_text: Great hotel. Walking distance to everything. Close to the food market, if you want to grab lunch or a quick dinner after a long day of walking .  Def would stay here again .

reviews.title: A great place to stay!
reviews.review_text:
A very well located hotel, mere minutes away from everything in Florence. 
The rooms were clean and modern. 
The rooftop bar and swimming pool were fantastic as well!

reviews.title: Stay here. Central, efficient and clean
reviews.review_text: It is easy to get overwhelmed by the choice of hotels in a city like Florence. It was this difficulty that drove us back to a travel agent for our trip. Thank goodness we did as this is the place I was hoping to find. It is central to all we needed, train station on arrival, all the major sights and lots of choices for places to eat. The rooftop hotel bar is perfect for an aperitif before heading out for dinner and a last drink overlooking the city before bed. The staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are spotless. If you want a hassle free place to stay you could do no better.

reviews.title: Will stay again! Great value!
reviews.review_text: We stayed for 3 nights and loved the location and rooftop pool. Breakfast was very plentiful. The staff incredibly helpful and polite. Very clean hotel, both rooms and public areas. The air conditioning was great. The neighborhood is safe.

MH Florence Hotel.description: MH Florence Hotel is a newly built, located in the heart of Florence, 150 meters from the train station SMN and a 3-minute walk from the main monuments of the city. The hotel is equipped with wi-fi, it has double rooms, superior, triple and suites are elegantly designed. Our guests can enjoy American buffet breakfast in our local products, yogurt and juices of the best selections and our homemade cakes. Flagship of the hotel is the Spa, a relaxing space where guests can enjoy the route Kneip, the Bio Sauna, bath round, the pool and relaxation area, or enjoy a relaxing massage. At sunset, the roof terrace on the 6th floor of the hotel will give a 360-degree view of the city with direct views of the Cathedral while enjoying a cocktail in our outdoor living rooms.

reviews.title: EVERYTHING PERFECT!
reviews.review_text:
An excellent hotel. Everything was superlative. The hotel is located in a very good area close to the Duomo of Florence (10 minutes walk) with a tram stop in front of the hotel. It has its own parking (25 euros/day) underground. At the reception we were warmly welcomed and received a very nice room with a large balcony and a view of the outdoor pool. In the room there is a minibar (for a fee) with water and alcoholic beverages. The rooms are simply but modernly furnished, with very good beds. The bathroom is large and has quality toiletries. The hotel has a breakfast room with quality dishes and with kind and nice young waitresses, ready to satisfy your every desire.
In conclusion, I RECOMMEND this beautiful, clean hotel with quality staff.
PS. I regret that I didn't have time to visit the SPA Center but I will do it next month when I return to Florence.

reviews.title: Good and very central
reviews.review_text:
My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to Florence.
Overall it was a great base, perfectly located and the staff very friendly.
We’d been upgraded on arrival and had a lovely room with a terrace, however the bathroom and shower situation was very odd with the shower being a glass box in the middle of the room.  This is fine if your partner but if sharing could be a problem…it’s also a challenge going back and forth to the bathroom housing the vanity and toilet when getting dressed.
All of the staff we encountered were very nice and we’d happily stay again, despite the odd shower layout it was pretty good!

reviews.title: Can’t fault this hotel
reviews.review_text: Beautiful hotel. Extremely modern, clean, hi tech and with a high emphasis on sustainability. Free drinks if you opt not to have clean linen daily. Food excellent with lots of healthy options on offer. Staff helpful and friendly. Prices for spa and bar very reasonable. Location not the prettiest but certainly very convenient and once inside the front door forgot all about the station and tram lines outside. Beautiful gardens and pool. Room quite small for 3 but adequate for sleeping and with a large balcony for sitting and relaxing. Will definitely be returning as 3 days was not enough time to spend in beautiful Florence

reviews.title: Fantastic base for a beautiful city!
reviews.review_text: We are just home from 3 nights at this hotel. Great base for exploring the city. It’s a 3 minute walk from Florence SMN train station. Is a lovely 15 minute walk to Palazzi Vecchio and a further 5 minute walk to Ponte vecchio, with lots of lovely shops to browse on the way!  Rooms are very comfortable, we were two adults and our 17 year old daughter. The air conditioning a welcome treat after the 40 degree heat. Breakfast was fantastic, lovely choice which differs daily. The pool was a fantastic bonus, especially to escape from the afternoon heat. Easy to get drinks around the pool. The staff were polite and attentive. No bad things to say at all! The view from the roof top bar is beautiful! Would certainly recommend!

reviews.title: Just brilliant
reviews.review_text: Beautiful hotel and perfect location for the city and train station. The whole hotel is modern and there is a pool for guests to use.  We had breakfast which was buffet style with omelettes made on demand as well as a machine to freshly squash or ages for juice. Totally recommend this place.

reviews.title: Hotel on the Bellagio Waterfront
reviews.review_text: Hotel Florence is located on the waterfront in central Bellagio.  It is very convenient to the lake ferries and shopping.  The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable if fairly basic.  The hotel has a restaurant which served good meals.  The breakfast options were very good.  The hotel can arrange parking about 400 meters away.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with the best views
reviews.review_text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in October and were really happy with every aspect of the hotel. The upkeep is faultless and the staff are really lovely. You couldn’t get a better location very central and stunning views of the lake. 
We stayed in room 24, and the only gripe I had was the noise from the room above us, constant stomping across the wooden floor with shoes which shattered any peace. It was constant or I wouldn’t mention it.
Otherwise well worth a visit.

reviews.title: Beautiful elegant small hotel. Loved!
reviews.review_text: Beautiful and elegant everywhere the eye could see. Our room was tastefully decorated. It was a pleasure to stay here. Grazie Mille Hotel Florence. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Clean. Quiet. Our room had a little terrace. One of our favorite hotels we've ever stayed in. Staff wonderful. We also had dinner in the restaurant. Outstanding food and service! Grazie head waiter Marco and wait staff. Gem of a hotel all around.

reviews.title: A Beautiful Italian Gem in Bellagio
reviews.review_text:
Travelling to Como with a group of friends before our wedding we stayed at Hotel Florence for 4 Nights. When booking this gem we had been very impressed with the value but upon arrival become quickly even more impressed. 

The location was prefect! Beautiful views as you walk around the property, Lake Views and location wise right in front of the ferry terminal. 

When we booked they had no availability for a Lake View but when we got to our room we had been pleasantly surprised that we could still see the Lake on a side view from our room. Decor of the hotel was lovely. Lots of Italian charm. 

Breakfast was one of the best I’ve had from an Italian hotel. Service and food was fantastic. And overall service from the hotel was excellent, welcoming and helpful. 

Would highly recommend and would more than happily return, genuinely really impressed with our. (And all of the group felt the same!)

reviews.title: Great views and great service at this top shelf Bellagio hotel
reviews.review_text: Gisele at the front desk was a star and made us feel so welcome from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. Breakfast was very good, the room and view from the terrace was breathtaking. Definitely worth getting a room with a view. Staff confirmed rooms 1, 2, 3 & 4 had best views. Breakfast from 7:30. Ferries right outside the door. Top tip: Use the Ferry from the Targhetto landing, these are direct and around a 5 - 10 min walk from the hotel.

Riva Lofts Florence.description: A beautifully renovated 19th-century factory on the southern bank of the Arno River, the Riva Lofts provides a modern oasis in easy reach of the rich historical attractions of Florence.
amenities: Free Wifi in the Business Center

reviews.title: Great stay!
reviews.review_text: We stayed for 4 nights at Riva Loft and really enjoyed it! The staff was really friendly and helpful. The room had everything we needed and was very large. We really enjoyed the breakfast and especially the cappucinos! The hotel is a bit outside of the city center, which we found nice for things being quiet. It takes about 30-40 minutes to walk into the city center (but it is nice, right along the river) or there is a tram that takes you right near the train station.  They also organized a wine tour for us which was great. Would definitely stay again and recommend!

reviews.title: Accommodation to match Florence's beauty
reviews.review_text: We stayed at Riva Lofts for 4 nights. From the time we checked in, our stay was lovely.  Staff were helpful, grounds and lawn around the pool were well maintained and rooms were clean. There is a restaurant on-site (dinner four or five nights a week) where you have your complimentary breakfast each morning (plenty of options to choose from). You can also use this building during the day as a place to relax/read. It is a short 10-15 minute walk along the river, into the centre of Florence. A quicker option is to use the complimentary bikes. A great place to stay and will no doubt visit again

reviews.title: Not as great as I was expecting.
reviews.review_text:
Pros:
Nice looking hotel and welcome
The room is nice and bathroom and toiletries 
The pool is the best thing about the hotel, we stayed at the pool during day times but did not eat dinner
The Tram in to the centre is very nearby 

Cons:
Location is far from the city and nothing around the hotel
The hotel don’t serve anything for lunch not even sandwiches and it’s far from everything - we had to order a take away pizza, this really needs to be solved
The air conditioning is not controlled by a remote it’s automatic 
The pool is small and very cold!
There is no water readily available, you have to ask staff to fill bottles with cold filtered water all day 
The cleaners don’t clean until around 3pm
Breakfast is very basic 
The bed is very hard

reviews.title: Nicely designed but needs a redecoration
reviews.review_text:
3.5 stars.  Good only.
Discreet hotel from the road.  Quiet location.  Nicely designed and consideration for the old and new. however showing some signs of aging and needs some reinvestment to decorations.
Our linked room (A and B) had frosted windows only and no view felt very inward looking.  The decorations needed redoing too.  Sink ceramic glazing was crazing and generally needs a bit of love.
Pool looks lovely but is cold (in August) so kids were turning blue.
Quiet hotel.  Tram close.  Staff helpful.  Parking close.

reviews.title: Overpriced
reviews.review_text: I am surprised that this hotel has got such rave reviews.   It is beautifully situated but it is very overpriced.   We imagined we would have a loft room but instead had more of a cave.  Certainly not a room with a view.   There is little attention to detail.    I could provide a very comprehensive list as someone else did but just one example  to serve supermarket white bread at a boutique hotel is really disappointing.   I wouldn't recommend this at the price.

Florence Tour-Tale.description: We’re a group of friends and authorized tour guides of Florence, although we’d prefer to introduce ourselves as storytellers! Explaining history as a TALE is part of our NAME, BRAND and SOUL. We’re in love with our hometown and we’d like to transmit it to you, through its many stories, funny anecdotes and curiosities, that will make you travel into the past and LIVE IT as if it was a tale, and you, the main character. After this tour, you’ll see Florence from a completely different standpoint, and you’ll be able to decipher its symbols, and read its architecture and statues by yourself, as if your wore Renaissance glasses.

Mama Florence.description: At Mama Florence, a harmonious blend of culinary expertise and heartfelt passion awaits you. Our school is a haven where home cooks and internationally acclaimed chefs unite, sharing their profound skills, cultural wisdom, and love for the art of cooking. Whether you're learning from a seasoned chef or a skilled home cook, the common thread is the dedication to weaving their expertise into the tapestry of daily practice. Here, the essence of nourishing with love permeates every dish, creating an experience that transcends the ordinary. Step into our warm embrace, where the inviting atmosphere mirrors that of a cherished home. The camaraderie and hospitality envelop you, making you feel like you've arrived at a familiar hearth. It's not just a school; it's a culinary sanctuary. Rediscover the joy of two elemental pleasures: cooking and savoring a meal. With every chop, stir, and sizzle, you'll learn the secrets of Tuscan cuisine while immersing yourself in its timeless traditions.

reviews.title: Delightful Class
reviews.review_text: What a wonderful evening. Louisa was great fun and made our pasta making class easy and relaxing. Dinner afterwards using our pastas was fabulous! And the kitchen and dining room were beautiful. Couldn’t have asked for a better experience.

E-Bikes Florence.description: We provide everything you need for an unforgettable self guided and roadside assisted electric bike tour through the majestic Tuscan countryside surrounding Florence. With the freedom to explore at your own pace and boosted by our top quality e-bikes, you'll meander your way through cypress tree forests, olive groves and vineyards, little villages and hamlets with their ancient churches, monasteries, amphitheatres and delicious restaurants! You can sample the EV olive oils and locally produced wines, meet the owners of an organic Chianti vineyard and have the option to cool off in their outdoor swimming pool. Our route utilises the cycle path network to get you out onto the quieter country roads quickly and on the way back the cycle path route traverses the River Arno and up to Piazzale Michelangelo for great views of the city up close. The map works offline on your phone, we provide phone holders for the bikes and we are always on hand to make sure your ride goes smoothly.

Florence Private Guide.address: Via Francesco Berni 37 Oltrarno, 50124, Florence Italy
Florence Private Guide.description: Certified tour guide for the city of Florence
Florence Private Guide.address_string: Via Francesco Berni 37 Oltrarno, 50124, Florence Italy

reviews.title: Paolo is your best Italian friend in Florence
reviews.review_text: We couldn’t have interviewed a room full of people to find a guide as perfect as Paolo for our walking tour of Florence.  He has an admirable expertise in all things artistic and architectural for this important destination on everyone’s list.

reviews.title: Amazing private tour
reviews.review_text:
We travel frequently, this was our 6th trip to Florence. 
We Decided to do a repeat trip to the The Galleria dell’ Accademia primarily to see the statue of David. After much time spent on the Internet, I came across PAOLO , a private guide and booked time to visit with him as he had nothing but amazing reviews. 
What A treat..the experience was so relaxed and we had such a great time with him. He pointed things out and had such great stories that only come from years of experience and  knowledge ..his  delivery made it such a wonderful experience.  He made everything so easy ..setting up the tour,
Getting tickets and sharing things that would be near impossibly  to do on your own.
I highly recommending you spend as much time as possible with him And guarantee you won’t be disappointed.
 We spent seventeen days in Italy and this was the most memorable hour of the trip.     Mike and Marilyn A

reviews.title: Great experience at the Uffizi Gallery!
reviews.review_text: Paolo was amazing! He was recommended by a friend of mine, and we weren't disappointed. He gave such interesting background stories during our Uffizi tour that the history really came alive. Would love to go back!

reviews.title: Fabulous Florence walking tour with Paolo
reviews.review_text: Paolo was a great tour guide, he was very punctual and engaging. We booked a 3 hour private walking city tour which I highly recommend (he also does different tours as well). He took us to many great sites, his knowledge of the history, and different architecture was amazing. He explained the who and the why in a very interesting way. He answered all our questions. Also showed us the best way to get around, showed where to get the best gelato, best panini, best pizza and best leather store. We had a fabulous time with Paolo and highly recommend him.

reviews.title: Wonderful Tour of Florence!
reviews.review_text: I’m really glad we had Paolo as a tour guide! He could speak to everything from the paintings in the Brancacci Chapel to the world of the Medicis.  He showed us curiosities we would have walked by and easily accommodated special requests. Paolo is a certified tour guide, and he greatly enriched our experience of Florence.

Free Tour Florence – Another Florence.address: Piazza Santa Maria Novella In The Middle Of The Square, 50123, Florence Italy
Free Tour Florence – Another Florence.description: Florence is one of the most beautiful italian cities and with us you’ll have the chance to visit its soul. Our guides will show you the real heart of the city (off the beaten tracks!!) by giving you the best tips about local life, food and drinks, of course with an insider’s view! We will be happy to share with you interesting details about local life and useful tips about food and drinks.Don’t miss the opportunity to visit the city where Renaissance had begun BOOK YOUR TOUR NOW!
Free Tour Florence – Another Florence.address_string: Piazza Santa Maria Novella In The Middle Of The Square, 50123, Florence Italy

reviews.title: The Best Walking Tour
reviews.review_text: Ludi was a great tour guide for “The Beauties of Florence Free Walking Tour”. She was organized, detailed and very informative. I learned so much from her on this tour. I would highly recommend this tour!

reviews.title: From Medicis to the Maffia
reviews.review_text: Antonio was our amazing guide! He told us many stories during an evening walk in the city centre. He showed little secrets too, but I don't want to be a spoiler.

All Around Florence.description: Florence with a Local We are a group of friends and Florence's licensed tour guides. We are in love with our city and we would like to share this love with you. That's why we have decided to offer some tours to let the travelers discover the wonders of our magnificent hometown. Our passion, enthusiasm and professionalism are our strengths and the perfect ingredients to let you experience Florence through the eyes of a local.

LivTours Florence.description: Don't just visit Italy, live it! We aim to provide our guests with unique and authentic Experiences with expert and passionate guides. We are proud to offer extraordinary itineraries throughout the whole peninsula, which allow you to explore and get a real feel for this beautiful country. These are for seriously curious travelers who want a personal and special Experience! For questions or more information please continue browsing, email us, call us, Skype us, chat with us or even just take a look at our FAQ page.

reviews.title: Also, the man, the myth, the legend
reviews.review_text: Aldo was fabulous. We had so much fun, and learned so much from him. The food was amazing and I don’t think we would have found the places without a guide

reviews.title: Private walking tour of Florence
reviews.review_text: We were able the see the main highlights of Florence with our private guide Monica. Having Monica there to help us navigate the city, and museums was very valuable. We didn’t feel lost or overwhelmed trying to find the “must see” art and sights of Florence. She was with us through the exhibits to provide insight to the history of all we saw. What would have taken hours to research she was able to explain, and even interlink the people and places of Florence’s history. No wait tickets into all the exhibits. This city requires a lot of walking, but there were plenty times for breaks. This private tour was worth every cent.

reviews.title: Florence Highlights with Bobbie
reviews.review_text: Bobbie was amazing, so much information and a pleasure to be with.  She offered recommendations for other places in the city. Would happily tour with her again.

reviews.title: SILVIA is The Best Tour Guide - Private Tour of Accademia & Uffizi Gallery
reviews.review_text:
Our agent planned for us a Private 1/2-day Accademia and Uffizi Tour with Liv Tours. It was just for my husband and myself on our 3rd day in Florence. WE arrived on Monday late afternoon, and were so glad to be able to get oriented around Florence and save our energy and attention for Wednesday morning for an amazing tour of important works and collections at the Uffizi Gallery and the Accademia Gallery. What we hadn't known was that we would have such an amazing Tour Guide in Silvia! What a true treat and gift to meet her in front of the Cafe Rivoire in Piazza della Signoria at 10am! We only just met her and her effervenscent self which shone throughout the tour in addition to the pride she exuded telling us of these important works and history as it formed Florentine and Italian culture. A true and proud born and raised Florentine herself, she is steeped in local and ancient lore that she was generous in sharing with us.

We had not yet had breakfast since we walked so much the day before, and slept in longer than we anticipated before the morning of the tour. But, Silvia was absoloutely charming, warm and friendly and even concerned we hadn't yet had breakfast, so we stopped first to enjoy our cappucino and steamed milk tea while she spoke about what we were to accomplish in the Private Tour. We could do as much or as little, and customize the tour as we needed as it was just for Us Two. We enjoyed our morning hot drinks while we listened just outside the Uffizi Gallery entrance as Siliva recounted the deep history of the Medici and the impact they had on artwork of the Renaissance and life during these ancient times, including natural science, medicine and intellectual thought.

We were to embark on seeing highlights of both galleries, and there is so much to see! We are blessed to have been able to have a Private Tour, and not be on a large tour with a guide and a speaker/headphone set. We really got to hear and enjoyed having Silvia's extensive and amazing expertise and guidance sharing the stories around all the works we saw.

We would also get to admire the 17-foot scultpture of David by Michelangel and enjoyed exclusive entrance and passage in to both places. But, first, we needed a quick lunch and we sat and chatted in a small cafe off the Arno with the most amazing panini and juices before leaving for The David!

The care, depth of knowledge and extensive hospitality Silvia shared with us unmatched, and definitely was a highlight of our Florence Trip! Thank you again, and we will surely recommend Silvia and LivTours to others and share our positive experience with our agent, Human X Nature Travel!

Taste Florence.description: Voted Best Food Tour by The Culinary Travel Guide, this is a delicious way to begin your stay in Florence. We are Sommeliers, Culinary Professors, and Licensed Guides- but no worries, you'll have fun while tasting your way through Florence. Join our four hour Taste Florence Food Tour, and taste cheeses, balsamic vinegars, olive oils, antipasti, wine, gelato and several more local specialties. Featured in the Washington Post, The Dallas Morning News, The Toronto Star, The Boston Globe, The Newcastle Herald, on the CBC, on Voice of America, Deutsche Welle and more. Taste Florence with us and get the insider's edge on what to eat and where to find it.

reviews.title: Delicious walking tour of Florence food
reviews.review_text: We signed up for a walking food tour of Florence. It was a great experience moving thru the neighborhood including a bakery, pastry shop, Enoteca winery, and the central market. Just when we thought it was over our guide took us to a gelato store. All the food, history, and sites were enjoyable (and delicious). We learned a lot about Florence, Tuscany, and inside tips on their food! Well done Dilara! Grazie

reviews.title: Fantastic Tour
reviews.review_text: Stephanie was a fantastic guide.  She shared her local knowledge and passion for Italy.  I learned about local customs, food preparation, tips for selecting authentic food and more.  Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Book it! You won't regret this tour!
reviews.review_text: Taste of Florence Tour is a MUST DO for Florence! Toni is an amazing guide through small "hidden" (you would miss the places if you were walking down the street) bakeries, food market, wine tasting, gelato and more! Toni's passion for the food of Florence is evident from the beginning. She communicates well head of time, even giving recommendations for her favorite restaurants for dinner. The tour we too (family of 6 adults) was my second time. My husband and I heard her on Rick Steve's podcast and booked it when we visited Florence last year (2023) and it was the first thing we booked for our family trip with our kids in 2024! I highly recommend Toni and Taste of Florence Tour. You won't regret adding this to your itinerary!

reviews.title: Fantastic experience!
reviews.review_text:
Toni and her staff are outstanding! Our train into Florence was cancelled so we were 30 min late for the tour. We let them know immediately and the helped us meet the group. Our fantastic guide, Frederica, even saved samples for us from the one location we missed. 

The tour itself provided a wide sample of food & wine which were all delicious! The calamari was so fresh, I will never be able to eat it in US again! The wine & cheese/spread samples were magnificent. I’m so excited by the opportunity to purchase wine, olive oil, and white balsamic to be shipped home!

Of course, the final course, Gelato, was the best I had in Italy!

I recommend Taste of Florence without hesitation for an interesting and exquisite experience! Many thanks to Toni, Elisa, and Frederica!

reviews.title: Embracing Italian Culture through food
reviews.review_text:
Taste of Florence was a wonderful experience. Our guide, Alessandro, was friendly and informative. It was a great way to learn about the food in Italy and taste  new foods that we otherwise may not have tried. Alessandro took us to authentic Italian small businesses away from the touristy spots.
It was a small group experience which made it more enjoyable and intimate.

Ciao Florence Tours and Travels.description: Ciao Florence organizes tours from Venice, Rome, Naples and of course Florence! We guarantee the best value thanks to our experience and to our professional and multilingual staff, together with a careful selection of our suppliers. Enjoy an unforgettable experience in Italy choosing from our wide range of tours, special activities and visit the most famous museums in the world! Otherwise just create with us the private tour that best suites your needs! We guarantee: • specialized multilingual guides • GT Coach;• Quality, professionalism and friendliness;• Emergency Service;• Reservations "last minute" until 22.00.

reviews.title: Older Hyatt Place - - And it Shows.
reviews.review_text: Older Hyatt Place and it shows in some areas. My room had a bathroom door that was rotting away on the bottom corner. Looked really bad. The black out curtains were rotting out as well...noticed next morning when sun was coming right through them. My room was directly across from icemaker. Very loud. I realize that someone has to get that room but someting should be done to enclose the icemaker room or relocate it.

reviews.title: Amazing staff and a great time!
reviews.review_text: Amazing staff and a great experience, we had done the Graveyard room, had a blast finding clues and exploring the amazingly decorated room!

reviews.title: Awesome experience
reviews.review_text: Tim met us at the front desk and I asked about the breakfast. A few days ago we stayed at the Ark Encounter Hampton inn. I mentioned that the breakfast was nearly empty of everything two mornings in a row at 9 AM. The last day there the only thing they had was gravy. I'm not exaggerating. He assured me Miss Arlene wants to take kitchen and we will be very impressed. When we showed up for breakfast, Miss Arlene was busy as a bee, keeping everything clean and stocked and perfect. She's such a sweet, wonderful lady and both of Tim and Arlene have the sweetest most excepting loving Attitudes personalities off the top of the chains. Tim and Arlene are absolutely assets to your Hampton Inn franchise. We thoroughly loved getting to know them and eating this delicious breakfast.

reviews.title: Very clean! Indoor pool a plus!
reviews.review_text: Hotel was very clean and stylish! The main thing is that it was clean and our stay was wonderful! We went to the ARK encounter and needed somewhere to crash for the night. This was close by and there was an online discount. We had a king room with a pull out sofa. It was very spacious! We also enjoyed the indoor pool!

reviews.title: Dissapointed Rewards Member
reviews.review_text: Hotel lost my reservation and front desk was very aggressive and rude, once they found it, no apologies offered , long time wyndham rewards member, disappointed  at the treatment of the staff, I expected better from Wyndham and this location specifically which I've stayed at numerous times

Hotel Calimala Florence.description: Hotel Calimala is situated in the heart of the historic center of Florence, occupying two adjacent historic buildings, the East and the West. We offer a range of room categories, spanning from 16 sqm superior rooms to spacious 50 sqm executive suites. Renovations led by designer Alex Meitlis involved the use of authentic materials such as pietra serena and Tuscan marble, along with contemporary furniture, to leave the Florentine soul of the building intact. The rooms and common areas are characterized by high quality prints and masterpieces by international talents: a true compendium of contemporary art, in which you will immerse yourself in every moment of your day in Florence! The hotel also has two restaurants: Meze, which is in the west wing, offers a special Mediterranean sea cuisine experience that our chef has reinvented. A stunning perspective of Florence's City and a Mediterranean-style cooking are paired together at Angel RooftopBar&Dining in the East wing.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.review_text: This is a great hotel, the staff is wonderful, the hotel is right downtown walking distance to everything.  Restaurant upstairs is fantastic, drinks at night are wonderful, watching the sunset over the city.  The rooms are comfortable, and the bathrooms are amazing

reviews.title: Amazing family vacation stay
reviews.review_text: The rooms were new and beautiful. Nice showers with great water pressure. The customer service was simply the best!  The staff at the lobby bar and Angel Rooftop could not have been friendlier.   Amazing location in the middle of everything!  Walk from train as well. Perfect place to stay in Florence!

reviews.title: Amazing stay!
reviews.review_text: The hotel and staff exceeded all my expectations. Beautiful hotel in a perfect location. Walking distance from most points of interest. The staff, Leonardo, Veronica, Chiara, Luis and all the staff, always with smiles and eager to assist. Stayed for 3 nights in the balcony room. Loved it.

reviews.title: Wonderful Florence Trip!
reviews.review_text: Great and friendly staff. Rooms were very comfortable and well decorated. Enjoyed the bar in the lobby. Within steps to the wonders of this beautiful city. Book your tours in advance as you may find your dates are not available. Wear comfortable shoes for the walk up the Bell Tower (a little steep) and Dome.

reviews.title: Great old hotel now modernized in great location
reviews.review_text: This is a really great hotel in a perfect location.  We stayed in the annex (where the rooftop bar/lounge/restaurant is located).  We had a complimentary drink at their main hotel which has the first floor bar/restaurant.  Really we designed and updated hotel while maintaining it's old vintage look.  Really nice friendly service and great restaurant recommendation they offered was Buca Poldo.   Walking distance to everything!

Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen.address: 90 Folly Road Blvd Suite B-4, Charleston, SC 29407
Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen.description: Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen is a tribute to Florence Powell, the Great Grandmother of Jonathan and Patrick Kish of 82 Queen Restaurant established in 1982. Florence Mosley was born in 1908 in Charleston and worked at The American Tobacco Company’s Cigar Factory, where she met and married Plant Manager Jesse Powell. They enjoyed their life in the Lowcountry, crabbing, fishing, visiting the Limehouse Farmers Market on Wapoo road, and creating delicious home-cooked southern meals. They passed their recipes down to their granddaughter Tyler Kish, wife to Steve Kish chef/owner of 82 Queen. Florence and Jesse’s favorite dishes to cook were Deviled Crab Cakes, Seafood Gumbo, and Johnny Cakes. For every holiday Florence would make her famous punch, which we now served and call Grannies Punch.
Florence’s Lowcountry Kitchen.address_string: 90 Folly Road Blvd Suite B-4, Charleston, SC 29407

reviews.title: Good food, underperforming bar with no personality
reviews.review_text: Worst bartenders in history, but decent food. On the top of the list is Mel, so full of herself it’s painful…. You’re on James Island, there’s nothing special about you! Succeed in a large city… wait that’s impossible. It’s hilarious how small city people think they’re competent for a major metro… NOPE

reviews.title: NO LONGER THE FLORENCE'S LOWCOUNTRY KITCHEN WE ONCE LOVED!
reviews.review_text:
How the mighty have indeed tumbled! Remember when FLK was the place to be, nestled in that charming strip mall at Windermere and Folly Road (near Osaka Japanese Restaurant)? With a hip menu, a crowd that looked like they stepped out of a magazine, and service that was as smooth as butter, dining there was always a delight.

Then, just like that, they closed up shop. Cue the sad trombone.

But wait! They reopened, five miles down the road in what used to be a Mexican restaurant. We were thrilled, albeit a bit confused. We made the trek a few times, only to notice the vibe had shifted. Where did all the customers go? The food still held its own, but something felt... off.

Today, we decided to give it another shot. We ordered the Lowcountry Shrimp Dip to share, and the Gumbo and Smashburger for mains.

- The dip? Pretty tasty.
- The burger and fries? Saltier than a sailor on shore leave.
- And the gumbo? Oh boy, it was a culinary tragedy—a barely seasoned tomato soup with a sprinkle of Andouille sausage. We should've sent it back and demanded a redo!

The only reason we ever ventured this far down Folly Road was for Gillie's Seafood (now sadly closed) or Rita's in Folly Beach. At this rate, we can’t see ourselves making that trip again. It’s a shame to see
FLK go downhill in our opinion.

reviews.title: Mediocre
reviews.review_text: We went twice while on vacation so that tells you it wasn’t terrible. Pros:  the shrimp in all the dishes we had was so good!  The apple cobbler was fabulous, but the bread pudding needed to be warmer. They offered a special of scallops and caviar that my husband loved. The green bean side dish was really good. Cons:  the fried tomatoes were not good at all, and the Seafood Florentine was cold and “gluey”.    I couldn’t even eat it and had the flavors been better I would have asked to have them warm it up. Pecan pie was ok. Service is good.

reviews.title: I love Florence’s
reviews.review_text:
Casual dining with friends. 
They use to serve a great Ruben sandwich at the Windermere location. 
I look forward to it when they get there feet up under them on James Island

reviews.title: STILL JUST AS GOOD AS OLD LOCATION
reviews.review_text:
One of our go-to spots before they closed and finally re-opened in the old Jalisco Restaurant last December.

Happy to discover that its new incarnation is just as good as the last, the food choices are innovative and delicious (not to mention not Charleston expensive like most places) and the Bloody Mary's are still terrific.

Added benefit is the larger outside dining area, which was perfect the day we visited (and they allow dogs).

Can't wait to go back.

Only glitch was that the credit card charge still says Jalisco.

Luxor Florence.description: In Florence, Hotel Luxor Florence, opened in 2015, is within walking distance of the train station Santa Maria Novella, near the Exhibition Centre of Fortezza da Basso and Palazzo dei Congressi, as the old town and the main shopping streets. Its rooms have been designed streamlined and stylish. The interior design has a great attention to detail and the quiet, relaxing atmosphere is matched by the friendliness and warm hospitality that will make your stay memorable in the city of Renaissance. In addition to the 24h reception and the splendid breakfast room, you will find a custom-tailored services. Our goal is to make you feel at home, offering you double superior rooms , triple superior rooms, junior suites some of which with balcony and studio apartment different from each other but also by offering assistance and service worthy of the best hotels. Professionalism, and courtesy of the staff make finally Luxor Florence a perfect destination for any type of stay either you are visiting the city for pleasure either for those who seek a business hotel.

reviews.title: Good choice!
reviews.review_text:
Thank you for everything. The location is good, the room was clean and comfy, staff is very friendly and want to help you. Breakfast was good, I will advise you to add some more things but in all everything was great and tasty. 
P.S. the elevator was the great one 😂

reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE
reviews.review_text: STAY AWAY! TERRIBLE. The Hotel rooms do not match the description in the web page. The bathroom door does not close. as a family of 4 people there weren't enough toiletries, only 2 mini soaps. The AC in the middle of August is not working and they won't chenge our room.. The staff does not answer the phone and does not speak Italian. We asked for a room change and despite the hotel being empty we were denied service.  There is no drinking water.

reviews.title: A big NO!
reviews.review_text:
Pathetic, cheap, 0.5 star hotel with ridiculously noisy setup

The only positive is that it's at a 10 min walk to the metro station FSMN. Everything else is just sad. It's a small crammy converted-looking space at one corner of the road. Here are a few things to know..

- No lift! My room was on the first floor and the person at the reception had to lug the bag all the way up.
- The staircase is super dingy, worn, and smelly.
-  My room category: Junior Suite with Balcony
  The "suite" is just a sizeable room with 3 beds (1 double + 2 single)
- There's a small sitout-type area which looks at other surrounding buildings in your face - just a few meters away all of them!
- The rooms are across from each other separated by a 2-3 feet hallway which means you're almost sleeping in a large dorm with paper-thin walls. Noise travels from all the rooms and even the reception if someone were to speak slightly loudly
- Room phone doesn't work!
- The doors of the rooms shut with a loud click and thud  - so each time anyone on the floor opened theirs, you feel someone's entering your room!
- Breakfast was a tiny spread of stale breads, cakes, and fruits. So don't bother considering it free breakfast.
- The Italian lady at the reception was quite friendly and helpful - but even she couldn't make up for the total scam of this "3-star" hotel!

There are plenty of hotels closer to the station on the same route as this hotel. I suggest dig a little deeper and find the right hotel for you. because, Luxor Florence is definitely not it!

reviews.title: Had a memorable experience and  time , comfortable like home!
reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Luxor in Florence's! The staff and team were incredibly kind, generous, and cooperative, creating a friendly and warm environment throughout my visit. Their hospitality truly made my experience memorable. I appreciate their efforts and look forward to visiting again.

reviews.title: Huge disappointment
reviews.review_text:
The staff at reception depending on you get is either a very friendly guy or extremely rude....but rest was all a disappointment as it's definitely not a 3 star place as advertised...its a 1 star cheap place
There are no extra blankets or even tissues even if you request..if you loose the key card... yes the simple swipe thing they charge you 15 Euros as apparently its written in their fine print somewhere...
The rooms are actually in an adjoining apartment building on 3 floor..otherwise be ready to drag suitcases on the staircases for the few rooms..
The free breakfast is ok as regards the sealed stuff...fruits and croissants are stale and don't feel they change it every day... 
nice coffee machine though
And train track is right outside the window so hear trains all the time...

Chose this as was close to station and advertised as 3 star....Will not recommend to anyone for even one night and the pictures and descriptions are deceptive...
... huge disappointment....

The Westin Excelsior, Florence.description: With the Piazza della Signoria and Uffizi just steps away, The Westin Excelsior, Florence sits at the center of Florentine culture. Browse boutiques along the Ponte Vecchio, have an espresso at a local café, and enjoy the best Florence has to offer. Take in the vibrant flavors and sweeping views in SE·STO on Arno, our glass rooftop bar and restaurant. You can stay fit in the WestinWORKOUT® Fitness Studio, elevate your meeting in one of our unique venues and enjoy seven centuries of Italian history all inside our doors. Relive history in one of our 171 elegant guest rooms and suites recently renovated, some of which feature private balconies. Stunning views of the Arno and our Heavenly® Bed relax the senses, while high-speed internet access inspires peaceful productivity

reviews.title: Best hotel in Florence! A must stay that’s entirely worth it.
reviews.review_text: This hotel went above & beyond our expectations. Couldn’t recommend it enough for a long or short stay in Florence. The rooms were extremely spacious and kept up so well throughout our 4 days. We looked forward to heading back to our home away from home to escape the long days and unwind. Worth the money! Make sure you have a cocktail and enjoy the live piano player if you get a chance.

reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City
reviews.review_text: We felt wrapped in luxury from the minute we stepped through the revolving door into the beautiful lobby.  Porters took our luggage and showed us to the front desk where the clerk went over and above assisting us, answering our many questions. Our room was large and luxurious and the large beautiful bathroom offered a separate shower and oversized bathtub, with all the amenities you could want. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and all assistance was done with a smile. We were located across from the Arno near a wide variety of restaurants and within easy walking distance of Ponte Vecchio, the Duomo, and the Ufizzi Gallery. We hope to return to beautiful Florence and would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

reviews.title: horrible experience. definitely not a 5 star hotel.
reviews.review_text:
what a horrible experience. this is supposed to be a five star hotel? paid for a superior upgraded room and received a different room. the hotel justified it by stating that the room faced the river which is what i booked. no, i booked an upgraded room with a river view. 
more importantly, we were placed on the first floor right above the restaurant and the lobby and could hear everything happening below us well into the night. we could even hear the chairs dragging across the floors, the lobby music that played past midnight, and the constant conversation occurring below us and in the neighboring rooms. 
my wife and i never request service to our room as we prefer to not have people in our room. in turn, we ask for the normal replacement of water and towels every other day or so. we had to request this over and over again before we eventually just went downstairs and retrieved it ourselves. when we tried to speak to the hotel about the issues, they advised they didn't have a solution other than moving us to a new room the day before we checked out or providing us free buffet breakfast for our stay. this was priced at $55/person for a cold mediocre continental breakfast. we were staying there for 6 days and our stay cost over $6000. what a disappointment. 5 star hotel? more like 3 star. we stayed at the Marriot in Rome right before this that is considered a 4 star and it was SIGNIFICANTLY better in all avenues. 
if you're looking for a 5 star experience, stay away from this property.

reviews.title: Don’t hesitate to stay here
reviews.review_text: Such a wonderful hotel. Beautiful location on a plaza and on the Arno.  Easy walk to most locations.  Staff so friendly and really went out of the way to make us feel welcome.  Room is beautiful and they go the extra mile, leaving chocolates and even a bottle of wine and snacks.  Breakfast buffet is wonderful.  You can’t go wrong if you are looking for a luxury hotel in Florence.

reviews.title: Best trip ever!
reviews.review_text:
We loved Florence so much! We loved our time visiting the Westin. My family and i were so eager to arrive to see Salvatore at the Westin. This is a huge part of why we decided to visit the Westin, because we made connections with Salvatore at the St Regis, on a prior vacation. We absolutely adore him, and he treats our family so nicely and helps us with dinner recommendations and is so helpful and kind throughout our  whole stay! 
Everytime we come back, we look forward to seeing him, and we would never come to Florence without seeing Salvatore!

Tajimaya Aeon Mall Kyoto.address: 1 Nishikujo Toriiguchicho, Minami-ku 4F Aeon Mall Kyoto, Kyoto 601-8417 Kyoto Prefecture
Tajimaya Aeon Mall Kyoto.description: JR京都駅 八条口から 徒歩で5分。駐車場有り。(1125台）共有駐車場の場合があります。 【ランチ】ボリューム感たっぷり定量ランチは1,078円～。60分の食べ放題コースは全7品1,738円～。【ディナー】しゃぶしゃぶorすき焼きの食べ放題コースは全7品2,838円～。座席数88席。

reviews.title: Not waygu place! Its a nice sakuyaki
reviews.review_text:
Don't come here for waygu!!! It's not the point of this place. This should not be the #1 spot for mid range price waygu beef. Very misleading on that point.

But...
It's a cool place to try shabu or sukiyaki.

reviews.title: Worth it
reviews.review_text: The meat is decent. Especially the beef, the beef is very much worth it. You don't have too pay a lot of money for it. Also the vibe is nice.

reviews.title: Good hotpot
reviews.review_text: Hot Pot Haven offers a cozy ambiance perfect for gatherings. The selection of broths, including spicy Sichuan and savory pork bone, was exceptional. Ingredients were fresh, particularly the thinly sliced beef, lamb, shrimp balls, and handmade noodles. The DIY sauce station allowed for endless flavor combinations. The staff was attentive and friendly, enhancing the overall experience. Hot Pot Haven is a must-visit for hot pot enthusiasts, with its quality food, pleasant atmosphere, and excellent service making it an outstanding choice.

reviews.title: First time to this shabu shabu place. Great.
reviews.review_text: our first time coming to this one in the aeon mall.  It’s easy to locate as it’s just by the escalator on the 4th floor.  There are different options for lunch and the most economical option is 1580yen per person and up to 4080yeb per person for 60 minutes.  It wasn’t too busy when we were here so we sat over 60 mins and it was still ok but we were so full already.  Soup base options are quite common and I would say you need dipping sauce to go with it for sure as I find it a bit bland.  They even have curry sauce as well which you can have it with rice, noodles etc.  ice cream is also free here.  overall experience I would say it’s good for value and good if it’s not busy.  This time i didn’t try domestic beef which I should have ordered since I was too rush to order.  Enjoy!

reviews.title: highly recommended
reviews.review_text: very cheap restaurant for wagyu, highly recommended, many flavours for ice cream and really good service. the waitress are very nice

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review_text: Wonderful meat, perfectly prepared and excelent service. The menu includes also soup, salad, french fries and pudding, which are also extremely good!

reviews.title: SCAM - Taking advantage of tourists
reviews.review_text:
This place is a scam. They advertise themselves as a proper Kobe restaurant, supervised by a Michelin 3-star trained chef, serving halal Kobe - however I doubt that what they served us was actually Kobe beef. They make you pay in advance. Most of the kobe beef items are only available in set menus and the price isn't cheap. The starters etc were fine (nothing to write home about), but when the steak came out, our mood instantly soured. The meat was tough and had 0 marbling. It tasted like a average/disappointing steak you'd get from a mediocre restaurant anywhere - definitely not tender or melting, and had no special flavour. When we asked the staff why the meat had no marbling and was not tender like wagyu we've had elsewhere, their response was that the meat they source is the "lean cuts" of Kobe, and they cook it medium rare to keep it tender. I'm not sure that's even true (I've not heard of lean cuts of Kobe which has no fat marbling through it), and they did not explain that ANYWHERE on their website or online. Only when we asked about the steak did they point to a page on the menu which stated the above. That's when we felt that this place is a scam taking advantage of excited Muslims eager to try halal Kobe close to its source. Outrageous. We paid around $190 AUD for tough, disappointing tasting steak and some soup, salad and dessert. Oh and the dessert we got was store bought ice cream out of a tub - we couldn't even order the custard pudding because it had alcohol on it. Why make one of your set menu dessert options non-halal when you are obviously catering to muslim customers? I could have gotten a better dessert from a 7-eleven. It was insulting. Please be warned. Do not go to this place. 
We were severely mislead ny the good reviews on TripAdvisor and Google- the restaurant must have a system to entice customers to leave good reviews in exchange for something.

reviews.title: TRAP! SAVE YOUR MONEY!
reviews.review_text: Advertised as Kobe beef but was served as a tough regular steak. We paid ~19000 yen ($190) each for the Kobe set menu but was extremely disappointed by what was served for this price point. Additionally, the dessert options are NOT halal friendly so this was further disappointing. All in all, this appears to be a trap set up by the operator to take advantage of tourists looking to experience Kobe beef. Having read the negative reviews after this experience, it is clear that there is a system set up by the owner to get people to positively review the restaurant using free drink upon reviews being placed. I firmly believe that this steak is NOT Kobe Beef as it tastes like a regular steak, the was zero marbling (see pic) and we were not shown any certification (instead lied to). I will look to share this review on other platforms and will take steps to communicate this feedback to relevant tourism authorities.

reviews.title: Tasty Tidbits 😊
reviews.review_text:
Delicious food, amazing Chef 😁 loved the place and would come everyday. Staff is super friendly, very efficient and ambiance that cannot be described with words but sharing only beautiful memories. 

Definitely visit if you are in Kyoto 🩷

reviews.title: Lovely expérience
reviews.review_text:
Very welcoming, excellent experience.
The meat wagyu beef was really tasty and I can only recommend the Kobe beef premium course with a local gin and tonic to start

Matsuzakagyu What’s Kyoto Muromachi.address: 477 Eboshiyacho, Muromachi Sanjo-Dori Sagaru, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-8165 Kyoto Prefecture
Matsuzakagyu What’s Kyoto Muromachi.description: [A 4-minute from Karasuma Oike] Please enjoy one rank higher Yakiniku at a tasteful 80-year-old Kyomachiya house Abundant dishes unique to "buying a whole cow of Matsusaka beef"[Access] Subway Karasuma Line Karasuma-Oike Station 4-minute walk, Subway Tozai Line Karasuma-Oike Station 4-minute walk[Close] Every Tuesday[Cards Accepted] VISA, MasterCard, JCB, American Express, Diners Club, UnionPay

reviews.title: Great food, great time.
reviews.review_text:
We had a wonderful time here! 
The staff are very polite and professional. 
The food are so tasty , we ordered combinations wagyu dishes. We will be back again… 
Highly recommend for couples or small family.

reviews.title: Great food, ok service
reviews.review_text: My husband and I were so excited to try this restaurant in Kyoto. While the food was good there were definitely elements of the service that left us disappointed. First, they have you order off a QR code which is not a great experience for a top quality restaurant, the waiter just dropped off the code and basically said good luck. He did not explain how to order, how much to order, anything about the different cuts, or ultimately when the meat came how to cook it. While the meat was delicious the experience would have been much better if they had taken the time to give us explanations and guided us through the ordering not just telling us to do it on our phone and good luck. For our most expensive meal in Japan I would have expected more. Not a bad option to try upscale wagyu but I’m sure if you search a little further Kyoto has something more to offer.

reviews.title: Great Staff and Experience
reviews.review_text: The restaurant was great! We had a brilliant time and the staff were very helpful. I would highly recommend to try if you're in Kyoto

reviews.title: Wonderful first Kobe beef experience
reviews.review_text: This was a highlight of our Kyoto trip. We tried their famous “Big 3” (Kobe, Matsusaka and Omi) chateaubriand cuts of beef and all were excellent. The salads and garlic rice were equally delicious and a great accompaniment to our meal. Be aware you’ll have to grill the meat yourselves (we were afraid of messing it up, but they tell you how long to cook each cut). Service is responsive and they are very knowledgeable about the menu. All the servers also speak English, which was helpful as we had a lot of questions! Highly recommend if you are in Kyoto!

reviews.title: Don’t trust TripAdvisor reviews. There’s a catch!
reviews.review_text: This restaurant is the second best rated restaurant in Kyoto and now we understand why. At the end of the meal, they offer you a free desert if you write a review on TripAdvisor. And believe it or not, they check before bringing your the gratuity! I think it’s insulting. The food was good but not outstanding. This place did not feel traditional as the staff is not Japanese and the place is packed with tourists.

Kyoto.address: 22 High Street, Waterford X91 Y983 Ireland

reviews.title: Fast and tasty
reviews.review_text: This Japanese restaurant was recommended by a friend who lives in Waterford. At one of the museums a guide also highly recommended us to go for lunch. The service was fast and the food was excellent. Take a break from sightseeing and pop in for a nice lunch.

reviews.title: Magnificent Asian gem in in the heart of Waterford
reviews.review_text: Amazing food and lovely service. A real gem in the heart of Waterford and well worth the visit. Especially for the Spider Roll.

reviews.title: Yes, it makes no sense. We went to Ireland for a good Japanese meal.
reviews.review_text: After 7 or 8 days in Ireland, The Wife and I needed a dining break from Guinness stew and Fish and Chips. We picked this place totally at random and really got lucky.   The Wife had a Chicken Tatsutaage (sic?) and some gyozas.  I had salmon nigiri and prawn yaki soba stir fry.  Everything was very good.

reviews.title: Terrible attitude of one member of staff
reviews.review_text: I had planned on eating there, we were walking around the night before and saw it, so decided to check out the menu and I went in to use the toilet.  One member of staff started pulling on the bathroom door while o was inside, I thought it was a customer, so said occupied, they pulled the door again, I said nothing. I came out, the staff member, Asian, said I had no booking, I said ok, I will talk to my wife and give the time, my wife was outside, she said we are not eating there, the same lady had come out and shouted at her about making a booking, also shouted at another couple that were checking out the menu- we got sushi somewhere else, it’s a pity, as we had been looking forward to eating there.

reviews.title: Can't Wait To Return, Fantastic Food
reviews.review_text: Lovely little gem in Waterford. I was in Waterford with my Son for a sporting event on the Sunday and visited on Saturday evening. When we arrived the queue was out the door and we thought we would not get a table. However, much to our delight they were waiting for take-out.  It is nothing fancy inside (wooden benches at all tables) but the FOOD is AMAZING.  We started with Gyoza Dumpling dish, then the Jo Moriawase (€35) and also a Norimaki Prawn & Avacado all to share. We could not fault any of it. Staff were lovely too. Would defo return when in Waterford again.

KYOTO na Baixa.address: Praca Guilherme Gomes Fernandes 56, Porto 4050-294 Portugal

reviews.title: Great place for some Japanese comfort food
reviews.review_text: After finding out that 4 other Japanese restaurants didn’t exist in Porto, I found this restaurant. I started with the Miso Shiru which was as good as any Miso soup I have ever had. I also had a yakitori appetizer which was very tasty. For all the Japanese food fans, you know when you travel in Europe, sometimes you want a good bowl of rice and some okazu.  I had the Tori no Curry which is their take on a katsu curry and it really hit the spot. Could be the best meal I’ve had in a week. The wait staff is friendly and very pleasant. I was also introduced to Bohemian Bock which is a great dark beer.

reviews.title: Super Service, Good Food
reviews.review_text: The menu is extensive so we easily found a series of dishes that appealed to us and the food quality was very good.  The service was extremely good and attentive, although it was sad that the place was so empty.  It's a very nice interior space.  We had a very good meal.

reviews.title: Very bad service
reviews.review_text: We were waiting for more than 1h to bring a sushi, it is unacceptable. When we asked what is happening they said that they are full house. So instead of being grateful that they are full house and they have clients, for them this is an excuse and a reason to provide such bad service. This is the last time I come here.

reviews.title: Great sushi, great service
reviews.review_text:
We‘ve found this place via tripadvisor and simply loved it. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the sushi was awesome.
Number 7 from the Lunch menu is one of the best things I ever had.
We‘re looking forward to coming back on our next trip to Porto!

reviews.title: Rafael the waiter is brilliant.
reviews.review_text:
After being turned away from Subenshi Sushi for absolutely no reason, there were tables available as we had checked beforehand (glad we were otherwise we wouldn’t have found this place!) we walked into Kyoto, greeted by a very friendly and attentive waiter called Rafael. Our COVID passports weren’t working for some reason so he gave myself and my friends tests to do so we could still eat. 
Arriving quite late, around 9:30pm.. we were sat, and had food in front of us within 20 minutes and we ordered ALOT of food. I absolutely love sushi and have eaten it so much in my life and this restaurant, for a last minute walk in and ordering, was absolutely brilliant. The sushi was delicious (especially the salmon sashimi - beautifully thick fresh pieces) the chefs behind the counter outdid themselves. 
Prompt service, lovely staff (specially Rafael) and most importantly, deliciously fresh food. I’d recommended booking a table and experiencing it. 

Thanks very much Kyoto, I’ll definitely be back.

reviews.title: Worst restaurant experience ever.
reviews.review_text: Worst restaurant experience ever. They sat us at a table in the corner and then actively ignored us for 30 minutes. We finally gave up, paid for our drinks and left. Have never experienced such a complete lack of professionalism. If this was the only restaurant open in Aveiro we would rather go hungry.

reviews.title: Very good sushi.
reviews.review_text: Sushi was delicious with a large choice and several starters to choose from. Staff was really nice & friendly. Location is good not in the centre of town though.

reviews.title: Popular with the "Local"
reviews.review_text:
As it was cold & rainy, we decided not to dine at center which is good 20 min. walk but to try this "sushi joint" near by our hotel; we had not expected to have sushi come all the way to Portugal.

The food is most basic; sashimi limited to 3 kinds of common fish was fresh. Other dishes are "so so*.

It was full by 8pmish with seating capacity of about 80 pax; no wonder, the all-you-can eat was only ~€20.

Our bill of ala carte of total 6 small dishes with one glass of wine & 2 beers came to ~£27.

For its price-quality, this eatery deserves 3.5 star.

reviews.title: Great food
reviews.review_text: Very tasty, good quality suchi. Very fast and friendly service. Prices are average to high. Good decoration.

reviews.title: Great food
reviews.review_text: We came without previous recommendation so didn’t know what to expect. The food is amazingly cooked and the service was quick and efficient even with 20 people in 6 tables. My kids devoured the food! Will surely come back!

Tajimaya, Kyoto Yodobashi.address: 590-2 Karasumadori Sagaru Higashishiokojicho, Shimogyo-Ku Kyoto Yodobashi Bldg. 6F, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture
Tajimaya, Kyoto Yodobashi.description: JR京都駅 から徒歩で3分。【ランチ】ボリューム感たっぷり定量ランチは1,078円～。60分の食べ放題コースは全7品1,738円～。【ディナー】しゃぶしゃぶorすき焼きの食べ放題コースは全7品2,838円～。宴会最大56人までご利用可能。座席数80席

reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.review_text: The service was very friendly and prompt. The quality of meat was good and tasty. There can be a wait depending on the time of arrival.

reviews.title: Nice place to hanging
reviews.review_text: Very good place for bonding with family and friend. Nice food and nice ice cream. We came here to celebrate my husband birthday.

reviews.title: Yummy!
reviews.review_text: Food was great! We choose premium beef selection. The selection had a lot of choices. The soup was delicious. Served really well with the selection of meat

reviews.title: Nice Experience for Sukiyaki
reviews.review_text:
You can choose the domestic beef which  tastes good with very affordable price. The vegetable and noodles are served as “all you can eat”. Free flow drinks with additional 300 yen only.

Staff is friendly and patient enough to explain how Sukiyaki works. Overall, a nice restaurant to go if you want to try sukiyaki or Shabushabu.

reviews.title: Delicious lunch
reviews.review_text: Delicious lunch! Awesome value! We had the all you can eat wagyu sukiyaki. Meat was amazing quality. Super buttery and rich. Would come again

Fortune Garden Kyoto.address: 386-2 Ichinofunairicho Kawaramachidori 2-jo Sagaru, Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto 604-0924 Kyoto Prefecture
Fortune Garden Kyoto.description: 【French bistro restaurant where you can casually enhoy seasonal ingredients​ ​】 The former head office building of Shimadzu Corporation, created in 1927 by the eminent modern architect Takeda Goichi.​ ​ This historic landmark in the center of Kyoto has been reborn as a restaurant and a space for weddings and parties. You'll enjoy this casual French bistro, where you can dine on uncompromising cuisine against the backdrop of a bamboo-grove garden.​

reviews.title: A poor experience in this French/Japanese restaurant mid Kyoto
reviews.review_text:
Very nice location mid Kyoto. And it is possible to have a table inside and also outside in a small garden, if the weather permits. The bamboo garden is beautifull. the service is also good - except when you need to make a complaint.
We were two - one had Babette Steak and the other Nanzan Loin steak. And simply: It was terrible. The meat was filled with tendons and it was impossible to chew. In particular the Nanzan loin was terrible.
When complaining the staff just smiled and pretended not to understand what was the problem. When we asked to talk to a Manager he just smiled and took no further notice!
There were many japanese guests (locals I think) so unfortunately we left with a feeling that the tourist visitors are served what's left. Really a poor experience.
So conclusion: Don't go there for their meat selection!!

reviews.title: No exaggeration, the worst service we ever experienced
reviews.review_text:
Warning: do not expect to be served what you order. If you’re a foreigner, we recommend you go somewhere else.

We booked this place the night before to celebrate our anniversary, in our booking we specified the anniversary and what we can’t eat. The only dinner available on their website is the one menu, and we were pleased to see there was no pork in the menu as we have dietary restrictions.

When we arrived at the restaurant we started receiving a completely different menu than what we had chosen. We called the waitress over to explain that we were given the wrong menu, and we have dietary restrictions. There was no way to have a conversation as no one in the whole restaurant spoke English! It took so long to process anything or get through to them. We ended up spending most of the time trying to get the staff to understand us using translation apps.
But nothing seemed to work, we were met with blank stares mostly.

An apologetic waitress offered us cake free of charge, but when the bill came they insisted on us paying for it.
They actually tried to bill us the full amount, even though we were only served two small dishes. 

A complete mess, no service mentality, menus not matching, and at no time did anyone try to remedy the situation.

They had no regard for our time:  we were stuck arguing the bill even though we had  told them that we had to leave at a certain time as we had theater tickets and arrived late to the venue and were nearly not allowed entry. 
This whole experience really ruined our special day!

reviews.title: Fantastic Feast
reviews.review_text: A late walk-in to a busy restaurant can sometimes be a problem but not at Fortune Garden…brief wait for a table to be set in the garden area followed by impeccable service. Food was fantastic in terms of local produce quality elevated with precision cooking with a nod to France.  The turnip and scallop ceviche was awesome only bettered by the exquisite tenderloin,but what we really liked was the attention to any dietary allergies which they took great care to accommodate without reduction in taste and style confirming any amendments with a small note to ensure safe relaxed enjoyment by the patron…customer service at its best.

reviews.title: Don’t miss!
reviews.review_text: Yummy preset menu with our group-delicious food and drinks-incredible setting! Perfect place for a memorable lunch.

reviews.title: Not a great experience
reviews.review_text: Made a reservation for Valentine’s Day. The place had 4.5 stars so I thought it’ll be great. The place has a modern decor and good, dim lights ambience. Situated in a 1927 historical building across the street from the Okura Hotel. it has a bamboo garden in the back with tables that face the beautiful view. Now, the food and drinks are the real problem here. The restaurant is supposed to be a French bistro, and I don’t think because you serve French food, your portions need to be minuscule. Let’s start with the drinks. A gin and tonic served in a small 6-8 ounce glass and a sangria served chilled and in a portion similar to a wine portion. Need to remind that sangria is a mix of red wine and juices, and normally served as a full glass. This was a 2 finger portion in a large wine glass. The food.  We started with French onion soup which was served in a tiny, toy set bowl, probably no bigger than 2-3 ounces of soup.  It tasted good, but leaves you wishing for more, a lot more. Then a portion of mussels, very small again, with not a lot of flavor. A red wine braised beef served as two small pieces on no kore than a spoon of mashed potatoes. Half of the meat was fat, which was inedible. We asked for bread at ¥700 and a slice of bread cut in half was brought to us. The deserts were ok, but nothing worth telling. Total bill ¥11,000. We are ready to go for seconds somewhere else…

reviews.title: Will miss after
reviews.review_text: Perfect adventure in on other world and different taste , friendly and always smiling  waitress. Japanese atmosphere in the air

reviews.title: great restaurant
reviews.review_text: Another special evening at Kyoto sushi. Delicious food, prepared with great attention to the quality of the ingredients used and the aesthetics of serving. Great atmosphere, friendly service. The best sushi in the area, I recommend it to everyone - also for other dishes.

reviews.title: Great to impress someone
reviews.review_text: We were there for the first time with our grandma and let her taste something new. It was a great experience with very nice service and free extras. Also the restaurant is a fancy place. We had three fresh futomaki rolls and a pot of aromatic tea. You can find sushi elsewhere of the same quality and at least half the price, but here it's more about a fancy experience - if you want to impress someone, it's the best fit.

reviews.title: Worth to pop in
reviews.review_text: Very well done sushi, fresh and delicious. Nice and professional staff, helpful if you are unsure what to order. Very tidy and clean place. Defo will come back when visit Poland and Katowice again

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.review_text: Visit each time when in Katowice and I am never disappointed. Absolutely Fanta food amazing cocktails and great atmosphere. We have tried many stuff but definitely duck main course will be my favorite. For must husband it’s always sushi. If you visit don’t forget about desserts they all amazing. So definitely highly recommend either it’s a romantic dinner for 2 or occasion To meet with friends.

Kid Kyoto.address: 17-19 Bridge St Entry via Bridge Lane, Sydney, New South Wales 2000 Australia
Kid Kyoto.description: Where alternative rock meets unexpected Japanese. Kid Kyoto, a rebellious Japanese izakaya themed by music of the 80's and 90's - an era that encouraged its listeners to be different - turns up the heat on contemporary Japanese cuisine. Head Chef Rhys and his team, hero izakaya-style cooking, using fresh Australian produce. Stand out acts include the Watermelon sashimi with pickled ginger pearls, Lamb, bone marrow & kimchi gyoza, Table Smoked Scallop Sashimi with roasted tomato dashi and the Pork Hock with nori wakame jam & apple. The drinks menu includes a comprehensive wine selection, Japanese beers, premium sakes, whiskey, gin and cocktails. Kid Kyoto, features a semi-private dining room and an exclusive Chef's Table. At the Chef's Table, your chef is inspired by the playlist for the evening to create a unique menu. So, come as you are and see how the music wrote the menu.

reviews.title: Banquet menu with a difference
reviews.review_text: Business lunch we had a group of 9.  Only option is to select from their banquet menu which is a classic version or festive. However staff are accommodating of dietary requirements. Baked watermelon is very good - looks and tastes just like sashimi. The kingfish was also very good. In all a good experience but with a price to match.

reviews.title: Outstanding cuisine!!!!! Must Go!
reviews.review_text:
This is a Must Go To Restaurant !!!! 
We have the 75pp four of us. 
What can I say :  just simply a stunning experience and quite reasonable for the delicate presentation and generous portion and most delicious cuisine.  We thoroughly enjoyed every course of the meal.  The waiting staff was very attentive.
I look forward to my next 9 guests dinner end of November for my birthday.  
Thank you Kids Kyoto😀
This is probably my many visits since 2021 and each time never disappoint but last night was outstanding.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.review_text:
Amazing 
Absolutely delicious food 
Diverse and unique 
Perfectly cooked and served professionally and enthusiastically

reviews.title: Good food but a bad experience left a bad taste after wards
reviews.review_text:
You could not fault the food here. It is the best Japanese food that I have ever tasted.
The whole evening was a great culinary experience.
The taste and presentation of the food was so well thought out.
The service was 10 out of 10 until the bill arrived and it was then realised that our servers had added 10% to the bill which was not spoken about and agreed too.
This left a very bad taste as the set menu was $85 pp and we also had two bottles of expensive wine so the bill was pretty expensive anyway.
Nothing was said as it was a friend’s birthday and we did not want to make a fuss .. but I think added a tip with out the acknowledgment of the customer is not what we do in this country and is not right. This did spoil the whole experience.

reviews.title: Yummy food, great service.
reviews.review_text: Suggested by a friend, dinner was yummy and service friendly and efficient. Pork hocks, smoked edamame beans and octopus croquettes  - delicious! Our waiter Nahum was great, and taught us a bit about Spain as well as about the Japanese menu.

Ace Hotel Kyoto.address: 245-2 Kurumayacho, Nakagyo-ku ShinPuhKan, Kyoto 604-8185 Kyoto Prefecture
Ace Hotel Kyoto.description: Ace Hotel Kyoto lives in a part new build and part historic structure that was once home to a beloved landmark telephone company, designed in partnership with our longtime friends Commune Design and the legendary architect Kengo Kuma. Our first hotel in Asia, Ace Hotel Kyoto lives in the cultural epicenter of Japan, a place revered for its abundance of art, craft and nature. There’s an inspired Lobby with a dedicated art gallery, three distinct restaurants by award-winning culinary partners, 24-hour gym, flexible event spaces and a verdant garden courtyard.
