There’s also the first Stumptown Coffee Roasters cafe in Japan, and we’re within walking distance to cultural landmarks like the Nishiki Market, Kyoto Art Center and Kamesuehiro, the iconic 200-year old confectionary.
Ace Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 245-2 Kurumayacho, Nakagyo-ku ShinPuhKan, Kyoto 604-8185 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: A true hip hotel in Kyoto
reviews.review_text: This is a posh hotel in a great location in Kyoto. The rooms are large and very well decorated in a hip style.  The bathrooms are particularly beautiful.  The building is beautiful and offers a great roof terrace. Breakfast is delicious. Price is very reasonable given the quality of the hotel.

reviews.title: Modern Hotel with Traditional Service
reviews.review_text: We loved this hotel.  The concierge went above and beyond to help us with two serious issues our group had.  The food and service at Mr. Maurice's was excellent.  The rooms were spacious and well laid out and quiet which might surprise you when you walk into the busy reception and coffee shop area.  Loved the decor and layout of the hotel.

reviews.title: Stay here!
reviews.review_text: Accommodating staff, modern rooms with good comfort level in pillows and mattress. Spacious clever design and central to everything; food train, shops, family mart. After we stayed here nothing looked as good. Shout out to all the staff who made our stay really special. Oh and it’s dog friendly!

reviews.title: Home away from Home
reviews.review_text:
From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, Ace Hotel felt like a home away from home. It was also our treat to ourselves on our trip, and it lived up to all our expectations. There is such a great vibe and energy in the foyer and shared spaces, and yet the rooms are a calm retreat, with home touches and the best bathroom ever!
Would highly recommend

reviews.title: Amazing stay - beautifully and practically designed hotel. Outstanding service! Cannot ask for more !!
reviews.review_text:
I had an excellent 5 night stay at the Ace. Highlights were:

- amazing boutique hotel design everywhere
- excellent service and very helpful staff
- good sized rooms with super comfortable mattresses
- hotel Italian restaurant was amazing .. great food and atmosphere. Mushroom pizza was the best!

This is the place to stay!

Cross Hotel Kyoto.address: 71-1 Daikokucho, Kawaramachidori Sanjo Sagaru, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-8031 Kyoto Prefecture
Cross Hotel Kyoto.description: Cross Hotel Kyoto is adjacent to Kawaramachi and Kiyamachi streets in the heart of shopping and Gourmet district, yet you will find a variety of must-see heritage sites within walking distance. Nearest train stations of Keihan Line, Subway Tozai Line and Hankyu Line are no more than ten-minute walk away from the hotel. Cross Hotel Kyoto is your great travel hub to explore the beauty of this ancient capital of Japan – Kyoto.
Cross Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 71-1 Daikokucho, Kawaramachidori Sanjo Sagaru, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-8031 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Over-achieving hotel
reviews.review_text: A fine, modern hotel, ideally situated.  The service greatly exceeds the star status.  All staff were superbly helpful.  Rooms were excellent quality.  Breakfast varied and excellent.  Quiet, including quiet door-closings!  Recommended.

reviews.title: Great start to our Kansai trip at Cross Hotel!
reviews.review_text: Good size room by Tokyo standards and well maintained.  A great location to enjoy the Kyoto area.  Large Japanese style bath was a plus.  Bed was comfortable and the climate control was thoughtfully laid out including a humidifier. Our Japanese friends also enjoyed the hotel lobby and services.  Would come back

reviews.title: Good hotel is a very good location for touring.
reviews.review_text:
The Cross Hotel we found via other travel blogs. The hotel is very modern and well run with efficent and polite staff, all whom spoke quite good English.

The rooms were very tidy and even though it is in a major part of Kytoto is was very quiet apart from some party goers once outside on the orad on Sunday night.

The breakfast offers a huge range of food, both western and eatern inspired and the huge rooms you eat in were very comfortable with nice large cocuhes and artworks on the walls.

The beds and pillows were the usual firm sort you get in Japan, which I actually prefer to overly soft.

The location is excellent, a block away from the river, which has plenty of great walks around Gion and the old geiko areas. It is also very close to the resturants, food areas, subway and bus lines, making it an excellent spot for tourists.

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.review_text:
This was our second stay at the Cross Hotel in Kyoto. The location is excellent, just off a main street, Kawaramachi, with several bus lines as well as the subway a few blocks away. The staff are all exceedingly polite and helpful. We were helped with dinner reservations and booking our return to Kansai airport in Osaka.

Our superior king room was spacious and included a settee and table area. The separate WC, vanity, and wet room were great. There was plenty of room in both the entrance hall and the closet for our carry-on luggage. The mattress and pillows were just right, and we slept well with the black-out shades. We did not dine at the onsite restaurant. Coffee and tea are available in the lobby, as well as there is a kettle in the room.

If we were to return to Kyoto I would not hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.title: A Hotel to come back to!!!!
reviews.review_text:
I instantly loved this hotel upon seeing how centrally located it was from everything: dining, sightseeing, kyotos landmarks and shopping!
The front desk staff were so accomodating with our bed requirements, assistance with booking taxis for our day trips and even getting us a van to head back to the airport after our 6 night holiday.  Save on your luggage space! They provide you with 100% cotton pajamas, a complete set of heavenly scented bathing needs (shampoo, conditioner, body wash and bath salts for your evening soak) and bedroom slippers.  The housekeeping staff keep your room spotless for an excellent nights sleep throughout your whole stay!!! 
Thank you to the management of this hotel!!!

Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.address: 445-3, Myohoin Maekawa-Cho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0932 Kyoto Prefecture
Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.description: Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto, ranked #100 for "Travel + Leisure" World's Best Awards 2023, welcomes you to our contemporary oasis nestled around Shakusui-en, an 800-year-old heritage pond garden. Located in the serene and well-preserved Higashiyama district, our Hotel puts many of Kyoto's key attractions within easy reach. Every season unveils new splendours, providing an unrivalled setting for cultural rituals, wellness experiences and culinary explorations. Immerse yourself in the city's authentic living history while still enjoying the modern luxury and bespoke service synonymous with Four Seasons.
Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 445-3, Myohoin Maekawa-Cho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0932 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Nicest 4 seasons I have been to
reviews.review_text: Outside of the Ocean’s Club this is my favorite four season I have been too. The quality of the buildout was exceptional, polar opposite of the generic 4 seasons Mexico City.  We loved the cream brûlée pancakes. Hôtel is much smaller than it looks like in the photos, which we liked.  Sad the geisha never showed up in time on Saturday night for the show.  Japanese exceptionalism and quality at its best. Management well done

reviews.title: Great concierge and beautiful property. Breakfast and cocktails need work
reviews.review_text:
Overall a good stay but a few fixable misses to make the hotel live up to the brand promise and expectations.

It was peak season but breakfast was slow and hard to get service for multiple days. I had to find someone to take my order a few times. I’ve had much better breakfast in other comparably priced hotels in Japan. That said, the Japanese breakfast is exquisite.

Cocktail lounge was okay but not as good as other five star hotels in Japan.

Geiko/geisha experience was amazing and best part of stay. This is probably the reason to stay here above the other top tier hotels in Kyoto if you really want to see up close what that is like. The concierge was very helpful arranging all of these experiences and restaurant bookings.

reviews.title: Terrible experience.  Shower drain was plugged
reviews.review_text: I was so disappointed with this hotel.   It’s beautiful, the restaurant and common areas are fantastic, however my shower drain was clogged, no water was draining whatsoever and I showered with dirt water to my ankles. They simply said “I am sorry”.  Not a single glass of wine or anything.  I felt so disappointed.

reviews.title: Great hotel ok location
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel from my trip to Japan. Beautiful and new while also feeling like it honors tradition with its amazing garden. Service was excellent from the front desk to the restaurants to the concierge. Food was good and the drinks were very good. The only downside is the location requires a cab to pretty much anything you want to see or do.

reviews.title: probably busy in meeting ...
reviews.review_text:
The other day in September, I had to go to the French consulate in Kyoto. I am French myself, and we have never visited the Four Seasons Kyoto, while based in Osaka, we patronize a lot the local Four Seasons, where dining excels, we love the quality restaurant Est in Tokyo as well, and so on traveling from Osaka just for a treat, 
We, the couple, decided that day to do a visit around 3 pm, knowing the general manager is French Mrs. Fa. Gu..... we sought to have a little bite a treat in the lower lobby, having a glass of red wine glass served the  Cht Valandraud and cheese platers, a noisy saxophone disturbed us while enjoying the lovely garden view in front of us, and after a while, I asked the sommelier to share my name card to the management office to meet someone, the sommelier confirmed me twice he did. I have been in the hotel world my whole life, knowing most of the key managers around Japan are all close to customers I was not going to complain, but I was planning to share our experience with the upper management of our journey at  Kyotto Four Seasons we have been thrilled to have such great service by this Thai colleague who was cheerful, kind, attentive, and the cheese platers for a Japanese standard was amazing with quality bread and butter with some ash on it another new item we did enjoy.
We did enjoy the traditional dance in the lobby, too. I have been living in Japan for a while and enjoyed myself, but it is not this noisy, it is far too noisy. The saxophone was not in the right place in the main lobby, and the sound was not balanced at all.
 Past six pm, nobody came to visit us, no duty manager or guest relations nor the hotel or food beverage manager, leadership has been busy with meetings probably.
Well, of course, we could not congratulate the team for such lovely momentum, but I highly recommend the lower lobby and the garden any time.
 Communication and customer relations in such a luxury environment are basic and common. Don't expect any contact after 6 pm in this part of Kyoto, next time, we will go to the Amman hotel; it is just sad.

Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.address: 455 Nishinotoincho Nishinotoindori HanayachoSagaru, Shimogyo-ku, Kyoto 600-8327 Kyoto Prefecture
Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.description: With its rendering and design of light and shade, it is a hotel that will make you appreciate the wabi-sabi (beauty of quiet simplicity) of Kyoto culture. There are 11 types of guestrooms, ranging in size from 17m2 to 35m2. The guestroom interiors combine Kyoto culture with modern design, so you are sure to connect even more with Kyoto during your stay. Diners can choose from a Japanese or western menu. Kyoto's traditional "Okayu" thin rice porridge is the main Japanese dish, while the western menu includes the popular Kyoto pickles and egg sandwich.
Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.address_string: 455 Nishinotoincho Nishinotoindori HanayachoSagaru, Shimogyo-ku, Kyoto 600-8327 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Great accommodations in a magic city
reviews.review_text: Exceptional hotel, Rooms are specious clean and provide all the essential to make your stay enjoyable and pleasant. Staff is great responsive and is very  helpful in providing information on restaurants and attractions near the hotel. Good breakfast and unlimited coffee in the the entertainment area are additional bonuses

reviews.title: Find another hotel
reviews.review_text: I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews. In the elevator there is a QR code directing you to write a TripAdvisor review with an initiative to get a free gift.  This is the worse hotel I stayed at in Japan.  I was extremely disappointed.  The hotel is dark and dingy.  The rooms are tiny.  The beds are uncomfortable.  The bathroom is the size of a broom closet.  Their service was terrible.  The staff is extremely rude and not accommodating.  Do not stay here.

reviews.title: Kyoto cool
reviews.review_text: Stylish traditional Japanese vibe hotel with Western touches.  Cool, black and minimalist.  We had a superior queen room which was small but enough for a two night stay and great to have laundry facilities for a mid stay.  Staff were great and very helpful.  Good location, 10 minute walk to Kyoto station, Higashi Hongan-ji Temple and Nishihonganji Karamon Gate yet in a quiet neighborhood with restaurants a few blocks away.  The bar on site didn't have much atmosphere so we ventured out.  The best part was the onsen - so soothing and relaxing!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: The staff was very friendly and welcoming. It was located about 15 mins (walking) away from Kyoto station. There were bus stops right next to the hotel to easily get around the city. Our rooms were styled with a ryokan inspiration, so it was a nice experience to sleep on a futon set on tatami mats.

reviews.title: Recommended by a first timer
reviews.review_text: The entire hotel has an elevated modern ambiance but still really cozy with warm lighting. We greatly appreciated its accessibility to a local bus route to help us get to the main Kyoto station as well as throughout the city. The bed and amenities were amazing, after a day of touring I always had a restful night. Every day we returned just in time to freshen up at the bar and pick up toiletries for the evening. Good free wifi and no tattoo restrictions at the bath. The staff were professional, efficient and helpful and we didn’t have any issues.

Hotel Granvia Kyoto.address: Shiokojisagaru, Karasumadori, Shimogyo-Ku JR Kyoto Station Central Gate, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture
Hotel Granvia Kyoto.description: Beautiful 15-story hotel atop Kyoto Station - Broadband connection in all guest and banquet rooms - Easy access to Kansai Airport.
Hotel Granvia Kyoto.address_string: Shiokojisagaru, Karasumadori, Shimogyo-Ku JR Kyoto Station Central Gate, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Underwhelming
reviews.review_text: Very disappointing. Hotel is in a good location but is very tired looking. For the price I was disappointed. We had 2 superior twin rooms, good size but the bathroom could have done with an upgrade. The whole place showed signs of age, tired carpets, mould/damp on walls in bar. Too much money paid (roughly £200 per night per room) for the standard. This price was not including breakfast.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.review_text:
This was our favorite hotel we stayed at while in Japan.  The location can't be beat (although you can hear the trains in the morning starting at 6am, even from the 14th floor).
The amenities were amazing, we loved the room! The staff were very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great location, service and room
reviews.review_text: Extremely convenient location in the train station, my feet were grateful. Front desk are all English-speaking (much appreciated!). Nice room with a great view of Kyoto tower. Laundry service was fine and concierge was helpful in arranging for takkyubin service for my next destination. Nice minibar selection. No complaints, would def stay here again if wanting to explore Kyoto.

reviews.title: Hotel Granvia has it all!
reviews.review_text:
The Hotel Granvia had everything. Located in Kyoto Station the convenience for all our day trips was fantastic. There was shopping on site, lots of dining options and entertainment - dancing and light displays in the station auditorium on different nights and we explored all the walkways around the station. 
The rooms were faultless with sensor night lights, shower/steam room and all the amenities we could have wished for. Very comfortable extra bed.

reviews.title: Great location not the best customer experience
reviews.review_text: Hotel Granvia Kyoto is an excellent location for access to Kyoto train station. It is also very well positioned for access to many of the main visitor sites. It is above the Porto shopping centre which offers lots of choice for dining if you want to stay local. Room had a great view of the Kyoto Tower and the bed and linen are comfy and crisp. The reason for 3 star review is that the hotel is very busy, it feels very suited to a conference location or property for larger tour groups. This impacts on the customer service, all staff were very polite and professional but they are dealing with you from an efficiency perspective rather than one of real interest. An example is that on check in you are given breakfast vouchers which you present in the dining room, made it feel like a canteen experience. Breakfast very busy and not a relaxing or enjoyable event. So if you are looking for a more personal welcome, check out other options.

Hotel Okura Kyoto.address: Kawaramachi Oike, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-0924 Kyoto Prefecture
Hotel Okura Kyoto.description: Seventeen-story Hotel with impressive lobby of European architecture reminiscent of the 1920s.
Hotel Okura Kyoto.address_string: Kawaramachi Oike, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-0924 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Fine hotel, excellent breakfast buffet
reviews.review_text: The best hotel on our 2-week guided tour of Japan. Bigger rooms than usual in this hotel class in Japan, excellent and varied breakfast buffet with great views over the city. Close to Nishi Market with its shops and many informal dining options.

reviews.title: The best stay in Japan
reviews.review_text: This was our favorite hotel stay on a 2 week trip to Japan. The location couldn’t be more convenient as it connects to the rail station. Outside the doors on the bottom level of the station are several restaurants, making for a convenient quick dinner. The concierge was wonderful in recommending a fabulous sushi restaurant. The hotel is located right by the river and close to Nijo Castle and the Gion District. The best part was their breakfast room with a fabulous view of the city and a great buffet spread.

reviews.title: Good location but you pay extra for using the gym!
reviews.review_text:
The hotel is well located close to the Tozai Line subway station and within walking distance of Gion and Nishiki Market. 

The hotel feels quite dated but our premium room was a good size for Kyoto as was the bathroom with standalone shower. Most mod-cons are included but there were no USB sockets in the room and an iron/ironing board is only available on request.

The main downside to staying at this hotel is the ridiculous policy of charging guests an extra 3,300 Yen per day to use the gym and/or pool!! 

On the plus side, the excellent concierge was a great help with restaurant recommendations and reservations (which can be difficult as a tourist). They also operate a free shuttle service to Kyoto train station every 30mins which is very useful (both pick-up and drop-off). 

Breakfast is either a traditional Japanese breakfast on the 6th floor which is definitely recommended at least doing once. There's also a buffet breakfast on the 17th floor which was reasonable and included cooked-to-order eggs. However, the fruit was extremely limited and mostly of the tinned variety. 

Overall, the hotel provides good base for exploring wonderful Kyoto, but if you want to use a gym and/or pool you might find better value by looking elsewhere.

reviews.title: Nice Stay during nighttime
reviews.review_text: Had a good stay here for 2 days after our trips and tours around Kyoto. We only stayed here one night. We like that it’s not that crowded and it’s also peaceful tho we wished we stayed just to relax more. The bed was really comfortable and the service was great!

reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location between old and new
reviews.review_text: Great note, great location walkable to older historic districts like Gion but also a quick walk to the market and modern downtown, near a subway stop and several bus and train lines.  Free and easy shuttle to Kyoto Station for tours.  Great lounge area at the station and free shuttle pick up and baggage transfer/holding service.  Friendly and well informed English- speaking staff.  Great restaurants, and walkable to many more.  You can’t go wrong with this hotel!

Hyatt Regency Kyoto.description: A lush grove of bamboo marks the entrance to Hyatt Regency Kyoto in Higashiyama Shichijo, a leafy district suffused with the elegance of the old capital that is only 10 minutes away from Kyoto Station by taxi. Feel warmly welcomed in our contemporary hotel where tradition and modernity meets. Our team of expert concierges carefully curates tours and programs that offer insight into Japanese culture, meeting the needs of business and leisure travelers alike. The Rooms: Modern taste meets traditional style here, with artful hangings of antique kimono fragments and the soft light of paper lamps. The Locale: Even within historic Kyoto, Higashiyama is notable for its rich past as home to the imperial court. The Flavors: Three restaurants offer Italian trattoria style dining, exquisite Japanese cuisine, and cafe classics prepared in a wood-burning oven. The Possibilities: A 40-meter surround screen and live web-based projection enable event planners to immerse their guests in the experience. The Treatments: Seasoned therapists deliver Eastern healing traditions like shiatsu, acupuncture, moxibustion, and fermented hinoki powder bath at Riraku Spa.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
reviews.review_text:
It was a beatiful stay!  We were there to celebrate our 3 year anniversary and couldn't have asked for a better stay.  From check in to check out, everyone was very attentive and helpful.  Concierge helped us map a few things and gave us excellent recommendations.

Our room was beautiful and spacious...and we love that we were in a quieter area of Kyoto

reviews.title: Consistently exceeds lofty expectations
reviews.review_text:
We had lofty expectations for our recent visit to the Hyatt Regency Kyoto, because of several previous lovely visits. Our expectations were once again exceeded.

The staff at this hotel -- front desk, concierge, housekeeping and food and beverage--consistently go out of their way to make us feel welcome and truly appreciated. Dennis in the concierge's office was particularly warm and helpful.

While the "soft" product here is impressive, the "hard" product also met all our needs. The room, a decent size by Japanese hotel standards, was well-designed with plenty of electrical outlets for our devices (something lacking in many hotels). The bath/shower was divine.

We loved the Touzan Bar, which has some sophisticated bartenders, Sette restaurant and the Cafe 33 (though we missed the okonamayaki that was on the menu on previous visits).

We'll always return to this hotel.

reviews.title: Great Hotel Choice
reviews.review_text: First rate experience all-around.  Beautiful customer experience.  Treated personally and with great feeling.  Breakfast buffet is an extravagant bonanza and the Italian restaurant is superb.  Not in center but easily near trains and buses and Gion and Kyoto station are 15-20 minutes walks, which we did numerous times.

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel
reviews.review_text:
This is a very functional comfortable Western hotel! The rooms were medium sized and bed comfortable. Staff were very helpful. The concierge was excellent. 

If I ever go back to Kyoto, I may decide to stay here again! It is in a quieter corner of Kyoto but close to Gion and the foodie, shopping district! We have stayed in Arashiyama before and I think this location is so much better.

reviews.title: It was Great ...
reviews.review_text:
General Manager Tim O'Driscoll most  successfully runs a truly first class team at what is a truly excellent property.
My and my wife's list of items to praise would include a superb Deluxe Room ( with a wooden Japanese  bathtub) , excellent food, huge attention to detail, extremely helpful and friendly staff, good location ( right next to the must-visit Sanjūsangendō Temple). 
The hotel decor with its wood interior motifs has a very pleasing and zen feel to it - impressive while at the same time welcoming and relaxing. 
Particular mention is due to the following who, together with all those not listed, made our stay memorable through their kindness. 
The super energetic and kind Dennis Suherman ( Guest Experience Assistant Manager), Takeshi Shumabuku ( Cafe 33), Rejold ( Front Desk),  Kimura ( Concierge), Saula the Italian Executive Chef and last but not least Yasuda ( in the kitchen) who gets top marks in in my very own rating system which I have called GPEGS ( the Global Poached Egg Grading System). As a very seasoned traveller poached eggs are notoriously difficult to cook to perfection but Yasuda gets top marks.
Thank you Tim and all your colleagues for making our stay so welcoming, comfortable and memorable.

THE THOUSAND KYOTO.description: January 29, 2019 Grand Opening Opening in front of Kyoto Station is THE THOUSAND KYOTO, a hotel that offers each guest personalized comfort inspired by the wisdom and aesthetic philosophy of Kyoto, the millennial capital. In an atmosphere brimming with hospitality unique to Kyoto, indulge in true comfort suited for you.

reviews.title: Exceptional Design and Service – A Memorable Stay
reviews.review_text:
It is simply a stunning one —easily one of the more memorable hotels I’ve stayed in. The design is beautiful, the ambience (including the subtle scent throughout the looby) is super inviting, and the service was exceptional.

Breakfast was great, with two options: a Japanese-style meal or a Western one, each served in separate areas. The gym was also very well-equipped - 24/7.

The room was spacious and thoughtfully designed, though the view from the 7th floor could have been slightly better. That said, given the central location near the station, it’s understandable. The location itself was perfect for exploring Kyoto and the surrounding areas.

A fantastic choice.

reviews.title: One of the best places we have stayed
reviews.review_text: This is a very comfortable and aesthetically beautiful hotel. The staff is accommodating and welcoming. Location is convenient right across the street from the train station   Department stores and endless eating options. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast buffet. And I have to admit we asked for extra towels just to see the robot deliver them to our door.

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a great location
reviews.review_text: We enjoyed our stay at The Thousand.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  We really liked how close we were to the train station, as we took several day trips during our stay.  The hotel lobby has a beautiful lavender smell and a very calm atmosphere - reminded me of a spa hotel.  I will say that the breakfast was just okay, and got quite crowded at times.  Other than that, it was a very nice stay.

reviews.title: Outstanding hotel in every way
reviews.review_text: We stayed in 5 hotels during our two weeks in Japan, and the Thousand in Kyoto was by far the nicest.  Beautiful room with lots of space and every amenity possible.  Lavish breakfast, and a cozy bar to go to in the evening.  Very well located, near shops and restaurants, and an outstanding staff.  I highly recommend it!

reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Kyoto!
reviews.review_text: I've slept in hundreds of hotel rooms and the Thousand is one of my favorite hotel stays! The hotel itself is very conveniently located next to the train station. The breakfast is fantastic. The bathroom is AMAZING and I want to now redo our bathroom to be exactly like it!!

Park Hyatt Kyoto.address: 360 Kodaiji Masuyacho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0826 Kyoto Prefecture
Park Hyatt Kyoto.description: Park Hyatt Kyoto is a “luxury guesthouse” that blends the cultural sophistication of Kyoto with the graceful hospitality of Park Hyatt. The hotel faces famous Ninenzaka slope, home to Kyoto’s largest collection of heritage buildings and the gateway to Kiyomizu-dera Temple, a World Heritage Site. Park Hyatt Kyoto affords awe-inspiring views of Yasaka Pagoda as well as the overall city. It features stunning architecture that co-exists in perfect harmony with—and embodies the cultural sensibilities of—the historic buildings and gardens of Kyoyamato, a seventh-generation family-owned kaiseki restaurant that shares the same land. The hotel offers 70 rooms, a wellness center with a spa, and four food and beverage venues serving locally-inspired, innovative Western cuisine, all fostering a new style of hospitality in a timeless Kyoto space.
Park Hyatt Kyoto.address_string: 360 Kodaiji Masuyacho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0826 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Our best stay in Japan
reviews.review_text: We went on our honeymoon trip here. From the second we arrived we were treated like royalty. One of the best service I have experienced in any hotel. The location is perfect, so many attractions near by. Food was great too. Best stay of our Japan trip

reviews.title: Home ...away from home
reviews.review_text: The size of the room is spacious and comfortable. I loved the firm bed accompanied by fluffy pillows.  The bathroom is big and I loved the textured tiles in the bath area that prevents slipping.  Those who enjoy long showers will be spoiled by the strong water pressure from both the hand held and rain shower. One will always enjoy retuning to the comforts of this hotel room to relax after a day's activities in the lovely city of Kyoto.

reviews.title: I just don't see the Hype.
reviews.review_text: We have visited Kyoto numerous times and stayed at many hotels during our visit.   The Park Hyatt Kyoto hands down had the worst cost benefit ratio.  Despite a room upgrade as I am a Hyatt Globalist, the room was OK at best.   The Japanese breakfast that they rave about was unimpressive.   The service was so so.   The price extremely high for what is offered.   We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Kyoto as well.  Our opinion was that Hyatt Regency is much better in service and rooms.  Cost benefit ratio significantly better than Park Hyatt.   The only positive for park H is the location if you want to access Kiyomizu temple area.   On the other hand if you want to access Sanjyusangendo, Hyatt Regency is next door.

reviews.title: A wonderful base in Kyoto
reviews.review_text:
Concur with all recent reviews, this is a wonderful base for a visit to Kyoto!
The buildings and interiors are indeed serene and elegant, a true oasis from the very touristy streets outside the hotel. 
However the location means it is easy to wander off the main tourist route and evenings are wonderfully quiet. 
Our Pagoda View Twin room was very comfortable for relaxing in, with an excellent bathroom and some beautiful art on the walls. The rooms and public spaces are filled with superb books about the arts and culture of Japan.
Service, as one would expect in this great city, is warm, courteous and professional.
Our one meal at the Kyoto Bistro was pleasant but does not reach the heights of other aspects of the hotel.

reviews.title: This is a hotel you will never want to leave!
reviews.review_text: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in my life in every sense of the word. The quality of device , the magical ambiance, extremely dedicated outstanding immaculate service, artfully constructed exquisite building is beyond anyone’s expectation. Honestly I have never seen such a smiling and enthusiastic service anywhere else in my life. This is a place you will never want to leave; not only this exquisitely beautiful building but also its wonderful people who keeps running for the customers’s happiness 7/24.

Genji Kyoto.description: Lifestyle boutique hotel on the banks of Kamo River, close to major Kyoto attractions. A member of Design Hotels™ and a sanctuary with Japanese design in contemporary architecture. 19 luxurious rooms with river, garden or city views, tatami area and bathtub. Japanese gardens throughout the hotel including in lobby and on rooftop with panoramic river and mountain views. All-day dining with sumptuous breakfast and international and Japanese a la carte dishes, served in Genji Lounge, on rooftop garden or in-room. Personalised service and experienced staff to help plan tours and itineraries. Walking distance to Gion, Pontocho, Nishiki Market, National Museum, Kyoto Station and Kiyomizu temple area.

reviews.title: Amazing boutique hotel, excellent design, wonderful staff - in a peaceful and central neighborhood
reviews.review_text:
This hotel was absolutely amazing, and surpassed all of our expectations - I would highly recommend booking this hotel if you can find availability!

We stayed in a City Deluxe Room and were blown away by the attention to detail in the room design, the comfort, and functionality. The hotel opened recently, and everything felt new and custom. This room felt luxe, bespoke and truly designed for Kyoto. The room design was a perfect mix of Western and Japanese design and sensibilities, with an incredibly comfortable bed and pillows, a spectacular bathroom area, and a beautiful sitting area - and custom touches throughout. The design of the room and the hotel are so cohesive and thoughtful, it was a joy to get back to our room each day after the long, tiring days sightseeing in Kyoto!

The hotel itself really impressed us - it is truly a boutique hotel, with less than 20 rooms. I'll admit, I was a little nervous as I'd never stayed at a hotel this small before, but this hotel really surpassed expectations with it's personal service level, its location tucked into a local neighborhood along the riverfront, and just cozy and chic "vibes". All of the staff were helpful and so knowledgeable, with excellent recommendations for nearby restaurants and things to do. The lobby restaurant / bar are great for either the breakfast or an evening cocktail (I loved the Kyoto Negroni). And there's a beautiful garden rooftop with views of the city over the river, which was great in good weather. 

The neighborhood was also great - quiet, away from the crowds, and in a very local, neighborhood area - but still really easy to get to transit options, and walkable to either Gion or Kyoto station area. In fact, we walked here from Kyoto station with our luggage in about 15 minutes. Also, the hotel staff have great recommendations for nearby food and drink options. The hotel is right on the river, too!

I can't say enough about how much we loved this hotel, and I would recommend staying here, and hope to get to return someday! It definitely is one of the most memorable hotels I've stayed at, for all the right reasons!

reviews.title: Charming contemporary hotel in the midst of Kyoto with Japanese but  modern influences..
reviews.review_text:
This two year old hotel is utterly charming and has a great "Japanese" feel. It's facilities are excellent and staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and well appointed.
It has an excellent location and is within walking distance to many attractions, cafes, restaurants and a major shopping centre area.
The rooftop garden was a pleasant spot for breakfast and also the sake tasting experience.

reviews.title: Charming hotel
reviews.review_text: This is a charming hotel that is classy and comfortable.  Even though its architecture is contemporary, it has design details that reference traditional features and techniques. Their Japanese garden in the lobby has a back wall that looks like wood, but is actually concrete with imprinted wood patterns.  It was so cool! Our room was spacious with very comfortable beds, and the view was just amazing.  Looking at the birds and fish and turtles on the river was really fun and calming.  But the best part was getting to know the wonderful staff. They all speak English well and are incredibly friendly and helpful. We are grateful to them for a most memorable trip.

reviews.title: Wonderful and heartwarming stay in Genji Kyoto for my family
reviews.review_text: I am glad I returned to stay here for the second time, this time with my two children.  We had absolutlely the best experience.  Not only were the rooms super clean and comfortable as ever, but they have been enhanced with more charming details.  Our breakfast and meals were delicious and beautifully presented.  The staff recognized us, and were helpful, efficient and friendly in a way that you feel is coming from their hearts. They looked after us in every way, showing us the bus and train stations and providing suggestions for restaurants and activities.  I totally recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good design and good people, not to mention beautiful gardens, free bicycles and free self-service laundry.  This is surely our home away from home in Kyoto!

reviews.title: Boutique Hotel in Kyoto!
reviews.review_text:
We very much enjoyed our stay at Genji Kyoto! 

This is a boutique hotel in Kyoto, right next to the river. It feels thoughtful, well-designed, and curated. As you walk in, you enter the lobby area that is combined with a small restaurant where you can eat breakfast in the morning. There is a little zen garden to the right, perfect for sitting and having a cup of coffee. On the top floor, there is a garden where you can either have breakfast (make sure to make a reservation!) or have a glass of wine!

We only spent one night and they had thoughtfully upgraded our room to one that overlooks the river. The room was incredibly spacious, with a gigantic bed, an eating area with a tatami mat, a small bench and table, where you can either read or work, and a shower/tub room that felt like a spa, separate from the water closet. It was so relaxing to sit on the balcony and watch the herons and turtles below.

The neighborhood is walkable to Nishiki market and the shopping area immediately surrounding it but it is definitely a good 20 minute walk or so. After we checked into the hotel and stashed our belongings, it was a bit too late for us to easily find lunch close to the hotel, and we ended up having to walk for a bit to find something to eat. We are definitely planning on staying here again when we are back in Kyoto!

Cycle Kyoto.address: 7 Higashikujo Nishisannocho, Minami-ku, Kyoto 601-8003 Kyoto Prefecture
Cycle Kyoto.description: Cycle Kyoto organises small group bike adventures in Japan’s ancient capital of Kyoto, all in English, and all in a day. With over 2,000 temples and shrines and no less than 17 UNESCO World Heritage sites,
Cycle Kyoto.address_string: 7 Higashikujo Nishisannocho, Minami-ku, Kyoto 601-8003 Kyoto Prefecture

Kyoto MK.description: Follow us on Instagram：@mktaxi.global https://www.instagram.com/mktaxi.global/ We are the well-known heart-mark car service in Kyoto providing sightseeing tours with English speaking tour guide drivers as well.If you are looking for a special, "omotenashi" service (selfless hospitality) while staying in Kyoto, we are here to help.Our highly trained hire staff can show you around, enter the sights and explain about them in English. Our drivers are studying English to make you feel more comfortable during the ride!We hope we will have a chance to serve you soon!

reviews.title: Comfortable way to see Kyoto
reviews.review_text: Mr Kenji Kato from MK Taxi drove us around Kyoto yesterday. We very much enjoyed being driven around by Kenji.  He was very friendly and knowledgeable about various sights in Kyoto. He also recommended a nice conveyor belt sushi restaurant (Kura) for us to have lunch.

Kyoto Station Building.description: Kyoto Station Building is a train station and popular tourist spot, with a department store, The Cube selling souvenirs and fashion, Asty Road and Asty Square shopping areas, a mall, and restaurants.

reviews.title: Like all the major Japanese JR stations, pretty astounding.
reviews.review_text:
This huge station has everything - not just trains. Don't miss the grand stairway, "Daikaidan" with its seven progressive escalators reaching 35 metres into the air - with a wide choice of restaurants and sky garden on the 15th floor once you finally reach the top. This station even has a theatre and art gallery.
We had a moment of panic when, attempting to store our luggage for a few hours, saw that every storage box was marked with "no cash" signs requiring a special card. The cards turned out to be easy to buy but later we found another group of storage boxes accepting only cash
As always in Japan we found the station staff eager to help.

reviews.title: Great view of a lighted LED staircase!
reviews.review_text:
It is worth a visit to the huge and busy Kyoto Station if you have some time.  Make sure you stop by the Daikaiden-Giant Grand Staircase from 5p.m. - 10p.m. each day on as the staircase is lit up from the 3rd floor to the 8th floor with colorful flashing LED lights of different themes depending on the month and season as the images are depicted accordingly.  During our visit in July, the theme was "Summer- Gion Festival Lights." It was very colorful and many different scenes change and move around the staircase itself that acts as a background screen. 
There are no seats so make yourself comfortable by locating a good spot to view the lighted staircase.  Also, there are people who sit and/or run up and down the staircase, so it may obstruct your view or while you are taking photos as it is a working staircase.  Definitely worth a stop for a short break over to view it if you are in the Kyoto Station after sunset.

reviews.title: Very striking
reviews.review_text:
The bullet train brings you here exactly time! It is large and new-looking.

There are at,east four hotels within a short walk.

We had dinner in two parts: tardiness on floor 11 and ramen on floor 10.

reviews.title: Wow! A must see!
reviews.review_text: Culturally, people from Australia wouldn’t usually want to visit a train station on holiday, but we got off the train as we are staying a few stops up, and thought to check out main Kyoto.  Even though there are 4 Starbucks inside the station, we crossed the road to sit outside and watch the world.  I recognised the frontage from other trip advisor posts, and decided to kill the hour we had, exploring inside.  Omg.  I have never seen such steep escalators, rooftop gardens and free views! The enclosed walkway, the lit up stairs. Some nice seating too.  The top floor has a high end restaurant area with many restaurants.  Another end has a Ramen street!  It’s like 400m long!  Not including the many shops and department store!  There’s a hotel and a cinema…. So much!

reviews.title: Train Station Worth Checking Out
reviews.review_text:
This train station has it all and is a highlight during our visit to Kyoto. We visited in 2018 at the suggestion of friends and were skeptical at first but were very impressive with the train station. There are lots of architectural features to it that make it interesting including the Happy Terrace with unobstructed views of the surrounding city, the Skyway which goes high above the station, the grand staircase, and the large openings to see whats around like the Kyoto Tower.

Our favourite spot is the ramen street on the tenth floor which features award winning ramen from all over Japan. You do have to queue and prepay using vending machines at most (if not all) restaurants but it is worth the wait if you have time for lunch or dinner in the Kyoto Station area.

There are also numerous shops and conveniences that you would expect for a large train station in Japan and it is relatively easy to navigate. If you are a stamp collector like my wife you can go to the information centre or ask a station attendant for information on where to get your stamp.

We spent a couple of hours at the train station and would recommend getting here before your train departs to check it out or planning for a lunch or dinner here after your train arrives. When we stayed in Kyoto we found that the Kyoto Station was central to all the activities we wanted to do in Kyoto and offered us easy and frequent transit solutions to get to what we wanted to see.

Kimono Tea Ceremony Maikoya Kyoto.description: KYOTO MAIKOYA is a old machiya house registered Tangible Cultural Property by the local government. It is a historic townhouse where you can feel the real Japanese culture and enjoy the tea ceremony by gazing at two picturesque Japanese tea gardens. We also provide geisha experiences

Kyoto Tower.address: 721-1 Higashishiokojicho Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Tower.address_string: 721-1 Higashishiokojicho Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Brilliant views and great value
reviews.review_text:
This hadn't been in our plans but we found ourselves at Kyoto station with 1.5hrs to spare and thought why not. Turned out to be a great decision. Not to busy and stunning views of Kyoto and in the distance Osaka. Loved watching the bullet trains going to and fro from the station.
And all for about a 10th of the cost of going up either of the Tokyo towers

reviews.title: City view, short visit, with the kids
reviews.review_text:
Panoramic view of the city , useful to getfirst  good orientation of Kyoto, and helpful for planning next days. 
Across the street from Kyoto station , with a lot of good in the first and basement floors. 
Can be good starting point for rest, AC upon arrival

reviews.title: Not for men
reviews.review_text:
I don't recommend this hotel for men. The design of the toilets basin is awful.  When a normal man sits on the basin the tip of the penis touches the base of the basin.  Believe me you don't have to be extra-large. You will need to hold your penis with your hands outside the basin. Imagine the complications when you need to do 1 and 2. 
Recommend the hotel changes all toilets. I was told all rooms have the same type. 
Apart from that, good people and great location close to the train station.

reviews.title: Small and intimate and worth a visit!
reviews.review_text: We were so pleasantly surprised by this place! It’s a small observation deck overlooking Kyoto and it’s really fun to see the whole curry from up above. The binoculars are free to use and they give you a small picture of you with the Kyoto Tower in front - so sweet! Not as crazy as the other observation decks in Tokyo or other cities. We really liked this one. Worth a visit!

reviews.title: Crowded, but good views
reviews.review_text:
Given all the things to see in Kyoto, this probably could have been dropped off the sightseeing list, but the views were nice, especially at sunset.

It was very crowded, however.

Kyoto Samurai Experience.description: This is an excellent chance for visitors to get a firsthand look into the world of the samurai. Get a glimpse into the philosophies of Bushido ("The Way of the Warrior") and try your hand at wielding a real katana. Afterwards, practice some inward reflection with Zen meditation, used by the samurai to calm their minds during battle.

Kyoto Daily Tours.description: The Right Way To See Kyoto. We provide high quality private tours in and around Kyoto for both short stay and long stay guests. If you want to see everything this historical city has to offer and you don’t want to spend hours finding out where to go and what to see, you came to the right place.

reviews.title: Amazing tour of ancient Kyoto
reviews.review_text: We did the ancient Kyoto tour with José. It was amazing. We went to so many temples we would not have found on our own and learned so much about Japan and its history. In hindsight, we would have definitely booked more tours with them. Honestly, there's so much to see in Kyoto, I would consider the two day tour.

reviews.title: Excellent Private Tour and Tour Guide
reviews.review_text: We were a group of 7 mature aged ladies who arranged a private day tour of Kyoto. From the moment we enquired, to being picked up and dropped off we experienced a very friendly and professional service. Our English speaking tour guide Tad, was amazing - he was extremely knowledgeable and especially patient. He took lots of photos and even prepared a short video of our days' highlights. We enjoyed the flexibility of choosing our own itinerary with the expert assistance of Tad. We would all highly recommend this tour company and especially, Tad.

reviews.title: Memorable experience of Kyoto with KYOTO DAILY TOURS
reviews.review_text:
Big thanks to KYOTO DAILY TOURS team, on behalf of Michael, who smoothly organized our tour. This company is very trustful, proactive and incredibly professional in providing Customer oriented services. The most we loved is the flexibly. We highly recommend them as your tour agent.
On the other hand, we would like to highlight the high professionalism of our Guide Adria (Adriano Adal) and express our thanks for making our tour memorable.
Adria is both a nice person and well informed about the culture of Japan guide! We enjoyed our 2 days tour with him, and we would highly recommend him further as well.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable Kyoto tour
reviews.review_text: Very enjoyable with Tad who arranged the tour around our requests. It was very enjoyable, The drive with Tad was very comfortable, he was informative and took some lovely videos for us.

Kyoto Localized.address: 113 Nakajimacho, Sanjodori Kawaramachi Higashiiru, Nakagyo-Ku Starbucks Coffee Kyoto Sanjo-Ohashi, Kyoto 605-0074 Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Localized.description: Kyoto is heart of Japan and have the rich history and culture. Our Walking Tours will show you why. You will learn about the Old and New Kyoto, tradition, religion, history, food, and culture.
Kyoto Localized.address_string: 113 Nakajimacho, Sanjodori Kawaramachi Higashiiru, Nakagyo-Ku Starbucks Coffee Kyoto Sanjo-Ohashi, Kyoto 605-0074 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Must do walking tour
reviews.review_text:
We went on the free walking tour with Ben and it was above all expectations! 
Everything was really interesting, from basic facts that answered questions we were wondering about to the rich history of Kyoto 
Ben was amazing! 
Thank you !!!

reviews.title: Best Tour I did in Japan, thank you David
reviews.review_text: This was my first Tour I did in Japan, that time not knowing that it would be the best. Thanks to our tour guide David in that almost 3h I learned the most about the japanese history, culture and traditions. He could answer all our questions not just regarding to Kyoto but all uncertainties meeting the new culture we had in our minds. You could see that he was really passionate, knowing so many side informations and interesting side facts.. it was just incredible. After I realized, that other tours were not like this, I wished I tipped him triple. Wish you all the best, thank you again!

Kyoto Free Walking Tour.address: Kawabatacho, Higashiyama-Ku In front of the Izumo no Okuni Statue, Kyoto 605-0076 Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Free Walking Tour.description: Come join us on the original Kyoto Free Walking Tour, through the historic streets of the ancient capital of Japan! With a lot of information about the ancient capital's history and culture, geisha world, religion, local food, and life. Visit our homepage for schedule and needed information.
Kyoto Free Walking Tour.address_string: Kawabatacho, Higashiyama-Ku In front of the Izumo no Okuni Statue, Kyoto 605-0076 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Perfect Free WalkingTour in Gion
reviews.review_text: We had a blast with Jens. He made the time fly by and all was over too fast. He knows a lot and could get an inside into the japanese culture and into Gion. It was great. He even gave us some tips for dinner and other things.

reviews.title: Super amazing
reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful experience on this tour in Kyoto with Dom. The guide was knowledgeable, very fun and provided fascinating insights about the city's history, culture, and traditions. Every stop was well-organized, and I learned so much throughout the journey. It was both informative and enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Kyoto!

reviews.title: Great tour of Kyoto
reviews.review_text: Dom was an amazing tour guide. Lots of stuff to see. He had a lot of knowledge about the area and was engaging and entertaining.

reviews.title: Nice free walking tour with Dom!
reviews.review_text:
Nice Kyoto free walking tour with Dom. He was passionate and gave us plenty of useful informations!
Super Recommended!

reviews.title: Amazing tour guide in Kyoto
reviews.review_text: Dom was a brilliant and informative tour guide. We had a great few hours exploring Kyoto for the first time. He had amazing stories and took us to some beautiful spots- letting us take our time taking lots of photos! I would definitely recommend Dom to anyone who wants to learn about Kyoto in a fun and interesting way.

Kyoto Garden.address: Holland Park Ave Holland Park, London W11 4UA England
Kyoto Garden.address_string: Holland Park Ave Holland Park, London W11 4UA England

reviews.title: Heron, peacock & koi
reviews.review_text: This garden is a pleasant place, even in late November. There was a large heron, peacock, and large koi fish.  Toilets nearby.  Small bridge to walk over.   This garden is not far from Ukrainian statue of St Volodymr.

reviews.title: What a lovely garden.
reviews.review_text:
Peaceful, calming and beautifully maintained. 
A lovely walk around the pond with the extra bonus of seeing the resident grey herons and a peacock. 
Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Not bad for a Japanese garden outside Japan
reviews.review_text: Lovely Japanese Garden in the middle of Holland Park. It was a lot smaller and simpler than expected but not bad for a Japanese garden in the UK

reviews.title: Beautiful little garden
reviews.review_text:
Kyoto Garden is an amazing little garden in the middle of Holland Park. It's not very large so it makes it easy to wander through if you're in the area.

We'll definitely return and I highly recommend, especially on a nice sunny day.

reviews.title: Lovely but small garden
reviews.review_text: The Kyoto garden is located within Holland Park. It is a lovely but small garden, which is very well maintained. If you are lucky you will get to see some wildlife. I managed to see a Heron, Peacock and some ducks as well as a lot of friendly Squirrels. It's nice to spend a little time here and relax, however if you aren't in London for long it would be better to go to one of the more central parks unless you are in this area anyway.

Kyoto.description: The shrines and temples of Kyoto offer a rare link between modern life in the city and its very ancient past. The Shimogamo Shrine dates to the 6th century and seems suspended in time, its serenity and spiritual power still palpable. Visit Fushimi Inari Shrine, then see the life-sized Thousand Armed Kannon statues of Sanjūsangen-dō. Enjoy traditional geisha performances, then savor a tranquil meal at a restaurant overlooking the Kamo River.

reviews.title: It is still the most enjoyable hotel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.review_text:
I have just returned from spending a week at Mume in November. 

The many photos are true to life and speak for themselves. 
The superlatives that have been used in the 900 plus previous ‘excellent' reviews on Tripadvisor are not exagerations.

Our experience at Mume was excellent on our first visit in 2019 and was again on this visit.

I am not going to repeat most of what has been said over and over again about Mume previously  however I do have to say that Hisako, Hikaru, and Nana are what makes this place unique. Their hospitality skills are superb. You could be staying in tents and they would still make it OK.  They are charming, helpful and genuinely friendly. As a previous reviewer from Australia said, you would happily welcome them into your own house if they were ever to visit you. 
They set the same high standards for their young staff who as a result  are also charming,helpful and friendly.

For many years now I have been lucky to travel extensively both for work and pleasure.  Sometimes I  have stayed in expensive, luxurious establishments and sometimes in comfortable but more affordable places like Mume.  Some of them have even been excellent but Mume is still the most enjoyable hotel I have ever stayed in and superb value for money in Kyoto.

reviews.title: Fine hotel, excellent breakfast buffet
reviews.review_text: The best hotel on our 2-week guided tour of Japan. Bigger rooms than usual in this hotel class in Japan, excellent and varied breakfast buffet with great views over the city. Close to Nishi Market with its shops and many informal dining options.

Ace Hotel Kyoto.address: 245-2 Kurumayacho, Nakagyo-ku ShinPuhKan, Kyoto 604-8185 Kyoto Prefecture
Ace Hotel Kyoto.description: Ace Hotel Kyoto lives in a part new build and part historic structure that was once home to a beloved landmark telephone company, designed in partnership with our longtime friends Commune Design and the legendary architect Kengo Kuma. Our first hotel in Asia, Ace Hotel Kyoto lives in the cultural epicenter of Japan, a place revered for its abundance of art, craft and nature. There’s an inspired Lobby with a dedicated art gallery, three distinct restaurants by award-winning culinary partners, 24-hour gym, flexible event spaces and a verdant garden courtyard. There’s also the first Stumptown Coffee Roasters cafe in Japan, and we’re within walking distance to cultural landmarks like the Nishiki Market, Kyoto Art Center and Kamesuehiro, the iconic 200-year old confectionary.
Ace Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 245-2 Kurumayacho, Nakagyo-ku ShinPuhKan, Kyoto 604-8185 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: A true hip hotel in Kyoto
reviews.review_text: This is a posh hotel in a great location in Kyoto. The rooms are large and very well decorated in a hip style.  The bathrooms are particularly beautiful.  The building is beautiful and offers a great roof terrace. Breakfast is delicious. Price is very reasonable given the quality of the hotel.

reviews.title: Modern Hotel with Traditional Service
reviews.review_text: We loved this hotel.  The concierge went above and beyond to help us with two serious issues our group had.  The food and service at Mr. Maurice's was excellent.  The rooms were spacious and well laid out and quiet which might surprise you when you walk into the busy reception and coffee shop area.  Loved the decor and layout of the hotel.

reviews.title: Stay here!
reviews.review_text: Accommodating staff, modern rooms with good comfort level in pillows and mattress. Spacious clever design and central to everything; food train, shops, family mart. After we stayed here nothing looked as good. Shout out to all the staff who made our stay really special. Oh and it’s dog friendly!

reviews.title: Home away from Home
reviews.review_text:
From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, Ace Hotel felt like a home away from home. It was also our treat to ourselves on our trip, and it lived up to all our expectations. There is such a great vibe and energy in the foyer and shared spaces, and yet the rooms are a calm retreat, with home touches and the best bathroom ever!
Would highly recommend

reviews.title: Amazing stay - beautifully and practically designed hotel. Outstanding service! Cannot ask for more !!
reviews.review_text:
I had an excellent 5 night stay at the Ace. Highlights were:

- amazing boutique hotel design everywhere
- excellent service and very helpful staff
- good sized rooms with super comfortable mattresses
- hotel Italian restaurant was amazing .. great food and atmosphere. Mushroom pizza was the best!

This is the place to stay!

Cross Hotel Kyoto.address: 71-1 Daikokucho, Kawaramachidori Sanjo Sagaru, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-8031 Kyoto Prefecture
Cross Hotel Kyoto.description: Cross Hotel Kyoto is adjacent to Kawaramachi and Kiyamachi streets in the heart of shopping and Gourmet district, yet you will find a variety of must-see heritage sites within walking distance. Nearest train stations of Keihan Line, Subway Tozai Line and Hankyu Line are no more than ten-minute walk away from the hotel. Cross Hotel Kyoto is your great travel hub to explore the beauty of this ancient capital of Japan – Kyoto.
Cross Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 71-1 Daikokucho, Kawaramachidori Sanjo Sagaru, Nakagyo-Ku, Kyoto 604-8031 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Over-achieving hotel
reviews.review_text: A fine, modern hotel, ideally situated.  The service greatly exceeds the star status.  All staff were superbly helpful.  Rooms were excellent quality.  Breakfast varied and excellent.  Quiet, including quiet door-closings!  Recommended.

reviews.title: Great start to our Kansai trip at Cross Hotel!
reviews.review_text: Good size room by Tokyo standards and well maintained.  A great location to enjoy the Kyoto area.  Large Japanese style bath was a plus.  Bed was comfortable and the climate control was thoughtfully laid out including a humidifier. Our Japanese friends also enjoyed the hotel lobby and services.  Would come back

reviews.title: Good hotel is a very good location for touring.
reviews.review_text:
The Cross Hotel we found via other travel blogs. The hotel is very modern and well run with efficent and polite staff, all whom spoke quite good English.

The rooms were very tidy and even though it is in a major part of Kytoto is was very quiet apart from some party goers once outside on the orad on Sunday night.

The breakfast offers a huge range of food, both western and eatern inspired and the huge rooms you eat in were very comfortable with nice large cocuhes and artworks on the walls.

The beds and pillows were the usual firm sort you get in Japan, which I actually prefer to overly soft.

The location is excellent, a block away from the river, which has plenty of great walks around Gion and the old geiko areas. It is also very close to the resturants, food areas, subway and bus lines, making it an excellent spot for tourists.

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.review_text:
This was our second stay at the Cross Hotel in Kyoto. The location is excellent, just off a main street, Kawaramachi, with several bus lines as well as the subway a few blocks away. The staff are all exceedingly polite and helpful. We were helped with dinner reservations and booking our return to Kansai airport in Osaka.

Our superior king room was spacious and included a settee and table area. The separate WC, vanity, and wet room were great. There was plenty of room in both the entrance hall and the closet for our carry-on luggage. The mattress and pillows were just right, and we slept well with the black-out shades. We did not dine at the onsite restaurant. Coffee and tea are available in the lobby, as well as there is a kettle in the room.

If we were to return to Kyoto I would not hesitate to stay here again.

reviews.title: A Hotel to come back to!!!!
reviews.review_text:
I instantly loved this hotel upon seeing how centrally located it was from everything: dining, sightseeing, kyotos landmarks and shopping!
The front desk staff were so accomodating with our bed requirements, assistance with booking taxis for our day trips and even getting us a van to head back to the airport after our 6 night holiday.  Save on your luggage space! They provide you with 100% cotton pajamas, a complete set of heavenly scented bathing needs (shampoo, conditioner, body wash and bath salts for your evening soak) and bedroom slippers.  The housekeeping staff keep your room spotless for an excellent nights sleep throughout your whole stay!!! 
Thank you to the management of this hotel!!!

Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.address: 445-3, Myohoin Maekawa-Cho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0932 Kyoto Prefecture
Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.description: Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto, ranked #100 for "Travel + Leisure" World's Best Awards 2023, welcomes you to our contemporary oasis nestled around Shakusui-en, an 800-year-old heritage pond garden. Located in the serene and well-preserved Higashiyama district, our Hotel puts many of Kyoto's key attractions within easy reach. Every season unveils new splendours, providing an unrivalled setting for cultural rituals, wellness experiences and culinary explorations. Immerse yourself in the city's authentic living history while still enjoying the modern luxury and bespoke service synonymous with Four Seasons.
Four Seasons Hotel Kyoto.address_string: 445-3, Myohoin Maekawa-Cho, Higashiyama-Ku, Kyoto 605-0932 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Nicest 4 seasons I have been to
reviews.review_text: Outside of the Ocean’s Club this is my favorite four season I have been too. The quality of the buildout was exceptional, polar opposite of the generic 4 seasons Mexico City.  We loved the cream brûlée pancakes. Hôtel is much smaller than it looks like in the photos, which we liked.  Sad the geisha never showed up in time on Saturday night for the show.  Japanese exceptionalism and quality at its best. Management well done

reviews.title: Great concierge and beautiful property. Breakfast and cocktails need work
reviews.review_text:
Overall a good stay but a few fixable misses to make the hotel live up to the brand promise and expectations.

It was peak season but breakfast was slow and hard to get service for multiple days. I had to find someone to take my order a few times. I’ve had much better breakfast in other comparably priced hotels in Japan. That said, the Japanese breakfast is exquisite.

Cocktail lounge was okay but not as good as other five star hotels in Japan.

Geiko/geisha experience was amazing and best part of stay. This is probably the reason to stay here above the other top tier hotels in Kyoto if you really want to see up close what that is like. The concierge was very helpful arranging all of these experiences and restaurant bookings.

reviews.title: Terrible experience.  Shower drain was plugged
reviews.review_text: I was so disappointed with this hotel.   It’s beautiful, the restaurant and common areas are fantastic, however my shower drain was clogged, no water was draining whatsoever and I showered with dirt water to my ankles. They simply said “I am sorry”.  Not a single glass of wine or anything.  I felt so disappointed.

reviews.title: Great hotel ok location
reviews.review_text: My favorite hotel from my trip to Japan. Beautiful and new while also feeling like it honors tradition with its amazing garden. Service was excellent from the front desk to the restaurants to the concierge. Food was good and the drinks were very good. The only downside is the location requires a cab to pretty much anything you want to see or do.

reviews.title: probably busy in meeting ...
reviews.review_text:
The other day in September, I had to go to the French consulate in Kyoto. I am French myself, and we have never visited the Four Seasons Kyoto, while based in Osaka, we patronize a lot the local Four Seasons, where dining excels, we love the quality restaurant Est in Tokyo as well, and so on traveling from Osaka just for a treat, 
We, the couple, decided that day to do a visit around 3 pm, knowing the general manager is French Mrs. Fa. Gu..... we sought to have a little bite a treat in the lower lobby, having a glass of red wine glass served the  Cht Valandraud and cheese platers, a noisy saxophone disturbed us while enjoying the lovely garden view in front of us, and after a while, I asked the sommelier to share my name card to the management office to meet someone, the sommelier confirmed me twice he did. I have been in the hotel world my whole life, knowing most of the key managers around Japan are all close to customers I was not going to complain, but I was planning to share our experience with the upper management of our journey at  Kyotto Four Seasons we have been thrilled to have such great service by this Thai colleague who was cheerful, kind, attentive, and the cheese platers for a Japanese standard was amazing with quality bread and butter with some ash on it another new item we did enjoy.
We did enjoy the traditional dance in the lobby, too. I have been living in Japan for a while and enjoyed myself, but it is not this noisy, it is far too noisy. The saxophone was not in the right place in the main lobby, and the sound was not balanced at all.
 Past six pm, nobody came to visit us, no duty manager or guest relations nor the hotel or food beverage manager, leadership has been busy with meetings probably.
Well, of course, we could not congratulate the team for such lovely momentum, but I highly recommend the lower lobby and the garden any time.
 Communication and customer relations in such a luxury environment are basic and common. Don't expect any contact after 6 pm in this part of Kyoto, next time, we will go to the Amman hotel; it is just sad.

Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.address: 455 Nishinotoincho Nishinotoindori HanayachoSagaru, Shimogyo-ku, Kyoto 600-8327 Kyoto Prefecture
Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.description: With its rendering and design of light and shade, it is a hotel that will make you appreciate the wabi-sabi (beauty of quiet simplicity) of Kyoto culture. There are 11 types of guestrooms, ranging in size from 17m2 to 35m2. The guestroom interiors combine Kyoto culture with modern design, so you are sure to connect even more with Kyoto during your stay. Diners can choose from a Japanese or western menu. Kyoto's traditional "Okayu" thin rice porridge is the main Japanese dish, while the western menu includes the popular Kyoto pickles and egg sandwich.
Hotel Tou Nishinotoin Kyoto.address_string: 455 Nishinotoincho Nishinotoindori HanayachoSagaru, Shimogyo-ku, Kyoto 600-8327 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Great accommodations in a magic city
reviews.review_text: Exceptional hotel, Rooms are specious clean and provide all the essential to make your stay enjoyable and pleasant. Staff is great responsive and is very  helpful in providing information on restaurants and attractions near the hotel. Good breakfast and unlimited coffee in the the entertainment area are additional bonuses

reviews.title: Find another hotel
reviews.review_text: I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews. In the elevator there is a QR code directing you to write a TripAdvisor review with an initiative to get a free gift.  This is the worse hotel I stayed at in Japan.  I was extremely disappointed.  The hotel is dark and dingy.  The rooms are tiny.  The beds are uncomfortable.  The bathroom is the size of a broom closet.  Their service was terrible.  The staff is extremely rude and not accommodating.  Do not stay here.

reviews.title: Kyoto cool
reviews.review_text: Stylish traditional Japanese vibe hotel with Western touches.  Cool, black and minimalist.  We had a superior queen room which was small but enough for a two night stay and great to have laundry facilities for a mid stay.  Staff were great and very helpful.  Good location, 10 minute walk to Kyoto station, Higashi Hongan-ji Temple and Nishihonganji Karamon Gate yet in a quiet neighborhood with restaurants a few blocks away.  The bar on site didn't have much atmosphere so we ventured out.  The best part was the onsen - so soothing and relaxing!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: The staff was very friendly and welcoming. It was located about 15 mins (walking) away from Kyoto station. There were bus stops right next to the hotel to easily get around the city. Our rooms were styled with a ryokan inspiration, so it was a nice experience to sleep on a futon set on tatami mats.

reviews.title: Recommended by a first timer
reviews.review_text: The entire hotel has an elevated modern ambiance but still really cozy with warm lighting. We greatly appreciated its accessibility to a local bus route to help us get to the main Kyoto station as well as throughout the city. The bed and amenities were amazing, after a day of touring I always had a restful night. Every day we returned just in time to freshen up at the bar and pick up toiletries for the evening. Good free wifi and no tattoo restrictions at the bath. The staff were professional, efficient and helpful and we didn’t have any issues.

Hotel Granvia Kyoto.address: Shiokojisagaru, Karasumadori, Shimogyo-Ku JR Kyoto Station Central Gate, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture
Hotel Granvia Kyoto.description: Beautiful 15-story hotel atop Kyoto Station - Broadband connection in all guest and banquet rooms - Easy access to Kansai Airport.
Hotel Granvia Kyoto.address_string: Shiokojisagaru, Karasumadori, Shimogyo-Ku JR Kyoto Station Central Gate, Kyoto 600-8216 Kyoto Prefecture

reviews.title: Underwhelming
reviews.review_text: Very disappointing. Hotel is in a good location but is very tired looking. For the price I was disappointed. We had 2 superior twin rooms, good size but the bathroom could have done with an upgrade. The whole place showed signs of age, tired carpets, mould/damp on walls in bar. Too much money paid (roughly £200 per night per room) for the standard. This price was not including breakfast.

reviews.title: Loved this hotel
reviews.review_text:
This was our favorite hotel we stayed at while in Japan.  The location can't be beat (although you can hear the trains in the morning starting at 6am, even from the 14th floor).
The amenities were amazing, we loved the room! The staff were very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Great location, service and room
reviews.review_text: Extremely convenient location in the train station, my feet were grateful. Front desk are all English-speaking (much appreciated!). Nice room with a great view of Kyoto tower. Laundry service was fine and concierge was helpful in arranging for takkyubin service for my next destination. Nice minibar selection. No complaints, would def stay here again if wanting to explore Kyoto.

reviews.title: Hotel Granvia has it all!
reviews.review_text:
The Hotel Granvia had everything. Located in Kyoto Station the convenience for all our day trips was fantastic. There was shopping on site, lots of dining options and entertainment - dancing and light displays in the station auditorium on different nights and we explored all the walkways around the station. 
The rooms were faultless with sensor night lights, shower/steam room and all the amenities we could have wished for. Very comfortable extra bed.

reviews.title: Great location not the best customer experience
reviews.review_text: Hotel Granvia Kyoto is an excellent location for access to Kyoto train station. It is also very well positioned for access to many of the main visitor sites. It is above the Porto shopping centre which offers lots of choice for dining if you want to stay local. Room had a great view of the Kyoto Tower and the bed and linen are comfy and crisp. The reason for 3 star review is that the hotel is very busy, it feels very suited to a conference location or property for larger tour groups. This impacts on the customer service, all staff were very polite and professional but they are dealing with you from an efficiency perspective rather than one of real interest. An example is that on check in you are given breakfast vouchers which you present in the dining room, made it feel like a canteen experience. Breakfast very busy and not a relaxing or enjoyable event. So if you are looking for a more personal welcome, check out other options.

Cycle Kyoto.address: 7 Higashikujo Nishisannocho, Minami-ku, Kyoto 601-8003 Kyoto Prefecture
Cycle Kyoto.description: Cycle Kyoto organises small group bike adventures in Japan’s ancient capital of Kyoto, all in English, and all in a day. With over 2,000 temples and shrines and no less than 17 UNESCO World Heritage sites,
Cycle Kyoto.address_string: 7 Higashikujo Nishisannocho, Minami-ku, Kyoto 601-8003 Kyoto Prefecture

360 Istanbul.address: Istiklal Caddesi Misir Apt. No: 163 / 8, Istanbul 34433 Turkiye
360 Istanbul.description: The multi award winning 360istanbul is set in a penthouse perched on a 19th century apartment building overlooking the old embassy row in Beyoglu. It commands a 360 breathe taking landscape view of Istanbul all the way from the up close steeple of St Antoine’s Church and across the Bosphorus strait to the Hagia Sophia Mosque and out to the Sea of Marmara. 360 is open for lunch and dinner, offering a twist on the modern Turkish meze fused with international cuisine and an exclusive wine selection to compliment it. 360 turns into Club360 on the weekends so come enjoy your fresh elixir while listening to our talented Djs and vocalists with live dancers and performances. 360istanbul also endocrine’s the 360 concept of dining experience. This concept consists of four crucial elements; Cuisine - Design - Entertainment and Atmosphere. No element in 360istanbul is more or less important than the other. Instead they coexist in harmony.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.review_text:
I went to 360 Istanbul with my friends  as I heard a lot about this famous place the hospitality was acceptable they spoke English as well I give 10/10 for the service 
waiters were so professional, also I'm rating the food 10/10 with the best 360 view around Istanbul 
Definitely will be back soon

reviews.title: amazing
reviews.review_text: Amazing space, amazing food and drinks. Incredible view. Music is friendly. Staff is prompt and kind. If I'll back in Istanbul, my favorite restaurant

reviews.title: Great rooftop
reviews.review_text: Great restaurant and  rooftop, great music and show, the service needs to improve!  The drinks were delicious. The food was ok and the service needs to be faster.

reviews.title: Check when its the best time to be there.. not at 16:30
reviews.review_text:
A visit at 16:30 -  staff cleaning up, organizing the restaurant and ordering the table, but they told us they have it open.. but no visitors, toproof not organized yet. The Kitchen took maybe  30 mins to prepare the order. 
But to be honest, the food was good .. and the staff was nice  and friendly...

reviews.title: best team,great wiev ,delicious food
reviews.review_text: Everything was great, the manager Özgür and his entire team worked meticulously, it was a great night, thank you🙏 ı will come again 👍👍

1924 Istanbul.address: Olivya Gecidi No 7 Istiklal Caddesi, Istanbul 34435 Turkiye
1924 Istanbul.description: A TASTE OF HISTORY Contemporary guidebooks described dinner at “1924istanbul” as much a part of experiencing Istanbul as a visit to the bazaar or Blue Mosque.
