No visitor to Istanbul be it Greta Garbo, Agatha Christie or the King of Spain would leave the city without paying a call. Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the Turkish president was a loyal client. Emigrés and civil servants, bohemians and politicians all rubbed shoulders in its wood-paneled dining-room. The common denominator was a sophisticated ambiance, Central & Eastern European delicacies and lashings of ice-cold lemon vodka and some spectacular cocktails. This Istanbul institution with its 98 years tradition is in every detail a legend of a restaurant and bar in istanbul.

reviews.title: Wonderful old world nostalgia. Beautiful room. Romantic
reviews.review_text: Wonderful old world nostalgia. Beautiful room. Romantic. Michelin food rated but not really - wanted flambe steak - they couldn't do that night (was a Saturday). Ordered ordinary steak rare - came medium. Duck a la orange overdone. Got feeling were pre cooked. My wife's a chef. Wine seriously overpriced compared to other fine restaurant. However, absolutely stunning and atmospheric room - do go but order carefully. The Russian beef dumplings were superb. Live accordion music added to atmosphere

reviews.title: Back in time, great food
reviews.review_text:
We decided to try this restaurant because of the great reviews online. 
The place is a bit difficult to find because it‘s located in a litte street off Istiklal Street and the door is easy to miss.
Once you enter the restaurant, it is like moving back in. Time. One can just imagine Trotsky sitting at the bar and Ataturk at his (permanently „reserved“) table in the corner.
The staff are very attentive and friendly and service was fast and reliable.
The food was delicious and the drinks fantastic. There is a rather extensive selection of well known, mainly European, dishes.
The bar is well equipped and I recommend trying one or two of the delicious cocktails or the vodka tray (if you dare)

reviews.title: My favorite Restaurant in Istanbul.
reviews.review_text: My favorite restaurant in Istanbul. I've been there every time I visit the city and it's always a wonderful experience.  I've suggested this place to all my friends, and they've all loved it.  Sasha is a wonderful host and I look forward to going back every chance I get.  The appetizers and food is always perfect and I love the vodka selection. Especially the horse radish Vodka.

reviews.title: Nice place, good service but had hoped food would be better.
reviews.review_text: Atmosphere is pleasant - even on a quiet night. Service is also good. Staff were friendly and the food came quickly. However, food was just OK.  We had the tasting menu - starters were nice but mains were nothing special. Chicken Kiev a bit dry and they had no sea bream so it was just a piece of salmon on some green beans. £300 for 4 people with wine. Overall, glad we went but had hoped for better.

reviews.title: 1924Istanbul - A MUST in Istanbul - World's Best
reviews.review_text: 1924Istanbul was the great discovery of our Istanbul trip. The decor is luxurious, but with a strong hint of decadence, reminiscent of the restaurant's beginnings as a retreat for Russians escaping the revolution. The feeling that 'anything could happen' - that delicious sense of possibility, fun, and adventure - so lacking in a world filled with generic 'sports' bars and sterile pubs - lives in the candlelit shadows of 1924Istanbul. The owner, Sasha, is a world class host—befriending us after our second visit, introducing us to the glories of the infused vodka cart, wheeled around the restaurant by a waiter in evening clothes. Sasha's nightlife pedigree includes the legendary 80s New York City after-hours club, 'Save the Robots'—one of the greats. That feeling is very much present at 1924Istanbul. Sasha absolutely gets it. The food, high end Russian emigre fare, is terrific. The booze is great. The service is top notch. (On our second visit, they'd run out of the local beer that I loved, but our bartender, a wonderful host in his own right, made a point to run out and get more for me. Perfect!) The music, an older gentleman on accordion playing 'Lily Marlene' and 'La vie en Rose' and then sitting at the upright piano for more of the same, adds a touch of romantic melancholy to the evening. If you ever fantasized about drinking in 20s Paris or Berlin, or at Rick's Cantina in 'Casablanca' (I do!) then you will LOVE 1924Istanbul. It's easily one of my favorite drinking experiences in the world. Get thee to 1924Istanbul. You're welcome!

Istanbul Kebab Cafe & Restaurant.address: Alemdar, Bicki Yurdu Sk. No 5, Istanbul 34122 Turkiye
Istanbul Kebab Cafe & Restaurant.description: İstanbul kebab cafe restaurant Located in Sultanahmet, the heart of Istanbul, istanbul kebab cafe restaurant invites you to the unique tastes of Ottoman cuisine Turkish barbecue in the middle of history.

reviews.title: Excellent food and service
reviews.review_text: The food was exceptional, we had soups and their special kebab served in cermic. The sevice was friendly, it is a small place with good atmosphere. I think the pricing  is more in the higher région. However, spicy tomato with bread, baklava and tequilas we offered on the house.

reviews.title: Best Kebab and Baklava in Istanbul!
reviews.review_text:
Best kebab restaurant in Istanbul! Visited twice in 3 days, planning our third visit very soon. The kebab meat was very well seasoned and well cooked, whether it was chicken, beef or lamb. The grilled sea bass was very fresh too - the fish was juicy and had subtle sweetness.

Not to mention the complimentary baklava and Turkish tea! The baklava has a well balanced sweetness and crisp, compared to others in town.

Also, friendly staffs and good vibes. Highly recommend this restaurant!

reviews.title: A culinary experience in a warm atmosphere
reviews.review_text: We had a wonderful evening and felt so welcomed at Istanbul Kebab. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Amazing, chilled restaurant with awesome food!
reviews.review_text: Amazing chilled restaurant with very nice traditional food ! Very affordable and we got tea and dessert on the house . Manager was very kind and explained everything to us.

reviews.title: Great food, excellent service and an exciting show (dependent on what you order)
reviews.review_text: What a great restaurant. Good food and amazing service. Very attentive and entertaining. We ordered the pottery kabap and it fed four people (although I could have ordered another with a different meat it was so good). There's a show that goes along with opening the pottery to spill out the contents. It's a fun experience. Highly recommend!

Zuma - Istanbul.address: I_stinye Mahallesi BayIr CIkmazI I_stinye Park No:461 Sariyer, Istanbul 34460 Turkiye
Zuma - Istanbul.description: Zuma offers a contemporary representation of the informal Japanese dining style, izakaya. respecting the traditions of Japanese food culture dishes are prepared in three separate areas. The open kitchen, the sushi bar and the robata grill. Rather than offering individual starters and main courses, Zuma serves dishes that are designed for sharing and are brought to the table continuously throughout the meal.

reviews.title: Great views
reviews.review_text: Great place!!! really like the food and have a great time there. The service was good, atmosphere also was excellent. It was soo worth it. Thank you

reviews.title: Employee
reviews.review_text: Theres a employee with thick brows and glasses with necklaces i think its gold , he has broad body a little , he is very nice and his service very excellent and respectful 💖

reviews.title: Excellent experience
reviews.review_text: We had our wonderful experience in zuma istanbul. Manager Mika from Italy made our lunch more beautiful and nice. Great hospitality and warm welcome.

reviews.title: Very bad experience as compared to Zuma dubai. Not recommended!
reviews.review_text: The service and attitude of managers was pathetic. Starters were served along with the main course and service was very slow.

reviews.title: Michaela from Dubai to Istanbul rocks!
reviews.review_text: Michaela rocks Zuma Istanbul. She made sure everything was top notch and from the minute we entered we had a different kind of welcome the Italian way. Certainly a nice way to start. Zuma is best visited if you want to enjoy your food at 4 onwards

Istanbul Anatolian Cuisine.description: Dear guest our restaurant close to small hagia sofia our restaurant space 40 person we do server sea food barbecue ottoman cuisine salads beer wine soft drinks most welcome dear guests

reviews.title: Great time
reviews.review_text:
Great place amazing food
We love it testi kebabı 
And İskender was very deliciois
Thank you for great time..
We came back again..

reviews.title: Food was amazing staff great lovely place
reviews.review_text:
Great little restaurant 
Amazing delicious food!
Gorgeous interior!
Great food and lovely sercive
Cosy atmosphere 
Beautiful decoration
Well done

reviews.title: Best Anatolian in Istanbul
reviews.review_text: Best Turkish Anatolian meal on our 3 week trip! Chicken casserole and chicken kebabs. Complimentary baklava and tea.  950L with water; alcohol available

reviews.title: Fabulous  Affordable Restaurant
reviews.review_text: We discovered this lovely restaurant by chance, and were so happy that we did. The food was delicious and the prices were reasonable compared to other restaurants in the area. Our waiter was extremely friendly and entertaining. The service was fast. Nice atmosphere. Would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Amazing a place
reviews.review_text:
Great food lovely dinner
We went to there 3 times 
Food was amazing staff was very friendly
We love this place one of the best place in old town

Giritli Istanbul.address: Keresteci HakkI Sokak Armada Otel YanI Cankurtaran, Istanbul Turkiye

reviews.title: Good fresh fish and a lovely courtyard haven
reviews.review_text: We had a bumpy start as the waiter pushed his set menu. However once we had a menu and got a choice we had fantastic food. The quality of fresh fish was the best yet on our trip and a plain grilled fish is what we wanted as travellers. Paired with the zucchini - it was just what we needed ! Recommend although it is a walk down the hill

reviews.title: No receipt, no taste
reviews.review_text: I was there on 11th of June, 2024 for a siblings gathering. I’m an executive chef over at USA, also a culinary instructor last 10 years. The food was generally salty, they didn’t use EVOO, which was expected from a restaurant influenced by Greek Cuisine. At least the name of the restaurant is a Greek island. It was so hot. They need to use some fans here in there. They gave me a piece of calamari slice I mean, literally a ring of a calamari as an appetizer. I thought this was for tasting, but it was the literally whole thing. The other food was very small portions. Also, yes I’m not expecting American portions, but these are really small for the amount of the people. We were total of nine adults and one kid first they charge me around 12,000 lira when I was leaving the place they caught me at the exit and they told me they charged wrong tables bill and they required another 8800 lira with the tips and total of payment I paid 20,200 liras.(640$ currency of the day) We used one bottle of Raki and standard menu, which was tiny, a little sardines wrapped in leaves, which was quite salty also. With the amount of people The atmosphere has been given, and the food does not worth that money. Also I paid in CASH and they did not give me a RECEIPT at all not at first time nor not at the second time so this makes me think this place is acting questionable with the tax situation. to be honest, I won’t go there one more time. If you are willing to go, please figure out the costs before you order anything please ask for a receipt.

reviews.title: Trap for tourists
reviews.review_text:
We had dinner on the terrace / garden close to the restaurant across the street. Place nice. But very loudly, people speaking with no respect.
In my opinion, the owner takes advantage, of the Michelin. Award, for commercial purposes.
Not respecting the food quality, just on the limit, for a Michelin awarded restaurant.
Kind of local "Cantina".
On the top only two menus !!
With two different prices.
Which do not reflect what you have got on your dishes.
Better places today in Istanbul and cheaper.
Is a trapfor tourist.

reviews.title: At last
reviews.review_text: Finally. We tried two days to get a seat and kept arriving too late … they’d sold all the food! At last we got a table - Alex the fixed menu of amazing mezes and best calamari I’ve ever had. Topped with a sea bass cooked to perfection. Dessert was quite a treat - apricots and almond gelato. So glad we came.

reviews.title: Charming and so fun; great food
reviews.review_text: Really warm, fun, casual but excellent place- adorable garden setting. Set menu but they kindly accommodated an allergy. Great guitarist playing Turkish hits- many people dancing by the end of the evening! Excellent and warm, professional service in a gorgeous garden. This place is magical.

reviews.title: Great place for a special dinner!
reviews.review_text:
We chose Topaz restaurant to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it was great. The view of the Bosphorus Strait and the Dolmabahçe Mosque was awesome. The place has a sober decoration with pictures of memorable scenes from old movies. The Prosecco and the wine were very light and refreshing. We had the octopus and the soft crab as appetizers and the pasta with lobster as the main course. Everything had good presentation and great flavor. The staff was always prompt and very attentive.”
Çok teşekkür ederim! Bir dahaki sefere görüşürüz!

reviews.title: Run Away As Quickly As Possible
reviews.review_text: Coming from Los Angeles, this restaurant was a huge disappointment. We were one of first guests to arrive, had a reservation, and yet they refused to seat us near the window. We sat almost two hours before they sat anyone at the window side seat. Our waiter was not friendly and scoffed when I requested to taste a wine before ordering it (in California, one of the best wine regions in the world, they welcome tastings). We ordered tuna tartare, hamachi, soft shell crab and sea bass, all of it was mediocre at best. Worst of all we left having spent over $200 for one of the worst fine dining experiences of our lives. And btw, the promise of a DJ spinning tunes under the stars never happened - and this was a Saturday night!

reviews.title: Awful service, waste of time and money
reviews.review_text:
We were excited to try this restaurant. What a mistake that turned out to be.

I have never seen such poor service ever (McDonald’s service in a Micheline star restaurant).  Despite having a reservation and wanting to enjoy a nice dining experience, they were continuously rushing us to place our order.

The dishes, when they eventually came, were simply whatever random number of dishes they decided themselves. The gave us three dishes of something when we had only ordered one.

 

We were asked by the waiter if he had to serve us or if we could do it ourselves. We politely asked for them to serve us, which they did not like. They eventually did reluctantly serve us but with a rude attitude.  As soon as one person was done eating, they immediately removed their plate and provided the dessert menu and plate on the table. When asked for them to slow down, letting them know that others at the table  were still eating, we were completely ignored and they kept on doing the same thing.

When we told them again repeatedly to slow down, they said that their kitchen was closing soon when other tables still eating and ordering.

By this time, we really had lost our patience and decided to leave without dessert and proceeded to order the check.  Well, we were in for another major surprise. Of course, they charged us for all those additional dishes we did not order.

The total bill came to 694 EUR. To add insult to injury, they included a service charge of 90 EUR when similar, in fact better restaurants, only added a service charge of 20 EUR.  They wanted us to pay in EUR but when we looked at the exchange rate there was an extra 50 EUR in their favor compared to the official exchange rate. A manager eventually came to the table at our request who applied  the official exchange rate and removed the previously applied 50 EUR “incorrectly applied” exchange rate.   

Now comes payment time and we tried to pay with 3 Revolut cards. To our surprise none of them worked when they had worked perfectly fine everywhere else. Of course, not in this restaurant as they wanted us to pay in cash and in Euros. We ended up paying cash and leaving with a very bitter taste in our mouths.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!  The food is ok, but not to a Micheline standard.  The restaurant has a pleasant view but a lot of restaurants in Istanbul do too, which provide a much more pleasant dining experience for less money.

reviews.title: Easter visit
reviews.review_text: This restaurant was well positioned next to our hotel near the Beziktas stadium. We booked in advance but the restaurant was far from full. There seemed a large number of staff which did lead to rapid service but perhaps did leave me with the feeling of being rushed. Food was very good, particularly the soft shell crab, but quite expensive. However, some of that price premium was undoubtedly for the awesome views.

reviews.title: Worse SCAM ever!
reviews.review_text: I just want to warn everyone that This is an absolute SCAM! The restaurant staff is really deceitful. We had New Year’s Eve dinner here; biggest red flag was that they never showed us the breakdown of the prices. They charged 300+ EUR per pax for dinner and they had no transparency on the breakdown of the prices. We went on 31-Dec early afternoon to make the booking and they asked us to pay a deposit in cash, we told them we didn’t have any cash so they told us to make the entire payment upfront. They even promised us they have seats with good view of the bridge reserved for us. When we reached, they had changed the table next to a pillar which blocked our view to the bridge. Food was just really blend and average. Their serving method was very chaotic and when we asked for olive oil for the bread, despite reminding them twice they never brought it to us till the end. They had a staff member at the entrance gathering our coats and when we left the restaurant he asked for 200 Lira and his mouth smelled really and of alcohol. When we were on deserts, me and my friend stepped out for a smoke and without asking us they had cleared our plates. When we asked for itemized bill they purposely pretended to not understand our request and kept saying that we have to pay 10% service charge extra in cash due to accounting reasons. Huge red flag! When they brought the itemized bill, they categorised 400+ eur just for “New year’s drink”, I don’t even drink and initially when paying for dinner I had asked this question but they just deflected my question. Huge huge SCAM! And worse of all they have used Michelin stickers everywhere to deceive everyone. Please save your hard earned money and don’t go here!!!

Cecconi's Istanbul.address: Mesrutiyet Cad. No 56 Soho House Istanbul, Istanbul 34430 Turkiye
Cecconi's Istanbul.description: In the courtyard of the 19th century Palazzo Corpi Building, Cecconi's is a modern day classic Italian restaurant open for dinner, six days a week and brunch on Saturdays. Tables are available indoors or outdoors, set among the garden's olive trees.

reviews.title: Beautiful evening at Cecconi's
reviews.review_text:
Our recent dining experience at Cecconi's Istanbul was made even more memorable thanks to the outstanding service provided by Mehmet. Not only was he attentive and friendly throughout our meal, but he went above and beyond when we accidentally left behind a shopping bag. To our surprise, Mehmet came running after us to return it, demonstrating genuine care and commitment to his guests.

The food, ambiance, and overall experience were excellent, but Mehmet's thoughtfulness truly stood out. If you're dining at Cecconi's, I highly recommend asking for him. Thank you again, Mehmet, for turning a great evening into an unforgettable one!

Highly recommend Cecconi's for both the food and the top-notch service!

reviews.title: If you appreciate comfortable elegance and high quality Italian food, you must visit this place.

2 people +/- 5 000 tl (145 EUR rating today 1st August 2024)

reviews.title: Cecconi accepting dining guests with baseball caps
reviews.review_text:
I recently dined at Cecconi İstanbul and overall, it was a delightful experience. The food was delicious and the service was good. The ambiance of the restaurant was elegant, making it a perfect choice for a special occasion or a sophisticated evening out.

However, one aspect of my visit detracted from the otherwise nice experience. I was surprised and somewhat disappointed to see other guests dressed in casual attire, including shorts and baseball caps. When I complained about this to the manager his response was their dress code is smart casual and that they accept people wearing shorts and baseball caps. While I understand that dress codes can vary, I believe that a restaurant of this caliber would benefit from maintaining a certain level of decorum in terms of dress.    It would greatly enhance the overall atmosphere and ensure that all guests can fully appreciate the refined setting. I felt I was dining at McDonalds when sitting next to these people.
 I hope that the management will consider implementing or reinforcing a dress code to preserve the elegant environment that they have worked so hard to create.

reviews.title: Delicious, healthy lunch
reviews.review_text: The lunch special, with an appetizer, entree, and drink, allowed us to sample a few different appetizers and the entrees were delicious as well as satisfying and healthy. The Turkish meatballs and beef shish kebab were wonderful, as were the humus and tabouleh. Definitely worth driving a bit out of our way!

reviews.title: Very good.
reviews.review_text: Good location, easy parking, limited menu, fresh food, service was a bit slow. Other than that solid 4-star establishment.

reviews.title: Yeah, It Really is that Good!
reviews.review_text: We ate at Istanbul Grill about 10 years ago on an infrequent visit to Texas. Ever since then, it has been the top-rated restaurant in Arlington every time I check. Recently, I had the opportunity to take my lovely bride back there a second time. They did not let me down. It is every bit as good as it was back then, if not better. The lamb was almost melt-in-my-mouth tender, moist and flavorful. Yet it was so mild that I almost mistook it for beef. The service was as good as the food. Our waitress was so graceful that I suspect she may be the matron of the establishment. She asked us if we wanted to take away our leftover flatbread. When we agreed to that, she brought more warm bread in a carry-out bag. My only regret was that it was too late in the evening to try the Turkish coffee. I hope it won't be 10 years before we do this again!

reviews.title: Nope..
reviews.review_text: People rate this place as one of the best in Arlington. This is sub par at best. The restaurant is filthy, the server was rude and the food was plain. be adventurous try a million other places. You’re missing out real Mediterranean food. This is not it.

Romance Istanbul Hotel.description: Romance Istanbul Hotel has 39 rooms.Every room is elegantly furnished and harmonizes the modern life style with the traditional Ottoman touch. Romance Istanbul sits at the intersection of the old city’s most important part. With its luxuriously inspiring design and landmark old city location, steeped in the history of its surroundings, Romance Istanbul Hotel welcomes you with exceptional designed rooms and world-renowned Turkish hospitality. Our colleagues deliver the most personal service. It is perfectly placed and perfectly designed to enhance all that Istanbul has to offer. Each room offers a private bathroom and shower. Each is equipped with a satellite TV and free wifi connection. The rooms size change between 20 m2 and 45 m2. It includes 7 suite rooms: 1 Royal Suite, 4 Grand Suite, 1 Romance Suite and 1 Premium Suite, 2 Luxury Room With Terrace, 22 Deluxe Room, 8 City Room.

reviews.title: Wonderful Accommodation in Ottoman History
reviews.review_text: Among the hotels I have stayed at, this was one of the best in terms of room comfort. The bed and linens were chosen with great quality. The hotel's location and room design were very fitting for the historic peninsula. The food was amazing; it was an excellent choice to taste delicious Turkish cuisine. When combined with the friendly and helpful behavior of the staff, it turned into a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: 5 star experience
reviews.review_text: Perfect service, great breakfast. Romance everywhere around us. Staff was friendly and welcomed us. Rooms at the street side are noisy when windows are open. Spa was very nice and clean. Romance hotel is my favourite hotel in Istanbul region

reviews.title: Perfect Stay at Romance Hotel
reviews.review_text: Such a Friendly staff, they were very accommodating. The breakfast was delicious with so much to choose from. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The location was perfect with the tram so close. I would recommend using a private guide on your first day to get the history of Istanbul.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay and location.
reviews.review_text: Great service. Wonderful location to walk to all of the local sites and the ferries. Spacious, beautiful, clean rooms and a wide selection for breakfast. Recommend for your stay to be near everything. They will arrange taxi service to and from the airport.

Conrad Istanbul Bosphorus.description: Boasting a perfect location between 2 continents, indulge in a stay at Conrad Istanbul Bosphorus and discover yourself at one of the world's most alluring destinations. At the very centre of the city, yet far away from the hustle and bustle, Conrad Istanbul Bosphorus's rooms and suites allow for the highest standard of relaxation, complete with personalised comfort and services. Savor Mediterranean cuisine at Manzara, take in the view of the Bosphorus while lounging at the Summit Bar. Relax with Spa treatments, enjoy a revitalizing workout in the brand-new health club and clay tennis courts. The newly opened Monteverdi Ristorante, nestled in the heart of the city, offers an exquisite Italian fine-dining experience, featuring authentic flavors and a curated selection of Italian wines.

Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus.description: The iconic Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus, with its landmark location, newly renovated guest rooms and outdoor pool, stunning views, and lush gardens, is an oasis of serenity in one of the world’s most vibrant cities. As the ambassador of Turkish hospitality, this legendary hotel serves its great heritage and service quality since 1955. Located in the heart of Istanbul next to the Congress Valley, walking distance to famous Taksim Square and responds every travelling purpose. Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus offers 475 newly renovated guest rooms, all with a balcony and with breathtaking Bosphorus or beautiful garden view. Hotel has various restaurants which offer different sceneries and exclusive dining opportunities. Interior upgrades are in progress between 10am-5pm. Garden view rooms are not affected. The outdoor pool is open during the summer with its entirely refreshed looks, the fitness center and massage services are relocated, and wet areas, including the indoor pool are closed.

reviews.title: Amazing Thanksgiving
reviews.review_text: We went for the thanksgiving dinner. Amazing food and service. I was surprised that we could find traditional turkey, mashed potatoes and apple pie for the thanksgiving in Turkey. The staff was so helpful as well. Special thanks to Doğuş and Mustafa for their interest.

reviews.title: Best Experience Ever! INCREDIBLE SERVICE! 10/10 * * * * *
reviews.review_text:
Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus is renowned for being the first Hilton built outside America, established in 1955. Although the hotel is currently undergoing a remodeling phase, this has not affected the exceptional service provided. The service was impeccable! We stayed in one of the renovated Executive Bosphorus Suites, which included a kitchenette. The room was well-designed and offered a beautiful view of the Bosphorus. Its outstanding location allowed us to easily walk to shops, the metro, and restaurants. We are very grateful to have had the opportunity to stay where history was made.

We would like to express our heartfelt gratitude to the hotel staff for making our stay unforgettable. Everyone contributed to making it exceptionally pleasant. A special thanks to Mr. Murat for his warm welcome and for offering us a two-night upgrade. We also appreciate his assistance in extending our stay to more than a week. His professionalism and kindness were much appreciated.

We traveled to Istanbul for medical treatment, and this was our second hotel near the clinic we chose to stay at. There were times when we felt down after returning to our room, but the hotel staff made us feel at home and assisted us with our needs. Mr. Ergun, who works in the lounge area, kindly offered us soup and soft foods on the nights when we couldn’t manage solid food for dinner. Mr. Berkay was very kind and supportive, providing us with a variety of refreshments whenever we stopped by for drinks. We are also very grateful to Ms. Tsira from the front office for her assistance and for consistently checking to see if we needed anything.

Our day began with a warm greeting from the wonderful housekeeper, Ms. Fatma, as we headed to breakfast. She cheerfully said, “Good morning,” but I mistakenly thought I heard, “Good night.” When I tried to correct her, she kindly taught me that in Turkish, you say “Günaydın.” This was a valuable lesson from Fatma, who became close to each of us during our stay.  Fatma was more than just a housekeeping staff member; she acted like a caregiver. She often asked my mom how she was feeling and made sure our room was clean and well-stocked. Over our ten-day stay, my mom formed a deep connection with her, making it truly sad to say goodbye to Fatma and the entire hotel staff.

Also, We would especially like to commend Mr. Erenchan, Hasan, Yasin, and Harvin at the front door for their excellent service with our luggage and transportation needs. They greeted us warmly every time we entered or exited the hotel. The front desk staff, particularly Mr. Cem, was always pleasant, welcoming us with a smile and professionalism. He was consistently ready to assist us with our needs.
Ms. Merven Nur was also frequently available in the lobby, helping guests and providing us with umbrellas when it rained. She often checked to see if there was anything else she could do to assist us. Ms. Merven Nur sent us a heartfelt thank-you card and gifts to our room. On our final evening, Mr. Yusuf arrived at our door with a smile, carrying a bottle of Wine and some Chocolates and Baklava. He set up our table and wished us well. We couldn't have asked for better service; it was customer care at its finest. This touching moment, particularly the kindness and thoughtfulness displayed by Ms. Merven Nur, left a lasting impression on our family. It truly marked a highlight of our stay.

The attention and customer service at the Hilton Bosphorus were exceptional, deserving a rating of 10 out of 10. Every staff member demonstrated that this hotel is special, historic, and well-managed. It is a place that guests will never forget, where they feel like family, and the atmosphere is just like home. The employees of this historic hotel take pride in serving others and are true ambassadors of Istanbul. They certainly made their city proud.

We are incredibly grateful for the unforgettable experience and want to express our appreciation to everyone who made our stay exceptionally pleasant. Kudos to the Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus management team!

Many thanks to everyone!

White House Hotel Istanbul.address: Catalcesme Sok. No: 21 Alemdar Mahallesi, Istanbul 34110 Turkiye
White House Hotel Istanbul.description: White House Hotel Istanbul is located in the heart of the historical peninsula and it is within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Archeology Museum, the Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, the Millennium Stone and Byzantine Hippodrome, which are the most important landmarks of the city. White House Hotel Istanbul is the ideal starting place for exploring this Ottoman capital city's endless historical sites, museums, restaurants, clubs and shops.
White House Hotel Istanbul.address_string: Catalcesme Sok. No: 21 Alemdar Mahallesi, Istanbul 34110 Turkiye

reviews.title: Amazing stay at the White house hotel Istanbul
reviews.review_text: The most amazing hotel in the World! Excellent ambient and decoration, perfectly clean rooms, amazing food and the best staff ever. I really enjoyed my stay in White house hotel Istanbul and will definitely be coming back. Hotel is small and quiet, in the perfect location only 5-10 minutes by foot from the main attractions such as Hagia Sophia, The blue mosque and The grand bazaar. I highly recommend to stay at the White House Hotel Istanbul! Unique experience in the World!

reviews.title: Best hotel and hospitality in Istanbul!
reviews.review_text:
Wonderful stay at the White House Hotel with hospitality that surpasses all expectations! The hotel interior is beautifully decorated with traditional Turkish touches and royal accents. The rooftop is also beautifully decorated and the breakfast space is cozy and welcoming. 

The staff is amazing and goes above and beyond to cater to the guests. We received delightful and refreshing welcome drinks as well as Turkish tea and coffee throughout our stay. It was a joy to be greeted by the staff always with a smile on their face. 

A special thanks to Mr. Harun, Mr. Kemal, and all the other staff at the hotel from the lobby to the rooftop breakfast who made our visit so memorable. The staff made it a delight to stay at this hotel, and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Sultanhamet!

reviews.title: Incredible hospitality and best location!
reviews.review_text:
Fantastic experience at the White House Hotel! Every staff member provided unparalleled care and service. 

The hotel is in a prime location and conveniently located near great restaurants and the historic city center. The rooftop has gorgeous views of the Hagia Sofia and the city, both day and night. The breakfast is also a great spread and we enjoyed the variety of fresh cheeses and pastries.  

The hotel staff is extremely attentive and promptly helped us, whether it was restaurant recommendations or directions to the nearest tram station. They also gave us a wonderful welcome drink, Turkish coffee, and a an apple tea specially from the hotel owner’s village! 

The White House hotel has been exceptional and the staff truly treats its guests like family. Highly recommend this amazing hotel!

reviews.title: Unforgettable experience!!
reviews.review_text:
Our stay at the White House hotel was exceptional! I am an avid traveler covered more than 25 countries and my experience with White House and the staff is very unique and unforgettable and would highly recommend this amazing hotel. 

The dedicated staff went out of their way to help and care for us. From the lobby receptionists to the staff at breakfast and the hotel manager Mr. Kemal, we were met with amazing service and care. 

The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk away from some of the main attractions in Sultanahmet with plenty of restaurants nearby. The rooms are very cozy with royal accents. Rooftop breakfast has a great variety and spread with an amazing view and the staff managing breakfast always greeted us with a warm smile. 

The hotel staff is extremely dedicated and helped us with anything we needed. The hotel owner Mr. Harun, his friend Mr. Halit went out of their way to help us during an unexpected event where we needed to visit a hospital. They called several hospitals to check which would be best for us and even arranged transportation. Mr. Halit and Mr. Kemal even accompanied us to the hospital and stayed with us until we were finished. 

We cannot thank the staff at the White House Hotel enough for their warm hospitality and for going out of the way to help us and make this trip so memorable.

reviews.title: Best Hotel in Istanbul!
reviews.review_text: Best hotel in Istanbul! The hospitality here is unmatched. The staff was so accommodating, helpful, and kind. We arrived several hours early from our flight and they were able to upgrade us to an available room, no extra charge! They welcomed us with tea and turkish delights and sent us home with some as well! Everything was so clean and the included breakfast was on their beautiful rooftop terrace overlooking the city! The views did not disappoint! Location is fantastic and only a short walk to the main square with Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque! Overall, would recommend to anyone staying in Istanbul!

reviews.title: Hotel and staff
reviews.review_text: I stayed at the Sofitel Istanbul Taksim during my trip. The hotel is located in a great area, close to many attractions. The room was spacious and well-appointed with modern amenities, including a comfortable bed. The breakfast buffet was delicious, offering a variety of both local and international dishes. One staff member, Cho Cho, was especially helpful and made our stay even more enjoyable. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience, and I would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

reviews.title: Definitely need some refreshments
reviews.review_text:
Tanks to a fantastic crew, I will still give 4 star, but honestly I hab better experience in 4 star hotel of the same group
The breakfast buffet is below the standard you can except. The pastry not fresh, the choice of fruit or hot dish is weak. The coffee machines always in “cleaning mode”
The wood floor in the room definitely need a deep clean or even resurfacing . A lot of light switch / elevator call bouton are not working. And the loud music until past midnight from the restaurant on the 9 floor is really annoying .
Definitely not worth the extra money required compared to lower category hotel of the same group
Once again, thanks to all the hotel crew who helped to offset most of those annoying things

Barcelo Istanbul.address: Abdulhak Hamit Cad No 25 Kocatepe Mah, Istanbul 34435 Turkiye

Accommodations range from relaxed rooms to polished 2-bedroom suites with kitchenettes, living areas and sofabeds. All feature flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi, as well as minibars, tea and coffeemakers, and safes; some have hammams. Room service is offered 24/7.

Swissotel The Bosphorus, Istanbul.description: Swissotel The Bosphorus, Istanbul, having Safe Hotels Executive Level Certificate for 2016 - 2020, is a five-star luxury hotel right in the centre of Istanbul on the European banks of the Bosphorus. reviews.title: Fantastic hotel for groups/business, with a friendly local team
reviews.review_text:
We organised a business meet up during a conference in Istanbul for (almost) the entire team for a small startup of 15 people, and I was really blown away with how friendly and flexible the hotel team was. Since we were a large group, I’d gone through the RFP platforms for a handful each of IHG, Hilton, and Marriott hotels. The team at the W was one of the most responsive in getting back with an initial quote, and then working with me on adapting to the needs of our group. We stayed here for a week, but the flexibility was in giving us different checkin / check out dates (given that our team was flying in from many different countries). Huge shoutout to Ezgi from the hotel sales team for personally meeting me and being consistently responsive to help us make an amazing stay for our entire team!

The hotel itself is furnished to a modern standard and in a hip place in Istanbul. I had some worries based on previous reviews that it might be noisy, but I’m happy to say this wasn’t the case at all and rooms are really well soundproofed. The bar team was extremely friendly and on a fair few days, we ended up closing down the bar. Breakfast was extremely lush, with a wide range of Turkish and Western dishes. I love the design of the shower room makes it look a *bit* like a hammam, which was a great nod to locally-inspired design.

My only regret is that the terrace area was unfortunately left unexplored due to private events booked during our stay.

reviews.title: W is for Wonderful
reviews.review_text: Fantastic hotel and the GM was so attentive as were all the staff. Best hotel to stay and best area also. Great breakfast and staff very knowledgable  and their English was fantastic . Made my business stay a smooth and pleasant one. Apparently I need to write more words . Nothing much more to add !

reviews.title: Very Posh Hotel in Istanbul
reviews.review_text:
I had a great stay at this hotel. It is a short ride near many of the tourist attractions. 

The hotel is located around many restaurants and has a neat aesthetic matching traditional Istanbul buildings. 

I was greeted at the door by Omar; he was very helpful and ensured I found all the places I was looking for throughout my stay. He even arranged taxis for me. 

Unfortunately, I was feeling ill when I arrived. The receptionist, Azra, informed me that the pharmacies took turns for night shifts in the area and called around to find the open one for me. When I returned, she made me herbal tea with honey. 

Every morning, I was greeted by Sinem. Aside from ensuring I was well-fed every day, she was a delight, full of information and experiences in the city and an absolute joy. 

Deniz, who works at the reception, took time to search places up for me and make fun of Azra’s Marvel movie man crushes. 

The hotel staff is fantastic and accommodating. They are very down-to-earth and a treat to talk with. They would greet you, strike up an interesting conversation around the hotel, and show genuine interest in making your stay as fulfilling as possible. Sadly, I could not get all the names of people I had the pleasure of interacting with around the hotel. I would always like to leave credit where it's due. Thank you all for everything.

reviews.title: Thanks Omar & Kog for the W Wonderful service!
reviews.review_text: I would like to extend my sincere thanks to W Istanbul for their 1st class service. Coincidentally the phone in the room was down and we were communicating with Concierge via WhatsApp. Let me tell you that this is perhaps the most personal way to reach out to guests. Kudos to the team for being so prompt with their WhatsApp replies, making reservations for us was a breeze. Special thanks to the very strong Omar for handling 2 Rimowa trunks plus luggages (as there’re steps within the premise) and KOG for the loan of his personal transport card. Room wise, housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean.

reviews.title: Meh!
reviews.review_text:
We had a long layover in Istanbul, and decided to stay at the W in Besiktas for the night! 

We booked a nice room, but were upgraded to a higher caliber (a room with a cabana), since we are Gold Bonvoy members, which was a nice touch by the hotel .. However .. 

Upon entering the room, we noticed how outdated it was. The panel flooring under the shower was worn out, and moldy. The toilet’s wall paper, although nice, but also super old and needs to be replaced .. 

The room has minimal lighting .. It was sooo dark!! We understand there’s ambiance lighting and that the hotel is trying to follow a theme, but this shouldn’t affect the experience negatively. We had to use the flash light on our phone most of the time ..

The upgrade we received with the cabana is nice. Too bad we couldn’t sit outside although the weather was nice, since the cabana was not clean, nor covered .. Such a pity! 

Upon check out we noticed we were charged for a can of soda and a bottle of sparkling water. We had the bottle of water from the airport lounge earlier, and we most certainly did not consume a soda in the room .. It was weird and uncomfortable having to explain these points to the hotel. Luckily both were waived off. 

All in all, the location is good, but the hotel needs MAJOR renovations and upgrade.

Its prime location near the city's attractions, shopping centers, and historical sites, as well as its proximity to the arts scene, make Grand Hyatt Istanbul a top choice for travelers. Visitors can also frequently enjoy exhibitions at the hotel. Guests can indulge in Turkish cuisine with modern twists at the 34 Restaurant, which offers a variety of delectable dishes. Istanbul Duty Free.description: Located within Istanbul’s Ataturk Airport, this shopping wonderland welcomes departing travelers to peruse its range of top-tier luxury brands and ornamental wares unique to Turkey. Explore the nine different sections, with themes including Fashion Garden, Style Beach, and Family Palace. Whether you’re purchasing a designer handbag, a new watch, or the latest smartphone, inquire regarding the currency your credit card will be charged in and familiarise yourself with the process for getting your tax refund. Istanbul Duty Free offers a convenient opportunity to secure a last-minute souvenir or gift before you board your flight—coffee, chocolate, and Turkish Delight are all very popular. – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Do not buy anything at Istanbul airport!!!
reviews.review_text:
If you're traveling through Istanbul Airport, be prepared to feel like you're being robbed blind. Everything is ridiculously overpriced, turning what should be a simple layover into a financial nightmare.

I went to get a quick snack at a coffee shop: a bottle of water, a croissant, and a chocolate bar that looked appealing. When I checked my charge, I was shocked to see over 60 euros on my bill! I thought this must be a mistake and approached the cashier, only to learn that the chocolate bar alone was priced at a staggering 54 euros. Yes, you read that right—a chocolate bar more expensive than a meal at a fancy restaurant.

When I insisted on returning the chocolate bar and getting reimbursed, the cashier suddenly developed "technical problems" with his cash register. After some back-and-forth, and seeing that I wasn’t going to back down, he begrudgingly handed me 50 euros, likely hoping I would just leave.

This isn't just expensive; it's outright exploitation. Even the famous Turkish delights (lokum) are overpriced to the point of absurdity—a small 250-gram box for almost 20 euros! It's a blatant rip-off aimed at travelers who don’t know the local prices or don’t have the option to leave the airport.

Do not buy anything at Istanbul Airport. Pack your own snacks or wait until you leave the terminal to shop elsewhere. It's outrageous and shameful for such a modern airport to treat travelers this way. Avoid spending a single cent here if you can.

reviews.title: excellent experience
reviews.review_text: the Istanbul  airport is very big and beautiful and it’s duty free shops are big and every items available there chocolates perfumes jewelry gifts item and many many more . Prices are little bit high and very expensive but it’s ok. Overall beautiful airport and best duty free shopping. I went to this duty free store in Istanbul week before Saturday where I got the fridge magnet of Istanbul and it cost only 5 euros which is not too bad on the way to the cruise terminal and I liked this duty free store it is very expensive and it is an excellent experience as well and hopefully I will go back to this duty free store in Istanbul in the future.

With their conversion to lira we got an equivalent 1.10. Very disappointing. Use cash if you can.

Istanbul Akvaryum.description: This aquarium is home to 18 different themed zones covering various ocean and rainforest habitats over 2 floors, and home to over 1,500 species of aquatic creatures from around the world. Besides viewing and learning about marine life, catch live feeding sessions during certain hours of the day. You can also sign up for diving courses and dive with sharks in the main tank. Istanbul Akvaryum is located just southwest of Ataturk airport—inside the massive Aqua Florya Shopping Complex alongside a hotel and retail outlets. Tickets can be bought online, and it is also available on some Istanbul City passes – Tripadvisor

reviews.title: Good aquarium experience
reviews.review_text: It was nice and worth the entrance fee, and taxis in Istanbul are economical. The display isn't as wide-ranging as Barcelona 6 years ago, but a good experience overall. Plus it's located in a major shopping mall which heightened the overall excursion

reviews.title: The best aquarium I've been to, hands down
reviews.review_text: We were blown away by our trip, not only is it huge with many species, they have a real ice sculpture, a lot of history to learn from and interactive parts all throughout. We were wonderfully surprised when we reached the rainforest not having known it was there before our visit, we spent a lot of time here and you can make a whole day of it, especially when going through to the city centre afterwards. The vending machines and restaurants inside the aquarium were reasonable priced and we grabbed to keepsakes from the gift shop for under £15. We got some amazing photos but everyone visiting could benefit from the aquarium allowing people in in slots to avoid crowds building up

reviews.title: Great aquarium
reviews.review_text: Lovely place to visit whilst in Istanbul. This is quite the unique aquarium , very modern and different take on how to exhibit fish. Thoroughly enjoyed my visit and would go again. There is also a mall nearby.

reviews.title: İstanbul Akvaryum-very intersting
reviews.review_text:
We went to the Istanbul Aquarium, located near the Aqua Flora mall. We took 2 buses, approx 40 stops !, it's about 25 km from Taksim Square,Istanbul. On the way back, we did better, we took the B1 train to the station Sirkeci (ticket 40 TL) very close to Bosphorus.
The aquarium is fabulous, organized by climate-geography zones. A multitude of fish and animals. The entrance is 25 euros, there are rooms with huge aquariums, with sharks, fish, cats seas, turtles, fauna for each area. The aquariums go over the corridors so you can see the animals from all directions. Belly of sharks, cats seas, etc. At the South Pole there are happy penguins, jumping in the water, very cute. It's worth every penny, I recommend it

reviews.title: Best day with small kids in Istanbul
reviews.review_text:
I ordered tickets through Get Your Ride app which was a bit lower price although included transfer. This trip made my day one of the best in Istanbul (that is usually not very welcoming to small children).

Overall, we had a great time, but the transportation was a bit problematic at the beginning. First, the good news: the aquarium is located in a shopping mall on the shores of the Marmara Sea with fantastic views. The aquarium itself is amazing, my kids aged 2, 5, and 8 were incredibly excited. Sharks, moray eels, penguins - they loved it most. The price through the official website is slightly higher than through Get Your Ride, although the latter also includes a transfer. The journey takes about half an hour, we were picked up by a minibus. After the aquarium, you can go to one of the restaurants or to the food court, where the view is even better, as it is higher. In the food court, you can find the main Turkish fast foods and have a budget lunch with a view of the sea, ships, seagulls, and planes. After that, you can go shopping, there are both budget and more expensive brands, local and global brands.
Now about the cons:
 * The meeting point was indicated incorrectly!!! The bus picks up from the end of Sultanahmet Square, where the university is, but the app shows the opposite end at the German fountain. Be sure to call the number indicated on the voucher, WhatsApp is also possible.
 * The bus was 15 minutes late, and the bus itself had a strong smell, either of cigarettes or just old. My daughter felt bad at the end of the trip.
 * The girls in the aquarium insisted on taking a photo against a green background. I asked, "Do you want to sell me the photos on a fake background later?" They replied, "No, it's for the system." I ask: "For what system?" They: "I don't know, I just work here." In the end, I just walked past, of course, at the end there was a shop with photos a la 2000s.
 * I would have loved to spend more time in the mall, but our interval was 11:00-16:00. Of course, you can go back by metro or bus, but even the smelly transfer is still more convenient than public transport.
* Price discrimination against tourists is frustrating. While it's understandable that locals might have lower incomes, it makes tourists to feel robbed. It's no surprise that taxi drivers often overcharge tourists, as this is government policy to charge tourists 2-10x times than locals. Perhaps local discounts could be offered through other platforms to prevent tourists from feeling exploited.

Despite the cons, we had a great day and are very happy with our choice.

Istanbul Cevahir Mall.description: This sprawling modern complex is one of Istanbul’s largest and most popular shopping and entertainment hubs, with over 200 shops and restaurants. You’ll find both international and Turkish brands here across the mall’s six floors. There’s also a multi-hall cinema and a well-stocked supermarket, making Istanbul Cevahir Mall a great place to spend the day. Located in the Sisli district, the shopping hub is easily reached by bus or subway, and there’s ample parking free for up to three hours. Crowds flock to the mall on weekends, so start your shopping day early or visit on a weekday. – Tripadvisor

Mall of Istanbul.description: This giant shopping haven is one of the biggest retail complexes in Turkiye, boasting luxury apartments, hotels, offices, and over 350 stores. Unfortunately what let's it down is that it has such a huge variety of shops that a lot of them are quite small will limited selection. For example the Columbia shop literally had one variety of shirt, one of t shirt and one of trousers available for women. Could do with reducing the number of shops to enable those shops that are there to have more space.

reviews.title: NOT pet friendly
reviews.review_text: They didn't allow us to enter with a small yorkie dog. We had to leave him in the car. Without any explanation, that he has to be in the bag.

reviews.title: Don't shop at Mall of Istanbul
reviews.review_text: Great shops but so warm it's very uncomfortable. Why does all of Turkiye not believe in air conditioning or deodorant??? People smell when they sweat!   PLEASE join the world in making public places comfortable.

reviews.title: Good shopping mall in general
reviews.review_text:
The first time I've heard of Mall Of Istanbul was probably when I was 12 years old and I can say that I was really curious to explore this place. Today was the day that I visited this massive shopping mall and I can say that I am impressed but not thoroughly. I went to the cinema to watch SAW 10 and it was really good but the popcorn prices are absolutely ridiculous. There is no option to get popcorn on its own. Rather, you can only get that along with coke and the prices are literally 100 lira. I don't know if that would be cheap for you but there is no way it would worth more than 70 lira for 2 cans of coke and a bucket of popcorn. After the cinema I went to a jacket potato restaurant and I had one jacket potato along with a can of coke. I paid 150 lira in total which I think was a bit expensive. 
There are tens of different brands to choose from which I think is really convenient as this caters to different budgets.
When I went to the loo, I was absolutely disgusted by how horrible and obnoxious the toilets looked. They need to hire more people to keep the toilets clean because it looked like a cesspit. I don't even want to talk about the smell in there as I tried to hold by breath.
All in all I would go back to that mall but they need to sort out the toilet issue.

reviews.title: Everything you can think of under one roof!
reviews.review_text:
You can't visit Istanbul and not visit the biggest Mall can you! Even my Husband who is very anti shopping had a lovely time. Great selection of shops, food outlets and children's entertainment.. Wow! I think my children could of spent our whole holiday here alone and not got bored! 

Only downsides are ones you'd expect from the busiest shopping mall, wait times for lifts was crazy! And the taxi's outside charge way over the odds for journeys from the Mall.

This is my second visit here and I would definitely visit again

reviews.title: Beautiful but has issues
reviews.review_text: Firstly the sites are amazing, the city is nice and the food is great. I have been 3 times to Istanbul and will go likely go again. . The city is not as clean as it was and there are lots of people trying to mess with tourists, you always have to be on your guard, which is sad as most people in the city  are amazing.  It feels very chaotic.

reviews.title: Istanbul ,go somewhere else
reviews.review_text: Went to Istanbul last week always wanted to go but left very disappointed.everyones out to rip you off especially taxi drivers(always make sure they have there meters on or sort the price before you set off because they will make up an extortionate fair when you arrive at your destination.it also feels a bit dirty.pick another place to visit

reviews.title: Beautiful but chaotic
reviews.review_text: Beautiful historic city but a nightmare to walk around for anyone, but particularly for a solo woman, as you’re more vulnerable to aggressive sellers and harassment

Istanbul Airports Transfer - Adore Touri.description: We make Istanbul airport transfer service from airports to the hotels, apartments or wherever you would like to go. Door to door airport transfer service including free Meeting & Greeting service in Istanbul airports. New age Minivans, Minibuses and Buses. Vip Airport Transfer Service in Istanbul is also available with vip cars like Mercedes E Class, S class. Car Hire with Driver Service is the best option for historical visits, shopping and business meetings for our guests.

reviews.title: Professional and great communication!
reviews.review_text: Everything went smoothly with our two young children from the airport to our hotel as well as a super early pick up from our hotel (4AM) for our flight back home (do recommend getting to IST three hours early for flights to the US). Very professional, clean vehicles, and great communication via WhatsApp. Will use again in the future!

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.review_text: We had a great experience with this operator. On time pick up, great driver, and good communication from the group! We would recommend using them.

reviews.title: Highly recommend them!!
reviews.review_text:
Friendly staff, prompt communication over WhatsApp, clean vehicles, rates are excellent, no last minute surprises, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

We managed to leave behind our cellphone and eyeglasses during airport drop off and  “Erik” (our driver) managed to bring them back at the passenger drop off zone, THANK YOU!!!!!! You saved us a ton of headache.

reviews.title: Airport Transfer
reviews.review_text: We were going to try taking the Metro but taking the car was the best! Door to door service, convenient, reliable and safe.

reviews.title: Excellent and trusted service
reviews.review_text: Excellent service with the transport, well organised, clean, comfortable and with WiFi to be connected during your trip, polite driver, punctual and fair price, highly recommend.
